Jack Evans - modern american

July 28, 2025

30_minute_chicken_curry.txt - 30 Minute Chicken Curry

Objectives

  • Make a flavorful chicken curry in 30 minutes.
  • Prepare a chicken marinade and tomato gravy.
  • Cook basmati rice to accompany the curry.

Ingredients

  • 2 green chilies
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 15 g ginger
  • 800 g boneless, skinless chicken
  • 250 g natural Greek yogurt
  • 5 g garam masala
  • 2.5 g ground coriander
  • 2.5 g ground turmeric
  • Salt
  • Ground white pepper
  • 40 ml vegetable oil
  • 7.5 g garam masala
  • 5 g ground coriander
  • 2.5 g ground turmeric
  • 1.5 g ground Kashmiri chili powder
  • 2 cans (800 g) crushed tomatoes or puree
  • 1 tbsp kasoori methi (ground fenugreek leaves)
  • 5 g sugar (optional)
  • 180 ml chicken stock or water
  • 1.5 cups basmati or long grain rice
  • 2.75 cups cold water
  • Cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, dried bay leaves (optional)
  • Salt

Instructions

  1. Roughly chop 2 green chilies, removing the stems.
  2. Peel 5 cloves of garlic and 15 g of ginger.
  3. Grate the garlic and ginger using a microplane, scraping out all the paste.
  4. Divide the garlic and ginger paste in half.
  5. Dice 800 g of boneless, skinless chicken into small pieces.
  6. In a bowl, combine the diced chicken with 250 g of natural Greek yogurt, 5 g of garam masala, 2.5 g of ground coriander, 2.5 g of ground turmeric, half of the garlic and ginger paste, salt, and ground white pepper.
  7. Mix well to coat the chicken evenly.
  8. Heat 40 ml of vegetable oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  9. Add the chopped green chilies and the remaining garlic and ginger paste to the pan and fry for 1-1.5 minutes, stirring regularly.
  10. Add 7.5 g of garam masala, 5 g of ground coriander, 2.5 g of ground turmeric, and 1.5 g of ground Kashmiri chili powder to the pan and cook for 1 minute.
  11. Add 2 cans (800 g) of crushed tomatoes or puree, 1 tbsp of crushed kasoori methi, and 5 g of sugar (optional) to the pan.
  12. Season with salt to taste and mix well.
  13. Bring the mixture to a simmer, cover the pan, reduce heat to low, and cook for 10 minutes.
  14. Add 180 ml of chicken stock or water to the pan and mix well.
  15. Add the marinated chicken and its marinade to the pan, scraping the bowl to incorporate all the flavor.
  16. Mix well to ensure all the chicken is coated and the sauce lightens up.
  17. Bring the mixture to a boil, cover the pan, reduce heat to low, and cook for 20 minutes.
  18. While the curry cooks, prepare the rice.
  19. Place a pot over high heat and add 1.5 cups of washed basmati or long grain rice.
  20. Add 2.75 cups of cold water, optional aromatics (cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, dried bay leaves), and a pinch of salt.
  21. Mix well to ensure the rice is not clumped and bring the mixture to a boil.
  22. Cover the pot, reduce heat to low, and cook for 12 minutes.
  23. After 12 minutes, turn off the heat and leave the lid on for 5 minutes.
  24. Remove the lid, discard the aromatics, and fluff the rice with a fork or spatula.
  25. Remove the lid from the curry pot, being careful of escaping steam.
  26. Mix the curry well to incorporate the oil that has risen to the top.
  27. Check the seasoning and remove the curry from the stovetop.
  28. Serve the rice and curry separately or with the rice as a bed for the curry.
  29. Garnish with coriander or cilantro.
  30. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HHrQoZ-H4zA

adobo_chicken.txt - Adobo Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make a classic Filipino adobo chicken dish.
  • Master the art of marinating chicken for maximum flavor.
  • Create a perfectly cooked and flavorful adobo sauce.

Ingredients

  • 750 grams (1.6 pounds) chicken thigh
  • 80 milliliters (1/3 cup) soy sauce
  • 110 milliliters white vinegar
  • 4 garlic cloves
  • 3 dried or 4 fresh bay leaves
  • 1 medium brown onion
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 spring onions or scallions
  • 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons (27 grams) brown sugar
  • 2 tablespoons (10 grams) whole black peppercorns
  • 300 milliliters cold water
  • 1 cup (200 grams) basmati rice
  • 1.5 cups (375 milliliters) cold water
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1 star anise
  • 3 cardamom pods
  • 1/2 cinnamon stick
  • 1/2 teaspoon sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Combine chicken thighs, soy sauce, white vinegar, grated garlic, and bay leaves in a bowl.
  2. Cover with cling wrap and refrigerate for 1 to 24 hours.
  3. Slice onion in half, peel, and thinly slice, saving scraps for stock.
  4. Crush and chop garlic cloves.
  5. Slice spring onions, saving bottom halves and ends for stock.
  6. Heat a large skillet over high heat and add olive oil.
  7. Sear marinated chicken thighs for 1 minute per side, working in batches.
  8. Remove chicken from pan and set aside, reserving juices.
  9. Sauté diced onion and chopped garlic in the pan for 2 minutes.
  10. Add chicken marinade, bay leaves, brown sugar, and black peppercorns to the pan.
  11. Stir and pour in cold water, bringing to a boil.
  12. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 5 minutes.
  13. Add seared chicken thighs back to the pan, smooth side down, and simmer for 15 minutes.
  14. Rinse basmati rice under cold water until water runs clear.
  15. Drain rice and set aside.
  16. Combine rice, water, bay leaf, star anise, cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, and salt in a saucepan.
  17. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes.
  18. After 15 minutes of chicken simmering, flip thighs and simmer for another 15 minutes.
  19. Remove rice from heat and allow to steam for 10 minutes without opening the lid.
  20. After 30 minutes of chicken simmering, remove and discard bay leaves.
  21. Fluff rice with a fork or spatula.
  22. Serve rice in bowls, top with chicken, sauce, and peppercorns.
  23. Garnish with sliced spring onions, if desired.
  24. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Gb22RWZ_Oc

african_chicken_curry.txt - African Chicken Curry

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy African chicken curry.
  • Understand the importance of marinating the chicken.
  • Create a flavorful citrus yogurt sauce.

Ingredients

Curry Paste: - 2 long red chilies (stems removed) - 1 bunch of coriander stems and roots - 20 grams peeled ginger (finely chopped or grated) - 1 whole lemon (zest and juice) - 8 cloves of garlic (peeled) - 5 whole peeled shallots (or 2 small onions) - 1.5 tablespoons canola oil - 1 tablespoon garam masala - 2 teaspoons smoked paprika - 1 teaspoon ground allspice - 2 teaspoons ground turmeric - 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes

Chicken: - 1.2 kilos boneless, skinless chicken thighs - 2 cups chicken stock - 2 cans (800 grams) diced tomatoes - Sea salt flakes to taste

Citrus Yogurt: - 200 grams natural Greek yogurt - 1/4 teaspoon red chili powder - 1 clove garlic (grated) - 1 lime (zest and juice) - Sea salt flakes to taste

Rice: - 1 cup washed basmati rice - 2 cups cold water - Pinch of sea salt flakes - 1 star anise (optional) - 4 whole cloves (optional) - 4 green cardamom pods (optional) - 3 dried bay leaves (optional) - 1/2 cinnamon stick (optional)

Garnish: - Fresh coriander (cilantro) - Citrus yogurt

Instructions

  1. Make the curry paste: Roughly chop chilies, coriander stems and roots, ginger, and lemon zest. Add to a blender with garlic, shallots, lemon juice, canola oil, and all spices. Blend until smooth but slightly coarse.
  2. Marinate the chicken: Add curry paste to a mixing bowl with chicken thighs. Rub paste all over chicken until evenly coated. Marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes to 48 hours.
  3. Make the citrus yogurt: Combine yogurt, chili powder, grated garlic, lime zest and juice in a bowl. Season with salt and mix well. Adjust seasoning as needed. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  4. Sear the chicken: Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of canola oil. Once hot, add chicken in batches, searing for 2 minutes on each side. Remove chicken and set aside.
  5. Cook the sauce: Add reserved marinade to the pan and sauté for 1 minute. Pour in chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Add diced tomatoes and season with salt. Mix well and bring to a simmer, allowing edges to bubble.
  6. Add chicken and simmer: Gently add seared chicken back to the pan with resting juices. Mix well and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour, covered.
  7. Finish the curry: Remove lid and mix gently. Continue simmering uncovered for 20 minutes, or until sauce has thickened. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
  8. Cook the rice: Heat a saucepan over high heat. Add rice, water, and salt. Mix well to break up clumps. Add optional spices and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 14 minutes. Turn off heat and let sit, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork.
  9. Serve: Place rice in bowls. Top with chicken and generously spoon over curry sauce. Garnish with fresh coriander and citrus yogurt.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aHNc9mp9vQE

aglio_e_olio.txt - Aglio e Olio

Objectives

  • Learn to make a classic Italian pasta dish, Aglio e Olio.
  • Master the technique of creating a garlic and oil emulsion.
  • Understand the importance of using high-quality ingredients for optimal flavor.

Ingredients

  • 6 cloves garlic, freshly peeled and sliced thinly
  • 1/4 bunch (10 grams) flat leaf parsley, chopped finely
  • 1.5 tablespoons sea salt flakes
  • 300 grams (10.5 ounces) spaghetti
  • 1/3 cup (80 milliliters) high-quality olive oil
  • 1/2 cup (120 milliliters) pasta water
  • 1 teaspoon (1 gram) dried chili flakes
  • 1/2 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper

Instructions

  1. Slice 6 cloves of garlic thinly.
  2. Chop 1/4 bunch of flat leaf parsley finely.
  3. Fill a medium to large saucepan halfway with water and bring to a boil over high heat.
  4. Season the boiling water with 1.5 tablespoons of sea salt flakes.
  5. Add 300 grams of spaghetti to the boiling water and allow it to sit half out of the water for 15-20 seconds to soften.
  6. Submerge the spaghetti completely in the boiling water and cook for 7 minutes (2 minutes less than packet instructions).
  7. While the spaghetti cooks, heat a large heavy-based skillet over high heat.
  8. Pour 1/3 cup of high-quality olive oil into the cold skillet.
  9. Add the thinly sliced garlic to the oil and gently stir continuously until it starts to sizzle.
  10. Continue mixing the garlic for about 1 minute, or until it shows the slightest bit of color.
  11. Once the garlic is slightly colored and the spaghetti is cooked, ladle out 1/2 cup of pasta water and carefully add it to the oil and garlic.
  12. Allow the water and oil to bubble vigorously for 30 seconds to create an emulsion.
  13. Add the spaghetti to the skillet, along with some more pasta water.
  14. Turn off the heat and add 1 teaspoon of dried chili flakes, 1/2 teaspoon of sea salt flakes, 1 teaspoon of black pepper, and the chopped parsley.
  15. Mix everything thoroughly to coat the spaghetti in the emulsion and distribute the ingredients evenly.
  16. Remove the spaghetti from the heat and gently twist it into serving bowls.
  17. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wu_ZfLtgshk

air_fried_bang_bang_chicken_bowls.txt - Air Fried Bang Bang Chicken Bowls

Objectives

  • Make air-fried bang bang chicken bowls with pickled vegetables and avocado
  • Prepare a quick pickling brine for the vegetables
  • Create a bang bang sauce with mayonnaise, sweet chili sauce, and Sriracha
  • Cook jasmine rice and air-fry chicken skewers
  • Assemble the bowls with rice, chicken, and garnishes

Ingredients

Pickled Vegetables: - 1/2 cup white vinegar (60 mL) - 60 mL water - 1 Lebanese cucumber - 1 carrot

Bang Bang Chicken: - 1 kg (2.2 lb) chicken - 2/3 cup lowfat mayonnaise - 1/2 cup sweet chili sauce - 1/4 cup Sriracha mayo - 1 lime - 1 teaspoon onion powder - 1 teaspoon garlic powder - 1 teaspoon smoked paprika - 1/4 teaspoon chili powder - 1 tbsp olive oil - Salt - Cracked black pepper

Rice: - 300 g washed jasmine rice - 500 mL cold water - Salt

Garnishes: - 1 avocado - 1 lime - 2 g (0.1 oz) coriander or cilantro

Instructions

  1. Prepare the pickling brine by combining white vinegar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat and let cool.
  2. Slice the cucumber and carrot into thin strips using a mandolin or knife. Stack the strips and cut them in half lengthwise.
  3. Place the cucumber and carrot in a mason jar or sterilized container. Pour the pickling brine over the vegetables and press down to ensure they are submerged. Seal the jar and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  4. Soak skewers in water to prevent burning.
  5. Slice the chicken in half lengthwise and then cut into 1/4 or 1/3 pieces, ensuring they are all the same size.
  6. Slice the avocado in half, remove the seed, scoop out the flesh, and slice into thin strips. Fan out the strips using your palm.
  7. Slice the lime in half and cut into wedges.
  8. Roughly chop the coriander or cilantro, removing any large leaves or stems.
  9. Combine the jasmine rice and cold water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, then add a pinch of salt and stir to prevent clumping.
  10. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and cook for 12 minutes without lifting the lid.
  11. Turn off the heat and let the rice sit for an additional 4 minutes with the lid on.
  12. Make the bang bang sauce by combining mayonnaise, sweet chili sauce, Sriracha mayo, lime zest, and lime juice in a bowl. Mix well and adjust seasoning as needed.
  13. Divide the bang bang sauce in half. Set aside half for serving.
  14. Combine the diced chicken, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, chili powder, olive oil, salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup of the bang bang sauce in a large bowl. Mix well to combine.
  15. Skewer the chicken pieces onto the soaked skewers.
  16. Fluff the cooked rice with a fork or spatula.
  17. Place the chicken skewers in an air fryer basket and air fry at 200°C (390°F) for 8 minutes.
  18. After 8 minutes, open the air fryer, baste the chicken with the remaining bang bang sauce, flip the skewers, and baste the other side.
  19. Close the air fryer and cook for an additional 8 minutes.
  20. Remove the chicken skewers from the air fryer.
  21. Assemble the bowls by layering rice, chicken skewers, and garnishes (avocado, lime wedges, and coriander/cilantro).
  22. Drizzle a little bit of the remaining bang bang sauce over the top.
  23. Refrigerate the bowls for 3 to 4 days or freeze for 3 to 4 months.
  24. When ready to serve, reheat the bowls in the microwave. Serve the pickled vegetables, avocado, and lime wedges separately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q91D6ZaGfDk

air_fryer_chicken_parmesana.txt - Air Fryer Chicken Parmesan

Objectives

  • Cook delicious chicken parmesan in an air fryer.
  • Roast potatoes in an air fryer.
  • Make a flavorful marinara sauce.

Ingredients

  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 can (400g) crushed tomatoes
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Basil sprigs
  • Sugar (optional)
  • 500g baby potatoes, sliced in half
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • Dried oregano
  • Dried basil
  • Smoked paprika
  • 2 chicken breasts, butterfly cut and sliced into fillets
  • 1 1/2 cups panko breadcrumbs
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • Sweet paprika
  • Dried basil
  • Dried oregano
  • Salt and pepper
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 3 free-range eggs
  • 1/2 cup milk
  • Spray oil
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Mozzarella cheese (optional)
  • Parsley
  • Basil

Instructions

  1. Mince garlic and set aside.
  2. Heat a large pan over medium heat.
  3. Add olive oil to the cold pan.
  4. Add minced garlic and break up with a spatula.
  5. Cook garlic until it starts to sizzle.
  6. Add crushed tomatoes, salt, pepper, and basil sprigs to the pan.
  7. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
  8. Add sugar to balance the acidity (optional).
  9. Simmer the marinara sauce for 15-20 minutes.
  10. Slice baby potatoes in half and place in a bowl.
  11. Drizzle potatoes with olive oil and add onion powder, garlic powder, oregano, basil, and smoked paprika.
  12. Toss potatoes to coat evenly.
  13. Butterfly cut and slice chicken breasts into fillets.
  14. Pound chicken fillets with a meat mallet until flat.
  15. Combine panko breadcrumbs, garlic powder, paprika, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper in a tray.
  16. Spread all-purpose flour in a separate tray.
  17. Whisk eggs and milk together in a bowl.
  18. Dredge chicken fillets in flour, then egg wash, and finally panko breadcrumbs, ensuring full coverage.
  19. Spray the air fryer basket with oil.
  20. Add potatoes to the air fryer basket and set the air fryer to 200°C for 10 minutes.
  21. Spray the second air fryer basket with oil.
  22. Add breaded chicken to the second basket, ensuring they are not overlapping.
  23. After 10 minutes, flip the potatoes and chicken, mixing them around.
  24. Air fry for another 10 minutes at 200°C.
  25. Flip the chicken and potatoes again and air fry for 5 minutes at 200°C.
  26. After 3 minutes, remove the chicken from the air fryer.
  27. Remove the marinara sauce from the heat.
  28. Spread marinara sauce over the chicken.
  29. Grate Parmesan and mozzarella cheese over the chicken (optional).
  30. Gently place the chicken back into the air fryer basket, ensuring no overlapping.
  31. Air fry for the remaining 3 minutes.
  32. Remove the chicken and potatoes from the air fryer.
  33. Season potatoes with salt and toss.
  34. Plate the chicken and potatoes.
  35. Garnish with parsley and basil.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2wtKG4ostaU

alcatio_ibe.txt - Alcatio Ibe

Objectives

  • Create a simple and flavorful pasta dish
  • Master the art of cooking pasta one minute less than packet instructions
  • Learn to make a creamy sauce with black pepper and pecorino Romano cheese

Ingredients

  • Pecorino Romano cheese
  • Black pepper
  • Pasta water

Instructions

  1. Grate pecorino Romano cheese into a bowl.
  2. Crack black pepper into a pan.
  3. Cook pasta one minute less than packet instructions, generously salting the water.
  4. Place the cracked black pepper over medium-high heat and toast for 1.5-2 minutes.
  5. Add pasta water to the pan and gently mix until it simmers.
  6. Cook for one minute until the sauce thickens.
  7. Add cooked pasta to the pan, bringing some pasta water with it.
  8. Gently fold everything together until coated.
  9. Add the grated pecorino Romano cheese and mix vigorously until combined.
  10. Adjust the sauce with pasta water until it reaches a creamy consistency.
  11. Remove the pan from the stove.
  12. Serve in bowls and add additional cheese and cracked pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zNAuC86k6ic

alfredo_pasta.txt - Alfredo Pasta

Objectives

  • Learn the history of Alfredo pasta and its origins
  • Understand the traditional ingredients and preparation methods
  • Explore variations of the dish including cream and seafood additions

Ingredients

  • Fettuccine pasta
  • Butter
  • Parmesan cheese
  • Salt
  • Pepper

Instructions

  1. Cook fettuccine pasta according to package directions.
  2. While pasta is cooking, melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
  3. Add freshly grated Parmesan cheese to the melted butter.
  4. Stir continuously until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
  5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  6. Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the sauce.
  7. Toss to coat the pasta evenly in the sauce.
  8. Serve immediately and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QoNxeNjD3Bo

apple_crumble_slice.txt - Apple Crumble Slice

Objectives

  • Create a luxurious and easy apple crumble slice recipe
  • Prepare a flavorful apple filling with spices and butter
  • Assemble a crumble base and topping for a perfect texture

Ingredients

Apple Filling

  • 6 Granny Smith apples (peeled, cored, and diced)
  • 14 grams unsalted butter
  • 20 grams Caster or fine sugar
  • 1.5 grams ground cinnamon
  • 0.1 gram nutmeg (about 1/4 teaspoon)
  • 1/2 cup (125 milliliters) cold water

Crumble Topping

  • 165 grams Caster or fine sugar
  • 125 grams unsalted butter
  • 180 grams plain all-purpose flour
  • 4 grams baking powder

Crumble Base

  • 100 grams softened unsalted butter
  • 110 grams Caster or fine sugar
  • 1 whole free range egg
  • 150 grams plain all-purpose flour
  • 4 grams baking powder
  • 20 milliliters full fat milk

Instructions

  1. Peel, core, and dice 6 Granny Smith apples into even-sized cubes.
  2. In a pot over medium heat, melt 14 grams of unsalted butter.
  3. Add the diced apples, 20 grams of Caster sugar, 1.5 grams of cinnamon, and 0.1 gram of nutmeg to the pot.
  4. Mix well and cook for 6 minutes, allowing the apples to soften and absorb the butter and spices.
  5. Add 1/2 cup (125 milliliters) of cold water to the pot and continue cooking for 4 minutes until the apples are soft but not completely broken down.
  6. Remove the pot from heat, cover with a lid, and let the apples rest.
  7. In a bowl, combine 165 grams of Caster sugar, 125 grams of unsalted butter, 180 grams of plain flour, and 4 grams of baking powder.
  8. Rub the ingredients together using your fingertips until they form fine breadcrumbs. Set aside.
  9. In another bowl, combine 100 grams of softened unsalted butter and 110 grams of Caster sugar.
  10. Mix using a hand mixer or stand mixer for 5 minutes until light and fluffy, ensuring the sugar is fully absorbed into the butter.
  11. Add 1 whole free-range egg and mix for 1-2 minutes until light and fluffy and fully combined.
  12. Add 150 grams of plain flour, 4 grams of baking powder, and 20 milliliters of full fat milk to the bowl.
  13. Gently fold the ingredients together using a spatula until a smooth, slightly wet pastry or dough forms.
  14. Place the pastry on a lined baking pan (approximately 30cm x 19cm) and spread it out evenly, using a little flour to help with spreading.
  15. Remove the lid from the cooked apples and sprinkle them evenly over the pastry base.
  16. Level out the apples, ensuring they are sitting flat.
  17. Sprinkle the crumble topping evenly over the apples, using a fork or your fingers to spread it out.
  18. Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F).
  19. Place the baking pan on a tray to catch any potential spills.
  20. Bake for 40-50 minutes, or until the crumble is golden brown.
  21. Allow the crumble to cool for 30-40 minutes before slicing.
  22. Slice the crumble into thirds lengthwise, then slice each third in half, resulting in 12 even pieces.
  23. Store the crumble slices in airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 6 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months.
  24. Enjoy the delicious and comforting flavors of your homemade apple crumble slice.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fwzcGmhdbmk

apple_rhubarb_crumble.txt - Apple and Rhubarb Crumble with Creme Anglaise

Objectives

  • Learn to make a classic apple and rhubarb crumble with a creme anglaise glaze.
  • Discover how to create a delicious crumble topping.
  • Master the art of making a smooth and silky creme anglaise.

Ingredients

For the Crumble: - 1.2 kilos (2.6 pounds) Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, and diced - 250 grams (8.8 ounces) rhubarb, leaves and ends removed, sliced into even strips - Zest of 1 lemon - 60 grams (2.1 ounces) unrefined caster sugar (optional) - 1.5 teaspoons (2 grams) ground cinnamon (optional) - 200 grams (7.05 ounces) plain all-purpose flour - 110 grams (3.8 ounces) cubed room temperature unsalted butter - 80 grams (2.8 ounces) unrefined caster sugar - 70 grams (2.4 ounces) rolled oats (optional)

For the Creme Anglaise: - 400 milliliters (400 grams) full fat milk - 200 milliliters (210 grams) thickened cream (pourable heavy cream or whipping cream) - 1 vanilla pod (or 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) vanilla extract) - 4 large free-range egg yolks - 90 grams (3.1 ounces) unrefined caster sugar

Instructions

  1. Prepare the apples and rhubarb: Peel, core, and dice the apples into even-sized chunks. Remove leaves and ends from the rhubarb and slice into even strips. Combine the diced apples and sliced rhubarb in a pot.
  2. Add flavorings: Zest the lemon and add it to the fruit mixture. Add the unrefined caster sugar and ground cinnamon (optional). Stir well to coat the fruit.
  3. Cook the fruit: Place the pot over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 5 minutes, undisturbed. Remove the lid and stir. The rhubarb should be soft, and the apples should still have a slight bite. Remove from heat.
  4. Make the crumble: In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, cubed butter, unrefined caster sugar, and rolled oats (optional). Rub the ingredients together with your fingers until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs.
  5. Assemble the crumble: Transfer the apple and rhubarb mixture to a 30cm x 22cm baking dish. Spread evenly. Sprinkle the crumble mixture over the top, ensuring all corners are covered.
  6. Bake the crumble: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F). Bake the crumble for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
  7. Prepare the creme anglaise: In a large saucepan, combine the milk, thickened cream, and vanilla pod (or extract). Heat over medium heat, whisking occasionally, until the mixture reaches 67°C (152°F) or just under simmering point.
  8. Whisk the egg yolks and sugar: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and unrefined caster sugar for 1.5-2 minutes, until pale, creamy, and light.
  9. Combine the milk mixture with the egg yolks: Pour the heated milk mixture into the egg yolk mixture, whisking constantly. Return the saucepan to medium-low heat.
  10. Cook the creme anglaise: Gently whisk the mixture continuously for 5-6 minutes, until the egg yolks begin to cook and the custard thickens. The mixture should be a beautiful golden color and leave ribbons when whisked. Remove from heat.
  11. Cool the creme anglaise: Immediately transfer the creme anglaise to a jar, bowl, or non-plastic container to prevent scrambling or curdling. Cool and refrigerate for up to 5 days.
  12. Serve the crumble: Allow the baked crumble to cool and set for 10 minutes. Serve warm, topped with the chilled creme anglaise. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=soMB01dVoLM

apricot_chicken_meal_prep.txt - Apricot Chicken Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and easy apricot chicken meal prep
  • Learn to cook couscous without rice
  • Combine chicken, vegetables, and couscous for a balanced meal

Ingredients

  • 2 heads broccoli
  • 250 grams green beans
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 kilo boneless and skinless chicken thigh
  • 5 grams onion powder
  • 5 grams garlic powder
  • Salt
  • Ground white pepper
  • 2 teaspoons peanut oil
  • 250 grams apricot nectar
  • 50 milliliters low sodium soy sauce
  • 20 grams light brown sugar (optional)
  • 12 grams corn flour or cornstarch
  • 450 milliliters chicken or vegetable stock
  • 300 grams dried couscous
  • 20 milliliters extra virgin olive oil
  • 5 grams flat leaf parsley (optional)
  • 1 lemon
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 1.5-2 tablespoons peanut oil
  • 5 grams flat leaf parsley (optional)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the vegetables:
  2. Trim broccoli florets to a uniform size.
  3. Remove woody ends from broccoli stalks and slice them into pieces similar in size to the florets.
  4. Remove stems from green beans and slice them in half.
  5. Prepare the chicken:
  6. Dice chicken thighs into large, even-sized pieces.
  7. Place diced chicken in a large mixing bowl.
  8. Season chicken with onion powder, garlic powder, salt, ground white pepper, and peanut oil.
  9. Mix well to combine.
  10. Prepare the apricot sauce:
  11. Combine apricot nectar, low sodium soy sauce, garlic paste, light brown sugar, corn flour/cornstarch, and ground white pepper in a bowl.
  12. Whisk until smooth.
  13. Prepare the couscous:
  14. Bring chicken or vegetable stock to a boil in a saucepan.
  15. Add dried couscous and stir well.
  16. Remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 5 minutes.
  17. Fluff couscous with a fork.
  18. Add extra virgin olive oil, chopped parsley, and lemon zest.
  19. Season with sea salt flakes and ground white pepper.
  20. Mix well to combine.
  21. Stir-fry the vegetables:
  22. Heat peanut oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
  23. Add broccoli and green beans.
  24. Season with sea salt flakes and ground white pepper (optional).
  25. Stir-fry for 6-7 minutes until lightly charred and slightly soft.
  26. Cook the apricot chicken:
  27. Heat peanut oil in a large pan over high heat.
  28. Add seasoned chicken thighs and spread them out.
  29. Cook for 3 minutes, undisturbed, to get a golden sear.
  30. Stir chicken and cook for another 3 minutes, undisturbed.
  31. Continue cooking for 1 minute, stirring occasionally, until all pieces are golden brown.
  32. Add apricot sauce and stir well to deglaze the pan.
  33. Bring sauce to a boil and cook for 1.5-2 minutes until thickened.
  34. Assemble the meal prep:
  35. Divide the couscous, stir-fried vegetables, and apricot chicken evenly into five containers.
  36. Garnish with spring onion or scallion stems (optional).
  37. Cool and store:
  38. Allow meal preps to cool for 15-20 minutes before refrigerating for up to 4 days or freezing for up to 4 months.
  39. Reheat in a pan or microwave.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7r8e2Ov4-nI

apricot_chicken.txt - Apricot Chicken

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and easy-to-make apricot chicken dish.
  • Prepare broccoli and green beans for stir-frying.
  • Combine ingredients for a delicious apricot sauce.
  • Sear chicken to golden perfection.
  • Thicken the sauce for a rich and flavorful finish.

Ingredients

  • 2 heads of broccoli
  • Green beans
  • 1 clove garlic
  • Chicken thighs
  • Onion powder
  • Salt
  • Ground white pepper
  • Oil
  • Apricot nectar
  • Soy sauce
  • Brown sugar
  • Corn flour
  • Couscous or rice (optional)
  • Spring onion (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Remove the florets from two heads of broccoli.
  2. Slice off the ends of the broccoli stalks and trim them into bite-sized pieces.
  3. Remove the tops from the green beans and slice them in half.
  4. Grate the garlic on a microplane.
  5. Dice the chicken thighs.
  6. Add the diced chicken to a bowl along with garlic, onion powder, salt, ground white pepper, and oil.
  7. Mix the chicken mixture to combine.
  8. Combine apricot nectar, soy sauce, garlic, brown sugar, corn flour, and pepper in a bowl.
  9. Whisk the sauce ingredients until smooth.
  10. Heat oil in a pan over high heat.
  11. Add the broccoli and green beans to the pan along with salt.
  12. Stir-fry the vegetables for 6 minutes until they are al dente.
  13. Heat oil in another pan over medium-high heat.
  14. Add the chicken to the pan and sear for 6-7 minutes until golden brown and cooked through.
  15. Add the apricot sauce to the chicken pan and bring it to a boil.
  16. Mix the sauce and cook for 2 minutes until it thickens.
  17. Remove the chicken and sauce from heat.
  18. Serve the broccoli and green beans with couscous, rice, or another side of your choice.
  19. Add the apricot chicken and any leftover sauce to the serving plate.
  20. Garnish with spring onion and enjoy.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_tmBqiqp0Ps

arabiata_pasta.txt - Arabiata Pasta

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple, delicious Arabiata pasta.
  • Understand the importance of slow-cooking garlic for flavor infusion.
  • Create a flavorful sauce by reducing tomatoes and adding basil.

Ingredients

  • 6 cloves garlic, freshly peeled and thinly sliced
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2.5 grams dried chili flakes (optional)
  • 2 cans (800 grams) whole Roma tomatoes in sauce (or crushed tomatoes)
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 1 teaspoon (2.5-3 grams) sugar
  • 4 stems basil (optional)
  • 700 grams spaghetti (or pasta of choice)
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Basil leaves (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a large pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil.
  2. While the water is heating, prepare the sauce: place a large pan or pot over medium-high heat.
  3. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the cold pan.
  4. Add the sliced garlic and stir, cooking for 2 minutes to infuse the oil.
  5. Add 2.5 grams of dried chili flakes (optional) and stir for 30 seconds.
  6. Add 2 cans (800 grams) of whole Roma tomatoes in sauce (or crushed tomatoes).
  7. Rinse the tomato cans with a little water to avoid wasting any tomato juice.
  8. Season with sea salt flakes, cracked black pepper, and 1 teaspoon of sugar.
  9. Stir well to combine the flavors and bring to a very light boil.
  10. Add 4 stems of basil (optional) and stir.
  11. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are soft and the sauce thickens.
  12. While the sauce is simmering, season the boiling water with salt and add 700 grams of spaghetti (or pasta of choice).
  13. Cook the pasta for 1 minute less than the package instructions.
  14. After 20 minutes, use the back of a spatula to break up the tomatoes in the sauce (optional, only if using whole tomatoes).
  15. Remove the basil stems from the sauce.
  16. Taste the sauce and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper as needed.
  17. Transfer the cooked pasta directly from the water into the sauce, including a bit of the pasta water.
  18. Mix well to coat the pasta in sauce and cook over low heat for 1 minute to finish cooking the pasta and thicken the sauce.
  19. Remove from the heat and serve.
  20. Optional toppings include Parmesan cheese, basil leaves, and cracked black pepper.
  21. Store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or freeze for up to 4 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mmFZUcAsXec

avocado_dressing.txt - Avocado Dressing

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and healthy avocado dressing
  • Learn how to blend the ingredients for a smooth and creamy texture
  • Understand how to store the dressing for optimal freshness

Ingredients

  • 1 lime, juiced
  • 1 avocado
  • 1/2 cup natural Greek yogurt
  • 1/2 bunch coriander or cilantro
  • 2.5 teaspoons dried oregano
  • 1.5 tablespoons red wine vinegar
  • Extra virgin olive oil (1/3 cup + more to taste)
  • Sea salt flakes, to taste
  • Cracked black pepper, to taste

Instructions

  1. Slice a lime in half and extract the juice.
  2. Cut an avocado around the seed, being careful of your hand, and twist to open.
  3. Remove the seed and scoop out the avocado flesh into a blender bowl.
  4. Add 1/2 cup of natural Greek yogurt, 1/2 bunch of coriander or cilantro, 2.5 teaspoons of dried oregano, 1.5 tablespoons of red wine vinegar, and lime juice to taste to the blender bowl.
  5. Blend on high speed until a coarse, thick paste forms.
  6. Add 1/3 cup of extra virgin olive oil and blend again on high speed until the dressing becomes smooth and creamy.
  7. Add sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper to taste.
  8. Blend on high speed again until fully incorporated.
  9. Transfer the dressing to a container and store in the refrigerator for up to five days.
  10. The dressing can also be frozen for later use.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sdZrg2C1GDs

bacon_egg_spinach_muffins.txt - Bacon, Egg & Spinach Muffins

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and convenient breakfast meal prep option
  • Prepare a savory tomato relish to accompany the muffins
  • Assemble and bake a bacon, egg, and spinach frittata-style cake
  • Toast English muffins and assemble the muffins with cheese and relish

Ingredients

Tomato Relish - 2 cans (14.5 oz each) diced or crushed tomatoes - 1/2 cup (90g) brown sugar - 1/4 cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar - 1 tablespoon (20 ml) balsamic vinegar - Pinch of sea salt flakes

Bacon & Spinach - 10 slices streaky bacon (or back bacon) - 100g (3.5 oz) washed baby spinach - Pinch of sea salt flakes (optional)

Egg Mix - 12 large free-range eggs - 1/4 cup (60 ml) thickened cream (or milk) - Pinch of sea salt flakes - 20 cracks of black pepper

Assembly - 6 English muffins (or bread of your choice) - Unsalted butter (optional) - American cheddar cheese (or cheese of your choice) - Spray oil or softened unsalted butter (for baking dish) - Sandwich wrap paper (for storage)

Instructions

  1. Make the Tomato Relish:
  2. Combine tomatoes, brown sugar, red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar, and salt in a saucepan over high heat.
  3. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low.
  4. Simmer for 50 minutes to 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until thickened.

  5. Transfer to a sterilized jar, seal tightly, and cool before refrigerating.

  6. Cook the Bacon & Spinach:

  7. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  8. Add bacon and cook for 2-2.5 minutes, or until sizzling and lightly golden.
  9. Add spinach and a pinch of salt (optional).
  10. Cook for 1 minute, until wilted.

  11. Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes.

  12. Prepare the Egg Mix:

  13. Crack eggs into a bowl, add cream, salt, and pepper.
  14. Whisk until smooth and yolks are broken up.

  15. Gently fold in the cooled bacon and spinach mixture.

  16. Bake the Frittata:

  17. Grease a baking dish with spray oil or butter.
  18. Pour in the egg mixture and stir gently to distribute evenly.

  19. Bake in a preheated oven at 340°F (170°C) for 18-20 minutes, or until lightly set.

  20. Prepare the English Muffins:

  21. Slice English muffins in half and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  22. Spread with butter (optional).

  23. Toast under the broiler, flipping halfway through, until desired level of browning.

  24. Assemble the Muffins:

  25. Slice the cooled frittata lengthwise into thirds.
  26. Spread tomato relish on both sides of the English muffins.
  27. Place a slice of frittata on top of the relish.
  28. Top with cheese.

  29. Place the other half of the English muffin on top.

  30. Toast the Muffins:

  31. Place assembled muffins back on the baking sheet.

  32. Toast under the broiler for 1-1.5 minutes, or until cheese melts.

  33. Store and Reheat:

  34. Wrap muffins individually in sandwich wrap paper.
  35. Refrigerate for up to 2 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
  36. To reheat, toast under the broiler, microwave, or eat cold.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OmXh5Kiuu60

bacon_mac_and_cheese.txt - Bacon Mac and Cheese

Objectives

  • Create a classic mac and cheese recipe with a twist of bacon.
  • Achieve a creamy and cheesy sauce with a golden crust.
  • Emphasize the importance of proper cooking times and ingredient proportions.

Ingredients

  • 300g streaky bacon (10.5 oz)
  • 5 cloves garlic, finely chopped
  • 10g fresh thyme (0.3 oz)
  • 5g flat leaf parsley (0.2 oz)
  • 200g cheddar cheese (7 oz)
  • 2 teaspoons dijon mustard (20g)
  • 10 cracks black pepper
  • 1.5 cups chicken or vegetable stock (375ml)
  • 300g macaroni pasta (10.5 oz)
  • 2.5 cups milk (625ml)
  • 1/2 cup thickened cream (125ml)
  • 50g plain all-purpose flour (1.7 oz)

Instructions

  1. Dice the bacon into large pieces.
  2. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  3. Add the bacon to the pan and cook for 5 minutes, stirring regularly, until golden and crispy.
  4. Add the dijon mustard, chopped thyme, garlic, and black pepper to the pan. Mix well and sauté for 1 minute.
  5. Increase heat to high and deglaze the pan with chicken or vegetable stock. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring regularly, until boiling.
  6. Add the macaroni pasta, milk, thickened cream, and flour to the pan. Mix well until combined.
  7. Simmer for 7 minutes over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens and the pasta is almost cooked through.
  8. Add half of the grated cheddar cheese to the pan and mix until melted.
  9. Spread the remaining cheese over the top of the mac and cheese, without mixing.
  10. Add more cracked black pepper on top.
  11. Broil for 6-7 minutes until the cheese forms a golden crust.
  12. Garnish with parsley (optional).
  13. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g3Q3RCocQBA

bacon_salmon_bites.txt - Crispy Bacon Salmon Bites

Objectives

  • Create crispy and flavorful bacon-wrapped salmon bites
  • Prepare a bourbon barbecue sauce to glaze the salmon bites
  • Assemble and bake the salmon bites until golden brown and crispy

Ingredients

Salmon - 1.6 kilos of salmon (or use store-bought fillets)

Spice Rub - 40 grams brown sugar - 6 grams smoked paprika - 2.5 grams sweet paprika - 5 grams onion powder - 5 grams garlic powder - 1.5 grams yellow mustard powder - 1 gram cayenne or chili powder - Salt and pepper to taste

Bacon - 10 rashes of streaky bacon (or middle bacon)

Bourbon Barbecue Sauce - 30 milliliters bourbon (optional) - 20 grams brown sugar - 80 grams tomato ketchup - 50 grams American mustard (or yellow mustard) - 20 milliliters apple cider vinegar - 30 milliliters maple syrup

Garnish - Black and white sesame seeds (optional) - Spring onion or scallion (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the salmon into 2-3 inch fillets, then cut each fillet into four even-sized pieces.
  2. Combine all spice rub ingredients in a bowl and whisk until well blended.
  3. Slice the bacon in half to create 20 even-sized strips.
  4. In a mixing bowl, add the salmon pieces and massage in 4 tablespoons of the spice rub.
  5. Wrap each salmon piece with a bacon strip, overlapping the bacon and securing it with a toothpick.
  6. Rub the remaining spice rub onto the bacon-wrapped salmon bites.
  7. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  8. Place the salmon bites on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
  9. Bake for 6 minutes.
  10. While the salmon bakes, prepare the bourbon barbecue sauce.
    • Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a simmer.
    • Cook for 2-3 minutes until thickened.
    • Season with salt and white pepper if needed.
  11. After 6 minutes of baking, use a pastry brush to baste the salmon bites with the barbecue sauce.
  12. Bake for another 6-7 minutes until the bacon is crispy and the glaze is golden brown.
  13. Let the salmon bites cool slightly before removing the toothpicks.
  14. Garnish with black and white sesame seeds, spring onion, and pan juices, if desired.
  15. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSq_KAJCa3Q

baked_eggs_one_pan.txt - One Pan Baked Eggs

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and easy one-pan baked egg dish.
  • Use affordable ingredients for a budget-friendly meal.
  • Learn to create a flavorful sauce with fresh herbs and spices.

Ingredients

  • 1 red onion, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 bunch coriander or cilantro, roots chopped (optional)
  • 1 red bell pepper or capsicum, diced
  • 5 large ripe tomatoes, diced
  • 1 tablespoon (20ml) olive oil
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons (3g) ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon (2.5g) smoked paprika
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 1/3 cup (80ml) vegetable stock
  • 4 large eggs (or more, depending on preference)
  • Toasted bread (for serving)
  • Persian feta or parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Cracked black pepper (optional)
  • Extra virgin olive oil (optional)
  • Fresh coriander or cilantro leaves (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice the red onion, mince the garlic, and roughly chop the coriander or cilantro roots (if using).
  2. Dice the red bell pepper or capsicum, and dice the tomatoes after removing the core.
  3. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
  4. Saute the diced onion for 3 minutes until translucent.
  5. Add minced garlic and chopped coriander or cilantro root (if using) and saute for 1 minute.
  6. Add diced bell pepper, ground cumin, smoked paprika, and a pinch of sea salt flakes. Saute for 4 minutes, stirring regularly.
  7. Add diced tomatoes and another pinch of sea salt flakes. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes, breaking down the tomatoes to create a sauce.
  8. Pour in the vegetable stock and reduce for 1 minute.
  9. Use a spoon to create a well in the tomato mixture and gently pour in the eggs. Cook for 1 minute.
  10. Transfer the pan to a preheated oven (180°C/350°F) and bake for 4-5 minutes, or until the eggs are soft on top.
  11. Carefully remove the pan from the oven.
  12. Serve with toasted bread, garnished with Persian feta or parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper, a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil, and fresh coriander or cilantro leaves (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZE4y2Ao8Hxw

baked_eggs.txt - Baked Eggs

Objectives

  • Learn to make a quick and easy baked eggs dish.
  • Utilize a combination of sauteed vegetables and spices to create a flavorful base.
  • Bake the eggs in the oven to achieve a perfectly cooked consistency.

Ingredients

  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 diced red onion
  • 2 cloves minced garlic
  • 1 bunch chopped coriander roots and stems
  • 1/2 diced bell pepper
  • 1.5 teaspoons ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 4 diced tomatoes
  • 1/3 cup chicken stock
  • 4 eggs
  • Persian or Greek feta
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Extra virgin olive oil
  • Coriander (optional)

Instructions

  1. Heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  2. Add one diced red onion and saute for three minutes.
  3. Add two cloves of minced garlic, one bunch of chopped coriander roots and stems, and mix for one minute.
  4. Add half a diced bell pepper, one and a half teaspoons of ground cumin, one teaspoon of smoked paprika, one quarter of a teaspoon of cayenne pepper, and sea salt flakes to taste.
  5. Mix to combine and saute for four minutes.
  6. Add four diced tomatoes and another pinch of sea salt flakes to taste.
  7. Cook for five minutes to break down the tomatoes.
  8. Pour in one third of a cup of chicken stock and cook for one minute.
  9. Make a well with a spoon and place four eggs in different areas.
  10. Cook for one minute.
  11. Place the pan into a preheated oven set at 180 degrees Celsius and bake for four minutes.
  12. Remove from the oven and gently tip it out into a bowl.
  13. Top with Persian or Greek feta, cracked black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, and coriander (optional).
  14. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1dtsM8MfGxU

baked_potato.txt - Crispy and Soft Centered Baked Potatoes

Objectives

  • Learn to bake potatoes that are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
  • Prepare the potatoes for baking by seasoning and piercing them.
  • Learn to create a soft center by adding butter and cheese after baking.

Ingredients

  • 2 large potatoes, washed
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon (5 g) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 2 spring onions (green stem only)
  • 65 g (1/2 cup) fresh mozzarella cheese
  • 1 tablespoon (14 g) salted butter
  • Sour cream (optional)

Instructions

  1. Wash two large potatoes and place them in a bowl.
  2. Add 1 tablespoon (20 ml) olive oil, 1 teaspoon (5 g) sea salt flakes, and 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper to the bowl.
  3. Rub the seasoning into the potatoes until well coated.
  4. Use a fork to pierce several holes around each potato.
  5. Place the potatoes on a baking tray and bake at 170 degrees Celsius for 45 minutes.
  6. After 45 minutes, flip the potatoes over and bake for another 30 minutes.
  7. Remove the potatoes from the oven.
  8. Cut across the top of each potato and press down on all four corners to open it up.
  9. Add 1 tablespoon (14 g) of salted butter to each potato.
  10. Top with grated mozzarella cheese.
  11. Grill or broil the potatoes on the middle shelf for 10 minutes at the same temperature.
  12. Spoon a small amount of sour cream into each potato (optional).
  13. Garnish with thinly sliced spring onions.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1En8TkHhatk

baked_ricotta.txt - Baked Ricotta

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and versatile baked ricotta dish.
  • Learn to bake ricotta with a flavorful topping.
  • Discover a simple and quick recipe for a satisfying meal.

Ingredients

  • 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) full fat whole milk ricotta
  • Zest of 1 lemon
  • Juice of 1/2 lemon (optional)
  • 4 large free-range eggs
  • 90 grams (3.1 ounces) Parmigiano-Reggiano or Parmesan cheese
  • 5 grams (0.2 ounces) fresh oregano
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 20 cracks of black pepper
  • 80 grams (2.8 ounces) sun-dried tomatoes
  • 5 grams (0.2 ounces) flat leaf parsley
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) sun-dried tomato oil
  • Zest of 1/2 lemon
  • Juice of 1/2 lemon (optional)
  • Handful of rocket or arugula leaves
  • Lemon vinaigrette dressing (optional)
  • Edible flowers (optional)

Instructions

  1. Combine the ricotta, lemon zest, lemon juice (optional), eggs, Parmigiano-Reggiano or Parmesan cheese, chopped oregano, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl.
  2. Mix until well combined and forms a sticky ball.
  3. Spray a 20-centimeter springform tin with oil.
  4. Line the base with parchment paper and lock the spring.
  5. Spray the edges of the tin with oil and attach parchment paper strips around the edges.
  6. Pour the ricotta mixture into the prepared tin, spreading it evenly and leveling the top.
  7. Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit).
  8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the surface forms a golden crust.
  9. While the ricotta bakes, dice the sun-dried tomatoes.
  10. Chop the parsley finely.
  11. Combine the diced sun-dried tomatoes, chopped parsley, sun-dried tomato oil, lemon zest, and lemon juice (optional) in a small bowl.
  12. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  13. Remove the baked ricotta from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for 15 minutes.
  14. Release the springform tin and remove the parchment paper.
  15. Spread the sun-dried tomato mixture evenly over the top of the baked ricotta.
  16. Add a handful of rocket or arugula leaves, coated in lemon vinaigrette dressing (optional).
  17. Garnish with edible flowers (optional).
  18. Slice the baked ricotta into portions and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6jxMuUZt8Js

balsamic_glaze.txt - Balsamic Glaze

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and flavorful balsamic glaze.
  • Understand the importance of reducing the vinegar to achieve the desired consistency.
  • Discover a versatile glaze for various dishes.

Ingredients

  • 500 ml balsamic vinegar
  • 50 g brown sugar (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a medium-sized saucepan over high heat.
  2. Pour the entire bottle of balsamic vinegar into the saucepan.
  3. Add 50 grams of brown sugar (optional) to the saucepan and mix to combine.
  4. Bring the vinegar to a boil.
  5. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 12 minutes or until the mixture reduces by two-thirds.
  6. The glaze is ready when it coats the back of a spoon.
  7. Remove the glaze from the stovetop.
  8. Pour the glaze into a bowl or jar (not plastic).
  9. Store the glaze in the refrigerator for up to one month.
  10. Use the glaze over your favorite dishes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yg0HXf1O6pU

balsamic_vinaigrette.txt - Balsamic Vinaigrette

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a tangy and delicious balsamic vinaigrette.
  • Understand how to create an emulsion for a smooth dressing.

Ingredients

  • 125 ml (1/2 cup) balsamic vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon (20 grams) Dijon mustard
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon (30 grams) runny honey
  • 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1/2 teaspoon (5 cracks) black pepper
  • 125 ml (1/2 cup) extra virgin olive oil

Instructions

  1. Add balsamic vinegar, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, runny honey, sea salt flakes, and black pepper to a mixing bowl.
  2. Whisk the ingredients together until well combined.
  3. While continuously whisking, slowly pour in extra virgin olive oil to create an emulsion.
  4. Continue whisking until the dressing is smooth and stable.
  5. Pour the dressing into a jar, bottle, airtight container, or any serving vessel.
  6. Seal the lid and enjoy the dressing on your favorite salads.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12vxmO_9_Vc

banana_bread.txt - Banana Bread

Objectives

  • Create a moist and flavorful banana bread.
  • Utilize readily available ingredients.
  • Achieve a soft center and slightly crispy crust.

Ingredients

  • 4 overripe bananas
  • 190 grams (6.7 ounces) room temperature, cubed salted butter
  • 180 grams (6.3 ounces) brown sugar
  • 115 grams (4.06 ounces) unrefined caster sugar
  • 3 free-range eggs
  • 315 grams (11.1 ounces) plain all-purpose flour
  • 6.5 grams (0.2 ounces) baking powder
  • 6.5 grams (0.2 ounces) bicarbonate soda
  • 7 grams (0.25 ounces) vanilla bean paste or extract
  • 125 milliliters (1/2 cup) full fat milk

Instructions

  1. Peel and mash 4 overripe bananas.
  2. In a stand mixer bowl, combine cubed butter, brown sugar, and unrefined caster sugar.
  3. Mix on low speed, then increase to medium and mix for 4 minutes until slightly creamy.
  4. Reduce speed to low and add in 3 eggs one at a time, mixing until combined.
  5. Add in flour, baking powder, and bicarbonate soda.
  6. Mix on low speed, then increase to medium and mix for 1 minute until just incorporated.
  7. Add vanilla bean paste or extract.
  8. Add full fat milk.
  9. Add mashed bananas to the batter.
  10. Mix on low speed, then increase to medium-high and mix for 45 seconds to 1 minute until combined.
  11. Line a 24cm x 13cm loaf pan with spray oil and parchment paper.
  12. Pour batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top.
  13. Bang the pan on the bench to remove air pockets.
  14. Bake in a preheated oven at 170°C (340°F) for 50 minutes.
  15. Allow to cool for 15 minutes.
  16. Gently tip the loaf pan to remove the bread.
  17. Peel off the parchment paper.
  18. Slice and serve warm or cold with butter.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJoop_ySxhc

barbecue_chicken_mac_and_cheese.txt - Barbecue Chicken Mac and Cheese

Objectives

  • Create a high-protein, satisfying meal prep option.
  • Make a flavorful mac and cheese with a barbecue twist.
  • Minimize cooking time and effort for an easy meal.

Ingredients

  • 1.2 kg boneless and skinless chicken thighs
  • 140 g cheddar cheese (or other melting cheese)
  • 2 g flat leaf parsley (optional)
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika
  • 1 tsp dried thyme
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • 1/2 tsp chili flakes
  • 2 tsp olive oil
  • Salt and pepper
  • 400 g macaroni
  • 1/2 cup (125 ml) barbecue sauce (reduced sugar recommended)
  • 400 ml reduced fat cream or milk
  • 100 g low fat cream cheese
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Crack black pepper (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a large pot of water on the stovetop over high heat and bring to a boil.
  2. Slice 1.2 kg boneless and skinless chicken thighs lengthwise into thin, consistent strips.
  3. Dice the chicken strips into small to medium pieces.
  4. Grate 140 g cheddar cheese on the largest side of a box grater.
  5. Roughly chop 2 g flat leaf parsley (optional).
  6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the diced chicken with 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1 tsp dried thyme, 1 tsp dried oregano, 1/2 tsp chili flakes, 2 tsp olive oil, salt, and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  7. Mix the chicken and seasoning thoroughly with clean hands.
  8. Once the water is boiling, add 400 g macaroni and stir to prevent sticking.
  9. Cook the macaroni for 1 minute less than the packet instructions.
  10. Heat a large pan over high heat.
  11. Add 2 tsp olive oil to the hot pan.
  12. Add the seasoned chicken to the pan, spreading it out in a single layer.
  13. Cook the chicken for 2 minutes to form a crust, then stir.
  14. Cook the chicken for a total of 4 1/2 minutes until cooked through.
  15. Add 1/2 cup (125 ml) barbecue sauce to the pan and stir.
  16. Cook for 1 minute to glaze the chicken.
  17. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
  18. Return the pan to medium-high heat.
  19. Add 400 ml reduced fat cream or milk, 100 g low fat cream cheese, the grated cheddar cheese, salt, and 15 cracks of black pepper to the pan.
  20. Stir the mixture until the cream cheese is broken up and both cheeses are melted.
  21. Reduce the heat to medium to prevent the sauce from becoming too thick.
  22. (Optional) Add 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp garlic powder, and 1 tsp smoked paprika to the sauce.
  23. Cook the sauce for 2-3 minutes until thickened.
  24. Add the drained, cooked macaroni to the sauce.
  25. Stir until the pasta is fully coated in the cheese sauce.
  26. (Optional) Add the barbecue chicken to the mac and cheese and stir thoroughly.
  27. Cook for 30 seconds to ensure all flavors are combined.
  28. Portion the mac and cheese into containers.
  29. Garnish with Parmesan cheese, flat leaf parsley, and cracked black pepper (optional).
  30. Allow the mac and cheese to cool for 15-20 minutes before placing on lids.
  31. Store in the refrigerator for 3-4 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
  32. If frozen, thaw overnight in the refrigerator before reheating.
  33. Reheat in the microwave or on the stovetop, adding a splash of water or stock for rehydration.
  34. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7OiOX8h6_Pc

basic_bread_recipe.txt - Basic Bread Recipe

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and delicious loaf of bread from scratch.
  • Understand the importance of proper kneading and proofing for bread making.
  • Discover tips for achieving a soft and flavorful loaf.

Ingredients

  • 240 milliliters (1 cup) of water
  • 60 milliliters (1/4 cup) of full fat milk
  • 2 and 1/4 teaspoons (7 grams) of instant dry yeast
  • 2 tablespoons (25 grams) of caster sugar
  • 375 grams (3 cups) of bread flour
  • 60 grams (1/4 cup) of softened unsalted butter
  • 1 and 1/4 teaspoons of sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil
  • Bread flour for dusting and kneading
  • 1 teaspoon of unsalted butter for greasing

Instructions

  1. Place a small saucepan on the stovetop and pour in 240 milliliters of water and 60 milliliters of full fat milk.
  2. Turn the heat to medium and heat the mixture until just warm. Alternatively, microwave for 30-40 seconds.
  3. Remove from heat.
  4. In a large mixing bowl, add 2 and 1/4 teaspoons of instant dry yeast, 2 tablespoons of caster sugar, and the warmed water and milk mixture.
  5. Whisk well to combine.
  6. Cover the bowl with a tea towel and allow it to sit for 10 minutes. The yeast will feed off the sugar and create a froth on top.
  7. After 10 minutes, add 375 grams of bread flour, 60 grams of softened unsalted butter, and 1 and 1/4 teaspoons of sea salt flakes.
  8. Using clean hands, mix all ingredients together until combined and there are no lumps of butter. The dough will be sticky.
  9. Dust a bench with about 4 tablespoons of flour and tip out the dough.
  10. Add a small amount of flour to any dough stuck in the bowl and rub together to remove it.
  11. Generously dust the dough with flour.
  12. Using the palm of your hand, push the dough towards you and tuck it back in. Repeat this process for 4-5 minutes or until the dough is smooth and no longer sticky. You may need to add a small amount of flour as you knead.
  13. Alternatively, you can knead the dough in a stand mixer with a dough hook attachment for 3-4 minutes on low.
  14. Once the dough is smooth, shape it into a smooth ball.
  15. In a large mixing bowl, pour in 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil and wipe it around the bowl with a kitchen cloth to prevent the dough from sticking.
  16. Place the dough in the bowl, cover with a warm damp tea towel, and allow it to proof in a warm dark space for 1-1.5 hours or until doubled in size.
  17. After 1 hour and 15 minutes, punch the dough to knock out the air.
  18. Lightly grease a 9 by 5 inch bread pan with 1 teaspoon of unsalted butter.
  19. Dust the bench with about 2 tablespoons of bread flour and tip out the dough.
  20. Lightly dust the dough with flour and knead again for 30-40 seconds to remove any remaining air.
  21. Shape the dough into an oval and use a rolling pin to roll it to roughly 8 inches wide, 15 inches long, and about half an inch thick.
  22. Gently roll up one side of the dough towards the opposite end, creating a log. Tuck the meeting point in at the bottom.
  23. Place the dough in the greased pan. Cover it with oiled cling wrap, a warm damp tea towel, or another pan, and allow it to proof in a warm dark space for another hour or until doubled in size.
  24. 40 minutes into the second proving, preheat your oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  25. After one hour, remove the cover from the dough.
  26. Bake in the oven for 30-35 minutes or until deeply golden-brown, rotating the loaf halfway through.
  27. After 30 minutes, allow the loaf to cool for 5 minutes before carefully removing it from the pan and placing it on a wire rack.
  28. Slice the loaf while it's hot or allow it to cool completely.
  29. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zE82qUHSgZI

basil_pesto_chicken_pasta.txt - Basil Pesto Chicken Pasta

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and easy basil pesto chicken pasta meal.
  • Learn how to properly cook chicken for a tender and flavorful result.
  • Master the art of making homemade basil pesto.

Ingredients

  • 750 grams (1.6 pounds) chicken breasts
  • 2 teaspoons (5 grams) onion powder
  • 2 teaspoons (5 grams) garlic powder
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 20 cracks of black pepper to taste
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) olive oil
  • 30 grams (1.06 ounces) pine nuts
  • 2-3 garlic cloves
  • 1 lemon (half used)
  • 2 bunches (around 60 grams) basil
  • 30 grams (1.06 ounces) freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano or parmesan cheese
  • 1/2 cup (125 milliliters) extra virgin olive oil
  • 750 grams (1.6 pounds) penne or pasta of choice
  • Pasta water (optional)
  • Wedge of lemon (optional)
  • Extra virgin olive oil (optional)
  • Grated parmigiano-reggiano or parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Cracked black pepper (optional)

Instructions

  1. Season chicken breasts with onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
  2. Drizzle with olive oil and rub seasoning into the chicken.
  3. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
  4. Sear chicken breasts for 2 minutes per side, creating a seal.
  5. Transfer chicken to a preheated oven (200°C/390°F) and bake for 13 minutes.
  6. While chicken bakes, toast pine nuts in the oven on the grill setting for 1-1.5 minutes.
  7. Let pine nuts cool for 10 minutes.
  8. Grate garlic cloves using a microplane grater to create a paste.
  9. Juice half a lemon.
  10. Pick basil leaves from the stems and chop them roughly.
  11. In a blender, combine minced garlic, grated parmesan cheese, toasted pine nuts, lemon juice, basil leaves, and basil stems.
  12. Blend until pine nuts are broken down and ingredients are well combined.
  13. Add sea salt flakes, cracked black pepper, and extra virgin olive oil to the blender.
  14. Blend until everything is evenly combined.
  15. Place pesto in the fridge until ready to serve.
  16. While chicken is cooling, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
  17. Add penne pasta and cook for 1 minute less than the package instructions.
  18. Drain pasta and set aside some pasta water.
  19. Thinly slice chicken across the grain.
  20. Return sliced chicken to the pan with resting juices.
  21. Combine cooked pasta, sliced chicken, and basil pesto in a large bowl.
  22. Mix well to ensure pesto coats everything.
  23. Add pasta water if desired to adjust consistency.
  24. Portion out the pasta mixture into containers.
  25. Add a wedge of lemon, drizzle with extra virgin olive oil, grate parmesan cheese, and top with cracked black pepper.
  26. Store in the fridge for up to 4 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
  27. To reheat, microwave until hot.
  28. Squeeze lemon over the pasta for a fresh citrus kick.
  29. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oBVnPTbViPU

basil_pesto_pasta.txt - Basil Pesto Pasta

Objectives

  • Prepare a quick and easy basil pesto pasta dish.
  • Learn how to make a flavorful pesto sauce from scratch.
  • Combine the pesto sauce with cooked pasta for a satisfying meal.

Ingredients

  • Pine nuts
  • Garlic
  • Basil
  • Parmesan cheese
  • Lemon juice
  • Olive oil
  • Salt
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Pasta
  • Pasta water

Instructions

  1. Toast pine nuts in a pan over medium heat for 2 minutes.
  2. Remove pine nuts from pan and let cool.
  3. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat.
  4. In a blender, combine cooled pine nuts, garlic, basil, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  5. Blend until a coarse paste forms.
  6. Scrape the sides of the blender and add more olive oil to reach desired consistency.
  7. Add salt to the boiling water.
  8. Add pasta to the boiling water and cook for one minute less than the package instructions, until al dente.
  9. Scoop out some pasta water and drain the pasta.
  10. Add pasta to a bowl along with the basil pesto.
  11. Mix well and adjust consistency with pasta water.
  12. Serve into bowls and garnish with parmesan cheese and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AaseWiZp5Gg

basil_pesto.txt - Basil Pesto

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a quick and easy basil pesto.
  • Discover the key ingredients and their roles in creating a delicious pesto.
  • Understand how to store and preserve your homemade basil pesto.

Ingredients

  • 35 grams (1.2 ounces) raw pine nuts
  • 35 grams (1.2 ounces) freshly grated parmesan cheese
  • 2 cloves freshly peeled garlic
  • 2 whole bunches (50 grams / 1.7 ounces) fresh basil
  • 5 tablespoons (100 milliliters) extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper

Instructions

  1. Place the pine nuts, garlic, and grated parmesan cheese into a food processor.
  2. Close the lid securely and process on the highest setting for 45 seconds, until everything is well combined.
  3. Add the fresh basil, including most of the stems, to the food processor.
  4. Spread the basil evenly to ensure the machine processes it efficiently.
  5. Add 5 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil, 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes, and 1 teaspoon of black pepper to the food processor.
  6. Close the lid and process on the highest setting for 1-1.5 minutes, until a beautifully green, slightly coarse and smooth pesto is achieved.
  7. Transfer the pesto to a glass jar or airtight container.
  8. Store the pesto in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or freeze it in an airtight container for up to 3 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sUTmuIlL4A8

beef_and_broccoli_stir_fry.txt - Beef and Broccoli Stir Fry

Objectives

  • Create a high-protein, low-calorie beef and broccoli stir fry.
  • Learn how to prep broccoli for quick cooking.
  • Make a flavorful stir fry sauce with simple ingredients.

Ingredients

  • 2 heads of broccoli (230 calories)
  • 1 kilo (2.2 lb) rump steak (1,250 calories)
  • 1/3 cup low sodium soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon Shaoxing wine
  • 1 tablespoon mirin
  • 1 teaspoon sesame oil
  • 1 1/2 teaspoon corn flour (cornstarch)
  • 3 cloves garlic (paste)
  • 5g (0.2 oz) ginger (paste)
  • Ground white pepper
  • 300g Jasmine rice (1,900 calories)
  • 550ml cold water
  • Pinch of salt
  • 1 tablespoon vegetable or peanut oil
  • 1 tablespoon vegetable or peanut oil (second batch)
  • Sesame seeds (optional)
  • Spring onion stem (optional)

Instructions

  1. Prep the broccoli by trimming the florets and stems into bite-sized pieces. Remove the woody end of the stems and slice them thinly.
  2. Prep the steak by trimming off any excess fat, sinew, or silver skin. Slice the steak thinly across the grain.
  3. Make the stir fry sauce by whisking together soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, mirin, sesame oil, corn flour, garlic paste, ginger paste, and ground white pepper.
  4. Cook the rice by combining jasmine rice, cold water, and a pinch of salt in a saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes undisturbed. Turn off the heat and let stand for 4 minutes with the lid on. Fluff with a fork.
  5. Heat a wok over high heat until it starts to smoke. Add 1 tablespoon of oil, broccoli, a pinch of salt, and ground white pepper. Stir fry for 4-5 minutes until lightly charred and tender. Add a splash of water, cover, and steam for 2 minutes to retain color.
  6. Remove broccoli from the wok and set aside. Wipe the wok clean.
  7. Heat the wok over high heat until it starts to smoke. Add 1 tablespoon of oil and steak in batches. Stir fry for 2-3 minutes until no longer pink. Remove steak from the wok and set aside.
  8. Add the cooked broccoli, steak, and stir fry sauce to the wok. Stir fry for 2 minutes until the sauce thickens.
  9. Serve the beef and broccoli stir fry over rice. Garnish with sesame seeds and spring onion stem (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F-weGQt3MfM

beef_and_chalada_soup.txt - Beef and Chalada Soup

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and nutritious beef and chalada soup.
  • Create a homemade enchilada sauce and taco seasoning.
  • Learn meal prep techniques for a convenient and flavorful dish.

Ingredients

For the Enchilada Sauce: - 1 g red chili powder - 2.5 g ground cumin - 2.5 g garlic powder - 1 g dried oregano - 0.2 g ground cinnamon

For the Taco Seasoning: - 2 g red chili powder - 1 g ground cumin - 1 g smoked paprika - 1 g onion powder - 1 g garlic powder - 1 g dried oregano - 20 cracks black pepper

For the Soup: - 1 brown or yellow onion - 1 red bell pepper - 5 cloves garlic - 40 ml avocado oil - 24 g all-purpose flour - 60 g concentrated tomato paste - 500 ml beef stock - 20 ml apple cider vinegar - 20 ml olive oil - 500 g lean beef mince - 610 ml beef stock - 1 can (400 g) washed kidney beans - 1 can (400 g) creamed corn - Sea salt flakes - Optional garnishes: chopped coriander or cilantro, cheesy corn chips, lime wedges

Instructions

  1. Prepare the vegetables:
  2. Remove the tip of the onion, leaving the root intact.
  3. Slice the onion in half and peel off the skins.
  4. Make thin slices across the onion, stopping at the root.
  5. Slice through the center horizontally.
  6. Dice the onion into medium-sized pieces.
  7. Slice the bell pepper in half and remove the core and seeds.
  8. Lay the bell pepper flat and slice it into strips.
  9. Rotate the strips 90° and dice into medium to large pieces.
  10. Crush the garlic cloves with the side of a knife.
  11. Roughly chop the garlic.
  12. Make the Enchilada Sauce:
  13. Combine the red chili powder, ground cumin, garlic powder, dried oregano, and ground cinnamon in a bowl.
  14. Set aside.
  15. Make the Taco Seasoning:
  16. Combine the red chili powder, ground cumin, smoked paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, dried oregano, and black pepper in a bowl.
  17. Set aside.
  18. Prepare the Roux:
  19. Heat the avocado oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
  20. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
  21. Infuse the Spices:
  22. Add the enchilada spice mix to the roux and cook for 45 seconds, stirring constantly.
  23. Add the Tomato Paste:
  24. Add the tomato paste and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
  25. Make the Sauce:
  26. Add the beef stock, season with salt, and mix well.
  27. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 7 minutes.
  28. Remove from heat and stir in the apple cider vinegar.
  29. Set aside.
  30. Brown the Beef:
  31. Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
  32. Add the beef mince and cook for 2 minutes, letting it form a crust.
  33. Break up the beef and cook for an additional 3 minutes, or until no longer pink.
  34. Season with salt and pepper.
  35. Sauté the Vegetables:
  36. Add the diced onion, bell pepper, and garlic to the pan.
  37. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly softened.
  38. Add the Taco Seasoning:
  39. Add the taco seasoning and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
  40. Deglaze the Pan:
  41. Add the beef stock to the pan and scrape up any browned bits.
  42. Combine the Ingredients:
  43. Add the kidney beans, creamed corn, and enchilada sauce to the pan.
  44. Stir well to combine.
  45. Cook the Soup:
  46. Bring the soup to a boil over high heat.
  47. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 25 minutes, or until the flavors have developed.
  48. Serve:
  49. Divide the soup into containers.
  50. Garnish with coriander or cilantro, cheesy corn chips, and lime wedges (optional).
  51. Store:
  52. Refrigerate for up to 4 days or freeze for up to 6 months (without garnishes).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qCU8dsuRd1w

beef_and_onion_stew.txt - Beef and Onion Stew

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a delicious beef and onion stew.
  • Follow a step-by-step recipe for a hearty and flavorful dish.

Ingredients

  • [Please provide the full ingredient list from the video's recipe]

Instructions

  1. [Please provide the instructions from the video, following the format guidelines.]

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k7PC4p8m9Ow

beef_and_potato_stew.txt - Beef and Potato Stew

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and flavorful beef and potato stew.
  • Understand how to sear beef for a rich flavor.
  • Master the art of creating a thick and flavorful gravy.

Ingredients

  • 8 shallots
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 kg chuck steak, diced (2.2 lb)
  • 400 g baby potatoes, halved
  • 5 g flat leaf parsley, chopped
  • 5 g thyme, chopped
  • 2 tbsp olive oil (40 mL)
  • 1 tbsp unsalted butter (14 g)
  • 2 tsp smoked paprika (5 g)
  • 4 tsp tomato paste (80 g)
  • 1 L beef stock (4 cups)
  • 2 tsp brown sugar (10 g)
  • 2 tbsp soy sauce (10 mL)
  • Salt and pepper
  • Crusty bread, toasted (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the shallots in half, leaving the root intact. Peel them and set aside.
  2. Grate the garlic using a microplane.
  3. Place a large pan over medium-high heat.
  4. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the pan and heat until shimmering.
  5. Add the diced beef to the pan and season with salt.
  6. Sear the beef for 6 minutes, stirring occasionally, until browned on all sides.
  7. Add the butter, grated garlic, and shallots to the pan.
  8. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the garlic is fragrant.
  9. Add the smoked paprika and tomato paste to the pan.
  10. Cook for 4 minutes, stirring constantly, until the tomato paste is fragrant.
  11. Add the beef stock, brown sugar, soy sauce, chopped thyme, and chopped parsley to the pan.
  12. Season with salt and pepper.
  13. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  14. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
  15. Remove the lid and stir the stew.
  16. If the stew is too dry, add 1 cup of beef stock.
  17. Add the halved baby potatoes to the stew.
  18. Cover the pan and cook for 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork-tender.
  19. Serve the beef and potato stew with crusty bread, toasted, or your favorite side dish.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xC81Uf6SYns

beef_bgi.txt - Beef Bgi

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy Korean beef dish.
  • Prepare a flavorful Bgi sauce using fresh ingredients.
  • Create a complementary broccoli and spring onion stir-fry.

Ingredients

Bgi Sauce - 1 red shallot - 3 cloves garlic - 20 g ginger - 20 ml vegetable or peanut oil - 5 ml sesame oil - 80 ml low sodium soy sauce - 20 g gochujang (Korean chili paste) - 20 g brown sugar (optional) - 2 g dried chili flakes - Salt and ground white pepper to taste

Beef Bgi - 1 kg beef mince or ground beef (10% fat) - 1 tablespoon vegetable or peanut oil - Salt and pepper to taste

Broccoli and Spring Onion Stir-fry - 2 heads broccoli - 1 tablespoon vegetable or peanut oil - Salt and ground white pepper to taste - 8 spring onions (scallions) - 5 ml sesame oil

Rice - 300 g washed jasmine rice - 500 ml cold water - Salt to taste

Garnish - Sesame seeds - Thinly sliced spring onion stems

Instructions

  1. Prepare the Bgi Sauce:
  2. Trim and roughly chop a red shallot, 3 cloves of garlic, and 20g of peeled ginger.
  3. Combine the chopped ingredients with 20 ml vegetable or peanut oil, 5 ml sesame oil, 80 ml low sodium soy sauce, 20g gochujang, 20g brown sugar (optional), 2g dried chili flakes, salt, and ground white pepper in a blender.
  4. Blend on high speed until a coarse paste forms.
  5. Prepare the Vegetables:
  6. Separate the white roots from the green stems of 8 spring onions.
  7. Roughly chop the white roots.
  8. Thinly slice the green stems for garnish.
  9. Trim and cut broccoli florets into bite-sized pieces.
  10. Trim and slice the broccoli stems.
  11. Cook the Rice:
  12. Place a large saucepan on the stovetop and add 300g of washed jasmine rice, 500ml of cold water, and a pinch of salt.
  13. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes undisturbed.
  14. Cook the Beef:
  15. Heat a large high-rimmed pan or pot over medium-high heat.
  16. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable or peanut oil and 1 kg of beef mince or ground beef.
  17. Cook for 5 minutes, breaking up the beef with a spoon, and season with salt and pepper.
  18. Continue cooking until the beef is browned and no longer pink.
  19. Combine the Beef and Sauce:
  20. Add the prepared Bgi sauce to the cooked beef and stir to combine.
  21. Cook for 1 minute over medium heat to allow the flavors to meld.
  22. Stir-fry the Broccoli:
  23. Heat a large wok or pan over high heat.
  24. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable or peanut oil, the broccoli florets, and a pinch of salt and ground white pepper.
  25. Stir-fry for 4-5 minutes, until the broccoli is slightly charred and softened.
  26. Add the Spring Onions:
  27. Add the chopped spring onion roots to the broccoli and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
  28. Remove from the heat, add 5 ml of sesame oil, and stir to combine.
  29. Finish the Rice:
  30. After the rice has cooked for 12 minutes, turn off the heat but leave the lid on for 5 minutes.
  31. Fluff the rice with a fork or spatula.
  32. Assemble and Serve:
  33. Divide the cooked rice, broccoli and spring onion stir-fry, and beef Bgi into serving containers.
  34. Garnish with sesame seeds and thinly sliced spring onion stems.
  35. Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 4 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=guaymJOnHAI

beef_burger.txt - Beef Burger

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a juicy, flavorful beef burger.
  • Discover the importance of seasoning and resting the meat.
  • Create a delicious herby mayonnaise to complement the burger.

Ingredients

  • 480 grams (16.9 ounces) 65% lean to 35% fat beef mince
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) paprika
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) garlic powder
  • 2 free-range egg yolks
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 20 milliliters olive oil
  • 80 milliliters vegetable oil
  • 7 grams fresh dill, roughly chopped
  • 5 grams flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 4 slices streaky bacon
