  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon cracked black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon unsalted butter
  • 40 gram chunk Monterey Jack cheese
  • Burger buns
  • Romaine lettuce
  • 1 tomato
  • Herby mayonnaise

Instructions

  1. Combine 480 grams of beef mince with 1 teaspoon each of paprika, onion powder, and garlic powder.
  2. Mix the seasonings into the meat until well incorporated.
  3. Shape the mixture into 4 patties, using a burger press or egg ring.
  4. Press the patties down to create an even surface and tuck in the sides for a smooth finish.
  5. Allow the patties to rest at room temperature for better crust and even cooking.
  6. Preheat oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
  7. In a small bowl, whisk together 2 egg yolks and 1 teaspoon of Dijon mustard.
  8. Slowly pour in 20 milliliters of olive oil while whisking continuously to create an emulsion.
  9. Gradually add 80 milliliters of vegetable oil, whisking constantly.
  10. Combine roughly chopped dill and parsley.
  11. Add the herbs, 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes to the mayonnaise.
  12. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  13. Place bacon slices on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
  14. Bake in the preheated oven for 9-10 minutes, or until golden brown.
  15. Season each patty with 1 teaspoon of salt flakes and 1 teaspoon of cracked black pepper.
  16. Heat a large skillet over high heat.
  17. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and swirl to coat.
  18. Place the patties in the skillet, seasoned side down, and sear for 2 minutes.
  19. Carefully flip the patties and sear the other side for 2 minutes.
  20. Transfer the skillet to the oven for 3 minutes to cook the center of the patties.
  21. Remove the skillet from the oven, add 1 teaspoon of unsalted butter and a 40 gram chunk of Monterey Jack cheese to each patty.
  22. Return to the oven for 2 minutes to melt the cheese.
  23. Remove the patties from the oven and let them rest for 5 minutes.
  24. Wipe the skillet clean and heat it over medium heat.
  25. Toast burger buns until golden brown, checking frequently to prevent burning.
  26. Assemble the burgers by spreading herby mayonnaise on the top and bottom buns.
  27. Layer romaine lettuce, sliced tomato with a pinch of salt, the beef patty, bacon, and the top bun.
  28. Slice the burger in half and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YMEMXy6Om3E

beef_casserole.txt - Beef Casserole

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and tender beef casserole
  • Utilize a slow-cooking method for melting beef
  • Achieve a rich sauce with a balance of flavors

Ingredients

  • 3 large brown or yellow onions OR 6 shallots (peeled, root intact, quartered)
  • 3 medium carrots (washed, tops left on, sliced into 3 cm pieces)
  • 3 ribs of celery (optional, sliced into 3 cm pieces)
  • 6 cloves of garlic (peeled, woody stems removed, crushed)
  • 5 grams or 0.3 ounces of thyme (roughly chopped, optional, for garnish)
  • 1.4 kilos or 3 pounds of diced beef bowler blade
  • 70 grams or 2.4 ounces of plain all-purpose flour
  • 1 tablespoon or 20 milliliters of olive oil (x3)
  • 5 grams or 0.3 ounces of whole thyme
  • Sea salt flakes (to taste)
  • 10 cracks of black pepper
  • 1 cup or 250 milliliters of red wine OR beef stock
  • 2 and a half tablespoons or 35 grams of concentrated tomato paste
  • 2 and a half tablespoons or 50 milliliters of balsamic vinegar
  • 1 liter or 4 cups of beef stock
  • 3 bay leaves (optional)
  • Flat leaf parsley (optional, for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Peel 3 large brown or yellow onions (or 6 shallots) leaving the root intact. Quarter them.
  2. Wash 3 medium carrots, leaving the tops on. Slice them into 3 cm pieces.
  3. Slice 3 ribs of celery (optional) into 3 cm pieces.
  4. Peel 6 cloves of garlic, remove the woody stems, and crush them with the side of a knife.
  5. Roughly chop 5 grams (0.3 ounces) of thyme (optional) for garnish.
  6. Combine 1.4 kilos (3 pounds) of diced beef bowler blade with 70 grams (2.4 ounces) of flour in a bowl. Mix well to coat the beef.
  7. Place a large, high-rimmed pan or pot over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon (20 ml) of olive oil.
  8. Once hot, add the floured beef in batches, shaking off excess flour. Sear for 2.5-3 minutes per side to create a golden crust.
  9. Remove the seared beef and place in a clean bowl to rest.
  10. Add another 1 tablespoon (20 ml) of olive oil to the pan and repeat the searing process with the remaining beef.
  11. Reduce heat to medium-high. Add another 1 tablespoon (20 ml) of olive oil to the pan.
  12. Add the onions, carrots, celery, and garlic. Saute for 4 minutes, stirring regularly.
  13. Add 5 grams (0.3 ounces) of whole thyme, sea salt flakes to taste, and 10 cracks of black pepper. Continue mixing and sauteing for 1 minute.
  14. Deglaze the pan with 1 cup (250 ml) of red wine or beef stock. Reduce for 2 minutes until it reaches half a cup (125 ml).
  15. Add 2.5 tablespoons (35 grams) of concentrated tomato paste and mix. Cook for 1 minute.
  16. Add the seared beef back into the pan, along with any resting juices.
  17. Add 2.5 tablespoons (50 ml) of balsamic vinegar, 1 liter (4 cups) of beef stock, and 3 bay leaves (optional). Mix well.
  18. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat, stirring occasionally.
  19. Once boiling, cover with a lid or foil and transfer to a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit). Bake undisturbed for 1.5 hours.
  20. Carefully remove the casserole from the oven and place back on the stovetop or a heat-resistant surface.
  21. Remove the lid or foil and gently mix to combine the surface oils and flavors.
  22. Check for seasoning and adjust with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper.
  23. Return the casserole to the oven (lid off) and bake for an additional 30 minutes.
  24. Remove the casserole from the oven and gently mix again to ensure all flavors are combined.
  25. Garnish with the chopped thyme (optional).
  26. Serve the casserole in bowls, on its own or with various sides.
  27. Garnish with flat leaf parsley (optional).

Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N4Qc7CaRS_Y

beef_chili.txt - Beef Chili

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and flavorful beef chili.
  • Understand the importance of sweating onions and garlic.
  • Master the technique of simmering chili for optimal flavor development.

Ingredients

  • 1 large brown onion
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 5 grams flat leaf parsley
  • 2 tablespoons (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 kg (2.3 lbs) beef mince/ground beef
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon cracked black pepper
  • 2 tablespoons (2 grams) dried oregano
  • 2 teaspoons (4 grams) smoked paprika
  • 3 tablespoons (16 grams) ground cumin
  • 1/2 teaspoon (0.2 grams) cayenne pepper (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons (35 grams) tomato paste
  • 1/2 cup (125 ml) beef stock
  • 800 grams (28 ounces) crushed or diced tomatoes
  • 400 grams (14 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed
  • 1 cup (390 grams) jasmine rice, washed
  • 1 star anise
  • 3 cardamom pods
  • 3 3/4 cups (860 ml) cold water
  • Sour cream (optional)
  • Fresh coriander/cilantro (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion in half, remove the ends and skin, and save the root for stock.
  2. Thinly slice the onion, stopping just before the root, and slice in half again, stopping at the root.
  3. Dice the onion into medium-sized pieces, trimming off any excess flesh from the root.
  4. Crush the garlic cloves with the side of a knife.
  5. Thinly slice the garlic and chop it finely.
  6. Scrunch the parsley into a tight ball and thinly slice it.
  7. Heat a large pot over high heat.
  8. Add olive oil to the pot and heat.
  9. Add the diced onions and stir, sweating them for 3 minutes.
  10. Add the chopped garlic and stir constantly for 45 seconds.
  11. Add the beef mince and break it up, cooking for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  12. Season the beef with salt and pepper, mixing well.
  13. Continue cooking the beef until most of the fat has evaporated.
  14. Add oregano, smoked paprika, ground cumin, cayenne pepper (optional), and tomato paste.
  15. Stir and fry for 1 minute.
  16. Pour in beef stock and crushed tomatoes, mixing well.
  17. Season with salt and pepper.
  18. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  19. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour, checking every 20 minutes.
  20. After 40 minutes, add the rinsed kidney beans and chopped parsley.
  21. Stir well and adjust seasoning.
  22. Simmer for the remaining 20 minutes.
  23. For the rice, bring a large saucepan with rice, star anise, cardamom pods, and cold water to a boil.
  24. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 14 minutes.
  25. Remove the saucepan from heat and let it rest, covered, for 5 minutes.
  26. Remove the lid from the chili and stir well.
  27. Remove the lid from the rice, remove the star anise and cardamom pods, and fluff the rice with a fork.
  28. Serve the chili over the rice, adding sour cream and fresh coriander/cilantro as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HIYHDNKOMYk

beef_madras_curry.txt - Beef Madras Curry

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and tender beef curry using simple ingredients.
  • Learn to sear beef for a rich flavor.
  • Master the art of making a flavorful and thick gravy.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion, peeled and sliced
  • 3 cloves peeled garlic
  • 35 grams or 1.2 ounces peeled ginger
  • 1 kilo or 2.2 pounds chuck steak
  • 1 tablespoon or 14 grams ghee or clarified butter
  • 1 teaspoon or 3 grams whole cumin seeds
  • 3 bay leaves
  • 1 tablespoon or 14 grams ghee or clarified butter
  • 1 and a half teaspoons or 3 grams ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon or 2.5 grams ground coriander
  • 2 and a half teaspoons or 4.5 grams garam masala
  • half a teaspoon or 1.5 grams red chili powder or kashmiri chili powder
  • three quarters of a teaspoon or 2 grams ground turmeric
  • 8 to 10 curry leaves (optional)
  • 1 400 gram or 14.1 ounce can of diced tomatoes
  • sea salt flakes
  • cracked black pepper (optional)
  • hot water
  • 1 cup or 200 grams washed basmati rice
  • 2 cups plus 1 tablespoon or 520 milliliters of cold water
  • half a cinnamon stick
  • Fresh coriander or cilantro (for garnish)
  • Roti or naan bread (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion in half moon shapes.
  2. Grate the garlic and ginger.
  3. Heat a large pot over high heat.
  4. Add 1 tablespoon of ghee and melt.
  5. Sear the chuck steak in batches for 4 minutes per side, ensuring good browning.
  6. Remove the beef and set aside.
  7. Add 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds and 3 bay leaves to the pot.
  8. Add 1 tablespoon of ghee and toast the cumin seeds for 1 minute until golden and cracking.
  9. Add the sliced onion and sauté for 4 minutes, stirring frequently.
  10. Add the grated garlic and ginger and sauté for 1 minute.
  11. Add the ground cumin, coriander, garam masala, red chili powder, and turmeric.
  12. Toast the spices for 45 seconds, stirring constantly.
  13. Add 8 to 10 curry leaves (optional).
  14. Pour in the diced tomatoes and bring to a boil, stirring regularly.
  15. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  16. Return the seared beef and any resting juices to the pot.
  17. Pour in enough hot water to cover the beef, adding more as needed.
  18. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour and 20 minutes, stirring halfway through.
  19. After 1 hour, prepare the rice by combining basmati rice, cold water, cinnamon stick, and salt in a saucepan.
  20. Bring the rice mixture to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and steam for 14 minutes.
  21. Turn off the heat and leave the lid on for 4 minutes.
  22. Remove the lid, discard the cinnamon stick, and fluff the rice.
  23. After 1 hour and 20 minutes, check the curry. The beef should be tender and the gravy thick.
  24. Adjust the gravy's thickness by adding a splash of water if needed.
  25. Remove the curry from the heat.
  26. Serve the beef curry over a bed of steamed rice, garnished with fresh coriander or cilantro.
  27. Serve with roti or naan bread.
  28. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qL6tevHQYhw

beef_mushroom_stir_fry.txt - Beef and Mushroom Stir Fry

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful beef and mushroom stir fry
  • Maximize flavor through proper ingredient prep and cooking techniques
  • Utilize a budget-friendly cut of meat for a delicious result

Ingredients

  • 1-2 brown or yellow onions, sliced
  • 4 cloves garlic, roughly chopped
  • 10g ginger, peeled and sliced into matchsticks
  • 300g mushrooms (Swiss brown and shiitake), sliced
  • 3-4 spring onions, white root sliced large, green stem thinly sliced
  • 400g porterhouse steak (or rump, flank, or eye fillet), trimmed and sliced thin
  • 2 tbsp low sodium soy sauce
  • 2 tsp corn flour (or cornstarch)
  • 1/2 tsp bicarb soda (or bicarbonate of soda)
  • Ground white pepper to taste
  • 2 1/2 tbsp oyster sauce
  • 1 tsp black soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp low sodium soy sauce
  • 1 tsp sugar
  • 1 tsp rice wine vinegar
  • 1 1/2 tbsp vegetable oil (or peanut oil)
  • Rice noodles (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice onions, garlic, and ginger.
  2. Slice mushrooms into thick slices.
  3. Slice spring onions, separating white root and green stem.
  4. Trim and thinly slice steak across the grain.
  5. Marinate steak with soy sauce, corn flour, bicarb soda, and white pepper.
  6. Combine stir fry sauce ingredients: oyster sauce, black soy sauce, soy sauce, sugar, rice wine vinegar, and white pepper.
  7. Heat wok over high heat until lightly smoking.
  8. Add oil to wok, then add marinated beef, spreading it out.
  9. Cook beef for 30 seconds to create a crust, then stir fry for 2-3 minutes until no longer pink and browned.
  10. Add onions, garlic, and ginger to wok, stir fry for 1-1.5 minutes until fragrant.
  11. Add mushrooms to wok, stir fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly firm but not falling apart.
  12. Add stir fry sauce and white spring onion stems to wok, stir fry for 1 minute until sauce thickens.
  13. Remove from heat and serve with rice noodles or plain, garnished with green spring onion.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lVNJXFpMe_E

beef_noodle_stir_fry.txt - Beef Noodle Stir Fry

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful beef noodle stir fry.
  • Master the technique of stir-frying ingredients separately.
  • Create a balanced sauce for the stir fry.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- 350 grams of steak (rump, fillet, flank, or skirt) | 牛肉 (niú ròu) 50 milliliters of Shaoxing wine | 绍兴酒 (shào xīng jiǔ) 6 grams of corn flour | 玉米粉 (yù mǐ fěn) sea salt flakes | 海盐 (hǎi yán) ground white pepper | 白胡椒粉 (bái hú jiāo fěn) 1 small brown or yellow onion | 洋葱 (yáng cōng) 1 medium carrot | 胡萝卜 (hú luó bo) 5 cloves of garlic | 大蒜 (dà suàn) 10 grams of peeled ginger | 生姜 (shēng jiāng) 2 baby bok choy | 小白菜 (xiǎo bái cài) 180 milliliters of chicken stock | 鸡汤 (jī tāng) 50 milliliters of light soy sauce | 生抽 (shēng chōu) 30 milliliters of Shaoxing wine | 绍兴酒 (shào xīng jiǔ) 5 milliliters of black vinegar | 黑醋 (hēi cù) 30 grams of oyster sauce | 生蚝酱 (shēng háo jiàng) 10 grams of corn flour | 玉米粉 (yù mǐ fěn) sugar (optional) | 糖 (táng) ground white pepper | 白胡椒粉 (bái hú jiāo fěn) 2 tablespoons of peanut oil | 花生油 (huā shēng yóu) 300 grams of noodles (fresh egg noodles or dried) | 面条 (miàn tiáo) thinly sliced spring onion or scallion | 葱花 (cōng huā) homemade chili oil (optional) | 自制辣椒油 (zì zhì là jiāo yóu)

Instructions

  1. Thinly slice the steak across the grain.
  2. Combine steak, Shaoxing wine, corn flour, sea salt flakes, and ground white pepper in a bowl. Mix well and set aside to marinate.
  3. Slice the onion in half, then thinly slice in a half-moon shape.
  4. Slice the carrot in half lengthwise, then remove a strip from the side. Slice into thin strips and then julienne.
  5. Grate the garlic and ginger into a paste.
  6. Separate the bok choy leaves from the stems. Chop both into even-sized pieces.
  7. In a bowl, combine chicken stock, light soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, black vinegar, oyster sauce, corn flour, sugar (optional), and ground white pepper. Mix well.
  8. Heat a large pan or wok over high heat. Add peanut oil.
  9. Stir-fry the beef in batches for 1.5-2 minutes, until golden brown on the outside. Remove and set aside.
  10. Add another splash of peanut oil to the pan. Stir-fry the onions and carrots for 2 minutes until golden.
  11. Add the garlic and ginger paste and stir-fry for 45 seconds.
  12. Add the bok choy stems and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
  13. Pour in the sauce and stir-fry until it boils and thickens.
  14. Add the bok choy leaves and stir-fry until wilted.
  15. Return the beef and any resting juices to the pan. Stir-fry to combine.
  16. Add the cooked noodles and stir-fry until everything is combined.
  17. Remove from heat and serve. Garnish with spring onion and chili oil (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ir4nbjSJwL0

beef_onion_stew_garlic_mash.txt - Beef and Onion Stew with Garlic Mash

Objectives

  • Create a simple, flavorful beef and onion stew.
  • Make a creamy garlic mash to accompany the stew.
  • Learn to brown beef for a rich sauce.
  • Utilize a potato ricer for a smooth mash.

Ingredients

Beef and Onion Stew - 3 large brown or yellow onions - 2 ribs celery, thinly sliced - 250 g Swiss brown mushrooms, thinly sliced or quartered - 5 large cloves garlic, thinly sliced - 10 g fresh thyme, roughly chopped (optional) - 1 kg beef blade, chuck roast, or chuck steak - Sea salt flakes - 25 g plain flour - 2 tbsp olive oil - 150 ml red wine (or beef stock) - 600 ml beef stock - 1 bunch baby carrots, washed (leave tops on)

Garlic Mash - 5 large cloves garlic, minced - 1 kg high starch potatoes - 150 g unsalted butter - 150 ml full fat milk, warmed - Sea salt flakes - Ground white pepper

Instructions

  1. Peel three large brown or yellow onions, leaving the root intact.
  2. Cut the onions in half, then in half again, and then in half again to create eight even-sized pieces.
  3. Thinly slice two ribs of celery.
  4. Thinly slice or quarter 250g of Swiss brown mushrooms.
  5. Thinly slice five large cloves of garlic.
  6. Roughly chop 10g of fresh thyme, removing any woody stems (optional).
  7. Season 1 kg of beef blade, chuck roast, or chuck steak with sea salt flakes and coat with 25g of plain flour.
  8. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan over high heat and add 2 tbsp of olive oil.
  9. Sear the beef in batches for 3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
  10. Remove the seared beef from the pan and place it in a bowl to rest.
  11. Add 1 tbsp of olive oil to the pan, reduce heat to medium-high, and add the onions, celery, mushrooms, and a pinch of sea salt flakes.
  12. Sauté for 5 minutes, stirring regularly, until the mushrooms release moisture and the onions caramelize.
  13. Add the sliced garlic to the pan.
  14. Pour in 150 ml of red wine (or beef stock) and stir for 2 minutes, bringing the wine to a boil.
  15. Return the seared beef and any resting juices to the pan along with 600 ml of beef stock and the thyme (if using).
  16. Stir to combine and ensure the beef is submerged in the liquid.
  17. Bring the mixture to a boil, then season with sea salt flakes and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  18. While the stew simmers, mince five large cloves of garlic using a microplane, box grater, or garlic press.
  19. Peel 1 kg of high starch potatoes and place them in a large pot.
  20. Fill the pot with cold water, 1 inch above the potatoes.
  21. Bring the potatoes to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat and cook for 22-23 minutes until tender.
  22. Drain the potatoes in a colander and let them cool for 15 minutes.
  23. Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add 150g of unsalted butter.
  24. Allow the butter to melt and foam, then add the minced garlic and cook for 3 minutes, stirring regularly, until golden brown.
  25. Remove the garlic butter from the heat.
  26. Mash the potatoes using a potato ricer, blender, fork, or handheld potato masher until smooth.
  27. Warm 150 ml of full fat milk in a pan or microwave.
  28. Add the warmed milk, garlic butter (reserving some crispy bits), and a pinch of sea salt flakes to the mashed potatoes.
  29. Stir until smooth and season with ground white pepper.
  30. Remove the lid from the stew and add 1 bunch of washed baby carrots (leave tops on).
  31. Push the carrots down into the liquid and continue cooking for 30 minutes until tender and the sauce is thickened.
  32. Remove the stew from the heat.
  33. To serve, spread a portion of the garlic mash on a plate or bowl.
  34. Top the mash with the reserved crispy garlic bits and a dollop of garlic butter.
  35. Add a generous portion of the stew, including meat and vegetables.
  36. Arrange 2-3 baby carrots on the side.
  37. Spoon over any remaining sauce.
  38. Garnish with fresh thyme.
  39. Enjoy the warming and comforting beef stew with garlic mash and al dente carrots.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8t5Lzg4CzYQ

beef_ragu_pasta.txt - Beef Ragu Pasta

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful beef ragu for pasta.
  • Learn to sear beef and sweat onions.
  • Simmer the ragu for a rich and complex flavor.

Ingredients

  • 1 onion, sliced and diced
  • 2-3 cloves garlic, crushed and chopped
  • Beef, seasoned with salt and pepper
  • Olive oil
  • Salt
  • Chili flakes
  • Tomato paste
  • Red wine
  • 1 beef bouillon cube, crushed
  • Crushed tomatoes
  • Beef stock
  • Fresh thyme
  • Dried bay leaves
  • Basil stems
  • Worcestershire sauce
  • Cooked pasta of choice
  • Parmesan cheese, grated
  • Basil leaves

Instructions

  1. Slice and dice the onion into small to medium sized pieces.
  2. Crush the garlic with the side of a knife and chop roughly.
  3. Season the beef with salt and pepper and mix well.
  4. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  5. Add the beef in batches and fry until browned all over.
  6. Add the onion with a pinch of salt and sweat for about four minutes.
  7. Add the garlic and chili flakes and cook for one minute.
  8. Add the tomato paste and mix well.
  9. Cook the tomato paste for two minutes.
  10. Add the red wine, crushed bouillon cube, and mix well.
  11. Bring the mixture to a boil and reduce for a couple of minutes.
  12. Add crushed tomatoes, beef stock, fresh thyme, dried bay leaves, basil stems, Worcestershire sauce, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
  13. Bring the mixture to a boil, cover, and simmer for two to two and a half hours.
  14. Remove the herbs and break up the beef with tongs.
  15. Add the cooked pasta of your choice to the sauce and mix well.
  16. Garnish with Parmesan cheese and basil leaves.
  17. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t0ev-n6KfA0

beef_rendang.txt - Beef Rendang

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy beef rendang recipe.
  • Create a fragrant and creamy sauce that melts in your mouth.
  • Achieve tender beef that falls apart easily.

Ingredients

  • 4 dried chilies (fresh can also be used)
  • 1 can (400 ml) coconut milk
  • 5 golden shallots (not red onions)
  • 2 lemongrass roots (white part)
  • 1 whole stalk of lemongrass
  • 6 kaffir lime leaves
  • 6 cloves of garlic
  • 15 grams ginger
  • 15 grams galangal
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 ml) vegetable oil
  • 4 star anise
  • 5 green cardamom pods
  • 4 cloves
  • 1 cinnamon stick
  • Salt to taste
  • 1 kg (2.2 lbs) beef chuck steak (or beef short rib)
  • Splash of chicken stock or water (optional)
  • 25 grams tamarind puree (or paste)
  • 1 cup (200 grams) washed jasmine rice
  • 1.25 cups (310 ml) cold water
  • 3 kaffir lime leaves (optional)
  • 15 grams grated palm sugar (or granulated sugar)

Instructions

  1. Soak the dried chilies in hot water for 10-15 minutes to soften them.
  2. Toast shredded coconut in a pan over medium heat for 2-3 minutes until golden brown and fragrant. Remove from heat.
  3. Roughly chop the shallots, lemongrass roots, and chilies.
  4. Bruise the whole stalk of lemongrass by banging it on the bench. Cut into 2-3 pieces.
  5. Stack kaffir lime leaves and slice thinly.
  6. Blend the shallots, garlic, chopped chilies, ginger, galangal, and lemongrass into a coarse paste.
  7. Heat vegetable oil in a large, high-rimmed pan over medium-high heat.
  8. Add the blended paste to the pan, scraping the blender bowl to ensure all the paste is used.
  9. Add star anise, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick, and salt to the pan. Mix well and cook for 3 minutes to release the flavors.
  10. Add the beef chuck steak (or short rib) and chopped lemongrass to the pan. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes, browning the beef.
  11. Add the coconut milk, chicken stock (or water), tamarind puree, and mix well. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
  12. Add the toasted coconut, kaffir lime leaves, and palm sugar. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
  13. Reduce heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 1.5 hours. Stir halfway through.
  14. Remove the lid carefully, being mindful of steam, and gently mix the rendang.
  15. If desired, add water or stock to adjust the sauce consistency.
  16. For the rice, combine washed jasmine rice, cold water, kaffir lime leaves, and salt in a pot. Mix well.
  17. Bring the rice to a boil, cover the pot, reduce heat to low, and cook for 12 minutes.
  18. Turn off the heat and leave the lid on for 6 minutes.
  19. Remove the lid and discard the kaffir lime leaves. Fluff the rice with a spatula or fork.
  20. To serve, place rice in a bowl or plate. Top with beef rendang, lemongrass, and chili (optional). Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=79122ZTYMx8

beef_short_rib_broth.txt - Beef Short Rib Broth

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and aromatic beef short rib broth.
  • Learn how to properly sear beef short ribs for optimal flavor.
  • Prepare soba noodles and bok choy for a complete meal.

Ingredients

  • 1 tablespoon peanut oil
  • 1.2 kilos beef short ribs
  • 2 tablespoons red miso paste
  • 90 milliliters soy sauce
  • 130 milliliters mirin
  • 1.7 liters chicken stock
  • 8 thinly sliced spring onions
  • 15 grams julienned ginger
  • 1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar
  • 2 bunches baby bok choy
  • 270 grams soba noodles

Instructions

  1. Add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil to a large pot and heat over medium-high heat.
  2. Add 1.2 kilos of beef short ribs to the pot and sear on all four sides for 3 minutes or until golden brown.
  3. Add 2 tablespoons of red miso paste, 90 milliliters of soy sauce, 130 milliliters of mirin, 1.7 liters of chicken stock, 8 thinly sliced spring onions, and 15 grams of julienned ginger to the pot.
  4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes.
  5. After 45 minutes, skim off any fat from the surface of the broth and discard it.
  6. Cover the pot again and simmer for another 45 minutes.
  7. While the broth simmers, bring a pot of water to a boil and add 270 grams of soba noodles.
  8. Cook the noodles according to the package instructions, then drain.
  9. After the second 45 minutes of simmering, remove the lid from the pot and add 1 tablespoon of rice wine vinegar and 2 bunches of baby bok choy to the broth.
  10. Mix to combine and cook for 4 minutes.
  11. Remove the pot from the heat.
  12. Place the cooked soba noodles in a bowl.
  13. Top the noodles with the beef short ribs and bok choy.
  14. Pour the broth over the noodles, covering them completely.
  15. Garnish with remaining spring onions and serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5O2Hf0QmwcY

beef_short_rib_hot_pot.txt - Beef Short Rib Hot Pot

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and aromatic Beef Short Rib Hot Pot.
  • Learn to sear beef short ribs for maximum flavor.
  • Create a rich broth with miso paste, soy sauce, and mirin.

Ingredients

  • 8 spring onions
  • 15 grams ginger, peeled and julienned
  • 2 bunches baby bok choy (optional)
  • 1.2 kilos beef short ribs
  • 1 tablespoon peanut oil
  • 2 tablespoons red miso paste
  • 90 milliliters soy sauce
  • 130 milliliters mirin
  • 2 liters chicken stock
  • 1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar
  • 270 grams soba noodles

Instructions

  1. Slice 8 spring onions on a slight angle, keeping the roots for stock or other uses.
  2. Thinly slice 15 grams of peeled ginger into matchstick cuts (julienne).
  3. If using, trim the roots of 2 bunches of baby bok choy, wash, and set aside the leaves.
  4. Sear 1.2 kilos of beef short ribs in 1 tablespoon of peanut oil over high heat for 3 minutes per side (total of 12 minutes) until golden brown.
  5. Add 2 tablespoons of red miso paste, 90 milliliters of soy sauce, 130 milliliters of mirin, 2 liters of chicken stock, ¾ of the sliced spring onions, and the julienned ginger to the pot.
  6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 50 minutes.
  7. After 50 minutes, skim off any excess fat from the surface of the broth.
  8. Continue simmering the short ribs for another 50 minutes.
  9. 15 minutes before the short ribs are finished cooking, bring a saucepan of water to a boil and add 270 grams of soba noodles.
  10. Cook the noodles for 20 seconds, then continue cooking according to the package instructions (approximately 4 minutes).
  11. Drain the cooked noodles.
  12. 4 minutes before the short ribs are finished cooking, add 1 tablespoon of rice wine vinegar and the baby bok choy to the pot.
  13. Simmer for 4 minutes to slightly soften the bok choy.
  14. To serve, place soba noodles in a bowl, followed by the short ribs, baby bok choy, and broth.
  15. Garnish with the remaining spring onion.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kTFPa89OSk8

beef_short_rib_lemongrass_curry.txt - Beef Short Rib and Lemongrass Curry

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and aromatic curry using beef short rib and lemongrass.
  • Develop a rich and creamy sauce with coconut milk, cream, and fish sauce.
  • Learn to cook the curry in the oven for a tender and flavorful result.

Ingredients

  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 30 grams peeled ginger
  • 1/2 amount of ginger if using galangal (optional)
  • 2 pieces lemongrass (one root end, one middle stem)
  • 3 long red chilies (optional)
  • 40 grams palm sugar (can be substituted with brown sugar)
  • 3 potatoes
  • 200 grams green beans (optional)
  • 1 lime
  • 1.2 kilos diced beef short rib
  • 100 milliliters grapeseed oil
  • 2 tablespoons grapeseed oil
  • 2 cups chicken stock
  • 1 can coconut milk
  • 1 can coconut cream
  • 2.5 tablespoons fish sauce
  • 3 kaffir lime leaves
  • small pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 1 cinnamon stick
  • 2 star anise
  • 1.5 cups jasmine rice
  • 2 cups cold water
  • 4 kaffir lime leaves
  • small pinch of sea salt flakes
  • chopped cilantro or coriander (optional)
  • fried shallots (optional)
  • sliced chili (optional)

Instructions

  1. Create pastes of garlic and ginger (and galangal if using) on a microplane.
  2. Bruise the root end of the lemongrass with the back of a knife.
  3. Slice the middle stem of the lemongrass as finely as possible.
  4. Remove the stems of the chilies and thinly slice one for garnish.
  5. Roughly chop the remaining chilies.
  6. Grate the palm sugar on the larger side of a box grater.
  7. Slice potatoes in half, then in half again lengthwise, rotate 90 degrees, and dice into even-sized chunks.
  8. Trim the woody stems from the green beans and slice them as desired.
  9. Slice the lime into wedges.
  10. In a blender, combine the garlic and ginger paste, galangal (if using), sliced lemongrass, chopped chilies, and grapeseed oil. Blend into a coarse but smooth paste.
  11. Heat a large pot over high heat.
  12. Add 2 tablespoons of grapeseed oil to the hot pot.
  13. Add the diced beef short rib in batches and sear for 5 minutes on each side, ensuring it's not overcrowded.
  14. Remove the seared beef short rib from the pot, leaving the oil and fat behind.
  15. Return the pot to medium-high heat and add the curry paste. Saute for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
  16. Add the palm sugar or brown sugar and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, until dissolved.
  17. Add 2 cups of chicken stock and bring to a boil.
  18. Add coconut milk, coconut cream, fish sauce, bruised lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and a small pinch of sea salt. Mix well.
  19. Add cinnamon stick, star anise, and seared beef short rib with its juices. Mix well.
  20. Bring to a light boil, cover, remove from the stovetop, and place in a preheated oven at 160°C/320°F for 2 hours.
  21. After 2 hours, remove the curry from the oven and place back on the stovetop over medium-high heat. Mix well.
  22. Add the diced potatoes, mix gently, cover, and return to the oven for 45 minutes.
  23. In a large saucepan, combine jasmine rice, cold water, kaffir lime leaves, and a small pinch of sea salt.
  24. Bring the rice mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes undisturbed.
  25. Turn off the heat and leave the lid on for 9 minutes.
  26. Remove the lid, discard the kaffir lime leaves, and fluff the rice with a fork.
  27. Remove the curry from the oven and place back on the stovetop over low heat.
  28. Add the green beans, mix gently, and cook for 6-7 minutes.
  29. Serve the curry in bowls, garnished with sliced chili, coriander, and fried shallots (optional).
  30. Enjoy with the fragrant jasmine rice.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gcYjQcvmi4Y

beef_stew.txt - Beef Stew

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and easy beef stew
  • Achieve a rich, reduced sauce
  • Learn to brown beef properly for maximum flavor

Ingredients

  • 2 medium brown or yellow onions
  • 6 shallots (optional)
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 7 grams fresh oregano (or dried oregano, details in description)
  • 1.5 kilos chuck beef, large diced
  • 30 milliliters olive oil
  • Salt to taste
  • 4 grams ground cumin
  • 130 grams tomato paste
  • 160 milliliters dried red wine (or beef/chicken stock)
  • 60 milliliters red wine vinegar
  • 550 milliliters chicken/beef stock (or water)
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 2 whole cinnamon sticks
  • 10 whole cloves
  • 4 whole dried bay leaves
  • 90 grams currants (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice onions in half, peel and dice into large pieces.
  2. Peel shallots and leave whole.
  3. Crush garlic cloves with the side of a knife.
  4. Chop oregano roughly.
  5. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
  6. Brown the chuck beef in batches, seasoning with salt.
  7. Remove browned beef and set aside.
  8. Saute onions and shallots in the same pan for 3 minutes.
  9. Add garlic and saute for 45 seconds.
  10. Stir in cumin and tomato paste, cook for 1 minute.
  11. Add red wine and boil for 30 seconds to deglaze the pan.
  12. Add red wine vinegar, chicken/beef stock, and season with salt and pepper.
  13. Simmer for 3 minutes.
  14. Return beef and resting juices to the pan.
  15. Add cinnamon sticks, cloves, and bay leaves.
  16. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 1 hour.
  17. Remove lid and add oregano and currants (optional).
  18. Stir gently and simmer for another hour, uncovered.
  19. Remove from heat and discard bay leaves.
  20. Serve with mashed potatoes or other desired accompaniments.
  21. Garnish with fresh oregano and cracked pepper (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9aIUZxFTMKk

beef_stir_fry.txt - Beef Stir Fry

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious beef stir fry in under 10 minutes.
  • Master the art of toasting spices for enhanced flavor.
  • Discover the secret to creating a flavorful and umami-rich sauce.

Ingredients

  • 1 teaspoon or 1.5 grams of Szechuan peppercorns (四川花椒)
  • 3/4 teaspoon or 0.75 grams of cumin seeds (孜然)
  • 1/2 teaspoon or 0.5 grams of coriander seeds (芫荽籽)
  • 4 cloves of garlic (大蒜)
  • 2 eye fillets or beef tenderloins (牛眼肉 or 牛里脊) - 250 grams or 8.8 ounces
  • 1 bunch of baby bok choy (小白菜)
  • 1 spring onion or scallion (葱) - optional
  • 450 grams or 15.8 ounces of noodles (面条)
  • 2 tablespoons or 40 milliliters of peanut oil (花生油)
  • 2 tablespoons or 40 milliliters of dark or regular soy sauce (酱油)
  • 2 tablespoons or 40 milliliters of oyster sauce (蚝油)
  • Sesame seeds (芝麻) - optional
  • Dried chili flakes or fresh chili (辣椒) - optional

Instructions

  1. Place a wok or pan on the stovetop over medium-high heat.
  2. Add 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) of Szechuan peppercorns, 3/4 teaspoon (0.75 grams) of cumin seeds, and 1/2 teaspoon (0.5 grams) of coriander seeds.
  3. Toast the spices for 1.5 to 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until golden and crackling.
  4. Remove the spices from the heat and let them cool for 10 minutes.
  5. Grind the cooled spices into a fine powder using a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
  6. Finely slice 4 cloves of peeled garlic.
  7. Slice 2 eye fillets or beef tenderloins (250 grams or 8.8 ounces) into thin strips.
  8. Wash and dry 1 bunch of baby bok choy.
  9. Snap off individual stems and leaves, separating them from the core.
  10. Slice the core and compost it.
  11. Slice any large bok choy leaves in half.
  12. Thinly slice the green stem of 1 spring onion or scallion on an angle, creating diamond or oval shapes (optional).
  13. Boil water according to your noodle packet instructions.
  14. Once cooked, drain the noodles in a sieve or colander.
  15. Over high heat, pour 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) of peanut oil into the wok or pan used for the spices.
  16. Swirl the oil to coat the wok.
  17. Add the sliced garlic and fry for 1.5 to 2 minutes, stirring regularly, until it starts to color and release its aroma.
  18. Add the thinly sliced beef and fry for 45 seconds, moving it constantly to brown it all over.
  19. Break up any pieces that may be stuck together.
  20. Add the spice mix and continue frying for 20 seconds, stirring regularly, to allow the flavors to blend.
  21. Add the prepared baby bok choy leaves, 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) of dark or regular soy sauce, and 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) of oyster sauce.
  22. Mix well to ensure everything is coated in the sauce.
  23. Cook for 30 seconds, stirring regularly.
  24. Add the drained noodles and mix well to coat them in the sauce.
  25. Cook for 45 seconds, stirring regularly, to heat the noodles.
  26. Remove the stir fry from the heat.
  27. Transfer to a serving bowl or plate, or eat directly from the wok.
  28. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and dried chili flakes or fresh chili (optional).
  29. Garnish with the thinly sliced spring onion (optional).
  30. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fftsu9PuUzQ

beef_stock.txt - Beef Stock

Objectives

  • Learn to make a rich and flavorful beef stock from scratch.
  • Understand the importance of roasting bones and vegetables for depth of flavor.
  • Learn how to store and use beef stock effectively.

Ingredients

  • 3 brown onions, halved and quartered (skin on)
  • 3 unpeeled carrots, roughly chopped
  • 1 large leek, halved and roughly chopped
  • 1 whole bulb of garlic, halved
  • 1.5 kg (3.3 lbs) beef neck bones (with some meat attached)
  • 1.5 kg (3.3 lbs) beef marrow bones
  • 3 celery stalks, roughly chopped
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) black peppercorns
  • 3 bay leaves

  • Cold water

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 230°C (450°F).
  2. Place onions, carrots, leek, garlic, and bones on a large oven tray lined with parchment paper, ensuring they are not overlapping.
  3. Roast in the oven for 20 minutes, until bones are deeply browned.
  4. Carefully flip the bones and roast for another 20 minutes.
  5. Transfer roasted bones and vegetables to a large stockpot.
  6. Add celery stalks, black peppercorns, and bay leaves to the pot.
  7. Fill the pot with enough cold water to reach three-quarters full.
  8. Bring the pot to a boil over high heat.
  9. Reduce heat to low, ensuring all ingredients are submerged in water.
  10. Place a lid on the pot, slightly ajar, and simmer for 6-24 hours (longer is better).
  11. After 2 hours, check the water level and top up with hot water if needed.
  12. Carefully skim off any scum buildup from the bones.
  13. Continue simmering for another 4-22 hours, checking and skimming every 1-2 hours.
  14. After 6 hours, remove the lid, turn off the heat, and let the stock cool for 30-40 minutes.
  15. Carefully pour the stock through a fine sieve into another pot or container, discarding the scraps.
  16. Gently scoop out the rendered fat from the surface of the stock, being careful not to remove any stock.
  17. Refrigerate the stock for 6-8 hours to allow the fat to solidify.
  18. Spoon out the solidified fat and discard.
  19. The stock will have turned into a jelly due to the collagen in the bones.
  20. To use the stock, place it in a saucepan over medium heat and melt it, stirring frequently, until smooth.
  21. Store the stock in the fridge for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 6 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pfL15LZEGrw

beef_stroganoff.txt - Beef Stroganoff

Objectives

  • Cook a delicious beef stroganoff in under 30 minutes.
  • Learn to sear beef for maximum flavor and tenderness.
  • Create a rich and tangy sauce with brandy, beef stock, and sour cream.

Ingredients

  • 2 x 250g (8.8oz) Scotch fillet steaks (boneless rib eye)
  • 350g (12.3oz) Swiss brown mushrooms
  • 4 tbsp (56g) unsalted butter
  • 1 brown onion, diced
  • 1 tbsp (20g) Dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp (5g) sea salt flakes
  • 1 tsp (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 80ml (1/3 cup) brandy (optional, can substitute with white wine or beef stock)
  • 1.5 cups (375ml) beef stock
  • 3/4 tbsp (15ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 3/4 tbsp (24g) plain flour
  • 3/4 cup (140g) sour cream
  • Flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Pound the steaks with a meat mallet to tenderize them.
  2. Slice the steaks into strips, 1-1.5cm thick.
  3. Slice the mushrooms into thick, even pieces.
  4. Heat a large pan over high heat.
  5. Add 2 tbsp (28g) butter to the pan and allow it to melt until it starts to brown.
  6. Add half of the sliced steak to the pan and sear for 45 seconds on each side, spreading it out to ensure even browning.
  7. Remove the seared steak and set aside.
  8. Add another 2 tbsp (28g) butter to the pan and add the diced onion.
  9. Saute the onion for 2 minutes, stirring regularly.
  10. Add the sliced mushrooms and saute for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.
  11. Add the Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper and mix until well coated.
  12. Pour in the brandy and cook for 2 minutes, stirring regularly, to deglaze the pan.
  13. Add the beef stock, Worcestershire sauce, and flour and mix well.
  14. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  15. Reduce the heat to low and add the sour cream and the seared steak.
  16. Gently mix everything together until the sour cream is fully incorporated.
  17. Adjust seasoning as needed.
  18. Serve the beef stroganoff over pasta, rice, mashed potatoes, or vegetables.
  19. Garnish with parsley and black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7jk1468EJmg

beef_taco_style_burrito_bowls.txt - Beef Taco Style Burrito Bowls

Objectives

  • Prepare a healthy and delicious meal prep recipe for beef taco style burrito bowls.
  • Learn how to make a flavorful corn salsa with charred corn.
  • Cook a seasoned beef mince with spices and stock.
  • Assemble the burrito bowls with rice, beef, salsa, cheese, and black beans.

Ingredients

For the Corn Salsa: - 1 can corn kernels (drained) - 2 medium tomatoes (diced) - 1/2 red onion (diced) - 1 jalapeno (diced, optional) - 7 grams coriander (roughly chopped, optional) - 2 small limes (juiced) - Sea salt flakes (to taste) - Cracked black pepper (20 cracks)

For the Spiced Beef: - 750 grams beef mince (82% lean) - 2 teaspoons olive oil - Sea salt flakes (to taste) - Cracked black pepper (10 cracks) - 1 teaspoon ground cumin - 1 teaspoon ground oregano - 1 teaspoon smoked paprika - 1/2 teaspoon chili powder - 3/4 cup beef, chicken, or vegetable stock - 3 spring onions (white root ends thinly sliced, optional)

For the Burrito Bowls: - 350 grams basmati rice (rinsed) - 700 ml cold water - 120 grams cheddar cheese (grated, optional) - 1 can black beans (rinsed) - Green stems from 3 spring onions (thinly sliced, optional) - Sriracha mayo (optional)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the Corn Salsa:
  2. Drain canned corn and spread in a pan over medium-high heat.
  3. Fry for 1.5-2 minutes, mixing occasionally, until golden.
  4. Transfer corn to a plate, spread out, and refrigerate.
  5. Dice tomatoes, red onion, and jalapeno (optional).
  6. Roughly chop coriander (optional).
  7. Juice limes.
  8. Combine all salsa ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
  9. Cook the Spiced Beef:
  10. Heat a large pan over high heat.
  11. Add olive oil and beef mince, spreading it out evenly.
  12. Fry for 1.5 minutes, then mix and cook for 6-7 minutes until browned.
  13. Season with salt and pepper.
  14. Drain excess fat from the pan.
  15. Add cumin, oregano, smoked paprika, and chili powder.
  16. Mix well and cook for 1 minute.
  17. Pour in stock and reduce for 1.5-2 minutes until thickened.
  18. Add white root ends of spring onions (optional) and cook for 30 seconds.
  19. Cook the Rice:
  20. Place a saucepan over high heat.
  21. Add rinsed rice and cold water (2:1 ratio).
  22. Season with salt and bring to a boil.
  23. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  24. Turn off heat and leave covered for 4 minutes.
  25. Fluff rice with a fork.
  26. Assemble the Burrito Bowls:
  27. Divide rice (120 grams) into bowls.
  28. Top with spiced beef (150 grams) and any leftover sauce.
  29. Add grated cheese (24 grams, optional).
  30. Add corn salsa (120 grams).
  31. Add black beans (80 grams).
  32. Garnish with sliced green onion stems (optional) and sriracha mayo (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IqgqMNJlQbk

beef_tataki.txt - Beef Tataki

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy beef tataki.
  • Prepare a tangy and umami-rich dressing for the beef.
  • Assemble a refreshing salad to accompany the beef.

Ingredients

Dressing - 1.5 tbsp (30 ml) cooking sake - 1.5 tbsp (30 ml) mirin - 2.5 tbsp (50 ml) soy sauce - 1.5 tbsp (30 ml) rice vinegar - 1 clove garlic, crushed - Juice of 1/2 orange

Salad - 1 small white or red onion, thinly sliced - 200g (7.05 oz) Chinese radish (daikon), grated

Beef - 2 large eye fillet steaks (500g / 1.1 lb) - Sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper - Seasoning of choice (optional) - 1.5 tbsp (30 ml) peanut or olive oil

Garnish - Fresh rocket, arugula, or watercress - Snow pea tendrils

Instructions

  1. Make the dressing:
  2. Combine sake, mirin, soy sauce, rice vinegar, garlic, and orange juice in a saucepan.
  3. Bring to a simmer over high heat.
  4. Remove from heat and let cool completely.
  5. Refrigerate until chilled (can be stored for up to 2 weeks).
  6. Prepare the salad:
  7. Slice onion thinly and place in a bowl.
  8. Grate daikon and place in a separate bowl.
  9. Cover both with cold water and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  10. Season the beef:
  11. Season eye fillets generously with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper on both sides.
  12. Roll in additional seasoning if desired.
  13. Sear the beef:
  14. Heat a pan over high heat until smoking hot.
  15. Add oil to the pan.
  16. Carefully place eye fillets in the pan and sear for 1.5 minutes per side, undisturbed.
  17. Flip and repeat for the remaining sides.
  18. Remove from pan and let rest for 10-15 minutes.
  19. Slice the beef:
  20. Once cooled, slice the beef as thinly as possible.
  21. Assemble the salad:
  22. Place rocket, arugula, or watercress on a plate.
  23. Top with drained onion and daikon.
  24. Drizzle with dressing.
  25. Arrange sliced beef evenly over the salad.
  26. Add more dressing to ensure the beef is well coated.
  27. Garnish with snow pea tendrils.
  28. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=22YYJWUhKVc

birya_tacos.txt - Birya Tacos

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and cost-effective birya taco recipe.
  • Learn to make a flavorful pico de gallo.
  • Prepare a rich and complex sauce using chipotle in adobo.

Ingredients

English:

  • 5 tomatoes (for pico de gallo)
  • 1 white onion (for pico de gallo)
  • 10 grams coriander or cilantro (for pico de gallo)
  • 1 jalapeno (for pico de gallo)
  • 2 small limes (for pico de gallo)
  • 5 tomatoes (for sauce)
  • 2 brown or yellow onions (for sauce)
  • 6 garlic cloves (for sauce)
  • 350 grams mozzarella cheese (for tacos)
  • 1.2 kilos bone-in chicken thighs (for tacos)
  • 2 teaspoons black peppercorns (for sauce)
  • 1.5 teaspoons cumin seeds (for sauce)
  • 1.5 teaspoons coriander seeds (for sauce)
  • 6 whole cloves (for sauce)
  • 1/2 cinnamon stick (for sauce)
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil (for chicken)
  • 220 grams chipotle in adobo (for sauce)
  • 1.5 tablespoons apple cider vinegar (for sauce)
  • 1 tablespoon dried oregano (for sauce)
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme (for sauce)
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika (for sauce)
  • 5 dried bay leaves (for sauce)
  • 650 milliliters chicken or vegetable stock (for sauce)
  • Sea salt flakes (for pico de gallo, chicken, sauce)
  • Cracked black pepper (for pico de gallo, sauce)
  • Corn tortillas (for tacos)

Chinese:

  • 番茄 (fān qié) - Tomatoes (5 for pico de gallo)
  • 白洋葱 (bái yáng cōng) - White onion (1 for pico de gallo)
  • 香菜 (xiāng cài) - Coriander or cilantro (10 grams for pico de gallo)
  • 青椒 (qīng jiāo) - Jalapeno (1 for pico de gallo)
  • 青柠 (qīng níng) - Lime (2 small for pico de gallo)
  • 番茄 (fān qié) - Tomatoes (5 for sauce)
  • 黄洋葱 (huáng yáng cōng) - Brown or yellow onion (2 for sauce)
  • 大蒜 (dà suàn) - Garlic cloves (6 for sauce)
  • 马苏里拉奶酪 (mǎ sū lǐ lá nǎi lào) - Mozzarella cheese (350 grams for tacos)
  • 鸡腿 (jī tuǐ) - Bone-in chicken thighs (1.2 kilos for tacos)
  • 黑胡椒粒 (hēi hú jiāo lì) - Black peppercorns (2 teaspoons for sauce)
  • 小茴香 (xiǎo huí xiāng) - Cumin seeds (1.5 teaspoons for sauce)
  • 香菜籽 (xiāng cài zǐ) - Coriander seeds (1.5 teaspoons for sauce)
  • 丁香 (dīng xiāng) - Whole cloves (6 for sauce)
  • 桂皮 (guì pí) - Cinnamon stick (1/2 for sauce)
  • 橄榄油 (gǎn lǎn yóu) - Olive oil (1 tablespoon for chicken)
  • 墨西哥辣椒 (mò xī gē là jiāo) - Chipotle in adobo (220 grams for sauce)
  • 苹果醋 (píng guǒ cù) - Apple cider vinegar (1.5 tablespoons for sauce)
  • 牛至 (niú zhì) - Dried oregano (1 tablespoon for sauce)
  • 百里香 (bǎi lǐ xiāng) - Dried thyme (1 teaspoon for sauce)
  • 烟熏辣椒粉 (yān xūn là jiāo fěn) - Smoked paprika (1 teaspoon for sauce)
  • 月桂叶 (yuè guì yè) - Dried bay leaves (5 for sauce)
  • 鸡汤 (jī tāng) - Chicken or vegetable stock (650 milliliters for sauce)
  • 海盐 (hǎi yán) - Sea salt flakes (for pico de gallo, chicken, sauce)
  • 黑胡椒粉 (hēi hú jiāo fěn) - Cracked black pepper (for pico de gallo, sauce)
  • 玉米饼 (yù mǐ bǐng) - Corn tortillas (for tacos)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the pico de gallo:
  2. Slice 5 tomatoes into quarters, remove seeds and pulp (optional), and dice into small pieces.
  3. Dice 1 white onion.
  4. Roughly chop 10 grams of coriander or cilantro.
  5. Remove the stem from 1 jalapeno, slice in half, and dice into small pieces.
  6. Juice 2 small limes.
  7. Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl.
  8. Add half of the lime juice, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to taste.
  9. Mix well and adjust seasoning with remaining lime juice as needed.
  10. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  11. Prepare the sauce:
  12. Slice 5 tomatoes in half, then into quarters, and finally into large chunks.
  13. Slice 2 brown or yellow onions in half and cut into large chunks.
  14. Roughly chop 6 garlic cloves.
  15. Place a large pan over medium-high heat.
  16. Toast 2 teaspoons black peppercorns, 1.5 teaspoons cumin seeds, 1.5 teaspoons coriander seeds, 6 whole cloves, and 1/2 cinnamon stick for 1.5-2 minutes until golden.
  17. Remove spices and set aside.
  18. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to the pan and sear 1.2 kilos of chicken thighs for 3 minutes per side, creating a golden crust.
  19. Remove chicken and set aside.
  20. Add the onions to the pan and sauté for 3 minutes, separating the layers, until lightly golden.
  21. Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
  22. Add 220 grams of chipotle in adobo, 1.5 tablespoons apple cider vinegar, 1 tablespoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, 5 dried bay leaves, the toasted spices, the tomato pulp and seeds (optional), the chopped tomatoes, 650 milliliters of chicken or vegetable stock, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to taste.
  23. Mix well and bring to a boil.
  24. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until everything softens.
  25. Blend the sauce using an immersion blender or a regular blender (let cool slightly before blending).
  26. Return the sauce to a simmer and mix well.
  27. Add the chicken and any resting juices to the sauce.
  28. Mix well and ensure chicken is fully covered in the sauce.
  29. Adjust seasoning if needed.
  30. Cover with a lid or foil and bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30 minutes.
  31. Shred the chicken:
  32. Remove the chicken from the oven and let cool slightly.
  33. Shred the chicken with a fork, removing all the meat from the bone and discarding any cartilage or bones.
  34. Assemble the tacos:
  35. Place a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat.
  36. Add 1 teaspoon olive oil.
  37. Dip a corn tortilla in the sauce on both sides and add to the hot pan.
  38. Push down with a spatula to prevent puffing and create an even golden crust.
  39. After 1 minute, flip the tortilla.
  40. Spread grated mozzarella cheese on one side of the tortilla.
  41. Add shredded chicken mixture to one side of the tortilla.
  42. Fold the tortilla over and press down to secure with the melted cheese.
  43. Cook for 45 seconds to 1 minute per side until golden.
  44. Remove from the pan and place on a wire rack.
  45. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
  46. Serve the tacos:
  47. Arrange the tacos on a plate or board.
  48. Spoon pico de gallo over the tacos or add it inside.
  49. Garnish with extra coriander or cilantro (optional).
  50. Serve with the remaining sauce for dipping.
  51. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sXNpFcfE6sU

blaet_sandwich.txt - BLT (or BlaET) Sandwich

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and customizable BLT sandwich with additional ingredients.
  • Make a flavorful Herby mayonnaise from scratch.
  • Assemble the sandwich with toasted bread, avocado, lettuce, tomato, bacon, and a fried egg.

Ingredients

  • 1 whole egg
  • 15 ml white vinegar
  • 10 g Dijon mustard
  • 180 ml neutral-flavored oil
  • 15 g fresh dill
  • 10 g flat-leaf parsley
  • Salt (to taste)
  • 1 avocado
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Baby cos lettuce (or lettuce of choice)
  • Gourmet tomatoes (or beefsteak tomatoes)
  • Middle bacon (or bacon of choice)
  • 1 loaf of Turkish bread (or bread of choice)
  • Butter (optional)
  • Olive oil (optional)
  • 10 ml olive oil
  • Water (for steaming eggs)
  • Sea salt flakes (for eggs)
  • Cracked black pepper (for eggs)

Instructions

  1. Make the Herby Mayonnaise:
  2. Combine 1 whole egg, 15 ml white vinegar, 10 g Dijon mustard, and 180 ml neutral-flavored oil in a bowl.
  3. Blend using an immersion blender until a thick emulsion forms.
  4. Add 15 g fresh dill, 10 g flat-leaf parsley, and a pinch of salt to the mayonnaise.
  5. Blend again until everything is evenly combined.
  6. Transfer the mayonnaise to a clean jar or container, scraping the sides to ensure no waste.
  7. Refrigerate until ready to serve (will last up to 4 days).
  8. Prepare the Avocado:
  9. Gently open an avocado and remove the seed using a dull knife.
  10. Scoop out the avocado flesh with a spoon or peel it by hand.
  11. Place the avocado flesh in a bowl.
  12. Add a pinch of sea salt flakes and mash the avocado.
  13. Prepare the Lettuce:
  14. Separate the baby cos lettuce from the core.
  15. Wash thoroughly and set aside.
  16. Prepare the Tomatoes:
  17. Slice the tomatoes as thin or thick as desired.
  18. Aim for 3-4 slices per sandwich.
  19. Bake the Bacon:
  20. Lay bacon strips on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, avoiding overlapping.
  21. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C for 13-14 minutes.
  22. Prepare the Bread:
  23. Slice the Turkish bread into four even-sized pieces.
  24. Use a bread knife to carefully slice each piece in half.
  25. Toast the Bread (optional):
  26. Butter or oil the bread slices (optional).
  27. Toast the bread in a pan over medium heat for 2.5-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy.
  28. Fry the Eggs (optional):
  29. Heat 10 ml olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
  30. Crack in the desired number of eggs.
  31. Spritz a little water from your fingers onto the eggs to create steam.
  32. Season with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper.
  33. Cook for 2.5-3 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
  34. Assemble the Sandwich:
  35. Spread Herby mayonnaise on both slices of toasted bread.
  36. Add mashed avocado (or sliced avocado) to one slice of bread.
  37. Layer 2-3 pieces of lettuce and 4 slices of tomatoes on top.
  38. Season with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper.
  39. Add the bacon and fried egg (if using) to the other slice of bread.
  40. Place the lid on the sandwich and gently press down to pop the egg yolk.
  41. Serve and Enjoy:
  42. Slice the sandwich open on an angle and serve.
  43. Dig in and enjoy your delicious BLT (or BlaET) sandwich!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NeDGF2eD25o

blooming_onion.txt - Blooming Onion

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a blooming onion from scratch.
  • Create a delicious and tangy mayonnaise dipping sauce.
  • Deep fry the onion to achieve a crispy and flavorful result.

Ingredients

Mayonnaise - 200 ml olive oil - 1 large egg - 1.5 tsp white vinegar or lemon juice - 1 tsp Dijon mustard - Sea salt flakes to taste - 1 tbsp tomato ketchup - 1 tbsp horseradish - 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce - 1 tsp garlic powder - 1 tsp smoked paprika - 1/2 tsp red chili powder (optional) - Pinch of sea salt flakes - 10 cracks black pepper

Blooming Onion - 1 large brown or yellow onion - Canola, sunflower, or vegetable oil (enough to submerge the onion) - 1 large egg - 250 ml full fat milk - 150 g plain all-purpose flour - 1/2 tbsp corn flour or starch - 1 tsp ground cumin - 1/2 tbsp smoked paprika - Pinch of sea salt flakes - 20 cracks black pepper

Instructions

  1. Make the mayonnaise:
  2. Combine olive oil, egg, vinegar, Dijon mustard, and salt in a tall jar.
  3. Blend using an immersion blender on low speed until emulsified and thick.
  4. Transfer to a bowl and add ketchup, horseradish, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, smoked paprika, chili powder (optional), salt, and pepper.
  5. Mix until combined and smooth.
  6. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  7. Prepare the onion:
  8. Slice off the tip of the onion, leaving the root intact.
  9. Peel the onion and save the scraps for stock.
  10. Slice the onion directly down next to the root, creating four slices in a cross shape.
  11. Continue slicing between each cross, then slice between those slices again, creating 16 even slices.
  12. Gently peel back each slice to create a blooming flower shape.
  13. Heat the oil:
  14. Fill a large pot halfway with oil (canola, sunflower, or vegetable).
  15. Heat to 170°C (340°F) using a thermometer.
  16. Make the egg wash:
  17. Whisk together one egg and 250 ml milk until smooth.
  18. Make the flour mix:
  19. Combine flour, corn flour, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
  20. Mix using a fork or whisk until combined.
  21. Dredge the onion:
  22. Coat the blooming onion in the flour mix, making sure to cover each layer.
  23. Dip the onion in the egg wash.
  24. Coat the onion in the flour mix again, ensuring a thick and sticky coating.
  25. Deep fry the onion:
  26. Carefully place the onion in the hot oil using a kitchen spider.
  27. Fry for 5-6 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
  28. Remove from oil and drain on a wire rack or kitchen cloth.
  29. Season and serve:
  30. Season the onion with salt to taste.
  31. Serve immediately with the tangy mayonnaise.
  32. Enjoy peeling and dipping the crispy onion layers into the sauce.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_ZaIUweZwog

bok_choy_chicken_noodle_soup.txt - Bok Choy Chicken Noodle Soup

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and flavorful Bok Choy Chicken Noodle Soup
  • Understand the importance of using fresh ingredients for a better taste
  • Learn to prepare and cook the soup in a time-efficient manner

Ingredients

  • 2 bunches of bok choy (about 500g)
  • 6 spring onions (scallions)
  • 45g piece of ginger
  • 1 long red chili (optional)
  • 1/4 teaspoon (0.5g) chili flakes (optional)
  • 8 cloves
  • 2 star anise
  • 1 teaspoon (3g) fennel seeds
  • 1 cinnamon stick
  • 1.5 liters of chicken stock
  • 800g (1.7 pounds) chicken thigh
  • 200g flat rice noodles
  • 1 lime
  • 1 teaspoon (15ml) fish sauce
  • Fresh mint
  • Coriander (cilantro)

  • Bean sprouts

Instructions

  1. Slice off the root of the bok choy and chop it into compost.
  2. Separate the bok choy leaves and slice them in half.
  3. Wash the bok choy leaves under cold water and set aside to drain.
  4. Slice off the root ends of the spring onions.
  5. Separate the green stems from the white parts of the spring onions.
  6. Roughly chop half of the green stems.
  7. Finely slice the other half of the green stems on an angle.
  8. Place the finely sliced spring onion stems in a bowl and set aside as garnish.
  9. Roughly chop the white parts of the spring onions.
  10. Add the white parts of the spring onions, chopped ginger, chili (optional), chili flakes (optional), cloves, star anise, fennel seeds, and cinnamon stick to a large heavy-based pot.
  11. Add the chicken stock to the pot.
  12. Slice the chicken thigh into even-sized pieces.
  13. Add the chicken to the pot and stir to ensure it's not clumped together.
  14. Place the pot on the stovetop over high heat and bring to a boil.
  15. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 35 minutes.
  16. After 35 minutes, remove the lid and use a slotted spoon or spider to scoop out all of the chicken, setting it aside.
  17. Remove the pot from the stovetop and pour the broth through a sieve into another large pot or saucepan.
  18. Discard the vegetables and spices from the sieve.
  19. Place the strained broth back on the stovetop over medium heat.
  20. Add the flat rice noodles and cook according to the package instructions (typically 7-8 minutes).
  21. Once the noodles are al dente, remove them from the broth and add them to a serving bowl.
  22. Add the bok choy to the broth and cook for 3 minutes, until the leaves start to wilt but the stems still have some crunch.
  23. Add the cooked bok choy to the serving bowl.
  24. Add the chicken back to the broth.
  25. Squeeze the juice of half a lime into the broth.
  26. Add 1 teaspoon (15ml) of fish sauce and mix well.
  27. Remove the broth from the heat.
  28. Spoon the chicken into the serving bowls.
  29. Pour the broth over the chicken and noodles.
  30. Garnish with the remaining half of the chili, fresh mint, coriander (cilantro), bean sprouts, and the reserved finely sliced spring onion stems.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xUx9rm5pdRI

bolognese_meal_prep.txt - Bolognese Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful Bolognese sauce for meal prep.
  • Utilize bacon fat for enhanced flavor.
  • Prepare Bolognese sauce in advance for easy meal prep.

Ingredients

  • 200 grams streaky bacon, sliced and diced
  • 2 brown or yellow onions, grated
  • 2 whole carrots, washed and grated
  • 2 ribs of celery, grated
  • 4 cloves of garlic, microplaned
  • 10 grams rosemary, roughly chopped
  • 10 grams basil, roughly chopped
  • 10 grams oregano, roughly chopped
  • 150 grams sun-dried tomatoes (optional), roughly chopped
  • 500 grams beef mince (90% lean)
  • 250 grams pork mince (90% lean)
  • 180 milliliters red wine (or beef/chicken stock)
  • 800 grams diced tomatoes (2 cans)
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 600 grams pasta of choice (penne used in video)
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Fresh basil leaves (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice bacon into small pieces and cook in a large pan over medium-high heat for 3 minutes, rendering the fat.
  2. Grate onions, carrots, and celery, then microplane garlic and add to the pan with the bacon fat.
  3. Season with salt and sauté for 5 minutes until vegetables are softened.
  4. Add beef and pork mince and cook for 4 minutes until no longer pink.
  5. Deglaze the pan with red wine (or stock) and season with salt and pepper.
  6. Simmer for 3 minutes until wine has reduced by half.
  7. Add diced tomatoes, a splash of water, sun-dried tomatoes (optional), rosemary, and oregano.
  8. Bring to a boil, adjust seasoning, cover, and simmer on low heat for 35-40 minutes.
  9. While Bolognese simmers, cook pasta in boiling salted water according to package directions.
  10. After 35-40 minutes, stir Bolognese and add basil.
  11. Check seasoning and remove from heat.
  12. Portion Bolognese and pasta into containers (160 grams pasta, 350-400 grams Bolognese per container).
  13. Let cool for 20 minutes before sealing and refrigerating for up to 4 days or freezing for up to 4 months.
  14. Garnish with Parmesan cheese and fresh basil leaves before serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=litF_RO73CY

bolognese_pasta_bake.txt - Bolognese Pasta Bake

Objectives

  • Create a comforting and flavorful pasta bake.
  • Utilize readily available ingredients for a quick and easy meal.
  • Achieve a cheesy and delicious crust on the bake.

Ingredients

  • 400 grams (14.1 ounces) pasta of choice (penne recommended)
  • Large pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) olive oil
  • 500 grams (1.1 pounds) beef mince
  • 250 grams (8.8 ounces) pork mince
  • 1 large brown or yellow onion, sliced
  • 1 large unpeeled carrot, washed and dried
  • 4 cloves garlic, peeled
  • 5 grams (0.2 ounces) flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped
  • 10 grams (0.3 ounces) basil, roughly chopped
  • 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) diced tomatoes (2 and a half tins)
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 20 cracks black pepper
  • 2.5 tablespoons (8 grams) dried Italian herbs
  • 60 grams (2.1 ounces) fresh parmigiano-reggiano, grated (optional)
  • Fresh mozzarella, grated
  • Extra virgin olive oil (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Place a saucepan of water on the stovetop over high heat.
  2. Add a large pinch of sea salt flakes and bring to a boil.
  3. Add 400 grams (14.1 ounces) of pasta and stir to prevent sticking.
  4. Cook for 3 minutes less than the packet instructions.
  5. Drain the pasta through a sieve and add a splash of olive oil to prevent sticking.
  6. Slice the onion and peel it, saving scraps for stock.
  7. Grate the onion and carrot on the largest side of a box grater.
  8. Grate the garlic on a microplane or fine grater to create a paste.
  9. Chop the parsley and basil roughly.
  10. Place a large pot on the stovetop over high heat and allow it to get smoking hot.
  11. Add 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) of olive oil.
  12. Add 500 grams (1.1 pounds) of beef mince and 250 grams (8.8 ounces) of pork mince.
  13. Break up the mince and fry for 6 minutes to get a nice color, stirring regularly to prevent burning.
  14. Add the grated onion, carrot, and minced garlic.
  15. Mix well and cook for 4 minutes, stirring frequently.
  16. Add 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) of diced tomatoes, 1 teaspoon (5 grams) of sea salt flakes, and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  17. Mix well and bring to a boil.
  18. Add 2.5 tablespoons (8 grams) of dried Italian herbs, chopped parsley, basil, and grated parmigiano-reggiano (optional).
  19. Mix well and reduce heat to medium.
  20. Simmer for 4 minutes, allowing flavors to develop.
  21. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and mix well to coat.
  22. Transfer half of the pasta mixture to a large baking dish.
  23. Grate fresh parmigiano-reggiano and mozzarella over the pasta in the dish.
  24. Top with the remaining pasta mixture, pressing down to compact.
  25. Grate more parmigiano-reggiano and mozzarella over the top to create a cheesy crust.
  26. Wipe the edges of the dish to prevent burning.
  27. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 20 minutes, or until the cheese is golden brown.
  28. Remove from the oven and let sit for 15 minutes to firm up.
  29. Serve portions on plates or in bowls, garnished with parmigiano-reggiano, thinly sliced basil leaves, and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BoNiEEBYUbY

breakfast_burrito.txt - Breakfast Burrito

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy breakfast burrito.
  • Prepare ingredients like potatoes, sausage, and eggs.
  • Assemble and store burritos for convenient meal prepping.

Ingredients

  • 3 round potatoes
  • 2 teaspoons (10 mL) olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • Cracked black pepper (10 cracks)
  • 4 chizo sausages (or any preferred sausage)
  • 100 g (3.5 oz) cheddar cheese (or any melting cheese)
  • 1 ripe avocado (optional)
  • 8-10 eggs
  • 5 tortillas
  • 1 tablespoon (15 g) sour cream

Instructions

  1. Peel and slice potatoes into thin strips.
  2. Stack strips and slice into small, even pieces.
  3. Spread potatoes on a parchment-lined baking tray, drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and bake at 190°C (375°F) for 40-45 minutes.
  4. Slice chizo sausages in half lengthwise, then into quarters, and then into small pieces.
  5. Grate cheddar cheese.
  6. Slice avocado into thin strips (optional).
  7. Crack eggs into a bowl, whisk until combined.
  8. Heat a pan over medium-high heat.
  9. Add chizo sausages and cook for 4 minutes until golden brown.
  10. Remove chizo and set aside.
  11. Add whisked eggs to the same pan, season with salt and pepper, and cook for 1-1.5 minutes until soft curds form.
  12. Remove eggs from heat.
  13. Microwave tortillas for 15 seconds to soften.
  14. Spread sour cream, scrambled eggs, potatoes, chizo, cheese, and avocado onto tortillas.
  15. Roll up tortillas tightly, tucking in any loose ingredients.
  16. Wrap burritos in food wrapping paper or store in airtight containers.
  17. Refrigerate for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 4 months.
  18. To serve, defrost overnight and heat in the oven or microwave.
  19. Slice burritos in half and enjoy with your favorite sauce.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MVoUXKSMqXw

breakfast_meal_prep_bowls.txt - Breakfast Meal Prep Bowls

Objectives

  • Create easy-to-make, affordable, and delicious breakfast meal prep bowls.
  • Learn how to prepare the vegetables, pico de gallo, scrambled eggs, and sausages.
  • Understand the nutritional values and macros per portion.

Ingredients

  • 4 Potatoes (or 3 if large)
  • 1 Large Bell Pepper (red, yellow, or green)
  • 1 Brown or Yellow Onion
  • 1 Red Onion
  • 2.5 grams Onion Powder
  • 2.5 grams Garlic Powder
  • 2.5 grams Smoked Paprika
  • 1 gram Dried Oregano
  • Sea Salt Flakes (to taste)
  • Cracked Black Pepper (30 cracks)
  • 5 Large Tomatoes
  • 10 grams Coriander (optional)
  • 1 Jalapeno (optional)
  • 1 Lime
  • 180 grams Sharp Cheddar Cheese (optional)
  • 10 Eggs
  • 50 ml Whole Milk
  • 16 Sausages (approx. 600 grams)
  • 30 ml Olive Oil

Instructions

  1. Slice potatoes into halves or thirds depending on size, then into strips, rotate 90 degrees, and dice into medium-sized pieces.
  2. Slice bell pepper in half, remove stem and seeds, and dice into medium to large strips.
  3. Remove top and bottom of onions, peel, slice in half, and dice into large pieces.
  4. Combine diced vegetables in a large mixing bowl.
  5. Add onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, dried oregano, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to the bowl.
  6. Mix well to coat the vegetables.
  7. Transfer the seasoned vegetables to a lined baking tray, spread out, and bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (390°F) for 30 minutes.
  8. Slice tomatoes into thin strips, stack 2-3 strips, slice again, and dice into small pieces.
  9. Slice red onion in half, make thin slices across, slice horizontally through the center, and dice into even-sized pieces.
  10. Roughly chop coriander.
  11. Slice jalapeno in half, remove pith and seeds (optional), slice into thin strips, rotate 90 degrees, and dice.
  12. Juice lime.
  13. Combine diced tomatoes, onion, coriander, jalapeno, lime juice, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper in a large mixing bowl.
  14. Mix well and store in the fridge.
  15. Grate cheddar cheese (optional).
  16. Combine eggs and milk in a large mixing bowl, whisk until smooth.
  17. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat, add olive oil, and cook sausages for 6-7 minutes, rotating every minute, until golden brown and cooked through.
  18. Remove sausages from pan and set aside.
  19. Return pan to medium-high heat, add scrambled egg mixture, and stir with a spatula, scraping the sides, for 2 minutes.
  20. Remove scrambled eggs from heat.
  21. Remove vegetables from oven.
  22. To assemble, divide vegetables, sausages, cheese, pico de gallo, and scrambled eggs into five portions.
  23. Garnish with coriander and sriracha mayo (optional).
  24. Let bowls cool for 10-15 minutes, cover, and refrigerate for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 4 months.
  25. Reheat in the microwave for a couple of minutes, mixing regularly, until hot.
  26. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-6OwgPN8EQQ

broccoli_cheese_bake.txt - Broccoli Cheese Bake

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious broccoli cheese bake from scratch.
  • Master the art of making a roux and bechamel sauce.
  • Discover a simple and efficient method for preparing broccoli.

Ingredients

  • 950 grams (2.1 pounds) broccoli
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 20 cracks of black pepper
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) cubed unsalted butter
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) plain all-purpose flour
  • 880 milliliters (880 grams) full fat milk
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) freshly grated Gruyere cheese
  • 120 grams (4.2 ounces) freshly grated mature cheddar cheese
  • 0.5 teaspoon (0.2 grams) freshly grated nutmeg
  • Pinch of ground white pepper
  • Additional mature cheddar cheese for topping (amount to taste)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Prepare broccoli:
  3. Remove florets from stalks, leaving clean stalks.
  4. Slice stalks in half lengthwise, then into thirds.
  5. Slice each strip in half.
  6. Place florets and stalk pieces in a large mixing bowl.
  7. Toss broccoli with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  8. Transfer broccoli to a 30 cm x 20 cm baking dish.
  9. Roast broccoli for 18 minutes, or until lightly golden brown.
  10. Make the bechamel sauce:
  11. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
  12. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute, or until the mixture is smooth and fragrant (this is called a roux).
  13. Gradually whisk in milk in two portions, cooking for 1 minute after each addition, or until the sauce is thick and smooth.
  14. Remove from heat and stir in Gruyere cheese, cheddar cheese, nutmeg, salt, and white pepper until smooth.
  15. Pour the bechamel sauce over the roasted broccoli, ensuring even coverage.
  16. Spread the sauce evenly over the broccoli, allowing some broccoli to stick out.
  17. Grate additional cheddar cheese over the top.
  18. Wipe the edges of the baking dish.
  19. Reduce oven temperature to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  20. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
  21. Allow to cool and set for 10-15 minutes before serving.
  22. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TG0Ue6pfqXg

broccoli_stems.txt - Broccoli Stems

Objectives

  • Learn how to utilize the stems of broccoli for added nutrition and flavor
  • Discover the nutritional benefits of broccoli stems, including fiber, antioxidants, and vitamin C
  • Learn how to prepare broccoli stems for cooking by removing the outer layers

Instructions

  1. Remove the outer layers of the broccoli stems by slicing them off or using a peeler.
  2. Discard the outer layers or add them to a compost bin.
  3. Cook the remaining broccoli stems as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pc9zmqmKDYU

bruschetta.txt - Bruschetta

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and impressive bruschetta.
  • Master the art of balsamic glaze reduction.
  • Create a flavorful tomato and basil topping.

Ingredients

  • 1 bottle (500 ml / 2 cups) balsamic vinegar
  • 1/4 cup (50 g) brown sugar (optional)
  • 1 loaf tiger bread (or any bread of choice)
  • 200 g (7.05 oz) cherry tomatoes (mix of heirloom red and yellow romas)
  • 5 g (0.2 oz) fresh basil leaves
  • 1 tbsp (20 ml) extra virgin olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 10 cracks black pepper
  • 1 tbsp (20 ml) olive oil
  • 1 clove garlic, peeled
  • Persian feta (or Greek feta)
  • Fresh basil leaves for garnish

Instructions

  1. Make the balsamic glaze:
  2. Place a medium to large saucepan over high heat.
  3. Pour in the entire bottle of balsamic vinegar.
  4. Add the brown sugar (optional) and mix well.
  5. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and simmer for 12 minutes, or until reduced to about 1/2 cup (125 ml).
  6. Allow to cool slightly, then transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
  7. Prepare the bread:
  8. Slice the bread into desired thickness.
  9. Toast the bread in a pan with olive oil over high heat for 1.5-2 minutes per side, or until lightly golden.
  10. Alternatively, toast the bread in a toaster.
  11. Rub a halved garlic clove over the surface of the toasted bread.
  12. Prepare the tomato and basil topping:
  13. Slice the cherry tomatoes in half or quarters, depending on size.
  14. Chiffonade the basil leaves.
  15. Combine the tomatoes, basil, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
  16. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to use.
  17. Assemble the bruschetta:
  18. Top the toasted bread with the tomato and basil mixture.
  19. Crumble the feta cheese over the top.
  20. Drizzle with balsamic glaze.
  21. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.
  22. Season with additional black pepper, if desired.
  23. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6CVtrI7dfEs

brussels_sprouts_table_filler.txt - Brussels Sprouts Table Filler

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy brussels sprouts side dish.
  • Discover the importance of proper roasting techniques for crisp, caramelized sprouts.
  • Explore flavor combinations that elevate the taste of brussels sprouts.

Ingredients

  • 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) refined olive oil
  • 650 grams (1.4 pounds) brussels sprouts, washed and dried
  • 200 grams (7.05 ounces) streaky bacon
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) balsamic vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon (8.5 grams) honey
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 10 cracks of black pepper
