  • 80 grams (2.8 ounces) Danish feta cheese
  • 1/4 cup (35 grams) dried cranberries (optional)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 220 degrees Celsius (430 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Pour 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) refined olive oil onto a baking tray and spread it evenly.
  3. Heat the oil in the oven for 20 minutes.
  4. Trim the root ends off the brussels sprouts and remove any discarded leaves.
  5. Slice the brussels sprouts in half evenly.
  6. Slice the bacon in half lengthwise, then thinly slice it into even-sized strips.
  7. Dice the bacon into even-sized pieces.
  8. In a mixing bowl, combine the halved brussels sprouts, balsamic vinegar, honey, sea salt flakes, and black pepper.
  9. Toss the brussels sprouts to coat them evenly in the seasoning.
  10. Carefully place the seasoned brussels sprouts onto the hot baking tray in batches, laying them flat side down.
  11. Roast the brussels sprouts in the preheated oven for 20 to 21 minutes, or until golden all over.
  12. While the brussels sprouts are roasting, heat a pan over medium-high heat.
  13. Add the diced bacon to the cold pan and cook for 7 minutes, mixing frequently.
  14. After 6.5 minutes, the bacon fat will have rendered out. Cook for an additional 30 seconds, then remove the bacon from the pan and drain it on kitchen cloth.
  15. Once the brussels sprouts are roasted, gently tip them into a mixing bowl.
  16. Crumble the feta cheese over the brussels sprouts.
  17. Add the dried cranberries (optional), crispy bacon, a pinch of sea salt flakes, and 10 cracks of black pepper.
  18. Toss everything together to combine the flavors.
  19. Transfer the mixture to a serving bowl or plate, stacking it high.
  20. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2WUmoRoCEuQ

buffalo_chicken_burger.txt - Crispy Buffalo Chicken Burger

Objectives

  • Prepare crispy buffalo chicken thighs.
  • Assemble a delicious buffalo chicken burger.
  • Learn to marinate chicken thighs in buttermilk and hot sauce.

Ingredients

  • 1 cup buttermilk
  • 2 tablespoons Frank's hot sauce
  • 4 large chicken thighs
  • 1 1/2 cups plain flour
  • 3 tablespoons corn flour
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • 1 teaspoon celery salt
  • 1 large tomato, thinly sliced
  • 1 average sized pickle, thinly sliced
  • Oil for frying (e.g., vegetable oil)
  • Buffalo hot sauce (from previous video)
  • Burger buns (toasted)
  • Herby milk
  • Lettuce
  • Salt
  • Optional: Additional toppings (e.g., cheese, onion)

Instructions

  1. In a bowl, combine 1 cup buttermilk and 2 tablespoons Frank's hot sauce.
  2. Add 4 large chicken thighs to the buttermilk mixture and massage them well.
  3. In another bowl, whisk together 1 1/2 cups plain flour, 3 tablespoons corn flour, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon paprika, and 1 teaspoon celery salt.
  4. Thinly slice 1 large tomato and 1 average sized pickle.
  5. Heat oil to 170°C (340°F).
  6. Dust the marinated chicken thighs in the flour mixture, ensuring a good coating.
  7. Fry the chicken thighs in the hot oil for 3 minutes on each side, or until deeply golden and crispy.
  8. Remove the chicken thighs from the oil and drain excess oil.
  9. Place the chicken thighs in a bowl and pour over buffalo hot sauce, coating well.
  10. Toast your burger buns to your preference.
  11. Spread herby milk on the bottom bun.
  12. Layer lettuce on top of the herby milk.
  13. Place the sliced tomato on the lettuce and sprinkle with a pinch of salt.
  14. Add the buffalo chicken thigh to the bun.
  15. Layer the sliced pickle on top of the chicken.
  16. Drizzle with leftover buffalo hot sauce.
  17. Place the top bun on the burger.
  18. Enjoy your crispy buffalo chicken burger!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y6Ckwo4cics

buffalo_chicken_wings.txt - Buffalo Chicken Wings

Objectives

  • Learn to make crispy, flavorful buffalo chicken wings.
  • Prepare a creamy blue cheese dipping sauce.
  • Deep fry chicken wings to achieve a golden brown, crispy shell.

Ingredients

Chicken - 1.6 kg chicken wings (adjust quantities accordingly) - Salt (for seasoning)

Blue Cheese Sauce - 110 g mayonnaise - 60 g sour cream - 30 ml buttermilk - 1/4 teaspoon yellow mustard powder (optional) - 50 g creamy blue cheese - 1 clove garlic (turned into a paste) - Salt (to taste)

Buffalo Sauce - 100 g unsalted butter - 300 ml Frank's Hot Sauce (or your preferred hot sauce) - 2 cloves garlic (crushed) - 20 g honey (about 1 tablespoon)

Other - Vegetable or sunflower oil (for deep frying) - Carrot and celery sticks (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Separate the chicken wings into drumsticks and flats by cutting through the joint at the bottom of the drum.
  2. Place the wings on a wire rack and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, or overnight, to dry them out.
  3. While the wings are drying, prepare the blue cheese sauce by combining mayonnaise, sour cream, buttermilk, mustard powder, blue cheese, garlic paste, and salt in a bowl. Whisk until smooth and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  4. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan or pot filled halfway with oil to 200°C.
  5. Combine the butter, hot sauce, garlic, and honey in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir gently until the butter melts and the sauce is smooth. Remove from heat and keep warm.
  6. Carefully add the dried chicken wings to the hot oil in batches, ensuring not to overcrowd the pan.
  7. Fry the wings for 10-12 minutes, turning them halfway through, until they are golden brown and crispy.
  8. Remove the wings from the oil using a kitchen spider and place them on a clean wire rack to drain. Season with salt immediately.
  9. Toss the cooked wings in the buffalo sauce, ensuring they are well coated.
  10. Serve the wings with the blue cheese sauce, carrot and celery sticks. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=74igxdNoaJg

buffalo_chicken_wraps.txt - Buffalo Chicken Wraps

Objectives

  • Learn to make delicious and easy buffalo chicken wraps for meal prep.
  • Create a flavorful buffalo chicken marinade and a creamy ranch sauce.
  • Assemble the wraps with various toppings and store for later consumption.

Ingredients

Chicken: - 600 g boneless and skinless chicken thighs - 4 g onion powder - 4 g garlic powder - 2.5 g sweet paprika - 125 ml Frank's Hot Sauce - Salt and cracked black pepper to taste

Ranch Sauce: - 1 whole egg - 15 ml white vinegar - 10 g American or yellow mustard - 100 ml neutral flavored oil (e.g., grape seed) - 2.5 g onion powder - 2.5 g garlic powder - 1 g dried dill - 1 g dried parsley - 50 g sour cream - 125 ml buttermilk - Sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper to taste

Wraps: - 5 tortillas (low carb, high protein, or regular) - 1 baby romaine lettuce (roughly chopped) - 1 ripe avocado (sliced or mashed) - 120 g cheddar cheese (grated) - 10 ml neutral flavored oil

Instructions

  1. Combine chicken thighs, onion powder, garlic powder, sweet paprika, Frank's Hot Sauce, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Mix well and marinate for 30 minutes to 24 hours.
  2. For the ranch sauce, blend together egg, white vinegar, mustard, oil, onion powder, garlic powder, dill, parsley, sour cream, and buttermilk. Season with salt and pepper. Blend until smooth.
  3. Refrigerate the ranch sauce until ready to use.
  4. Chop the romaine lettuce into thin strips and wash thoroughly.
  5. Slice the avocado into thin strips or mash as desired.
  6. Grate the cheddar cheese.
  7. Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
  8. Toss the marinated chicken with oil and spread on a lined baking tray, ensuring pieces are not overlapping.
  9. Bake the chicken for 16 minutes.
  10. Broil for an additional 5 minutes to achieve a char.
  11. Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before slicing or dicing.
  12. Microwave the tortillas for 10 seconds to soften.
  13. Spread ranch sauce on each tortilla.
  14. Layer lettuce, chicken, avocado, and cheese on top.
  15. Roll the tortillas tightly, tucking in the sides.
  16. Wrap the finished wraps in food paper, place in ziplock bags or airtight containers, and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
  17. To reheat, pan-fry over medium heat until crispy. Alternatively, use a sandwich press.
  18. Enjoy hot or cold.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pWoo0G-CBV4

buffalo_sauce.txt - Buffalo Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a delicious homemade buffalo sauce.
  • Understand the key ingredients and their proportions.
  • Master the simple cooking technique for a flavorful sauce.

Ingredients

  • 2 cloves of garlic
  • 1 cup of Frank's hot sauce
  • 1 teaspoon of white vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce
  • 110 grams of unsalted butter

Instructions

  1. Mince two cloves of garlic using a microplane.
  2. Place a small saucepan over high heat.
  3. Add 1 cup of Frank's hot sauce, the minced garlic, 1 teaspoon of white vinegar, and 1 teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce to the saucepan.
  4. Whisk the ingredients until combined.
  5. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
  6. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.
  7. Add 110 grams of unsalted butter to the sauce.
  8. Whisk the butter until melted.
  9. Continue cooking for 2 minutes.
  10. Remove the sauce from the heat.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dObP5YWQGVw

buffalo_wings_blue_cheese_sauce.txt - Buffalo Wings with Blue Cheese Sauce

Objectives

  • Prepare chicken wings by separating flats and drums.
  • Marinate wings in a buttermilk and blue cheese mixture for optimal flavor.
  • Create a flavorful buffalo sauce using butter, Frank's Hot Sauce, garlic, and honey.
  • Deep fry wings until crispy and golden brown.
  • Toss wings in buffalo sauce for a delicious and spicy coating.

Ingredients

  • Chicken wings
  • Mayonnaise
  • Sour cream
  • Buttermilk
  • Mustard powder
  • Creamy blue cheese
  • Garlic
  • Butter
  • Frank's Hot Sauce
  • Crushed garlic
  • Honey
  • Oil
  • Blue cheese sauce
  • Carrot (optional)
  • Celery (optional)

Instructions

  1. Separate chicken wings by slicing through the joint to separate flats and drums.
  2. Place wings on a rack over a baking tray and pat dry.
  3. Refrigerate wings for at least 6 hours and up to 24 hours.
  4. In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, buttermilk, mustard powder, creamy blue cheese, and garlic.
  5. Mix well and ensure wings are seasoned properly.
  6. Refrigerate the marinated wings until ready to cook.
  7. In a pan, melt butter over medium heat.
  8. Add Frank's Hot Sauce (or preferred hot sauce), crushed garlic, and honey.
  9. Mix well and allow the butter to melt.
  10. Heat oil to 190°C (375°F).
  11. Carefully drop wings into hot oil, away from you, and fry for 12 minutes.
  12. Place fried wings on a rack to drain excess oil.
  13. Transfer wings to a bowl and pour over the prepared buffalo sauce.
  14. Shake the bowl to ensure wings are evenly coated in sauce.
  15. Serve wings with blue cheese sauce, carrot sticks, and celery sticks (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4_MWhWhjzgU

burger_sauce.txt - Burger Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy burger sauce.
  • Understand how to create a thick mayonnaise emulsion.
  • Learn how to properly store burger sauce for later use.

Ingredients

  • 200 ml flavorless oil
  • 1 whole egg
  • 1.5 teaspoons white vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • 2 tablespoons tomato ketchup
  • 1 teaspoon American mustard
  • 1/4 white onion, diced
  • 3 dill pickles, diced
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions

  1. Slice a quarter of a white onion into thin slices, stopping just before the root.
  2. Make two horizontal slices through the center of the onion to break it up.
  3. Dice the onion into very small pieces.
  4. Slice three dill pickles thinly into long strips.
  5. Dice the pickles into very fine pieces.
  6. Combine 200 ml flavorless oil, one whole egg, 1.5 teaspoons white vinegar, and 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard in a tall container.
  7. Use an immersion blender to blend the ingredients on high speed until a thick emulsion forms (this is your mayonnaise).
  8. Transfer the mayonnaise to a clean bowl.
  9. Add 1 teaspoon onion powder, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon paprika, 2 tablespoons tomato ketchup, 1 teaspoon American mustard, the diced onion, and the diced pickle to the mayonnaise.
  10. Mix all ingredients together to combine the flavors.
  11. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
  12. Give the sauce a quick mix.
  13. Store the burger sauce in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9dchKV5Kid0

butter_chicken_meal_prep.txt - Butter Chicken Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and convenient butter chicken meal
  • Marinate chicken for optimal tenderness and flavor
  • Create a rich and creamy sauce using traditional techniques

Ingredients

  • 1 onion, sliced thin
  • 2 cloves garlic, grated
  • 1 inch ginger, grated
  • Chicken, diced into small pieces
  • Marinade ingredients (specify in the list below)
  • Oil
  • Ghee
  • Ground cumin
  • Ground coriander
  • Red chili powder (optional)
  • Canned tomatoes
  • Water
  • Garam masala
  • Sugar
  • Yogurt or thickened cream
  • Kasori methi (dried fenugreek leaves)
  • Rice
  • Coriander

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion into thin strips.
  2. Grate the garlic and ginger on a microplane to create pastes.
  3. Dice the chicken into small pieces.
  4. Add the chicken to a bowl and combine with the marinade ingredients.
  5. Marinate the chicken for 30 minutes to 48 hours.
  6. Heat a pan over high heat.
  7. Add oil to the pan and then add the marinated chicken.
  8. Cook the chicken for 8 minutes and then remove from the pan.
  9. Add ghee to the pan and allow it to melt.
  10. Add the sliced onions and cook for 4-5 minutes.
  11. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for 45 seconds.
  12. Add ground cumin, ground coriander, and red chili powder (optional) and toast for 45 seconds.
  13. Add the canned tomatoes and a bit of water.
  14. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 8 minutes.
  15. Use an immersion blender to blend the sauce until smooth.
  16. Add garam masala, sugar, yogurt or thickened cream, the cooked chicken, and any resting juices.
  17. Mix well and add the kasori methi.
  18. Cook for an additional 25 minutes.
  19. Serve the butter chicken with rice and coriander.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gouEeTxaY-4

butter_chicken.txt - Butter Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make a healthier version of butter chicken.
  • Cook chicken in a marinade for extra tenderness.
  • Make a smooth, flavorful sauce using an immersion blender.

Ingredients

  • 2 brown or yellow onions
  • 30 grams ginger
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 1 kg boneless and skinless chicken thigh
  • 170 grams natural Greek yogurt
  • 6.5 grams garam masala
  • 3.5 grams ground cumin
  • 2 grams kashmiri chili powder
  • 2 grams ground turmeric
  • Salt
  • 30 ml peanut oil
  • 56 grams ghee
  • 4.5 grams ground cumin
  • 4 grams ground coriander
  • 2 grams kashmiri chili powder
  • 800 grams diced tomatoes
  • 60 ml water
  • 5 grams garam masala
  • 11 grams granulated sugar
  • 250 grams Greek yogurt
  • 1.5 grams kasori methi (dried fenugreek leaves)
  • 300 grams washed basmati rice
  • 600 grams cold water
  • 1 cinnamon stick
  • 3 bay leaves
  • 3 cardamom pods
  • 1 star anise
  • Salt (for rice)
  • Coriander or cilantro (optional)
  • Naan bread (optional)

Instructions

  1. Peel and slice two onions into thin strips.
  2. Grate 30 grams of ginger and 6 cloves of garlic.
  3. Dice 1 kg of boneless and skinless chicken thigh into even-sized pieces.
  4. Combine the diced chicken with 170 grams of Greek yogurt, 6.5 grams of garam masala, 3.5 grams of ground cumin, 2 grams of kashmiri chili powder, 2 grams of ground turmeric, a pinch of salt, and half of the grated ginger and garlic.
  5. Marinate the chicken for 30 minutes to 48 hours.
  6. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan or pot over high heat.
  7. Add 30 ml of peanut oil to the pan.
  8. Add the marinated chicken to the pan and cook for 3 minutes per side to achieve a golden sear.
  9. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
  10. Add 56 grams of ghee to the pan and stir in the sliced onions.
  11. Cook the onions over medium heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until softened.
  12. Add the remaining ginger and garlic paste to the pan and cook for 45 seconds, stirring constantly.
  13. Add 4.5 grams of ground cumin, 4 grams of ground coriander, 2 grams of kashmiri chili powder, and a pinch of salt to the pan.
  14. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
  15. Add 800 grams of diced tomatoes and 60 ml of water to the pan.
  16. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
  17. Use an immersion blender to blend the sauce until smooth.
  18. Add 5 grams of garam masala, 11 grams of granulated sugar, 250 grams of Greek yogurt, and a pinch of salt to the sauce.
  19. Stir in the cooked chicken and any remaining marinade.
  20. Add 1.5 grams of kasori methi to the sauce.
  21. Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 35-40 minutes.
  22. While the curry simmers, cook the rice.
  23. Heat a large saucepan over high heat.
  24. Add 300 grams of washed basmati rice, 600 grams of cold water, 1 cinnamon stick, 3 bay leaves, 3 cardamom pods, 1 star anise, and salt to taste.
  25. Bring the rice to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  26. Turn off the heat and leave the lid on for an additional 4 minutes.
  27. Remove the lid and discard the herbs and spices.
  28. Fluff the rice with a spatula or fork.
  29. Stir the curry and adjust seasoning as needed.
  30. Garnish the curry with coriander or cilantro (optional).
  31. Serve the curry with rice and naan bread (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Z-FnoNJ2Yk

cacio_e_pepe.txt - Cacio e Pepe

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and flavorful Cacio e Pepe pasta dish.
  • Understand the importance of toasting pepper for enhanced flavor.
  • Discover the role of pasta water in creating a creamy sauce.

Ingredients

  • 450 grams (15.8 ounces) pasta (spaghetti recommended)
  • 1 and 3/4 cups (160 grams) Pecorino Romano cheese, grated (or Caciocavallo cheese)
  • 1 tablespoon (50 cracks) black peppercorns
  • 1/2 cup (125 milliliters) pasta water
  • Extra virgin olive oil (for drizzling)

Instructions

  1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
  2. Grate Pecorino Romano cheese and set aside.
  3. Add pasta to boiling water and cook according to package instructions until al dente.
  4. Heat a large pan over medium heat.
  5. Add black peppercorns to the pan and toast for 45 seconds, stirring regularly.
  6. Add 1/2 cup of pasta water to the toasted pepper and stir to create an infusion.
  7. Transfer cooked pasta to the pan with toasted pepper and pasta water.
  8. Quickly stir in grated cheese to prevent clumping.
  9. Gradually add additional pasta water in small batches, stirring constantly, to create a creamy sauce.
  10. Serve pasta in bowls or plates.
  11. Grate additional Pecorino Romano cheese over each serving.
  12. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and cracked pepper for a finishing touch.
  13. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4dDv1-SQqVc

cacioe_pepe.txt - Cacio e Pepe

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple yet delicious Cacio e Pepe pasta dish.
  • Understand the importance of using high-quality ingredients for optimal flavor.
  • Master the technique of creating a creamy sauce using only pasta water and cheese.

Ingredients

  • 450g Spaghetti (number 15)
  • 160g Pecorino Romano cheese (authentic, not processed)
  • 50 cracks of black pepper
  • 1 large pot of water

Instructions

  1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat.
  2. Grate the Pecorino Romano cheese on a fine microplane until it's soft and fluffy.
  3. Crack 50 times black pepper into a pan.
  4. Once the water is boiling, add salt and the spaghetti. Let it sit for 10-15 seconds before folding it in.
  5. Cook the spaghetti for 2-3 minutes less than the packet instructions.
  6. Two minutes before the spaghetti is done, heat the pan with peppercorns over medium-high heat. Toast for 45 seconds to 1 minute until fragrant and dark.
  7. Add 3/4 of a ladle of pasta water to the peppercorns. Be careful as it will splatter.
  8. Add more pasta water to the pan, filling it up to about one ladle's worth.
  9. Stir the peppercorn mixture and cook for 1-1.5 minutes until slightly reduced.
  10. Switch to a spatula to avoid burning peppercorns on the pan.
  11. Reduce heat to medium and transfer the cooked spaghetti to the pan, including some pasta water.
  12. Mix well to coat the pasta evenly.
  13. Add all the grated Pecorino Romano cheese to the pan.
  14. Quickly mix the cheese with the pasta using tongs. Continue mixing until evenly coated and smooth.
  15. Adjust the consistency of the sauce by adding pasta water in small amounts until it reaches your desired creaminess.
  16. Remove the pasta from the heat.
  17. Serve the Cacio e Pepe in bowls, plates, or eat directly from the pan.
  18. Garnish with additional Pecorino Romano cheese and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BdYlKF44gi4

caesar_dressing.txt - Caesar Dressing

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful Caesar dressing using an immersion blender.
  • Learn to make a dressing that can be stored in the refrigerator for up to a week.
  • Discover a unique twist on traditional Caesar dressing.

Ingredients

  • 1 egg
  • 1 teaspoon (10 grams) Dijon mustard
  • Juice of 1/4 lemon
  • 150 milliliters (2/3 cup) neutral-flavored oil
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 20 grams (0.7 ounces) Parmesan cheese
  • 6 anchovy fillets
  • 10 cracks black pepper

Instructions

  1. Add one egg, one teaspoon of Dijon mustard, the juice of a quarter of a lemon, and 150 milliliters of neutral-flavored oil to a tall jar or container.
  2. Blend the mixture with an immersion blender until thick and creamy.
  3. Grate one clove of garlic and 20 grams of Parmesan cheese into the mixture.
  4. Add six anchovy fillets and ten cracks of black pepper to the jar.
  5. Blend everything together with the immersion blender until smooth.
  6. Portion the dressing into containers for meal prep or store it in a single container.
  7. Refrigerate the dressing for up to seven days.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fj32CLwIldo

caesar_salad.txt - Caesar Salad

Objectives

  • Learn to make a classic Caesar Salad from scratch
  • Understand the importance of fresh ingredients and proper technique
  • Create a flavorful and balanced dressing from scratch
  • Make delicious croutons and poached eggs to accompany the salad

Ingredients

  • 2 heads of romaine lettuce, washed
  • 1 clove of garlic
  • 1/4 teaspoon of sea salt flakes
  • 5 anchovy fillets, soaked in olive oil
  • 2 free-range egg yolks
  • 1 teaspoon of Dijon mustard
  • 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil
  • 100 ml of vegetable oil
  • 1 fresh lemon, juiced (2 tablespoons or 30 ml)
  • 3 tablespoons (30 grams) of parmigiano cheese
  • 1 teaspoon of cracked black pepper
  • 5 slices of crusty sourdough bread
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons (20 ml) of olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon of cracked black pepper
  • 5 rashers (150 grams) of streaky bacon
  • 2 chicken breasts, sliced in half
  • 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon of cracked black pepper
  • 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of white vinegar
  • 2 free-range eggs
  • Fresh parmigiano cheese, shaved

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Wash and slice romaine lettuce in half, remove the core, and pat dry.
  3. Slice lettuce into thin strands.
  4. Place lettuce in a large mixing bowl and set aside.
  5. Slice garlic in half and chop finely.
  6. Sprinkle garlic with 1/4 teaspoon of sea salt flakes and use the side of a knife to create a paste.
  7. Chop anchovy fillets and repeat the process with them, without salt.
  8. Combine garlic paste, anchovy paste, egg yolks, and Dijon mustard in a small bowl.
  9. Whisk ingredients together.
  10. Slowly drizzle in 2 tablespoons of olive oil, whisking continuously to create an emulsion.
  11. Slowly drizzle in 100 ml of vegetable oil, whisking continuously.
  12. Squeeze in 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, grate in 3 tablespoons of parmigiano cheese, and add 1 teaspoon of cracked black pepper.
  13. Whisk dressing until well combined and season to taste.
  14. Refrigerate dressing until ready to use.
  15. Tear crusty sourdough bread into bite-sized pieces and place on an oven tray.
  16. Drizzle with 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil, sprinkle with sea salt flakes and cracked pepper.
  17. Rub ingredients together with clean hands until well coated.
  18. Place bacon on a parchment-lined tray.
  19. Bake bread and bacon for 12 minutes until golden brown.
  20. Slice chicken breasts in half and season with sea salt flakes and cracked pepper.
  21. Heat a large skillet over high heat.
  22. Pour in 2 tablespoons of olive oil and sear chicken breasts for 3 minutes per side.
  23. Remove chicken from heat and let rest for 5 minutes.
  24. Slice bacon into thin strips.
  25. Slice chicken into thin strips.
  26. Combine lettuce, croutons, bacon, and chicken in a large bowl.
  27. Toss with Caesar dressing.
  28. Bring a small saucepan of water to a boil.
  29. Add 2 tablespoons of white vinegar and 2 eggs.
  30. Poach eggs for 2 minutes and 30 seconds.
  31. Remove eggs with a slotted spoon and drain on a towel.
  32. Serve salad in individual bowls or one large bowl.
  33. Shave fresh parmigiano cheese over salad.
  34. Top with poached eggs and cracked black pepper.
  35. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jHmJSlBw9EY

cajun_chicken_pasta.txt - Cajun Chicken Pasta

Objectives

  • Learn to make a one-pot Cajun chicken pasta meal prep
  • Create a flavorful, creamy sauce with a smoky kick
  • Prepare individual portions for easy grab-and-go meals

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion, peeled and diced
  • 5 cloves garlic, minced or finely chopped
  • 800 grams boneless and skinless chicken thighs, diced
  • 3.5 grams onion powder
  • 3.5 grams garlic powder
  • 2.5 grams dried oregano
  • 2.5 grams dried thyme
  • 1 gram red chili powder (optional)
  • 10 grams smoked paprika
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 30 ml olive oil
  • 750 ml chicken stock
  • 600 grams diced or crushed tomatoes (about 1.5 cans)
  • 200 ml thickened cream
  • 600 grams penne pasta (or pasta of choice)
  • Freshly grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Flat leaf parsley (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice the onion and garlic. Dice the chicken into even-sized pieces.
  2. In a mixing bowl, combine the chicken with onion powder, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, chili powder (optional), smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well to coat the chicken.
  3. Heat a large pan or pot over high heat. Add olive oil and heat until hot.
  4. Add the seasoned chicken to the pan and spread it out evenly. Sear for 2.5-3 minutes, being careful not to burn the spices.
  5. Add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook for another 2.5-3 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
  6. Pour in the chicken stock to deglaze the pan. Add the diced tomatoes, thickened cream, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
  7. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
  8. Add the penne pasta to the pan and stir to coat.
  9. Cook for 15 minutes uncovered over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
  10. After 15 minutes, the sauce should have thickened and the pasta should be cooked al dente. Stir in the pasta.
  11. Add flat leaf parsley (optional) for color. Remove from heat.
  12. Divide the pasta evenly into 5 meal prep containers (750 ml each).
  13. Top with grated Parmesan cheese and cracked black pepper (optional).
  14. Allow the containers to cool for 20 minutes before sealing.
  15. Store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 4 months.
  16. Reheat before serving. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_2rH8musRp4

caramelized_onions.txt - Caramelized Onions

Objectives

  • Learn how to make delicious caramelized onions.
  • Understand the importance of thin onion slices and regular stirring.
  • Discover a simple and versatile recipe for caramelized onions.

Ingredients

  • 2 teaspoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon unsalted butter
  • Onions (as many as you like)
  • Salt (a big pinch)
  • Worcestershire sauce (to taste, about 1 tablespoon)

Instructions

  1. Slice onions thinly.
  2. Place a large pan over medium heat.
  3. Add 2 teaspoons of olive oil and 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter to the pan.
  4. Add sliced onions and a big pinch of salt to the pan.
  5. Sauté the onions for 15-20 minutes, stirring regularly.
  6. Once the onions start to caramelize, add Worcestershire sauce to taste (about 1 tablespoon).
  7. Cook and stir for another minute.
  8. Remove the onions from the stovetop.
  9. Serve with your favorite dishes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1KUgQj8wPeM

caramel_slice.txt - Caramel Slice (Millionaire's Shortbread)

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy caramel slice dessert.
  • Understand the importance of proper baking and cooling times for each layer.
  • Explore the unique flavor combinations of shortbread, caramel, and chocolate.

Ingredients

  • 140 grams plain all-purpose flour
  • 45 grams desiccated coconut
  • 65 grams brown sugar
  • 125 grams melted unsalted butter
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 125 grams cubed unsalted butter
  • 65 grams brown sugar
  • 395 grams sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste or extract
  • 200 grams good quality dark chocolate chips or pieces
  • 1 tablespoon sunflower oil
  • Sea salt flakes for garnish

Instructions

  1. Combine 140 grams flour, 45 grams desiccated coconut, 65 grams brown sugar, 125 grams melted unsalted butter, and a pinch of sea salt flakes in a bowl.
  2. Mix until a soft pastry forms.
  3. Press the mixture into a 28 cm x 18 cm baking pan lined with parchment paper.
  4. Bake at 160°C (320°F) for 14-15 minutes or until golden brown.
  5. Let cool for 20 minutes.
  6. In a saucepan, combine 125 grams cubed unsalted butter, 65 grams brown sugar, 395 grams sweetened condensed milk, and 1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste or extract.
  7. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly for 4 minutes, until the mixture bubbles and thickens.
  8. Pour the caramel mixture over the cooled shortbread base and spread evenly.
  9. Bake at 140°C (280°F) for 12 minutes or until golden and bubbly, rotating halfway through.
  10. Let cool for 15 minutes.
  11. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
  12. In a saucepan, melt 200 grams dark chocolate chips or pieces with 1 tablespoon sunflower oil over low heat, stirring until smooth.
  13. Pour the melted chocolate over the set caramel and spread evenly.
  14. Sprinkle with sea salt flakes.
  15. Refrigerate for 1-1.5 hours or overnight.
  16. Remove from the pan and peel off the parchment paper.
  17. Slice into desired sizes using a hot knife.
  18. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ciBoSHuzVc

carbonara_recipe.txt - Traditional Carbonara

Objectives

  • Learn how to make authentic Carbonara with just four ingredients.
  • Discover the importance of using high-quality guanciale.
  • Master the technique of incorporating the egg yolk mixture for a creamy sauce.

Ingredients

  • Guanciale (pork cheek)
  • Pecorino Romano cheese
  • Egg yolks
  • Pasta (e.g., spaghetti)

Instructions

  1. Slice the guanciale into thin strips.
  2. Remove the rind from the guanciale.
  3. Dice the guanciale into small to medium-sized pieces.
  4. Grate the Pecorino Romano cheese into a bowl.
  5. Add the egg yolks to the cheese and whisk until combined.
  6. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
  7. Heat a pan over medium heat.
  8. Add the diced guanciale to the cold pan and cook for 4-5 minutes until golden and the fat has rendered.
  9. Add the cooked pasta to the pan and mix well to coat it with the rendered fat.
  10. Add the egg yolk and cheese mixture to the pasta and mix quickly to avoid clumping or scrambling.
  11. Gradually add pasta water to the mixture until you achieve the desired consistency.
  12. Serve the carbonara in bowls.
  13. Top with additional guanciale, fresh cheese, and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zMUNG9KXmrE

carbonara_traditional.txt - Traditional Carbonara

Objectives

  • Learn to make a traditional carbonara with only 5 ingredients.
  • Understand the importance of using high-quality ingredients.
  • Learn how to cook spaghetti al dente and create a creamy sauce without cream.

Ingredients

  • 400 grams (14 ounces) spaghetti
  • 4 large free-range egg yolks
  • 40 grams (1.4 ounces) freshly grated pecorino romano cheese
  • 200 grams (7 ounces) guanciale (pork cheek) or pancetta
  • 2 teaspoons (20 cracks) black pepper
  • Salt for pasta water

Instructions

  1. Place a large saucepan of water on the stovetop over high heat.
  2. Add a large pinch of salt to the water and bring to a boil.
  3. Add 400 grams (14 ounces) of spaghetti to the boiling water and cook for 30 seconds, stirring to prevent sticking.
  4. Continue cooking according to the package instructions until al dente, stirring occasionally.
  5. In a mixing bowl, whisk together 4 large free-range egg yolks and 40 grams (1.4 ounces) of freshly grated pecorino romano cheese.
  6. Slice the guanciale (or pancetta) into thin, even strips.
  7. Rotate the sliced guanciale 90 degrees and slice across the initial slices to create diced pieces.
  8. Place a large pan on the stovetop over medium heat.
  9. Once the pan is hot, add the diced guanciale and sauté for 4-5 minutes, stirring regularly, until golden and slightly crispy.
  10. Carefully transfer the cooked spaghetti directly from the saucepan to the pan with the guanciale, being cautious of hot fat.
  11. Scoop out 3/4 cup (180 milliliters) of the pasta water and set aside.
  12. Season the spaghetti and guanciale with 2 teaspoons (20 cracks) of black pepper, adjusting to taste.
  13. Add the egg yolk and cheese mixture to the pan, scraping the bowl to ensure all of it is incorporated.
  14. Quickly and continuously mix the pasta to coat it in the cheesy mixture, using the remaining heat in the pan and the spaghetti to cook the sauce.
  15. Pour in a small amount of the reserved pasta water, continuously mixing, to create a creamy sauce. Add more water in small increments until desired consistency is achieved.
  16. Remove the pan from the heat.
  17. Serve the carbonara by creating a spiral of pasta in the center of a bowl or plate.
  18. Spoon the crispy guanciale pieces over the pasta.
  19. Grate more pecorino romano cheese over the top.
  20. Crack a touch more black pepper over the dish for added flavor.
  21. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbyJmqZZINU

carrots_parsnips_glaze.txt - Caramelized Parsnips & Carrots with Honey Sage Glaze

Objectives

  • Create a simple, flavorful side dish for Christmas or any occasion
  • Caramelize parsnips and carrots for a rich, sweet flavor
  • Make a honey sage glaze for a delicious and savory topping

Ingredients

  • 800g carrots (washed and dried)
  • 800g parsnips (washed and dried)
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes (to taste)
  • Cracked black pepper (to taste)
  • 42g unsalted butter
  • 10 sage leaves
  • 1 sprig rosemary
  • 60g honey

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Wash and dry carrots and parsnips. Leave the peels on or remove them as desired.
  3. Cut carrots and parsnips in half lengthwise.
  4. Line two baking trays with parchment paper.
  5. Place carrots and parsnips face down on the trays.
  6. Drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil over each tray.
  7. Sprinkle generously with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper.
  8. Roast for 15 minutes, then flip the vegetables over.
  9. Continue roasting for another 5-10 minutes, or until caramelized.
  10. While the vegetables are roasting, melt unsalted butter in a pan over medium heat.
  11. Add sage leaves and rosemary sprig to the butter and cook for 1 minute.
  12. Add honey to the pan and cook for 1-1.5 minutes, or until thickened.
  13. Remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
  14. Remove the roasted vegetables from the oven.
  15. Drizzle the honey sage glaze over the vegetables and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gKqafGGHH7k

cauliflower_cheese.txt - Cauliflower Cheese

Objectives

  • Learn to make a creamy, cheesy cauliflower dish.
  • Understand the importance of a roux for thickening the sauce.
  • Prepare a cauliflower cheese that pairs well with festive meals.

Ingredients

  • 1 whole cauliflower (950 grams)
  • 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) cubed unsalted butter
  • 50 grams (1.7 ounces) plain all-purpose flour
  • 420 milliliters (14.2 fluid ounces) full fat milk
  • 420 milliliters (14.2 fluid ounces) thickened cream
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (0.5 grams) freshly grated nutmeg
  • 120 grams (4.2 ounces) freshly grated matured cheddar cheese
  • 80 grams (2.8 ounces) freshly grated Gruyère cheese
  • Additional mature cheddar cheese for topping (optional)

Instructions

  1. Remove the leaves from a whole cauliflower (950 grams).
  2. Slice around the core to remove large florets.
  3. Snap off remaining florets or continue slicing around the core to remove all flowers.
  4. Chop large florets to ensure even cooking.
  5. Add chopped cauliflower to a mixing bowl.
  6. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes, and 1 teaspoon black pepper to the bowl.
  7. Massage the cauliflower to ensure even coating.
  8. Transfer the cauliflower to a 30 cm x 20 cm baking dish.
  9. Spread the cauliflower out to avoid overcrowding.
  10. Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius (400 degrees Fahrenheit).
  11. Roast cauliflower for 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until lightly charred.
  12. While the cauliflower roasts, make the cheese sauce.
  13. Place a large saucepan on the stovetop over medium-high heat.
  14. Add 100 grams cubed unsalted butter to the saucepan and melt until boiling.
  15. Add 50 grams plain all-purpose flour and mix continuously for one minute to cook out the flour taste and create a roux.
  16. Pour 420 milliliters full fat milk into the saucepan and mix continuously for one minute.
  17. Continue mixing for one minute after adding 420 milliliters thickened cream.
  18. After one minute, add 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes and 1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg.
  19. Stir for 20 seconds to allow flavors to blend.
  20. Remove the sauce from the heat and place it on a heat-resistant surface.
  21. Add 120 grams freshly grated mature cheddar cheese and 80 grams freshly grated Gruyère cheese to the sauce.
  22. Mix the cheeses into the sauce until melted and smooth.
  23. Remove the roasted cauliflower from the oven and place it on a heat-resistant surface.
  24. Pour the cheese sauce over the cauliflower, ensuring even coverage.
  25. Spread the sauce around to fill any gaps.
  26. Optionally grate mature cheddar cheese over the surface.
  27. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  28. Bake for 30-35 minutes until the top is golden brown and florets are charred.
  29. Remove the cauliflower cheese from the oven and allow it to set for 10 minutes.
  30. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJwdd0UOfzo

cauliflower_pasta.txt - Creamy Cauliflower Pasta

Objectives

  • Prepare a creamy pasta dish with cauliflower, mushrooms, and herbs
  • Learn how to cook pasta al dente and create a flavorful sauce
  • Utilize simple ingredients to create a satisfying and healthy meal

Ingredients

  • 1 tablespoon of salt
  • 1 small to medium sized brown onion
  • 2 cloves of garlic
  • 1 long red chili
  • 5 grams of flat leaf parsley
  • 2 grams or 5 sprigs of thyme
  • 1/2 cauliflower (300 grams)
  • 200 grams of portobello mushrooms
  • 1 tablespoon of olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons of white wine (or vegetable stock)
  • 200 grams of pasta (penne recommended)
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons of sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon or 10 cracks of black pepper
  • 100 grams of ricotta cheese
  • Zest of 1 lemon
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) of pasta water
  • Fresh parmigiana cheese (optional)
  • Extra virgin olive oil (optional)
  • Cracked black pepper (optional)

Instructions

  1. Fill a pot 3/4 full with water and place it on the stovetop over high heat.
  2. Add 1 tablespoon of salt and bring the water to a boil.
  3. Slice both ends off a small to medium sized brown onion, slice it in half, and remove the skin.
  4. Finely slice the onion and set aside.
  5. Slice 2 cloves of garlic in half and then thinly slice. Set aside.
  6. Slice off the top of 1 long red chili and discard.
  7. Slice the chili in half and scrape out the seeds (optional, keep seeds for spicier dish).
  8. Thinly slice the chili on a slight angle and set aside.
  9. Scrunch 5 grams of flat leaf parsley into a tight ball and roughly chop. Set aside.
  10. Remove the leaves from 2 grams or 5 sprigs of thyme by running your fingers down the stems (save stems for stock). Roughly chop the leaves and set aside.
  11. Slice around the root of 1/2 cauliflower (300 grams) to remove the florets. Discard the root.
  12. Slice the florets into small, even-sized pieces and set aside.
  13. Place 200 grams of portobello mushrooms cap side up and finely slice. Alternatively, you can slice the mushrooms in half, rotate 90 degrees, and slice into smaller pieces.
  14. Place a large, heavy-based pot on the stovetop over medium heat and allow it to get hot.
  15. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil, the sliced onions, garlic, chili, and chopped thyme to the pot.
  16. Mix everything together, breaking up any onion pieces that are stuck together.
  17. Sauté for 5 minutes, or until the onions are golden brown, stirring frequently.
  18. Add the sliced mushrooms and chopped cauliflower to the pot.
  19. Mix everything together and cook for 1 minute.
  20. Pour in 2 tablespoons of white wine (or vegetable stock) and mix well.
  21. Cook for 1 minute to cook out the alcohol and deglaze the pot.
  22. Reduce the heat to low, place a lid on the pot, and allow the mixture to cook for 5 minutes, stirring halfway through.
  23. Once the seasoned water is boiling, add 200 grams of pasta (penne recommended) and cook according to package instructions until al dente.
  24. After 5 minutes, remove the lid from the pot and add 1 1/2 teaspoons of sea salt flakes and 1 teaspoon or 10 cracks of black pepper.
  25. Mix the seasoning through, replace the lid, and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring halfway through.
  26. Remove the lid and turn off the heat.
  27. Use the back of a fork to break apart the cauliflower into smaller chunks (optional, but recommended for a stronger cauliflower flavor).
  28. Crumble 100 grams of ricotta cheese into a bowl.
  29. Add 3/4 of the chopped parsley and the zest of 1 lemon to the bowl.
  30. Mix everything together thoroughly.
  31. Drain the pasta using a slotted spoon or spider and add it to the cauliflower mixture.
  32. Carefully scoop out 1/4 cup (60 ml) of the pasta water and add it to the mixture.
  33. Mix everything together really well.
  34. Remove the mixture from the stovetop and serve over fresh parmigiana cheese (optional).
  35. Sprinkle with the remaining chopped parsley, drizzle with extra virgin olive oil (optional), and crack some black pepper on top (optional).
  36. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UmXspDYPHXs

cherry_tomato_pasta.txt - Cherry Tomato Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a simple, easy-to-make, and budget-friendly pasta dish
  • Use cherry tomatoes for a burst of flavor
  • Utilize sun-dried tomatoes for added depth of flavor
  • Learn to cook pasta perfectly
  • Make a flavorful sauce with caramelized tomatoes and garlic

Ingredients

  • 600g cherry tomatoes
  • 2 tbsp sun-dried tomato oil (or olive oil)
  • 50g sun-dried tomatoes (optional)
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 7g sugar (pinch)
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 400g spaghetti (or pasta of choice)
  • 50g basil (including stems)
  • Freshly grated Parmesan (optional)
  • Extra virgin olive oil (optional)

Instructions

  1. Wash and prepare cherry tomatoes. Leave whole if small, slice larger ones in half or quarters.
  2. Roughly chop sun-dried tomatoes.
  3. Crush garlic cloves and peel off skins. Roughly chop.
  4. Pick basil leaves from stems. Roughly chop or tear.
  5. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Season generously with salt.
  6. Add spaghetti to boiling water and allow to sit for 20 seconds.
  7. Stir the pasta and cook for 1 minute less than the packet instructions.
  8. While pasta cooks, heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  9. Add sun-dried tomato oil (or olive oil), cherry tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes (optional), garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper.
  10. Sauté for 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until flavors develop and sugar caramelizes.
  11. Continue cooking for 3-4 minutes, until pasta is cooked.
  12. Transfer pasta directly from the pot to the sauce, bringing a small amount of pasta water along.
  13. Add basil leaves to the sauce and gently fold everything together.
  14. Season to taste.
  15. Serve pasta in bowls, topped with cherry tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes, and optional garnishes like Parmesan, cracked black pepper, and extra virgin olive oil.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sgpnvQEXAmY

chicken_and_leek_stew.txt - Chicken and Leek Stew

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a delicious chicken and leek stew.
  • Master the art of searing chicken skin for crispy texture.
  • Understand how to create a rich, flavorful sauce for the stew.

Ingredients

  • 4 shallots (can be substituted with 2 brown or yellow onions)
  • 400g Swiss brown mushrooms (baby portobellas)
  • 2 large leeks
  • 1.2kg chicken thigh meat (bone-in, skin-on)
  • 2 tbsp (40 ml) olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 180 ml verjuice (or white wine/chicken stock)
  • 40g (2 tbsp) whole grain mustard
  • 15g fresh tarragon leaves
  • 600 ml chicken stock
  • Black pepper
  • 1 tbsp olive oil (optional)
  • 15g tarragon leaves (optional)
  • 1kg (2.2 lbs) high starch potatoes
  • 80g unsalted butter
  • 180 ml warmed milk
  • Ground white pepper

Instructions

  1. Prepare the shallots: Slice off both ends, cut in half, peel the skin, and slice into quarters. Roughly chop.
  2. Prepare the mushrooms: Slice in half or into quarters depending on size.
  3. Prepare the leeks: Slice off the root end and green stem. Cut in half, then slice into quarters. Roughly chop. Rinse under cold water.
  4. Salt the chicken skin: Season the chicken thighs with salt, skin side down.
  5. Sear the chicken: Heat a large pan over high heat. Add olive oil. Sear the chicken skin-side down in batches for 5 minutes.
  6. Rest the chicken: Transfer seared chicken to a bowl and set aside.
  7. Sauté the shallots and mushrooms: Add shallots and mushrooms to the pan with a pinch of salt. Sauté for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.
  8. Deglaze the pan: Add verjuice (or white wine/chicken stock) to the pan and bring to a boil. Reduce for 1 minute.
  9. Add mustard: Stir in whole grain mustard.
  10. Add leeks and tarragon: Add chopped leeks and fresh tarragon leaves.
  11. Add chicken stock: Pour in chicken stock. Mix well.
  12. Return the chicken: Add the chicken and any resting juices back to the pan. Ensure it's submerged in the liquid.
  13. Season and simmer: Crack black pepper over the stew. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
  14. Optional: Crispy tarragon: Heat olive oil in a pan. Add tarragon leaves and a pinch of salt. Fry for 1-1.5 minutes until crispy. Drain on kitchen paper.
  15. Prepare the mashed potatoes: Peel potatoes. Place in a pot and cover with cold water, about 1 inch above the potatoes. Bring to a boil and cook for 22-25 minutes until soft. Drain and cool for 10 minutes.
  16. Mash the potatoes: Mash potatoes using a ricer, potato masher, or fork.
  17. Add butter, milk, and seasoning: Add melted butter, warmed milk, salt, and ground white pepper to the mashed potatoes. Mix until smooth.
  18. Optional: Sieve the mash: Press the mashed potatoes through a fine sieve for a super smooth consistency.
  19. Assemble the stew: Place mashed potatoes in a serving dish. Top with chicken thighs, mushroom/shallot/leek mixture, and sauce. Garnish with crispy tarragon leaves (optional).
  20. Serve and enjoy: Dig in and savor the delicious flavors of your chicken and leek stew.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b19hohixzOA

chicken_avocado_wraps.txt - Chicken and Avocado Wraps

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful chicken filling for wraps.
  • Assemble delicious chicken and avocado wraps with various toppings.
  • Learn how to toast the wraps for added flavor.

Ingredients

  • 600g boneless, skinless chicken thighs
  • 1.5 tsp onion and garlic powder
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika
  • 0.5 tsp red chili powder
  • 0.5 cup ranch dressing
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 avocado
  • Grated mozzarella cheese
  • Pickled onions
  • Parsley
  • 5 tortillas

Instructions

  1. Combine 600g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, 1.5 tsp onion and garlic powder, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 0.5 tsp red chili powder, 0.5 cup ranch dressing, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper in a bowl.
  2. Mix the ingredients well and transfer to a lined baking tray.
  3. Drizzle 1 tbsp olive oil over the chicken and spread it out evenly.
  4. Bake at 190°C for 16 minutes.
  5. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes.
  6. Slice or dice the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
  7. Slice the avocado into chunks.
  8. Spread ranch sauce onto each tortilla.
  9. Add chicken, avocado, grated mozzarella cheese, pickled onions, a sprinkle of parsley, and cracked black pepper to each tortilla.
  10. Drizzle more ranch sauce over the toppings.
  11. Roll up the tortillas tightly.
  12. Toast the wraps or enjoy them fresh.
  13. Slice open the wraps to reveal the delicious chicken and avocado filling.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tpM95fZSnKM

chicken_breast_restaurant_style.txt - Restaurant-Style Chicken Breast

Objectives

  • Learn to cook juicy and flavorful chicken breast like a restaurant chef.
  • Master the technique of searing and baking chicken for optimal results.
  • Achieve a crispy skin and tender meat.

Ingredients

  • Chicken breasts (with skin)
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil

Instructions

  1. Season the chicken breasts with smoked paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
  2. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over the chicken and rub it in to coat.
  3. Heat a pan over high heat.
  4. Add another teaspoon of olive oil to the pan.
  5. Place the chicken breasts skin-side down in the pan.
  6. Sear the chicken for 2 minutes, or until a nice crust forms.
  7. Flip the chicken breasts and cook for another 2 minutes.
  8. Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
  9. Transfer the chicken breasts to the preheated oven and bake for 14 minutes.
  10. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes.
  11. Pour any juices from the pan over the chicken for added flavor.
  12. Slice the chicken in half or serve as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GSOFazC4kJk

chicken_burrito_bowls.txt - Chicken Burrito Bowls

Objectives

  • Create a quick, easy, and nutritious meal prep option.
  • Learn to prepare flavorful chicken burrito bowls.
  • Explore serving options and customization possibilities.

Ingredients

  • 350 grams (12.3 ounces) basmati rice
  • 700 milliliters (700 grams) cold water
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 750 grams (1.6 pounds) boneless, skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 teaspoons (5 grams) garlic powder
  • 2 teaspoons (5 grams) onion powder
  • 2 teaspoons (5 grams) smoked paprika
  • 1/2 teaspoon (0.5 grams) red chili powder (optional)
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper (10 cracks)
  • 5 large Roma tomatoes
  • 1 large red or white onion
  • 1 jalapeno pepper (optional)
  • 10 grams (0.3 ounces) coriander or cilantro (optional)
  • 2 large limes
  • 2 ripe avocados
  • Sour cream or natural Greek yogurt (optional)
  • Sriracha mayo or hot sauce (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a large saucepan over high heat.
  2. Add 350 grams (12.3 ounces) of washed basmati rice, 700 milliliters (700 grams) of cold water, and sea salt flakes to taste.
  3. Mix with a spoon to break up any clumps.
  4. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  5. Place 750 grams (1.6 pounds) of boneless, skinless chicken thighs in a mixing bowl.
  6. Add 2 teaspoons (5 grams) each of garlic powder, onion powder, and smoked paprika.
  7. Add 1/2 teaspoon (0.5 grams) of red chili powder (optional), sea salt flakes to taste, and cracked black pepper (10 cracks).
  8. Massage the chicken thoroughly with your hands.
  9. Place the chicken on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, spreading them out evenly.
  10. Bake in a preheated oven at 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit) for 16 minutes.
  11. Slice 5 large Roma tomatoes into three or four even-sized slices, then cut each slice into even-sized strips.
  12. Dice the tomato strips into medium to large pieces.
  13. Peel and remove the tip of 1 large red or white onion.
  14. Make thin slices across the onion, stopping just before the root.
  15. Rotate the onion 90 degrees and make a horizontal slice through the center.
  16. Dice the onion into small pieces, slightly smaller than the tomatoes.
  17. Discard the onion peels and scraps.
  18. Slice off the stem of 1 jalapeno pepper (optional) and discard it.
  19. Slice the jalapeno in half, remove seeds if desired, and slice into thin strips.
  20. Rotate the jalapeno 90 degrees and dice into small pieces.
  21. Roughly chop 10 grams (0.3 ounces) of coriander or cilantro (optional).
  22. Slice 2 large limes in half.
  23. Extract the juice from the limes, either by hand or using a citrus juicer.
  24. Combine the diced tomatoes, jalapeno, red onion, coriander or cilantro (if using), half of the lime juice, sea salt flakes to taste, and cracked black pepper (10 cracks) in a bowl.
  25. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly combined.
  26. Adjust seasoning levels to taste and add more lime juice if needed.
  27. Open 2 ripe avocados by running a knife around the seed.
  28. Twist the avocados open and remove the seed with a knife or spoon.
  29. Add the avocado flesh to a mixing bowl.
  30. Add sea salt flakes to taste and the remaining lime juice.
  31. Mix well and place the smashed avocado in the fridge until ready to serve.
  32. Turn off the heat on the rice and leave the lid on for 5 minutes.
  33. Carefully remove the lid, being mindful of escaping steam.
  34. Fluff the rice with a fork.
  35. Remove the cooked rice and set it aside.
  36. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes to redistribute juices and cool slightly.
  37. Dice the chicken into small pieces, leave it whole, or slice it into strips.
  38. To serve, start with a base of soft, fluffy rice.
  39. Top with juicy, seasoned chicken thigh.
  40. Add a layer of lime-smashed avocado.
  41. Optionally add sour cream or natural Greek yogurt.
  42. Place pico de gallo on top for freshness.
  43. Finish by squeezing sriracha mayo or hot sauce over the bowl (optional).
  44. Enjoy your delicious and beautiful chicken burrito bowls!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cF3KM-51PMY

chicken_cacciatore.txt - Chicken Cacciatore

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and delicious Chicken Cacciatore
  • Master the art of searing chicken for a crispy exterior
  • Create a flavorful sauce with a balance of herbs, spices, and tomatoes

Ingredients

  • 2 medium brown or yellow onions, peeled and sliced
  • 5 cloves garlic, peeled and roughly chopped
  • 1 large red bell pepper, sliced
  • 2 medium carrots, washed and sliced
  • 250 grams or 8.8 ounces button mushrooms, thinly sliced or quartered
  • 7 grams or 0.25 ounces flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped
  • 7 grams or 0.25 ounces basil, roughly chopped
  • 5 bone-in and skin-on chicken thighs
  • 1 tablespoon or 20 milliliters unrefined olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 20 cracks of black pepper
  • 1 and a half tablespoons or 30 milliliters unrefined olive oil
  • 5 grams or 0.3 ounces whole thyme, roughly chopped
  • 1 teaspoon or 0.5 grams dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon or 0.5 grams dried rosemary
  • 3 dried bay leaves
  • 1/2 cup or 125 milliliters red wine or chicken stock
  • 3 tablespoons or 42 grams concentrated tomato paste
  • 2 and a half cans or 1 kilo diced or crushed tomatoes
  • 1 teaspoon or 0.5 grams chili flakes (optional)
  • Sugar (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice two medium brown or yellow onions in half through the root, then make thin slices across stopping just before the root. Rotate at 90 degrees to make a horizontal slice through the center to break up the formation and proceed to make thin slices to create a nice small and fine dice.
  2. Crush five cloves of garlic with the side of a knife and roughly chop.
  3. Slice one large red bell pepper in half lengthwise, snap off the stem, peel away the pith, and remove the seeds. Slice across to create thin strips.
  4. Slice two medium carrots into thin circles, ensuring no pieces fall off.
  5. Thinly slice or quarter 250 grams or 8.8 ounces of button mushrooms.
  6. Roughly chop 7 grams or 0.25 ounces of flat leaf parsley and 7 grams or 0.25 ounces of basil.
  7. In a bowl, combine five bone-in and skin-on chicken thighs, 1 tablespoon or 20 milliliters of unrefined olive oil, a large pinch of sea salt flakes, and 20 cracks of black pepper. Massage the oil and seasoning all over the chicken until completely coated.
  8. Place a large high-rimmed pan or pot over high heat. Add 1 and a half tablespoons or 30 milliliters of unrefined olive oil. Sear the chicken skin side down in batches if necessary, for three minutes or until golden and starting to crisp.
  9. Flip the chicken and sear for another three minutes until golden all over. Remove the chicken and transfer to a plate or bowl.
  10. Reduce the heat to medium-high. Add the finely diced onions to the pan and sauté for 2 minutes or until lightly golden.
  11. Add the roughly chopped garlic and continue sautéing for 45 seconds, stirring constantly to prevent burning.
  12. Add the sliced bell pepper, sliced carrots, and thinly sliced or quartered mushrooms. Sauté for six minutes, stirring regularly, allowing the vegetables to soften and release their moisture and flavor.
  13. Add 5 grams or 0.3 ounces of whole thyme, roughly chopped flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped basil, 1 teaspoon or 0.5 grams of dried oregano, 1 teaspoon or 0.5 grams of dried rosemary, and 3 dried bay leaves. Season with sea salt flakes to taste.
  14. Pour in 1/2 cup or 125 milliliters of red wine or chicken stock and deglaze the pan, mixing well. Reduce the wine for one minute.
  15. Add 3 tablespoons or 42 grams of concentrated tomato paste and mix for one minute.
  16. Add 2 and a half cans or 1 kilo of diced or crushed tomatoes and 1 teaspoon or 0.5 grams of chili flakes (optional). Mix to combine and bring to a boil.
  17. Add a little bit of sugar (optional) to cut the acidity of the tomatoes if desired.
  18. Return the seared chicken to the pan, pushing them down to submerge in the sauce. Add any resting juices from the chicken. Mix well.
  19. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40 minutes undisturbed.
  20. After 40 minutes, carefully remove the lid, watching out for escaping steam. Mix the flavors and check for salt, pepper, and sugar levels, adjusting accordingly.
  21. Turn off the heat and remove the pan from the stovetop.
  22. Serve the chicken cacciatore on its own, or with pasta, mashed potato, salad, or more vegetables.
  23. Garnish with cracked black pepper, thinly sliced flat-leaf parsley and basil, and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil.
  24. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xzA7snditE

chicken_caesar_salad.txt - Chicken Caesar Salad

Objectives

  • Prepare a meal-prep friendly Chicken Caesar Salad
  • Create a delicious non-traditional Caesar dressing
  • Learn how to butterfly chicken breasts for even cooking

Ingredients

Caesar Dressing: - 1 egg - 1 teaspoon (10 grams) Dijon mustard - 1/4 lemon, juiced (1.5 teaspoons/15 ml) - 2/3 cup (160 ml) neutral oil - 1 clove garlic, microplaned - 20 grams (0.7 oz) parmesan cheese, microplaned - 6 anchovy fillets - Cracked black pepper (20 cracks)

Salad: - 5 slices white bread (or any bread) - 1.5 teaspoons (15 ml) olive oil - Sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper (10 cracks) - 5-6 rashers bacon - 3 baby cos lettuces (or romaine lettuce) - 3 chicken breasts (700 grams/1.5 pounds) - 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) olive oil - Cracked black pepper (to taste) - Additional parmesan cheese for garnish

Instructions

  1. Make the Caesar dressing:
  2. Combine egg, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, and oil in a tall jar.
  3. Blend with an immersion blender until a thick emulsion forms.
  4. Microplane garlic and parmesan cheese into the dressing.
  5. Add anchovy fillets and cracked black pepper.
  6. Blend again until smooth.
  7. Portion into containers and store in the fridge for up to 7 days.
  8. Prepare the croutons:
  9. Tear bread slices into even-sized pieces.
  10. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  11. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
  12. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 12 minutes or until crispy.
  13. Cook the bacon:
  14. Place bacon on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  15. Bake alongside the croutons for 12 minutes or until desired doneness.
  16. Prepare the lettuce:
  17. Shred or chiffonade cos or romaine lettuce.
  18. Rinse in cold water and drain well.
  19. Butterfly and cook the chicken:
  20. Butterfly chicken breasts by slicing down the side and through the middle.
  21. Tenderize with a meat mallet or the bottom of a saucepan.
  22. Season with salt.
  23. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  24. Sear chicken fillets for 3 minutes per side.
  25. Season with cracked pepper and cook for another 3 minutes.
  26. Remove from heat and let rest for 10 minutes.
  27. Assemble the salad:
  28. Combine lettuce, sliced or diced chicken, bacon, and croutons in a large bowl.
  29. Mix well.
  30. Portion into meal prep containers.
  31. Garnish with parmesan cheese.
  32. Allow to cool before storing in the fridge.
  33. Add dressing and enjoy:
  34. Before serving, add Caesar dressing to the salad.
  35. Mix well and enjoy.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=twMNN35rV-c

chicken_caesar_wrap.txt - Chicken Caesar Wrap

Objectives

  • Create a grab-and-go meal that's easy to make and doesn't need reheating.
  • Make a tasty and relatively cheap chicken Caesar wrap.
  • Provide a complete macro breakdown for the recipe.

Ingredients

  • 4 large chicken breasts
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon sweet paprika
  • Salt
  • Cracked black pepper (20 cracks)
  • 300g streaky bacon (optional)
  • 2 teaspoons (10 ml) olive oil
  • 180g (3/4 cup) lowfat mayonnaise
  • 1 clove garlic (microplaned)
  • 20g Parmesan cheese
  • 6 anchovy fillets (roughly chopped and scraped)
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice (no seeds)
  • Salt
  • Cracked black pepper (10 cracks)
  • 1 baby Cos or Roman lettuce
  • 5 lowfat high protein tortillas
  • Food safe paper (optional)
  • Ziploc bags (optional)
  • Meal prep containers (optional)

Instructions

  1. Season the chicken breasts with onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
  2. Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
  3. Sear the chicken breasts in a large pan with olive oil over medium-high heat for 3-3.5 minutes per side.
  4. Transfer the chicken to the oven and bake for 14 minutes.
  5. While the chicken is baking, prepare the bacon by laying it on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Bake to your liking.
  6. Make the Caesar dressing by combining mayonnaise, garlic paste, Parmesan cheese, anchovy paste, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
  7. Thinly slice the lettuce. Wash thoroughly.
  8. After the chicken rests for 5 minutes, slice or tear it into bite-sized strips.
  9. Slice or tear the cooked bacon into strips.
  10. Combine the chicken, bacon, shredded lettuce, and 2/3 of the Caesar dressing in a bowl. Mix well.
  11. Spread the remaining Caesar dressing across the tortillas.
  12. Divide the chicken mixture evenly among the tortillas.
  13. Wrap the tortillas tightly, tucking in the sides to prevent leaks.
  14. Store the wraps in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days.
  15. Enjoy cold.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hSYtqP9Rgg8

chicken_chizo_pasta.txt - Chicken and Chizo Pasta

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful chicken and chizo pasta dish in 25 minutes.
  • Utilize ingredients like sausage, garlic, herbs, and cream for a rich flavor.
  • Master the steps for cooking chicken and sausage to perfection.

Ingredients

  • Sausage meat (removed from casing or chopped)
  • Garlic (grated)
  • Herbs (chopped)
  • Chicken
  • Spices (as seen on screen)
  • Butter
  • Tomato paste
  • Cream
  • Salt
  • Pepper
  • Cooked pasta of your choice
  • Parmesan cheese
  • Flat leaf parsley
  • Pasta water (optional)
  • Cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Squeeze the sausage meat out of the casing or chop it if you have a hard sausage.
  2. Grate garlic on a microplane.
  3. Roughly chop the herbs.
  4. In a bowl, combine the chicken, herbs, and spices. Mix well.
  5. Heat a cold pan over medium-high heat.
  6. Add the sausage meat to the pan and break it up into small pieces.
  7. Cook the sausage until golden brown and the fat is rendered. Remove from the pan.
  8. Add the chicken to the pan and sear for about 2 and 1/2 minutes on each side. Remove from the pan.
  9. Add butter and garlic to the pan and cook for 1 minute.
  10. Add the tomato paste and mix well. Cook for a couple more minutes.
  11. Add the cream and bring to a simmer.
  12. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  13. Reduce heat to low and cook for 6 minutes.
  14. Add the chopped chicken, chizo, and flat leaf parsley. Mix to combine.
  15. Add cooked pasta of your choice.
  16. Stir in Parmesan cheese and flat leaf parsley. Adjust the consistency with reserved pasta water if needed.
  17. Serve in bowls and garnish with more Parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper, and parsley.
  18. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1t59jy5Wocc

chicken_chowan.txt - Chicken Chow Mein

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful Chicken Chow Mein dish in 25 minutes.
  • Learn to slice and julienne vegetables for a visually appealing dish.
  • Combine chicken, noodles, and vegetables with a savory sauce.

Ingredients

  • Mushrooms, sliced
  • Cabbage, shredded
  • Carrots, thinly sliced
  • Garlic, crushed and chopped
  • Spring onion, thinly sliced
  • Chicken, thinly sliced
  • Dark soy sauce
  • Oyster sauce
  • Sesame oil
  • Shaoxing wine
  • Granulated sugar
  • Ground white pepper
  • Peanut oil
  • Bean sprouts
  • Noodles

Instructions

  1. Slice the mushrooms.
  2. Shred the cabbage into thin strips.
  3. Thinly slice the carrots.
  4. Crush and roughly chop the garlic.
  5. Trim and thinly slice the spring onion.
  6. Thinly slice the chicken into uniform pieces.
  7. In a bowl, combine dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, Shaoxing wine, granulated sugar, and ground white pepper. Whisk well and set aside.
  8. In a separate bowl, add the chicken and 2 tablespoons of the marinade. Mix to combine.
  9. Heat a wok over high heat.
  10. Add peanut oil to the wok.
  11. Add the marinated chicken to the wok and fry for 2-3 minutes until cooked through. Remove the chicken from the wok.
  12. Add more peanut oil to the wok.
  13. Add the mushrooms and cabbage to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until softened.
  14. Add the carrots and continue cooking for 2 minutes.
  15. Add the garlic and spring onion and cook for 1 minute.
  16. Add the bean sprouts and cook for another minute.
  17. Return the cooked chicken to the wok.
  18. Add the noodles and the remaining sauce.
  19. Mix everything together until well combined.
  20. Remove from the stovetop.
  21. Serve in bowls and garnish as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2CZHyvZGunQ

chicken_chow_mein.txt - Chicken Chow Mein

Objectives

  • Prepare a simple, budget-friendly chicken chow mein recipe.
  • Create meal preps for the entire week in under 30 minutes.
  • Learn to create a flavorful and balanced chow mein dish.

Ingredients

  • 600 grams boneless and skinless chicken thigh
  • 60 milliliters low sodium soy sauce
  • 30 milliliters shaoxing wine
  • 20 grams runny honey (optional)
  • 10 milliliters sesame oil
  • 60 grams oyster sauce
  • 12 grams arrowroot
  • 2 tablespoons of sauce mix
  • Ground white pepper
  • 150 grams Chinese cabbage (wombok)
  • 2 medium to large carrots
  • 1 baby bok choy (optional)
  • 2 spring onions (scallions)
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 500 grams egg noodles
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) peanut oil
  • 150 grams mung bean sprouts (optional)
  • Sesame seeds (to taste, optional)

Instructions

  1. Trim excess fat from chicken thigh and slice into thin strips.
  2. Combine chicken with 2 tablespoons of sauce mix and ground white pepper. Marinate for 30 minutes.
  3. Shred Chinese cabbage.
  4. Top and tail carrots, slice in half, then into thin strips. Stack strips and julienne.
  5. If using bok choy, remove stem, wash, and roughly chop.
  6. Separate spring onion white and green parts. Slice white into thin circles, green into diamond shapes.
  7. Crush garlic cloves and roughly chop.
  8. Boil a pot of water and cook egg noodles for 1 minute less than packet instructions. Drain.
  9. Heat peanut oil in a large pan or wok until smoking.
  10. Add marinated chicken and cook for 2 minutes, flipping halfway through.
  11. Add garlic and cook for 45 seconds, stirring constantly.
  12. Add shredded Chinese cabbage, carrot, spring onion white, and bok choy (if using). Cook for 2 minutes, stirring well.
  13. Add drained noodles, breaking them up.
  14. Pour in remaining sauce mixture, scraping the bowl. Cook for 1.5 minutes, stirring constantly.
  15. Add mung bean sprouts (optional) and sesame seeds (optional). Mix well.
  16. Remove from heat and mix thoroughly with a spatula.
  17. Divide chow mein into five containers (750 milliliters). Garnish with green spring onion.
  18. Let cool for 10-15 minutes before sealing and refrigerating or freezing.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KaFcOWTUt3Q

chicken_coriander_lime.txt - Chicken with Coriander and Lime

Objectives

  • Learn to create a flavorful chicken marinade with coriander, lime, and garlic.
  • Master the technique of searing chicken to achieve a delicious char.
  • Discover versatile serving options for this flavorful chicken dish.

Ingredients

  • 2 large fresh limes
  • 1/2 bunch (25 grams) fresh coriander or cilantro (can substitute with flat leaf parsley)
  • 5 cloves minced garlic
  • 3 teaspoons (11 grams) brown sugar
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) ground cumin seeds
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1 gram) ground coriander seeds
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons (2 grams) dried chili flakes (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons (40 ml) olive oil
  • 4 large chicken thighs (650 grams or 1.4 pounds)
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Cut limes in half and juice them, adding juice and pulp to a medium bowl.
  2. Finely chop coriander or cilantro and add to the bowl with lime juice.
  3. Add minced garlic, brown sugar, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, chili flakes (optional), and olive oil to the bowl.
  4. Mix ingredients thoroughly with a fork or whisk.
  5. Add chicken thighs to the bowl and coat well with marinade.
  6. Marinate chicken for at least 30 minutes, up to 4 hours or overnight.
  7. Heat a large heavy skillet over high heat.
  8. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons (30 ml) olive oil to the hot skillet.
  9. Sear chicken for 3 minutes per side, creating a char.
  10. Transfer skillet to a preheated oven (200°C or 400°F) and bake for 12 minutes.
  11. Remove skillet from oven and serve chicken with pan juices, fresh lime slices, and chopped coriander or cilantro.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XjdfEZcJyuA

chicken_faito_tacos.txt - Chicken Fajita Tacos

Objectives

  • Learn to make delicious chicken fajita tacos in under 15 minutes.
  • Master the art of prepping ingredients for a flavorful and easy taco experience.
  • Assemble the perfect fajita taco with a flavorful chicken filling and fresh toppings.

Ingredients

  • Chicken (amount not specified)
  • 1 tablespoon of taco seasoning
  • Salt (amount not specified)
  • Onion (amount not specified)
  • 1 tablespoon of taco seasoning
  • Garlic (amount not specified)
  • Cherry tomatoes or regular tomatoes (amount not specified)
  • Red onion (amount not specified)
  • Avocado (amount not specified)
  • Lime juice (amount not specified)
  • Oil (amount not specified)
  • Tortillas (amount not specified)

Instructions

  1. Combine herbs and spices in a mixing bowl, adding salt and mixing to combine.
  2. Thinly slice the onion into small, even strips and add to a bowl.
  3. Add 1 tablespoon of taco seasoning to the onion and mix to combine.
  4. Butterfly the chicken, lay it flat, and slice it into strips across the grain.
  5. Add the chicken to a bowl, along with the remaining taco seasoning, oil, and salt. Mix well.
  6. Grate garlic on a microplane.
  7. Dice cherry tomatoes or regular tomatoes to a uniform size.
  8. Dice the red onion to match the size of the tomatoes.
  9. Open an avocado, remove the seed, and place it in a bowl.
  10. Add a pinch of salt to the avocado and mash it.
  11. Adjust the avocado with lime juice to taste and set aside.
  12. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  13. Fry the onions for 3 minutes.
  14. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
  15. Transfer the onions and garlic to a bowl.
  16. Heat the same pan over medium-high heat and add oil.
  17. Fry the chicken for 4 minutes until golden brown.
  18. Add the onion mixture to the chicken and cook for 1 minute.
  19. Toast tortillas to your desired level of crispness.
  20. Assemble the tacos with the chicken filling and desired toppings.
  21. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vNJkq8LlMow

chicken_fajitas.txt - Chicken Fajitas

Objectives

  • Marinate chicken and vegetables for flavorful fajitas
  • Create a delicious guacamole
  • Assemble and enjoy flavorful fajitas

Ingredients

  • 4 grams paprika
  • 2 grams ground cumin
  • 4 grams onion powder
  • 4 grams garlic powder
  • 8 grams white granulated sugar
  • 6 grams cornstarch
  • 7 grams sea salt flakes
  • 4 grams chili powder (optional)
  • 0.5 grams cayenne pepper (optional)
  • 2 brown onions
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 3 chicken breasts (1 kilo / 2.2 pounds)
  • 3 grams fresh oregano
  • 1 fresh lemon
  • 2 avocados
  • 1/2 red or Spanish onion
  • 2 medium size tomatoes
  • 5 grams coriander or cilantro (optional)
  • 1 fresh lime
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Warm homemade tortillas (optional)
  • Iceberg lettuce or lettuce of your choice
  • Chopped long red chili (optional)
  • Sour cream
  • Fresh grated tasty cheese
  • Coriander or cilantro (optional)

Instructions

  1. Combine all spice mix ingredients in a bowl: 2 teaspoons (4 grams) paprika, 1 teaspoon (2 grams) ground cumin, 2 teaspoons (4 grams) onion powder, 2 teaspoons (4 grams) garlic powder, 2 teaspoons (8 grams) white granulated sugar, 2 teaspoons (6 grams) cornstarch, 2 teaspoons (7 grams) sea salt flakes, 2 teaspoons (4 grams) chili powder (optional), and 1/2 teaspoon (0.5 grams) cayenne pepper (optional).
  2. Whisk the spices together until fully combined.
  3. Prepare onions: Remove both ends of 2 brown onions, slice in half, remove the skin, and save the skin for stock.
  4. Finely slice the onions, pushing down on the onion as you slice to make cutting easier and safer.
  5. Prepare red bell pepper: Stand the pepper upright and slice down and around the core. Discard the core.
  6. Remove any seeds from the bell pepper and tap them on the bench to remove them easily.
  7. Remove the pith from the bell pepper as it is bitter.
  8. Slice the bell pepper into thin strips on a slight angle.
  9. Prepare chicken: Lay 3 chicken breasts (1 kilo/2.2 pounds) down and gently run a knife through the center to open them up (butterflying).
  10. Slice the chicken into strips.
  11. Combine chicken and spices: Add the sliced chicken to a large mixing bowl with 3 grams of fresh oregano (scrunched and roughly chopped), the zest of 1 fresh lemon, and 3/4 of the spice mix.
  12. Rub the spice mix into the chicken with clean hands or a spoon, ensuring it's fully coated.
  13. Marinate chicken and vegetables: Wrap the chicken and sliced onions and peppers tightly and refrigerate for 30 minutes to 24 hours (longer is better).
  14. Make guacamole: Slice 2 avocados in half lengthwise, cutting through the stone.
  15. Gently slide the knife around the avocado, meeting back at the original cut.
  16. Twist the avocado open and carefully remove the stone.
  17. Scoop out the avocado flesh into a bowl and mash with the back of a fork until smooth.
  18. Prepare red onion: Slice the end of 1/2 red or Spanish onion opposite the root and peel off the skin.
  19. Finely slice the onion, stopping at the root, then dice the onion.
  20. Trim off any excess flesh from the root to avoid waste and save the root for stock.
  21. Add the diced onion to the avocado.
  22. Prepare tomatoes: Carefully place the tip of a paring knife next to the core of 2 medium size tomatoes and twist the knife, rotating the tomato to remove the core.
  23. Thinly slice the tomato, then slice into thin strips, rotate, and dice.
  24. Add the diced tomatoes to the avocado.
  25. Add coriander or cilantro (optional): Chop 5 grams of coriander or cilantro and add it to the avocado.
  26. Season guacamole: Grate the zest of 1 fresh lime into the avocado, squeeze in the lime juice, sprinkle with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper, and drizzle in 1 tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil.
  27. Mix the guacamole until combined and smooth and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  28. Cook chicken: Place a large pot on the stovetop over high heat and allow it to heat up.
