  8. Pour the ganache into the chilled tart base, ensuring it fills the entire base.
  9. Sprinkle a pinch of sea salt flakes over the ganache.
  10. Refrigerate the tart for at least one hour or overnight.
  11. In a stand mixer bowl, whisk egg whites until soft peaks form.
  12. Gradually add caster sugar in two installments, whipping until stiff peaks form.
  13. Gently spread the whipped egg whites over the set ganache, avoiding the edges.
  14. Use a spatula or fork to create peaks on the meringue.
  15. Toast the meringue using a kitchen blow torch, creating a golden brown color.
  16. Carefully remove the tart from the pie dish.
  17. Slice the tart using a hot, dry knife and serve.
  18. Refrigerate any leftover tart in an airtight container for up to four days or freeze for up to six months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4OSqY53GIec

chocolate_lava_cake.txt - Chocolate Lava Cake

Objectives

  • Create a classic chocolate lava cake with a molten chocolate center
  • Learn the proper techniques for melting chocolate and butter for a smooth consistency
  • Achieve a perfectly cooked cake with a rich and decadent chocolate flavor

Ingredients

  • 180 grams or 6.3 ounces dark chocolate (bar form, chopped)
  • 120 grams or 4.2 ounces unsalted butter (room temperature, cubed)
  • 2 free range egg yolks
  • 2 whole free range eggs
  • 70 grams or 2.4 ounces icing sugar
  • 35 grams or 1.2 ounces plain all-purpose flour
  • 1/2 teaspoon or 2.5 grams sea salt flakes
  • Unsalted butter (for greasing ramekins)
  • Cacao powder (optional)
  • Mascarpone cheese (optional)
  • Fresh strawberries (optional)
  • Fresh raspberries (optional)
  • Mint (optional)
  • Icing sugar (for dusting)

Instructions

  1. Roughly chop the dark chocolate.
  2. Place cubed butter and chopped chocolate in a saucepan over medium heat.
  3. Stir regularly until butter and chocolate are completely melted and smooth.
  4. Remove from heat and let rest for a few minutes.
  5. Whisk together egg yolks, whole eggs, and icing sugar until smooth.
  6. Add flour and salt to the egg mixture, whisking until just combined.
  7. Pour melted chocolate and butter mixture into the batter and stir until fully incorporated.
  8. Set batter aside for a few minutes.
  9. Grease ramekins or muffin tins with melted butter.
  10. Sprinkle a small amount of cacao powder in each ramekin (optional).
  11. Pour batter into prepared ramekins, ensuring even distribution.
  12. Place ramekins on a baking sheet.
  13. Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F).
  14. Bake for 10 minutes and 30 seconds.
  15. Remove from oven and let rest for one minute.
  16. Run a butter knife around the rim of each ramekin to loosen the cakes.
  17. Invert the cakes onto a serving plate.
  18. Garnish with mascarpone cheese, strawberries, raspberries, mint, and icing sugar (optional).
  19. Serve immediately and enjoy the oozing chocolate center.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W_MyhORJrCs

chocolate_mousse.txt - Chocolate Mousse

Objectives

  • Learn to make a classic chocolate mousse.
  • Understand the importance of separating eggs and using a double boiler.
  • Discover tips for achieving a light and airy texture.

Ingredients

  • 3 free-range eggs
  • 200 grams (7 ounces) dark chocolate chips or broken chocolate pieces
  • 20 grams (0.7 ounces) unsalted butter
  • 1 tablespoon (21 grams) caster sugar
  • 1 cup (250 milliliters) thickened cream (heavy cream or whipping cream)
  • Optional toppings: strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, mint

Instructions

  1. Separate the egg yolks from the whites. Set aside both yolks and whites.
  2. Fill a saucepan with a quarter full of water and place it on the stovetop over medium-low heat.
  3. Place a large bowl on top of the saucepan to create a double boiler (bain-marie).
  4. Add the dark chocolate chips and butter to the bowl. Gently mix until melted and smooth.
  5. Remove the bowl from the saucepan.
  6. Add the egg yolks to the melted chocolate one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
  7. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites with the caster sugar until soft peaks form. Set aside.
  8. In another bowl, whip the thickened cream until stiff peaks form.
  9. Gently fold the soft peak egg whites into the chocolate mixture.
  10. Fold the stiff peak thickened cream into the chocolate mixture until fully incorporated, smooth, and aerated.
  11. Pour the mousse into serving glasses, bowls, or containers.
  12. Refrigerate for at least one hour to set.
  13. Garnish with desired toppings.
  14. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Oa4meeQ3F3s

chocolate_pudding_cake.txt - Chocolate Pudding Cake

Objectives

  • Create a chocolate pudding cake with a self-made sauce.
  • Learn a simple and efficient recipe for a childhood favorite dessert.
  • Discover a technique that eliminates the need for a separate sauce preparation.

Ingredients

  • 150 grams (5.2 ounces) plain all-purpose flour
  • 165 grams (5.8 ounces) caster or fine sugar
  • 20 grams (0.7 ounces) dark cocoa powder
  • 8 grams (0.3 ounces) baking powder
  • 2.5 grams (0.1 ounces) sea salt flakes
  • 170 grams (6 ounces) full fat milk
  • 70 grams (2.4 ounces) melted unsalted butter (plus a little extra for greasing)
  • 5 grams (0.2 ounces) vanilla extract (or 1 vanilla pod with seeds extracted)
  • 150 grams (5.2 ounces) white chocolate chips (optional)
  • 105 grams (3.7 ounces) caster or fine sugar
  • 85 grams (3 ounces) brown sugar
  • 20 grams (0.7 ounces) dark cocoa powder
  • 310 milliliters (310 grams) boiling water

Instructions

  1. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
  2. Add the milk, melted butter, vanilla extract, and optional white chocolate chips to the dry ingredients. Whisk until smooth.
  3. Grease a 26 cm by 18 cm deep baking dish with a small amount of melted butter.
  4. Pour the batter into the prepared dish and level it out, ensuring the edges are clean.
  5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the caster sugar, brown sugar, and cocoa powder.
  6. Sprinkle the sugar mixture evenly over the batter in the baking dish.
  7. Carefully pour the boiling water evenly over the sugar mixture. Do not stir.
  8. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
  9. Place the baking dish on the middle shelf of the oven and bake for 40 minutes, or until the center is just cooked.
  10. Carefully remove the cake from the oven and let it cool on a heat-resistant surface or wire rack for 10 minutes.
  11. Serve warm with your favorite toppings, such as ice cream, whipped cream, or fruit.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m-vLFvRDBRI

chopped_cheese_sandwich.txt - Chopped Cheese Sandwich

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious chopped cheese sandwich with garlic mayonnaise.
  • Master the art of creating a flavorful garlic mayonnaise.
  • Prepare the perfect beef patty for a satisfying sandwich.

Ingredients

Garlic Mayonnaise: - 1 whole egg - 15 ml white vinegar - 10 grams Dijon mustard - 1 clove garlic - 200 ml neutral flavored oil (e.g., olive oil) - Salt and pepper to taste

Sandwich: - 1 brown or yellow onion - 1/4 iceberg lettuce - 2 tomatoes - 200 gram beef mince (18% fat) - 1 tablespoon oil (e.g., olive oil) - Salt and pepper to taste - American cheddar cheese (freshly grated) - Crusty hot dog roll or hoagie roll - Butter or oil for toasting

Instructions

  1. Prepare the garlic mayonnaise:
  2. In a tall jar or container, combine the egg, white vinegar, Dijon mustard, garlic, and oil.
  3. Use an immersion blender to blend everything until a thick emulsion forms.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

  5. Transfer to a jar with a lid and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to 4 days.

  6. Prepare the onion:

  7. Slice the onion in half through the root.
  8. Peel off the skins.
  9. Make thin slices across the onion, stopping at the root.
  10. Make two horizontal slices to break up the onion.

  11. Dice the onion finely, trimming any excess flesh from the root.

  12. Prepare the lettuce and tomatoes:

  13. Shred the lettuce thinly (chiffonade).
  14. Slice the tomatoes thinly.

  15. Season the tomatoes generously with sea salt flakes and black pepper.

  16. Cook the beef patty:

  17. Heat a large pan over high heat until smoking hot.
  18. Add the oil to the pan.
  19. Add the beef mince to the pan and flatten it down with a spatula.
  20. Season generously with salt and pepper.
  21. Peel the patty away from the bottom of the pan with a spatula to create a crust.
  22. Flip the patty over gently.
  23. Sprinkle with diced onion.
  24. Break up the beef patty slightly with a spatula to allow the onions to mix in.
  25. Add grated cheese on top.

  26. Cover the pan with a lid and reduce the heat to low.

  27. Prepare the rolls:

  28. Slice the rolls in half horizontally.
  29. Toast the rolls in a pan or under the grill to your liking.

  30. Spread the garlic mayonnaise generously on both top and bottom of the rolls.

  31. Assemble the sandwich:

  32. Add the cooked beef patty to the bottom of the roll.
  33. Top with the tomatoes.
  34. Add the shredded lettuce.
  35. Close the sandwich.
  36. Wrap the sandwich in food paper.
  37. Slice the sandwich in half.
  38. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9d23alyr5l4

christmas_ham.txt - Christmas Ham Glaze

Objectives

  • Learn how to create a delicious glaze for a Christmas ham.
  • Discover how to score and prepare a ham for optimal flavor.
  • Understand the importance of resting the ham after cooking.

Ingredients

  • 1 ham (already cooked)
  • 120 grams brown sugar
  • 100 milliliters maple syrup
  • 100 grams honey
  • 35 grams Dijon mustard
  • Whole cloves (optional)
  • 180 milliliters water

Instructions

  1. Remove the rind from the ham.
  2. Score the ham in a crisscross pattern, leaving a 1 centimeter gap between each cut.
  3. Optional: Insert cloves into each diamond-shaped cut.
  4. In a bowl, whisk together brown sugar, maple syrup, honey, and Dijon mustard until smooth.
  5. Place the ham in a large roasting dish, fat side up.
  6. Brush a quarter of the glaze over the ham.
  7. Pour 180 milliliters of water around the ham in the dish.
  8. Wrap the ham tightly in foil.
  9. Bake in a preheated oven at 150 degrees Celsius (300 degrees Fahrenheit) for 40 minutes.
  10. Unwrap the ham, brush with glaze, and bake uncovered for 25 minutes.
  11. Repeat the glazing and baking process for another 25 minutes.
  12. Let the ham rest for 15 minutes before slicing.
  13. Remove the cloves from the ham.
  14. Slice the ham and serve with pan juices.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6qbhcz6LApE

clarified_butter.txt - Clarified Butter

Objectives

  • Learn how to make clarified butter.
  • Understand the benefits of using clarified butter in cooking.
  • Learn how to store clarified butter for future use.

Ingredients

  • 300 grams (10.5 ounces) unsalted butter

Instructions

  1. Place a small saucepan over medium heat.
  2. Add 300 grams (10.5 ounces) of unsalted butter to the saucepan.
  3. Allow the butter to melt slowly without stirring.
  4. Once melted, cook for four minutes over medium heat, leaving it untouched.
  5. After four minutes, turn off the heat.
  6. Carefully remove the milk solids from the surface of the butter using a spoon.
  7. Remove the saucepan from the stovetop.
  8. Gently pour the golden butter into a heatproof container or jar, avoiding the milk fats that have separated to the bottom.
  9. Discard the remaining milk fats or use them to coat popcorn or make Indian breads.
  10. Store the clarified butter in the refrigerator for up to four months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rdkxNKSxtyM

coconut_chicken_curry_kaffir_lime_rice.txt - Coconut Chicken Curry with Kaffir Lime Rice

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and easy-to-make coconut chicken curry.
  • Prepare fragrant kaffir lime rice to accompany the curry.
  • Achieve a balanced flavor profile with the use of lime juice and spices.
  • Cook chicken and cauliflower to perfection.
  • Serve a satisfying and flavorful meal for four people.

Ingredients

  • 1/2 large cauliflower (keep stalk and florets intact)
  • 1 fresh lime (sliced in half)
  • 1 tbsp (20 ml) sunflower oil
  • 2.5 tsp (5.5 g) whole cumin seeds
  • 2.5 tsp (8 g) yellow mustard seeds
  • 2 tsp (4 g) ground turmeric
  • 1 kg (2.2 lbs) chicken thigh (5-6 thighs)
  • 1.5 tbsp (32 g) Dijon mustard
  • 15 fresh or frozen curry leaves
  • 1.5 cups (375 ml) chicken stock
  • 1 can (400 ml / 14.1 oz) coconut cream
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 1 cup (200 g) washed basmati rice
  • 2 cups (500 ml) cold water
  • 3 fresh or frozen lime leaves
  • Small pinch of sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Slice the cauliflower in half and then into quarters or smaller pieces.
  2. Slice the lime in half, saving half for later use.
  3. Extract the juice from the remaining lime half.
  4. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  5. Add sunflower oil, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and turmeric.
  6. Mix and toast the spices for 45 seconds.
  7. Add chicken thighs and sear for 2 minutes on each side.
  8. Add Dijon mustard, curry leaves, chicken stock, coconut cream, and salt.
  9. Mix well and bring to a simmer.
  10. Add cauliflower pieces, spreading them out in the pan.
  11. Bring to a simmer, cover, and transfer to a preheated oven (350°F/180°C) for 1 hour.
  12. 20 minutes before the curry is finished, place a saucepan over high heat.
  13. Add basmati rice, cold water, lime leaves, and salt.
  14. Mix well and bring to a boil.
  15. Reduce heat to low, cover, and steam for 14 minutes.
  16. Turn off the heat, leave the lid on, and let it steam for 5 more minutes.
  17. Remove the lid, discard lime leaves, and fluff the rice with a fork.
  18. Remove the curry from the oven and place back on the stovetop.
  19. Remove the lid and add lime juice.
  20. Mix gently, adjust seasoning, and remove from heat.
  21. Serve the kaffir lime rice, followed by the chicken and cauliflower.
  22. Pour the coconut curry sauce over the top.
  23. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qubaU3bj9MI

coconut_chicken_curry.txt - Coconut Chicken Curry

Objectives

  • Create a creamy, aromatic, and fragrant coconut milk chicken curry.
  • Marinate chicken thighs for maximum flavor.
  • Prepare a flavorful sauce with a variety of spices.
  • Cook perfect basmati rice with kaffir lime leaves.
  • Assemble and garnish the curry for a delicious meal.

Ingredients

  • 1 large brown or yellow onion, thinly sliced
  • 4 large cloves garlic, minced
  • 25 grams (0.8 ounce) ginger, peeled and minced
  • 1 green spring onion stem, thinly sliced (optional)
  • 1 long red chili or bird's eye chili, thinly sliced (optional)
  • 6 large chicken thighs (750 grams/1.6 pounds)
  • 2 tablespoons (50 grams) coconut oil or 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 teaspoon (10 grams) coconut oil or olive oil (for searing)
  • 3 teaspoons (7 grams) ground cumin
  • 2 teaspoons (3 grams) ground coriander
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1.5 grams) ground cloves
  • 2 teaspoons (6 grams) smoked paprika
  • 2 teaspoons (5 grams) ground turmeric
  • 4 whole cardamom pods
  • 3/4 cup (180 milliliters) chicken or vegetable stock
  • 2 cups (500 milliliters) coconut milk
  • 12 grams (0.4 ounces) desiccated coconut (optional)
  • 1 cup (195 grams) washed and dried basmati rice
  • 2 cups (500 milliliters) cold water
  • 2 kaffir lime leaves
  • A small pinch of sea salt flakes
  • Roasted and chopped cashew nuts (optional)
  • Fresh coriander or cilantro (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion thinly, mince the garlic and ginger.
  2. Thinly slice the spring onion stem and chili for garnish.
  3. In a bowl, combine the chicken thighs, coconut oil or olive oil, onion, garlic, ginger, salt, and pepper.
  4. Mix well to coat the chicken and marinate for at least 30 minutes in the fridge, or overnight.
  5. Heat a large pan over high heat.
  6. Add 1 teaspoon of coconut oil or olive oil to the pan and allow it to melt.
  7. Sear the marinated chicken for 3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
  8. Remove the chicken and set aside.
  9. Add the reserved onions, garlic, and ginger to the pan and sauté for 1 minute.
  10. Add the ground cumin, coriander, cloves, paprika, turmeric, and cardamom pods to the pan and cook for 1 minute, stirring frequently.
  11. Add the chicken or vegetable stock to the pan and simmer for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
  12. Add the coconut milk and season with salt to taste.
  13. Bring the sauce to a simmer and add the desiccated coconut (optional).
  14. Return the seared chicken to the pan and stir gently.
  15. Simmer the curry for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  16. In a saucepan, combine the rice, water, kaffir lime leaves, and a pinch of salt.
  17. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and steam for 16 minutes.
  18. Remove the lid and discard the kaffir lime leaves.
  19. Fluff the rice with a fork.
  20. After 25 minutes, stir the curry and remove it from the heat.
  21. To serve, place a bed of fluffy rice on a plate.
  22. Top with the cooked chicken thighs and pour the coconut gravy over the chicken and rice.
  23. Garnish with roasted and chopped cashew nuts, sliced spring onion stem, chili slices, and fresh coriander or cilantro (optional).
  24. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7wsa7XsaHQo

coconut_chickpea_curry.txt - Coconut Chickpea Curry

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and creamy coconut chickpea curry.
  • Understand how to prepare the ingredients for the curry.
  • Learn how to cook rice with aromatic spices.

Ingredients

  • 1 medium to large brown onion, diced
  • 1 medium to large red bell pepper, thinly sliced
  • 5 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons ground cumin
  • 1 tablespoon sweet paprika
  • 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1/2 cup vegetable or chicken stock
  • 400 ml coconut milk
  • 400 g diced tomatoes
  • 2 tablespoons brown sugar
  • 800 g chickpeas (2 cans)
  • 1 1/2 cups fresh baby spinach
  • 1 cup basmati rice, rinsed
  • 1 star anise
  • 2 green cardamom pods
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 1/2 cups cold water
  • Yogurt (for serving)
  • Fresh coriander or cilantro (for serving)
  • Fresh thinly sliced chili (optional, for serving)
  • Lime wedge (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Dice the onion by slicing it in half, then slicing thinly and finally dicing.
  2. Slice the red bell pepper around the core to create even slices.
  3. Flip the pepper over and slice into thin strips.
  4. Grate the garlic to create a paste.
  5. Heat a large pot over high heat and add olive oil.
  6. Sauté the onion for 2 minutes until slightly softened.
  7. Add the garlic paste, red bell pepper, and continue sautéing for 3 minutes.
  8. Add ground cumin, sweet paprika, cayenne pepper (optional), and sea salt flakes.
  9. Mix and fry for 15-20 seconds to release the flavors.
  10. Pour in vegetable or chicken stock and mix for 10 seconds.
  11. Add coconut milk, diced tomatoes, brown sugar, and chickpeas.
  12. Mix well and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
  13. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
  14. Add fresh baby spinach and mix gently until softened.
  15. Remove the pot from heat and set aside.
  16. Place a saucepan on the stovetop and add rinsed basmati rice, star anise, cardamom pods, bay leaf, sea salt, and cold water.
  17. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes undisturbed.
  18. Turn off heat and let the rice steam for 10 minutes with the lid on.
  19. Remove the lid and remove the spices.
  20. Fluff the rice with a spatula or fork.
  21. To assemble the dish, place a pile of rice in the center of a bowl, top with the chickpea curry, and add yogurt, fresh coriander or cilantro, chili (optional), and a lime wedge for serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vFRhKAfzP5I

coleslaw_recipe.txt - Coleslaw Recipe

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy coleslaw.
  • Understand the importance of thinly slicing vegetables for optimal texture.
  • Explore different serving options for coleslaw.

Ingredients

  • Red cabbage
  • White cabbage
  • 2 spring onions or scallions
  • 1/2 red onion
  • Flat leaf parsley (optional)
  • Yogurt
  • 1 lemon (use half)
  • Macadamia oil or extra virgin olive oil
  • Honey
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Thinly slice the red and white cabbage using the chiffonade technique.
  2. Thinly slice the two spring onions or scallions, including the green stems.
  3. Thinly slice half a red onion.
  4. Roughly chop the flat leaf parsley (optional).
  5. Add all the sliced vegetables and parsley to a bowl.
  6. Add yogurt to the bowl.
  7. Squeeze the juice from half a lemon into the bowl.
  8. Add macadamia oil or extra virgin olive oil to the bowl.
  9. Add honey, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to the bowl.
  10. Mix all ingredients together with clean hands.
  11. Serve in a bowl or use as a topping for dishes like chicken burgers.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iuT9oAWlXW4

corn_ribs_air_fryer_vs_oven.txt - Corn Ribs: Air Fryer vs Oven Baked

Objectives

  • Learn to prepare delicious corn ribs using both air fryer and oven methods.
  • Compare and contrast the results of air frying and oven baking corn ribs.
  • Make a flavorful Buffalo mayonnaise to accompany the corn ribs.

Ingredients

Corn Ribs: - 4 corn cobs - 70g melted clarified butter - 2.5g onion and garlic powder - 2.5g smoked paprika - 1g dried parsley - Sea salt to taste - 10 cracks black pepper

Buffalo Mayonnaise: - 1 egg - 15ml white vinegar - 10g American or yellow mustard - 180ml neutral flavored oil - 1.5g garlic powder - 1 dill pickle - 40g Frank's hot sauce - Sea salt to taste - 10 cracks black pepper

Garnish (Optional): - Chives - Flat leaf parsley - Fresh parmesan cheese

Instructions

  1. Prepare the corn: Slice off both ends of each corn cob, ensuring the larger side sits flat and stands upright. Peel off husks and remove hairs.
  2. Cut into ribs: Stand the corn cob on its straight end and slice it in half with a sharp knife. Stand the half upright and slice it again into quarters, creating corn ribs.
  3. Make the butter: Combine melted clarified butter, onion and garlic powder, smoked paprika, dried parsley, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Mix well until smooth.
  4. Marinate the corn ribs: Place the corn ribs on a lined baking tray. Brush the butter mixture generously over all sides of the ribs, ensuring they are well coated.
  5. Air fry: Remove half of the corn ribs and place them in an air fryer basket. Cook at 200°C for 12 minutes, flipping halfway through.
  6. Bake: Place the remaining corn ribs in a preheated oven at 210°C. Bake for 12 minutes, flipping halfway through.
  7. Make the Buffalo mayonnaise: Combine the egg, white vinegar, mustard, and oil in a jar or container. Blend with an immersion blender until a thick mayonnaise forms.
  8. Add flavors to mayonnaise: Add garlic powder, dill pickle, hot sauce, salt, and pepper to the mayonnaise. Blend again until well combined and the dill pickle is broken down.
  9. Optional garnish: Thinly slice chives and flat leaf parsley for garnish.
  10. Serve: Remove the corn ribs from the oven and air fryer and place them on a heatproof surface or wire rack. Drizzle with Buffalo mayonnaise, grate fresh parmesan cheese over the top, and add chives and parsley for a fresh touch. Drizzle with remaining infused butter, if desired.
  11. Enjoy: Taste and compare the air fried and oven baked corn ribs.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oH7c8TFVGCc

corn_ribs_baked_vs_air_fried.txt - Baked vs Air-Fried Corn Ribs

Objectives

  • Prepare corn ribs using both baking and air-frying methods
  • Compare the taste and texture of each method
  • Create a delicious butter sauce and serve with various toppings

Ingredients

  • 4 whole corn on the cobs
  • Melted butter
  • Onion powder
  • Garlic powder
  • Smoked paprika
  • Dried parsley
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Buffalo mayonnaise (optional)
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Chives (optional)
  • Parsley (optional)

Instructions

  1. Remove both ends and husks from 4 whole corn on the cobs, cleaning them thoroughly.
  2. Using a knife, firmly tap the top of each cob to split it into quarters, creating corn ribs.
  3. In a bowl, combine melted butter, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, dried parsley, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper.
  4. Mix the butter mixture well.
  5. Spread the butter mixture over the corn ribs, reserving some for later.
  6. Divide the corn ribs in half.
  7. Place one half of the corn ribs on a baking tray and the other half in an airfryer basket.
  8. Bake the corn ribs in the oven, flipping them halfway through the cooking time.
  9. Air-fry the corn ribs, flipping them halfway through the cooking time.
  10. Remove the corn ribs from the oven and airfryer.
  11. Serve the corn ribs with Buffalo mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, chives, parsley, and leftover butter sauce.
  12. Taste and compare the baked and air-fried corn ribs to determine your preference.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2QnTiih8qM4

cottage_pie.txt - Cottage Pie

Objectives

  • Make a comforting, flavorful Cottage Pie
  • Learn the difference between Cottage Pie and Shepherd's Pie
  • Master a crispy potato topping using egg yolks

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 1 rib of celery
  • 1 large carrot
  • 4 cloves of garlic
  • 3 g flat leaf parsley
  • 3 g Thyme
  • 1 kg (2.2 lb) Castel Russet or Yukon Gold potatoes
  • 150 ml full fat milk
  • 100 g unsalted butter
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 kg (2.2 lb) beef mince (90% lean)
  • 2 tbsp (50 g) concentrated tomato paste
  • 2 tbsp (40 ml) worcestershire sauce
  • 250 ml (1 cup) red wine
  • 250 ml (1 cup) beef, vegetable, or chicken stock
  • 1 cup (250 ml) frozen peas
  • 2 egg yolks

Instructions

  1. Peel and grate 1 onion, 1 rib of celery, and 1 large carrot.
  2. Grate 4 cloves of garlic using a microplane.
  3. Roughly chop 3 g of flat leaf parsley and 3 g of Thyme, removing any woody stems.
  4. Peel and boil 1 kg (2.2 lb) Castel Russet or Yukon Gold potatoes for 22-25 minutes until fork tender.
  5. Season the potatoes generously with salt during boiling.
  6. While the potatoes are boiling, warm 150 ml of full fat milk and 100 g of unsalted butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
  7. Season the milk and butter mixture with salt to taste.
  8. Heat 2 tbsp of olive oil in a large pan or pot over high heat.
  9. Add 1 kg (2.2 lb) of beef mince and season generously with salt and cracked black pepper.
  10. Allow the beef to sit for a couple of minutes to form a crust on the bottom, then break it up and cook for 5-6 minutes until browned.
  11. Add the grated vegetables, garlic, 2 tbsp (50 g) of tomato paste, 2 tbsp (40 ml) of worcestershire sauce, parsley, and Thyme to the pan.
  12. Cook the mixture for 5 minutes to soften the vegetables and infuse the garlic flavor.
  13. Add 250 ml (1 cup) of red wine (or stock if you prefer) to the pan, season with salt and pepper, and reduce for 3-4 minutes.
  14. Add 250 ml (1 cup) of beef, vegetable, or chicken stock to the pan, mix well, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook for 15 minutes.
  15. Drain the cooked potatoes and mash them using a potato ricer, hand masher, or fine mesh sieve.
  16. Add the warm milk and butter mixture to the mashed potatoes and mix well.
  17. Stir in 2 egg yolks to create a crispy crust.
  18. Season the mashed potatoes with salt and ground white pepper to taste.
  19. Stir the beef mixture and add 1 cup (250 ml) of frozen peas.
  20. Transfer the beef mixture to a large roasting dish or casserole dish.
  21. Spread and compress the beef mixture evenly, ensuring no liquid rises to the top.
  22. Spread the mashed potatoes over the beef mixture, covering it completely.
  23. Use a fork to gently press down on the mashed potatoes, ensuring no liquid pulls up.
  24. Wipe any excess potatoes from the edges of the dish to prevent burning.
  25. Season the top of the mashed potatoes with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper.
  26. Bake the Cottage Pie in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 25 minutes.
  27. Allow the Cottage Pie to cool for 10-15 minutes before serving.
  28. Garnish with fresh parsley and cracked black pepper before serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wSCOHIll1rM

cowboy_butter_salmon_big_green_egg.txt - Cowboy Butter Salmon on the Big Green Egg

Objectives

  • Cook a delicious cowboy butter salmon using indirect heat on the Big Green Egg.
  • Master the basics of temperature control on the Big Green Egg.
  • Enjoy a simple yet flavorful salmon recipe.

Ingredients

  • 250g (8.8oz) unsalted butter, softened
  • 2 tsp (6g) onion powder
  • 2 tsp (6g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (6g) smoked paprika
  • 2 tsp (6g) dried Italian herbs (oregano, basil, thyme)
  • 1/2 tsp ground chili powder (optional)
  • Salt and black pepper (10 cracks)
  • 5g (0.2oz) flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped
  • 750g (1.6lb) salmon fillet (pin-boned, skin on)
  • 1 tbsp olive oil or vegetable oil
  • 1 tbsp hot honey (optional)

Instructions

  1. Preheat the Big Green Egg: Fill the egg with lump charcoal, place three fire lighters in the center, and ignite using an igniter. Open the vent and regulator fully, allowing the coals to burn for 10-12 minutes.
  2. Prepare the Cowboy Butter: In a bowl, combine softened butter, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, dried Italian herbs, chili powder (optional), salt, pepper, and chopped parsley. Mix well.
  3. Season the Salmon: Rub 2/3 of the cowboy butter all over the salmon fillet.
  4. Prepare the Salmon: Add 1 tbsp olive oil to a seasoned cast iron pan. Place the salmon in the pan. Set aside the remaining butter.
  5. Set up Indirect Heat: Place the cast iron pan on the grill plate in the Big Green Egg. Use the convector to raise the pan and create indirect heat. Close the lid.
  6. Control Temperature: Adjust the regulator and vent to maintain a temperature of 150°C (300°F). Open the regulator and vent slightly to compensate for heat loss when opening the lid.
  7. Cook the Salmon: Cook the salmon for 20-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 52°C (125°F) for medium-rare. Adjust the regulator and vent as needed to maintain the target temperature.
  8. Melt the Remaining Butter: Melt the remaining cowboy butter in a saucepan. Add a squeeze of honey (regular or hot) and stir until melted.
  9. Finish and Serve: Remove the salmon from the Big Green Egg. Pour the melted honey butter over the salmon. Serve immediately. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OmS2HT6artA

cranberry_sauce.txt - Cranberry Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a quick and easy cranberry sauce for Christmas dinner.
  • Understand the importance of reducing the sauce to achieve a syrup-like consistency.
  • Learn how to store cranberry sauce for extended shelf life.

Ingredients

  • 400 grams (14.1 ounces) fresh or frozen cranberries
  • 1 cup (200 grams) white granulated sugar
  • 1/2 cup (120 milliliters) water
  • Zest of 1/2 orange
  • Juice of 1/2 orange
  • Zest of 1 lemon
  • 1 whole cinnamon stick (optional)
  • 3 whole cloves (optional)
  • 1 star anise (optional)
  • 3 green cardamom pods (optional)
  • 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Place 400 grams of cranberries into a large saucepan.
  2. Set aside 100 grams of cranberries for later use.
  3. Add 1 cup of white granulated sugar, 1/2 cup of water, the zest of half an orange, the juice of half an orange, and the zest of one lemon to the saucepan.
  4. Add optional ingredients: 1 whole cinnamon stick, 3 whole cloves, 1 star anise, 3 green cardamom pods, and 1/2 teaspoon of sea salt flakes.
  5. Place the saucepan on the stovetop over medium-high heat and mix frequently until the sugar melts and the water boils.
  6. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 8 minutes, stirring frequently.
  7. After 8 minutes, carefully press the cranberries against the side or bottom of the saucepan to burst them and release their flavor.
  8. Mix the sauce to incorporate the additional flavor.
  9. Add the reserved 100 grams of cranberries.
  10. Reduce heat to low and mix for one minute to defrost the frozen cranberries and allow them to blend in.
  11. Remove the saucepan from the stovetop and allow it to cool for 10 minutes.
  12. Transfer the sauce to clean jars or containers and press it down to remove air bubbles.
  13. Seal the jars or containers tightly and allow the sauce to cool completely before storing in the refrigerator.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CCyfkW0TjrY

creamy_beef_pasta_meal_prep.txt - Creamy Beef Pasta Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and convenient creamy beef pasta meal prep.
  • Learn how to create a flavorful sauce with simple ingredients.
  • Portion the meal into individual containers for easy reheating.

Ingredients

  • Tomatoes (sliced and diced)
  • Bell pepper or capsicum (sliced)
  • Garlic (grated)
  • Oil
  • Salt
  • Pepper
  • Onion powder
  • Dried oregano
  • Dried basil
  • Sweet paprika
  • Chicken stock
  • Cream cheese
  • Beef mince
  • Cooked pasta of your choice
  • Parmesan cheese (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Slice and dice tomatoes into even-sized pieces.
  2. Slice bell pepper or capsicum into similar sized pieces.
  3. Grate garlic using a microplane to create a paste.
  4. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  5. Add diced peppers and tomatoes, season to taste, and cook for 6 minutes.
  6. Add grated garlic and cook for 4 minutes.
  7. Add onion powder, dried oregano, dried basil, and sweet paprika. Mix and cook for 3 minutes.
  8. Add chicken stock, bring to a boil, cover with a lid, and cook for 10 minutes.
  9. Remove from heat and let cool for 15-20 minutes before blending.
  10. Once cool, blend the sauce until smooth.
  11. Add cream cheese and blend again until creamy.
  12. In a separate pan over medium-high heat, add oil, beef mince, salt, and pepper. Mix and cook for 6 minutes.
  13. Add onion powder, dried oregano, dried basil, and sweet paprika to the beef mixture. Cook for 4 minutes and check seasoning.
  14. Add the blended sauce to the beef mixture and cook until combined.
  15. Add cooked pasta of your choice and cook for 2 minutes.
  16. Portion the mixture into meal prep containers.
  17. Garnish with Parmesan cheese.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XHNgqIRScpE

creamy_cauliflower_cheese.txt - Creamy Cauliflower Cheese

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and easy creamy cauliflower cheese dish.
  • Roast cauliflower florets until lightly charred.
  • Prepare a creamy cheese sauce with a roux base.
  • Combine the roasted cauliflower with the cheese sauce.
  • Bake until the top is golden brown.

Ingredients

  • 1 large cauliflower
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Salt to taste
  • 20 cracks of pepper
  • 100g unsalted cubed butter
  • 50g plain all-purpose flour
  • 420ml full fat milk
  • 420ml thickened cream
  • 1 teaspoon fresh nutmeg
  • Salt and ground white pepper
  • 120g mature cheddar cheese
  • 80g gruyere cheese

Instructions

  1. Slice off any leaves from the cauliflower and discard or use in a soup.
  2. Trim the cauliflower into even-sized florets, including the stem.
  3. Place the florets in a large roasting dish.
  4. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and mix with your hands.
  5. Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 20-25 minutes, until the tops are lightly charred.
  6. While the cauliflower is roasting, melt the butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
  7. Add the flour and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until a thick paste forms (roux).
  8. Gradually whisk in the milk and cook for 2-3 minutes, until thickened.
  9. Stir in the cream, nutmeg, salt, and white pepper.
  10. Remove from heat and whisk in the cheddar and gruyere cheese until combined.
  11. Remove the roasted cauliflower from the oven and pour the cheese sauce over it, ensuring all florets are covered.
  12. Grate some more cheddar cheese over the top (optional).
  13. Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 35 minutes, until the top is golden brown.
  14. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6X1LOm10WXs

creamy_chicken_garlic_pasta.txt - Creamy Chicken & Garlic Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a creamy chicken and garlic pasta dish in under 25 minutes.
  • Use creme fraiche instead of cream for a lighter pasta.
  • Utilize simple ingredients and techniques for a flavorful and quick meal.

Ingredients

  • 6 rashers of streaky bacon
  • 1 red onion
  • 5 cloves of garlic
  • 5 g of flat leaf parsley
  • 2 small to medium chicken breasts
  • 2 teaspoons of olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon of onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon of garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon of smoked paprika
  • Salt and cracked black pepper
  • 350 g of pasta (any type)
  • 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter
  • 2 tablespoons of olive oil
  • 1 cup of chicken stock
  • 200 g of creme fraiche
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a pot of water over high heat, generously season with salt, and cover with a lid.
  2. Slice bacon into strips, rotate 90 degrees, and dice into medium to large pieces.
  3. Peel and dice red onion into small to medium pieces.
  4. Peel and crush garlic cloves, then roughly chop.
  5. Scrunch up parsley and roughly chop, removing large leaves or stems.
  6. Butterfly chicken breasts by slicing through the side, leaving the other side intact.
  7. Place chicken in a bowl, add olive oil, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper, then mix well.
  8. Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add bacon. Cook for 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until desired doneness.
  9. Remove bacon and leave the fat in the pan.
  10. Return pan to medium-high heat and add chicken. Sear for 4 minutes on each side, flipping occasionally.
  11. Remove lid from boiling water, add pasta, and let sit for 30 seconds.
  12. Stir pasta and cook for 1 minute less than the package instructions.
  13. Remove chicken and place on a plate to rest for 5-10 minutes.
  14. Wipe out the pan and return it to medium-high heat.
  15. Add butter and olive oil to the pan, then add red onion and a pinch of salt. Sauté for 3 minutes until translucent and softened.
  16. Add garlic to the pan and stir for 1 minute until fragrant.
  17. Turn heat to high and add chicken stock to deglaze the pan. Simmer for 2 minutes until reduced by half.
  18. Add creme fraiche and chopped parsley to the pan, stir, and simmer for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened.
  19. Add bacon bits to the sauce and mix well.
  20. Slice rested chicken into strips or dice as desired.
  21. Add chicken and any resting juices to the sauce and mix gently.
  22. Adjust sauce consistency with reserved pasta water if needed.
  23. Add cooked pasta to the sauce and fold gently to coat.
  24. Add more pasta water if necessary to achieve desired sauce consistency.
  25. Serve pasta in bowls, topping with chicken, bacon bits, Parmesan cheese (optional), parsley, and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MMW9VW9O1gg

creamy_garlic_cheesy_pasta.txt - Creamy Garlic Cheesy Pasta

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and delicious creamy garlic cheesy pasta.
  • Utilize fresh ingredients for optimal flavor.
  • Master the technique of creating a smooth and flavorful sauce.

Ingredients

  • 6 cloves garlic, peeled and minced
  • 60 grams grana padano cheese or parmigiano-reggiano, freshly grated
  • 5 grams flat leaf parsley, chopped (optional)
  • 500 grams pasta of choice
  • 1 tablespoon unsalted butter
  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • 80 milliliters chicken or vegetable stock
  • 400 milliliters heavy thickened cream
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 10 cracks black pepper
  • 120 grams washed baby spinach (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a large saucepan of water on the stovetop over high heat.
  2. Heavily season the water with sea salt flakes and bring to a boil.
  3. While the water is heating, mince 6 cloves of garlic using a microplane or grater.
  4. Grate 60 grams of grana padano cheese or parmigiano-reggiano using a microplane or grater.
  5. Chop 5 grams of flat leaf parsley (optional).
  6. Once the water is boiling, add 500 grams of pasta and cook for 1 minute less than the packet instructions.
  7. Place a large pan on the stovetop over high heat.
  8. While the pan is cold, add 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter and 1 teaspoon of olive oil.
  9. Stir to melt the butter quickly.
  10. Add the minced garlic and saute for 40 seconds, stirring constantly.
  11. Pour 80 milliliters of chicken or vegetable stock into the pan and stir.
  12. Bring the stock to a boil, which should take about 20 seconds.
  13. Pour 400 milliliters of heavy thickened cream into the pan.
  14. Season with 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes and 10 cracks of black pepper.
  15. Stir to combine the ingredients and bring the cream to a boil over high heat.
  16. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the sauce for 6-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens and reduces by one quarter.
  17. Add 120 grams of washed baby spinach (optional) and stir to wilt.
  18. Transfer the cooked pasta into the sauce using a kitchen spider or slotted spoon, draining off excess water.
  19. Add the freshly grated grana padano or parmigiano-reggiano cheese and stir well.
  20. Simmer for 1.5-2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, to finish cooking the pasta and melt the cheese.
  21. Adjust seasoning with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper, adding at least 20 additional cracks of black pepper.
  22. Stir well to combine the flavors.
  23. Remove the pasta from the stovetop.
  24. Serve in a bowl, topping with additional grated cheese, parsley, cracked black pepper, and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AK0dcuydkiM

creamy_garlic_chicken.txt - Creamy Garlic Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy creamy garlic chicken dish.
  • Master the technique of butterflying chicken breasts.
  • Create a rich and flavorful sauce with garlic, thyme, and parmesan cheese.

Ingredients

  • 2 free-range chicken breasts (350 grams each)
  • 2 tablespoons (15 grams) plain all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) garlic powder
  • 3 tablespoons (15 grams) grated parmesan cheese
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 small to medium brown or yellow onion
  • 6 cloves of garlic
  • 10 sprigs (5 grams) fresh savory thyme
  • 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons (28 grams) unsalted butter
  • 1/2 cup (120 milliliters) white wine, vegetable, or chicken stock
  • 400 milliliters (14 fluid ounces) thickened cream
  • 1/2 cup (45 grams) grated parmesan cheese
  • Freshly cracked black pepper
  • Freshly chopped flat leaf parsley (optional)

Instructions

  1. Butterfly each chicken breast by carefully slicing through the side, stopping just before reaching the opposite side.
  2. Cut through the center to create two even-sized fillets.
  3. Combine the chicken fillets in a mixing bowl with flour, onion powder, garlic powder, parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
  4. Mix until the chicken is coated.
  5. Slice the onion in half through the root, peel off the skin, and finely dice.
  6. Grate the garlic cloves to create a paste.
  7. Roughly chop the thyme.
  8. Heat a large pot or pan over medium to high heat.
  9. Add olive oil and butter, allowing the butter to melt.
  10. Sear the chicken for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.
  11. Remove the chicken and set aside.
  12. Wipe the pot or pan clean.
  13. Add olive oil to the pot or pan and sauté the onions for 3 minutes, until softened.
  14. Add garlic paste and thyme, sauté for 15-20 seconds.
  15. Pour in the white wine or stock and reduce by 75%.
  16. Add the cream, grated parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
  17. Simmer for 2 minutes to reduce and thicken the sauce.
  18. Return the chicken to the sauce and flip every 30 seconds for 2 minutes.
  19. Remove from heat and transfer the chicken to a bowl.
  20. Drizzle with sauce, garnish with black pepper, parsley (optional), and parmesan cheese.
  21. Slice the chicken and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g-EdicggZ-0

creamy_garlic_diane_sauce.txt - Creamy Garlic Diane Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn to make a creamy garlic diane sauce
  • Understand the importance of deglazing the pan
  • Create a sauce that can be served over a variety of dishes

Ingredients

  • 1 whole diced brown or yellow onion
  • 2 cloves of freshly minced garlic
  • 5 grams or 0.1 ounce of flat leaf parsley
  • 2 tablespoons or 28 grams of unsalted butter
  • 1 teaspoon or 5 milliliters of olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons or 40 milliliters of brandy or cognac (or beef stock)
  • 2 teaspoons or 20 grams of tomato paste
  • 2 teaspoons or 18 grams of Dijon mustard
  • 2 tablespoons or 40 milliliters of Worcestershire sauce
  • 1/4 cup or 60 milliliters of beef stock
  • 1 teaspoon or 5 grams of sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon or 10 cracks of black pepper
  • 1 cup or 250 milliliters of thickened cream

Instructions

  1. Dice one whole brown or yellow onion and mince two cloves of garlic.
  2. Roughly chop 5 grams or 0.1 ounce of flat leaf parsley.
  3. Place a large skillet on the stovetop over high heat and add 2 tablespoons (28 grams) of unsalted butter and 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) of olive oil.
  4. Allow the butter to melt and start to lightly bubble.
  5. Add the diced onion and sauté for 4-5 minutes, or until soft and lightly golden, stirring occasionally.
  6. Add the minced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds to develop the flavors.
  7. Carefully pour in 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) of brandy or cognac (or beef stock) to deglaze the pan.
  8. Cook for 45 seconds to reduce and enhance the flavors, stirring frequently.
  9. Add 2 teaspoons (20 grams) of tomato paste, 2 teaspoons (18 grams) of Dijon mustard, and 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) of Worcestershire sauce.
  10. Stir regularly for 1.5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld and the oils in the tomato paste to enhance.
  11. Pour in 1/4 cup (60 milliliters) of beef stock.
  12. Add 1 teaspoon (5 grams) of sea salt flakes and 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) of black pepper.
  13. Mix well and cook for 1-1.5 minutes, or until the beef stock has reduced by half.
  14. Pour in 1 cup (250 milliliters) of thickened cream and stir to combine.
  15. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low.
  16. Simmer for 6-7 minutes, or until the sauce has reduced by one quarter and is nice and thick, stirring every minute.
  17. Stir in the chopped parsley until evenly distributed.
  18. Remove the sauce from the heat and serve over your favorite dishes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DZxhJdHblRI

creamy_garlic_lemon_pasta.txt - Creamy Garlic Lemon Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and quick creamy garlic lemon pasta.
  • Learn to prep garlic and lemon for the dish.
  • Master the technique of creating a flavorful creamy sauce.

Ingredients

  • 400 grams spaghetti
  • 1 bulb garlic
  • 4 large cloves of garlic
  • 1 whole lemon
  • 10 grams curly or flat leaf parsley (optional)
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1.5 tablespoons unsalted butter
  • 1 cup thickened cream
  • Salt (to taste)
  • Sea salt flakes (for garlic)
  • Fresh parmesan cheese (for garnish)
  • Cracked black pepper (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Place a large pot of water over high heat, cover, and bring to a boil.
  2. While the water heats, prepare the ingredients:
  3. Crush the garlic bulb to easily remove cloves.
  4. Peel and remove the woody tips from 4 large cloves of garlic.
  5. Thinly slice the peeled garlic cloves.
  6. Zest the whole lemon, being careful to avoid the pith.
  7. Slice the lemon in half and squeeze the juice from one half.
  8. If using parsley, roughly chop it.
  9. Once the water boils, remove the lid and generously season with salt.
  10. Add 400 grams of spaghetti and cook for one minute less than the package instructions, until al dente.
  11. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  12. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1.5 tablespoons unsalted butter, allowing them to melt.
  13. Add the thinly sliced garlic and a pinch of sea salt flakes.
  14. Gently fry the garlic for about one minute, being careful not to brown it.
  15. Add the lemon zest, lemon juice, and continue cooking for another minute, stirring occasionally.
  16. Add 1 cup of thickened cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  17. Stir well to combine and bring the mixture to a light boil.
  18. Reduce heat to low and simmer until the sauce slightly thickens.
  19. When the pasta is al dente, transfer it directly from the pot into the sauce, keeping some of the pasta water.
  20. Add the chopped parsley, if using, and fold everything together.
  21. Cook for one final minute to allow the pasta to finish cooking and the sauce to coat it completely.
  22. Serve the pasta hot, garnished with lemon zest, parsley, and grated parmesan cheese.
  23. Season with cracked black pepper to taste.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i84Sc5uvQa8

creamy_garlic_mushroom_chicken_masala.txt - Creamy Garlic Mushroom Chicken Masala

Objectives

  • Create a creamy garlic mushroom chicken masala using sweet masala wine.
  • Learn a butterflying technique for chicken breasts.
  • Master the art of searing chicken and sauteing mushrooms.

Ingredients

  • 2 free-range chicken breasts (300 grams/10.5 ounces)
  • 1 teaspoon (3 grams) onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon (3 grams) garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) olive oil
  • 200 grams (7 ounces) swiss brown mushrooms (cremini or chestnut)
  • 6 cloves garlic, freshly peeled
  • 10 grams (0.3 ounces) flat leaf parsley
  • 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) olive oil
  • 2.5 tablespoons (35 grams) unsalted butter
  • 1 tablespoon (14 grams) unsalted butter (optional)
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 cup (250 milliliters) sweet masala wine
  • 1 cup (250 milliliters) chicken or vegetable stock
  • 1 cup (250 milliliters) full fat cream (heavy cream, whipping cream, thickened cream)
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes (optional)
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper (optional)
  • Fresh parmigiano-reggiano cheese or parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Fresh black pepper (optional)
  • Chopped flat leaf parsley (optional)

Instructions

  1. Butterfly the chicken breasts by slicing them in half through the side, stopping just before reaching the opposite side.
  2. Slice the chicken breasts in half through the center to create two even fillets.
  3. In a mixing bowl, combine the chicken fillets with onion powder, garlic powder, sea salt flakes, black pepper, and olive oil.
  4. Mix thoroughly to coat the chicken completely.
  5. Slice the mushrooms into thin strips.
  6. Grate the garlic cloves to create a smooth paste.
  7. Chop the parsley roughly.
  8. Heat a large heavy base pot or pan over high heat.
  9. Add olive oil and butter to the pan and allow it to melt.
  10. Sear the chicken breasts for 3 minutes per side, ensuring they are golden brown.
  11. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
  12. (Optional) Add another tablespoon of butter to the pan and melt.
  13. Saute the mushrooms for 3 minutes, stirring regularly.
  14. Add salt and pepper to the mushrooms after 1 minute.
  15. After 3 minutes, add the garlic paste and saute for 45 seconds, stirring constantly.
  16. Pour in the sweet masala wine and chicken or vegetable stock.
  17. Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 7 minutes.
  18. Add the full fat cream and stir to combine.
  19. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a simmer.
  20. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
  21. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 4 minutes, or until the sauce thickens and is golden.
  22. Stir in the chopped parsley.
  23. Add the seared chicken breasts to the sauce, pouring in any juices from the resting plate.
  24. Gently rotate the chicken in the sauce for 1 minute to coat it completely.
  25. Remove the pan from the heat.
  26. Serve the chicken with the creamy mushroom masala sauce.
  27. (Optional) Grate parmesan cheese over the dish.
  28. (Optional) Garnish with fresh black pepper and chopped parsley.
  29. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hC_1_eSSUlc

creamy_garlic_mushroom_chicken_pasta.txt - Creamy Garlic Mushroom & Chicken Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and easy one-pot pasta dish.
  • Utilize fresh and dried herbs for a rich flavor profile.
  • Master the art of creating a creamy sauce with a depth of flavor.

Ingredients

  • 750g boneless and skinless chicken thighs
  • 0.5g dried basil
  • 0.5g dried thyme
  • 2.5g onion powder
  • 2.5g garlic powder
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 10 cracks of black pepper
  • 1 large brown or yellow onion
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 200g Swiss brown or cremini mushrooms
  • 5g flat-leaf parsley
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 tsp olive oil
  • 1/4 cup white wine or chicken stock
  • 1 tsp sea salt flakes
  • 1 liter chicken stock
  • 500ml thickened cream
  • 350g pasta (penne recommended)
  • 40g freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese
  • 120g baby spinach
  • Extra virgin olive oil (for garnish)
  • Cracked black pepper (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Season chicken thighs with dried herbs, spices, salt, and pepper. Massage to coat.
  2. Slice onion in half through the root, then make thin slices across, stopping before the root. Slice horizontally to break up the formation. Dice into small even pieces.
  3. Create a garlic paste by grating garlic on a microplane or box grater.
  4. Thinly slice mushrooms.
  5. Roughly chop parsley, removing large leaves and stems.
  6. Heat a large pan or pot over high heat. Add olive oil and sear chicken thighs in batches for 3.5 minutes per side, until golden. Remove and set aside.
  7. Reduce heat to medium-high. Add butter and olive oil to the pan. Sauté diced onion for 3 minutes.
  8. Add minced garlic and sauté for 45 seconds.
  9. Deglaze the pan with white wine or chicken stock, mixing for 1.5 minutes.
  10. Add sliced mushrooms and salt, sauté for 4 minutes until golden and soft.
  11. Pour in chicken stock and thickened cream. Mix well. Season with salt and pepper.
  12. Bring sauce to a boil. Add pasta and mix well.
  13. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pasta is al dente.
  14. Thinly slice seared chicken thighs across the grain.
  15. Add grated cheese and chopped parsley to the sauce. Mix for 1 minute.
  16. Add baby spinach and mix until just softened.
  17. Turn off heat. Add sliced chicken thighs and any resting juices. Mix well.
  18. Serve pasta in bowls, garnished with parmigiano-reggiano cheese, extra virgin olive oil, and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=85eG2gsJ0Ko

creamy_garlic_mushroom_chicken.txt - Creamy Garlic Mushroom Chicken

Objectives

  • Create a creamy garlic mushroom chicken dish with simple ingredients.
  • Achieve a flavorful and aromatic sauce with a rich texture.
  • Learn to cook chicken thighs to perfection for a juicy and tender result.

Ingredients

  • 2 small shallots or 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 300 grams Swiss brown mushrooms (baby Portobellos or cremini)
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 3 grams flat leaf parsley (optional)
  • 1 gram fresh tarragon (optional)
  • 8 large boneless and skinless chicken thighs (or chicken breast)
  • 2 teaspoons olive oil
  • 2.5 grams onion powder
  • 2.5 grams garlic powder
  • 1 gram dried thyme
  • 1 gram dried oregano
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Black pepper
  • 20 grams unsalted butter
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) olive oil
  • 100 ml white wine or chicken stock
  • 300 ml thickened cream
  • 50 grams Parmesan cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice the shallots or onion finely.
  2. Thinly slice the mushrooms.
  3. Create a garlic paste by grating the garlic cloves.
  4. Chop the parsley and tarragon (optional).
  5. Season the chicken thighs with olive oil, onion powder, garlic powder, dried thyme, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
  6. Heat a large pan or pot over medium-high heat.
  7. Add 1.5 tablespoons of olive oil to the pan.
  8. Sear the chicken thighs in batches for 6 minutes per side, ensuring they are cooked through and browned.
  9. Remove the chicken and set aside to rest.
  10. Add the butter to the pan and melt.
  11. Add the shallots and cook for 1 minute to pick up the chicken flavor.
  12. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5-6 minutes, scraping the bottom of the pan to release moisture.
  13. Add salt to the mushrooms to extract more moisture.
  14. Once the mushrooms are browned and moisture has reduced, add the minced garlic and cook for 45 seconds.
  15. Add 100 ml of white wine or chicken stock and simmer for 2 minutes until reduced by ¾.
  16. Add the thickened cream, cracked black pepper, and mix well.
  17. Simmer the sauce for 6 minutes until it thickens and the color changes.
  18. Add the Parmesan cheese (optional) and stir.
  19. Add the chopped parsley and tarragon (optional) and cook for 30 seconds.
  20. Return the chicken and its resting juices to the pan.
  21. Gently mix everything together and cook for 1 minute to reheat the chicken and coat it in the sauce.
  22. Serve the chicken with mashed potatoes, vegetables, rice, or pasta.
  23. Top with the mushroom sauce, grated Parmesan cheese, parsley, and cracked pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R9R7VI_ZqCU

creamy_garlic_mushroom_risotto.txt - Creamy Garlic Mushroom Risotto

Objectives

  • Learn to make a creamy, flavorful mushroom risotto.
  • Understand the importance of using high-quality ingredients and proper cooking techniques.
  • Discover tips for creating a perfectly textured risotto.

Ingredients

  • 1.5 liters (6 cups) vegetable or chicken stock
  • 15 grams (0.5 ounces) dried paccini mushrooms (optional)
  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 1 rib of celery
  • 4 cloves of garlic
  • 450 grams (1 pound) swiss brown mushrooms (cremini)
  • 10 grams (0.5 ounces) flat leaf parsley
  • 5 grams (0.3 ounces) thyme
  • 4 leaves of sage
  • 1 lemon (optional)
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) olive oil
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 20 cracks black pepper
  • 400 grams (14.1 ounces) arborio rice
  • 1/3 cup (80 ml) white wine (or chicken stock)
  • 2 tablespoons (28 grams) unsalted butter
  • Freshly grated parmesan cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Bring 1.5 liters (6 cups) of vegetable or chicken stock to a boil in a saucepan over high heat.
  2. Rehydrate the dried paccini mushrooms by adding them to a bowl with 1/2 cup (125 ml) of boiling stock. Let steep for 5 minutes.
  3. Chop the rehydrated mushrooms and set aside.
  4. Grate the onion and celery using a box grater.
  5. Grate the garlic using a microplane.
  6. Thinly slice the swiss brown mushrooms.
  7. Chop the parsley, thyme, and sage.
  8. Juice the lemon (optional).
  9. Saute the sliced mushrooms in 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil over medium-high heat for 5-6 minutes, or until lightly golden.
  10. Add the chopped herbs to the mushrooms and saute for 1 minute.
  11. Transfer the mushroom and herb mixture to a bowl, add the lemon juice (optional), and season with cracked black pepper. Set aside.
  12. Saute the grated onion and celery in 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, or until lightly golden.
  13. Add the minced garlic and saute for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
  14. Add the arborio rice and toast for 1 minute.
  15. Deglaze the pot with 1/3 cup (80 ml) of white wine (or chicken stock) and cook for 1 minute.
  16. Add the paccini mushroom mix and the reserved mushroom stock to the pot and cook for 1 minute.
  17. Gradually add the hot stock to the pot, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly until the rice has absorbed the liquid (about 1.5-2 minutes).
  18. Repeat the process until all of the stock has been added.
  19. Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the mushroom and herb mixture, butter, and parmesan cheese (optional).
  20. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  21. Serve immediately in bowls or plates. Garnish with chopped parsley and a drizzle of olive oil.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Udb0kbjAzfk

creamy_garlic_mushroom_sauce_and_cheese_stuffed_chicken_breast.txt - Creamy Garlic Mushroom Sauce and Cheese Stuffed Chicken Breast

Objectives

  • Make a creamy garlic mushroom sauce
  • Stuff chicken breasts with cheese and mushrooms
  • Cook chicken breasts to perfection
  • Create a simple salad to accompany the dish

Ingredients

  • 5 cloves garlic, minced
  • 200 grams swiss brown mushrooms, sliced
  • 4 sprigs thyme, chopped
  • 10 grams flat leaf parsley, chopped
  • 3 balls bocconcini cheese, sliced
  • 2 large chicken breasts
  • 0.5 teaspoon garlic salt
  • 0.5 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon black pepper
  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • 3 tablespoons clarified butter
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 250 ml heavy thickened cream
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, grated (amount to taste)
  • Toothpicks or small skewers
  • Cucumber, thinly sliced
  • Cherry tomatoes, chopped
  • Half a red onion, thinly sliced
  • Lettuce
  • Honey mustard dressing
  • Cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Mince 5 cloves of garlic using a microplane or grater.
  2. Slice 200 grams of swiss brown mushrooms into half-centimeter slices.
  3. Finely chop 4 sprigs of thyme.
  4. Roughly chop 10 grams of flat leaf parsley.
  5. Slice 3 balls of bocconcini cheese into thin strips.
  6. Create a slit in the side of each chicken breast, making a pocket.
  7. Season the chicken breasts with 0.5 teaspoon garlic salt, 0.5 teaspoon onion powder, 1 teaspoon black pepper, and 1 teaspoon olive oil.
  8. Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add 3 tablespoons of clarified butter.
  9. Sauté 2 cloves of minced garlic in the melted butter for 30 seconds.
  10. Add the sliced mushrooms, 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes, and 1 teaspoon black pepper to the pan.
  11. Sauté the mushrooms for 4 minutes, then add the chopped thyme and half of the chopped parsley.
  12. Continue sautéing for 3 minutes until the mushrooms are golden brown.
  13. Stuff each chicken breast with 3-4 slices of bocconcini cheese, a few spoonfuls of the sautéed mushroom mix, and some grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.
  14. Secure the chicken breasts with toothpicks or skewers.
  15. Heat a large pan over high heat and add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
  16. Sear the stuffed chicken breasts for 3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
  17. Transfer the chicken breasts to a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius or 350 degrees Fahrenheit and bake for 14-15 minutes.
  18. While the chicken is baking, melt 2 tablespoons of clarified butter in a pan over medium heat.
  19. Sauté the remaining 3 cloves of minced garlic for 30 seconds.
  20. Add 250 ml of heavy thickened cream, 1 teaspoon black pepper, and the remaining parsley to the pan.
  21. Bring the sauce to a simmer and season to taste.
  22. Simmer the sauce for 7 minutes until it thickens.
  23. Make a salad with cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, lettuce, honey mustard dressing, and cracked black pepper.
  24. After 14 minutes, remove the chicken breasts from the oven and let them rest for 5 minutes.
  25. Add the pan juices from the chicken to the sauce.
  26. Remove the toothpicks or skewers from the chicken breasts and slice them in half to reveal the filling.
  27. Serve the chicken with the creamy garlic mushroom sauce and the salad.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tbSr9-N4H5U

creamy_garlic_mushroom_sauce.txt - Creamy Garlic Mushroom Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn to make a creamy garlic mushroom sauce to accompany steak.
  • Understand the importance of proper cooking times for shallots, garlic, and mushrooms.
  • Learn how to deglaze a pan with white wine.

Ingredients

  • 1 shallot
  • 4-5 cloves garlic
  • 1 pound mushrooms
  • White wine
  • Heavy cream
  • Salt
  • Cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Dice the shallot into small pieces.
  2. Crush and roughly chop the garlic.
  3. Slice the mushrooms into 1 cm slices.
  4. Heat the steak pan to medium-high heat.
  5. Add the shallot and cook for 3 minutes.
  6. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
  7. Add the mushrooms and cook for 6 minutes.
  8. Deglaze the pan with white wine and stir to combine.
  9. Reduce the wine by half, cooking for about 2 minutes.
  10. Season with salt and cracked black pepper.
  11. Add the cream and bring to a boil.
  12. Reduce heat to low and cook for 6-7 minutes, or until the sauce is golden and creamy.
  13. Pour the sauce into bowls or gravy boats and serve alongside steak.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3W9ls7aGU00

creamy_garlic_mushroom_sauce_with_seared_chicken.txt - Creamy Garlic Mushroom Sauce with Seared Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful creamy garlic mushroom sauce.
  • Prepare seared chicken for a delicious and satisfying meal.
  • Understand the importance of deglazing the pan for extra flavor.

Ingredients

  • 1 shallot, finely diced
  • Parsley, roughly chopped
  • Tarragon, roughly chopped
  • Mushrooms, thinly sliced
  • Garlic, grated
  • Chicken thighs
  • Olive oil
  • Garlic powder
  • Onion powder
  • Dried thyme
  • Dried oregano
  • Salt
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Butter
  • Chicken stock
  • Cream
  • Parmesan cheese

Instructions

  1. Finely dice one shallot.
  2. Roughly chop parsley and tarragon.
  3. Thinly slice the mushrooms.
  4. Grate garlic using a microplane.
  5. Add chicken thighs to a bowl along with olive oil, garlic powder, onion powder, dried thyme, dried oregano, salt, and cracked black pepper.
  6. Mix the chicken ingredients well until combined.
  7. Heat a pan over medium-high heat.
  8. Add olive oil to the pan.
  9. Sear the chicken in batches for six minutes on each side, until golden brown.
  10. Remove the chicken from the pan.
  11. Add butter and the diced shallot to the pan and cook for one minute.
  12. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook for six minutes, until golden brown.
  13. Add the grated garlic and cook for one minute.
  14. Add the chicken stock to deglaze the pan.
  15. Add the cream and cracked black pepper to the pan.
  16. Mix the sauce ingredients and bring to a boil.
  17. Reduce heat to low and cook for six minutes.
  18. Grate in the parmesan cheese.
  19. Add the chopped parsley and tarragon.
  20. Add the seared chicken to the sauce and cook for one final minute.
  21. Serve the creamy garlic mushroom sauce with the seared chicken, garnished with parmesan cheese and parsley.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qRZIneHwR_o

creamy_garlic_mushroom_soup.txt - Creamy Garlic Mushroom Soup

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and creamy garlic mushroom soup.
  • Learn to make a mushroom powder for a rich umami flavor.
  • Utilize a simple and straightforward recipe with easily accessible ingredients.

Ingredients

  • 5 grams dried porcini mushrooms
  • 5 grams dried shiitake mushrooms
  • 2 large brown or yellow onions
  • 2 large all-rounded potatoes (with peels)
  • 1 large leek
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 750 grams button mushrooms
  • 140 grams unsalted butter
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 ml) white wine or vegetable stock
  • 1 liter (4 cups) vegetable stock
  • 100 ml (110 grams) thickened cream
  • 2 tablespoons (40 ml) full fat milk
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Extra virgin truffle oil (optional)
  • Toasted bread (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 150°C (300°F).
  2. Place dried porcini and shiitake mushrooms on a baking tray.
  3. Roast for 5 minutes to enhance flavor and dry completely.
  4. Let cool for a couple of minutes.
  5. Grind mushrooms into a fine powder using a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
  6. Store mushroom powder in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 6 months.
  7. Peel and remove the tip and root from 2 large onions.
  8. Slice onions in half lengthwise, then in half again lengthwise.
  9. Rotate 90 degrees and dice into large, even-sized chunks.
  10. Wash 2 large all-rounded potatoes (leave peels on) and slice in half lengthwise.
  11. Slice in half again lengthwise, rotate 90 degrees, and dice into large, even-sized chunks.
  12. Slice 1 large leek in half lengthwise.
  13. Slice each half into quarters lengthwise.
  14. Wash leek under cold water to remove any dirt.
  15. Slice leek into thin strips, aiming for consistent size.
  16. Lay 6 cloves of garlic flat on a chopping board.
  17. Crush each clove with the side of a knife to activate the allicin compound.
  18. Roughly chop the crushed garlic.
  19. Thinly slice 750 grams of button mushrooms.
  20. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
  21. Add 140 grams of unsalted butter and allow it to melt.
  22. Add diced onions, diced potatoes, and a pinch of sea salt flakes.
  23. Mix to combine and sweat for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.
  24. Add sliced leek, crushed garlic, and thinly sliced button mushrooms.
  25. Sauté for 10 minutes, stirring regularly.
  26. After 10 minutes, turn the heat to high.
  27. Add 2.5 tablespoons (50 ml) of white wine or vegetable stock.
  28. Deglaze the pot for 2 minutes, stirring regularly.
  29. Pour in 1 liter (4 cups) of vegetable stock.
  30. Add 100 ml (110 grams) of thickened cream, 2 tablespoons (40 ml) of full fat milk, sea salt flakes to taste, and cracked black pepper.
  31. Mix well and bring to a boil.
  32. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
  33. Stir again after 10 minutes.
  34. Remove from heat.
  35. Blend the soup using an immersion blender, regular blender, or food processor.
  36. If using a regular blender or food processor, allow the soup to cool for at least 45 minutes before blending.
  37. Stir the blended soup and adjust seasoning as needed.
  38. Ladle hot soup into bowls.
  39. Sprinkle with diced mushroom powder for an umami kick.
  40. Add a few cracks of black pepper.
  41. Drizzle with extra virgin truffle oil (optional) or plain extra virgin olive oil.
  42. Serve with toasted bread for dipping.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zjp6swL1yCU

creamy_garlic_mustard_chicken_pot_pies.txt - Creamy Garlic Mustard Chicken Pot Pies

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and flavorful chicken pot pie filling.
  • Assemble the pot pies with puff pastry and bake until golden brown.
  • Create a creamy and savory sauce with garlic, mustard, and herbs.

Ingredients

  • Oil
  • Chicken
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Butter
  • Onion
  • Carrot
  • Celery
  • Garlic
  • Plain flour
  • White wine
  • Whole grain mustard
  • Dijon mustard
  • Chicken stock
  • Thickened cream
  • Fresh thyme
  • Fresh marjoram
  • Dried bay leaves
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Puff pastry
  • Egg

Instructions

  1. Heat oil in a large pan over high heat.
  2. Add chicken and sea salt flakes, sear for 7 minutes, flipping halfway through.
  3. Remove chicken and add butter, allowing it to melt.
  4. Add onion, carrot, celery, garlic, and sea salt flakes, sauté for 6 minutes or until lightly golden.
  5. Add plain flour and cook for 1.5 minutes.
  6. Return chicken to the pan along with white wine and cook for 2 minutes.
  7. Add whole grain mustard, Dijon mustard, chicken stock, thickened cream, fresh thyme, fresh marjoram, dried bay leaves, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper.
  8. Mix well and bring to a boil.
  9. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40 minutes.
  10. Remove lid and remove chicken, allowing sauce to continue simmering while slicing the chicken.
  11. Add sliced chicken back to the sauce and mix.
  12. Remove from heat and portion the mixture into 4 large ramekins.
  13. Cut 4 rounds of puff pastry and place over the top of each ramekin.
  14. Fold the pastry over the edges tightly.
  15. Crack an egg into a bowl and beat. Brush the egg wash over the top of the pastry.
  16. Make 2-3 slices on top of the pastry and season with salt.
  17. Bake at 190°C for 20-22 minutes or until golden brown.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IBz_5y9C4v8

creamy_garlic_mustard_chicken_pot_pie.txt - Creamy Garlic Mustard Chicken Pot Pie

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and creamy chicken pot pie filling.
  • Bake a golden brown puff pastry crust for the pot pie.
  • Assemble and bake the pot pie for a delicious meal.

Ingredients

Mirepoix - 2 brown or yellow onions - 1 carrot - 1 rib of celery

Other Ingredients - 4 cloves of garlic - 7 grams (0.2 ounces) of margarine or tarragon (fresh or dried) - 10 grams (0.3 ounces) of soft stem thyme (fresh or dried) - 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) boneless and skinless chicken thighs - 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) olive oil - Pinch of sea salt flakes - 70 grams (2.4 ounces) unsalted butter - 50 grams (1.7 ounces) plain all-purpose flour - 3/4 cup (180 milliliters) white wine (or chicken stock) - 1 tablespoon (30 grams) whole grain mustard - 2 teaspoons (20 grams) Dijon mustard - 4 cups (1 liter) chicken stock - 1/4 cup (60 milliliters) thickened cream - 3 dried bay leaves - Cracked black pepper (20 cracks) - 1 large egg - 2 sheets of defrosted puff pastry

Instructions

  1. Grate the mirepoix (onion, carrot, celery) on a box grater.
  2. Grate the garlic using a microplane to create a paste.
  3. Roughly chop the margarine/tarragon and thyme.
  4. Heat a large pan over high heat and add olive oil.
  5. Sear chicken thighs for 8 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown.
  6. Remove chicken from pan and reduce heat to medium-high.
  7. Add butter to the pan and let it melt and foam.
  8. Add the grated mirepoix, minced garlic, and a pinch of salt.
  9. Sauté for 6 minutes, breaking up the garlic, until moisture is cooked out.
  10. Add flour and cook for 1.5 minutes to cook out the floury texture.
  11. Return chicken and juices to the pan.
  12. Add white wine (or chicken stock) to deglaze the pan.
  13. Arrange chicken evenly in the pan and reduce for 1 minute.
  14. Add mustards, chicken stock, cream, herbs, bay leaves, salt, and pepper.
  15. Mix well and bring to a boil over high heat.
  16. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes.
  17. Remove chicken from the sauce and set aside.
  18. Simmer the sauce over medium heat while you slice or shred the chicken.
  19. Return the chicken and juices to the sauce and cook for 2 minutes.
  20. Transfer the sauce mixture into oven-safe ramekins, filling to 1 cm below the rim.
  21. Press down a circle of puff pastry larger than the ramekin diameter to create a lid.
  22. Carefully peel off the puff pastry and lay it over the ramekin.
  23. Crimp the pastry edges around the ramekin to create a tight seal.
  24. Beat an egg in a bowl and brush it over the pastry surface and sides.
  25. Make 3-4 shallow cuts on the top of the pastry to allow steam to escape.
  26. Sprinkle with sea salt flakes (optional).
  27. Place the ramekins on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (390°F) for 20-25 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and puffed.
  28. Let the pot pies cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AbWV3ammiz4

creamy_garlic_mustard_chicken.txt - Creamy Garlic Mustard Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful and creamy garlic mustard chicken dish.
  • Utilize the butterfly technique to create evenly cooked chicken fillets.
  • Master the art of deglazing a pan for enhanced flavor.

Ingredients

  • 1 onion
  • 2-3 cloves garlic
  • herbs (parsley, thyme, rosemary)
  • chicken breast
  • garlic powder
  • salt
  • pepper
  • olive oil
  • white wine or stock
  • whole grain mustard
  • Dijon mustard
  • heavy cream
  • mashed potatoes (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice the onion into medium pieces.
  2. Grate the garlic using a microplane to create a paste.
  3. Roughly chop the herbs and combine them together.
  4. Butterfly the chicken breast and slice into even fillets.
  5. In a bowl, combine the chicken fillets with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
  6. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  7. Add olive oil to the pan.
  8. Fry the chicken fillets in batches for about 3.5 minutes per side, then remove from the pan.
  9. Add a little more olive oil to the pan.
  10. Add the diced onion and a pinch of salt. Cook for 5 minutes to pick up the flavor.
  11. Add the garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
  12. Deglaze the pan with white wine or stock. Cook for 2 minutes until reduced by half.
  13. Add the whole grain and Dijon mustard. Cook for 1 minute.
  14. Add the cream and mix thoroughly.
  15. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  16. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low. Cook for 6 minutes until thickened.
  17. Stir in the herbs.
  18. Add the cooked chicken fillets to the sauce and spread them evenly.
  19. Cook for 1 minute.
  20. Serve over mashed potatoes, if desired. Garnish as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzUUBZj4PVU

creamy_garlic_pasta_meal_prep.txt - Creamy Garlic Pasta Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and nutritious creamy garlic pasta dish.
  • Prepare a meal prep-friendly version for easy storage and reheating.
  • Utilize a "cheats" version of romesco sauce for a creamy texture.

Ingredients

Sauce: - 4 large tomatoes, diced - 2 bell peppers, diced - 5 cloves garlic, microplaned - 1 tablespoon olive oil - Salt and pepper to taste - 1 teaspoon onion powder - 2 teaspoons sweet paprika - 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano - 1/2 teaspoon dried basil - 3/4 cup chicken stock Beef: - 2 teaspoons olive oil - 750 grams 90% lean beef mince - Salt and pepper to taste - 2.5 grams onion powder - 5 grams sweet paprika - 1 gram dried oregano - 1 gram dried basil Pasta: - 500 grams pasta of choice - 240 grams soft low-fat cream cheese Garnish: - Parmesan cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice tomatoes and bell peppers into small pieces.
  2. Microplane garlic cloves to create a paste.
  3. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
  4. Add diced tomatoes, bell peppers, garlic, salt, and pepper.
  5. Cook for 6 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes slightly break down.
  6. Add onion powder, paprika, oregano, and basil to the pan.
  7. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  8. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil.
  9. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.
  10. Allow the sauce to cool for 15-20 minutes before blending until smooth.
  11. Add cream cheese to the sauce and blend until smooth and creamy.
  12. Heat olive oil in another pan over high heat.
  13. Add beef mince, salt, and pepper.
  14. Cook for 3 minutes, breaking up the mince, until browned.
  15. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and season generously with salt.
