eggs_benedict.txt - Eggs Benedict

Objectives

  • Learn to make a classic Eggs Benedict breakfast dish.
  • Master the art of poaching eggs and making hollandaise sauce.
  • Assemble a delicious and impressive Eggs Benedict.

Ingredients

  • 1 1/2 tablespoons (30 ml) white vinegar
  • 300 grams (10.5 oz) unsalted butter
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) white vinegar or lemon juice
  • 1/2 tablespoon (10 ml) olive oil
  • 4-6 pieces ham or bacon
  • 180 grams (6.3 oz) baby spinach
  • 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 2 English muffins
  • Fresh parsley (optional)
  • Cayenne pepper (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a small saucepan filled halfway with water onto the stovetop.
  2. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons (30 ml) of white vinegar to the saucepan.
  3. Bring the water to a simmer over high heat.
  4. Place another small saucepan onto the stovetop and add 300 grams (10.5 oz) of unsalted butter.
  5. Melt the butter over medium heat.
  6. Once melted, cook the butter for four minutes to allow the milk solids to float to the top.
  7. Remove the saucepan from the heat.
  8. Carefully remove the milk solids from the clarified butter using a spoon, leaving the clarified butter in the saucepan.
  9. Pour the clarified butter into a container, leaving behind the milk solids.
  10. Place a large bowl on top of the saucepan with the simmering water to create a bain-marie (double boiler), ensuring the bowl doesn't touch the water.
  11. Add 3 large egg yolks and 1 tablespoon (20 ml) of white vinegar or lemon juice to the bowl.
  12. Hold the bowl firmly with a tea towel and whisk vigorously until the mixture forms thick ribbons.
  13. After two minutes of whisking, remove the bowl from the bain-marie and turn the heat back on high to bring the water to a boil.
  14. Place a damp tea towel in a circle on top of the bowl to help stabilize it.
  15. While continuously whisking, slowly pour in the clarified butter to create an emulsion.
  16. Add the clarified butter very slowly to help the bonds form together, avoiding splitting the hollandaise.
  17. Once the hollandaise reaches a thick but pourable consistency, season to taste.
  18. Cover the hollandaise with plastic wrap to prevent a skin from forming and set aside.
  19. Alternatively, you can make the hollandaise in a blender or food processor using the same ingredients.
  20. Process the egg yolks, vinegar, and salt in the blender or food processor on high speed for one minute to aerate.
  21. Slowly pour in the clarified butter while the blender or food processor is running.
  22. Once all the clarified butter is incorporated, turn off the blender or food processor and pour the hollandaise into a bowl.
  23. Cover the hollandaise with plastic wrap and set aside.
  24. Bring the poaching water to a boil.
  25. Create a vortex in the boiling water.
  26. Gently add the desired number of eggs to the water.
  27. Poach the eggs for two and a half minutes for soft poached eggs.
  28. Place a pan onto the stovetop over high heat and add 1/2 tablespoon (10 ml) of olive oil.
  29. Add 4-6 pieces of ham or bacon to the pan and cook for one and a half minutes on each side.
  30. Remove the poached eggs from the water after two and a half minutes and place them on a plate lined with a kitchen cloth or tea towel to drain.
  31. Remove the cooked ham or bacon from the pan and place it on a plate.
  32. Optionally, add 180 grams (6.3 oz) of baby spinach to the pan and sauté for one and a half to two minutes, or until wilted and soft.
  33. Season the spinach with 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) of sea salt flakes and 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) of black pepper while it cooks.
  34. Slice two English muffins in half using a sharp bread knife.
  35. Toast the English muffins until golden brown.
  36. To assemble the Eggs Benedict, place the toasted English muffins on a plate.
  37. Top the English muffins with the sauteed baby spinach (optional).
  38. Add the golden ham or bacon, or smoked salmon for Eggs Royale, or leave it plain for Eggs Florentine.
  39. Top with the poached eggs or hard-boiled eggs.
  40. Drizzle with the silky smooth hollandaise sauce.
  41. Garnish with chopped parsley, black pepper, or cayenne pepper (optional).
  42. Crack the yolk of the poached egg and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v7BQf_t7oOw

error.txt - Error

Objectives

  • [No objectives available. Transcript not provided.]

Instructions

  • [No instructions available. Transcript not provided.]

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ReyQLrRx9k8

fajita_tacos.txt - Fajita Tacos

Objectives

  • Combine tacos and fajitas for a delicious dish.
  • Prepare toppings and fillings for fajita tacos.
  • Cook chicken fajitas with onions and garlic.
  • Assemble and serve fajita tacos with fresh toppings.

Ingredients

For the Toppings - 1 red onion - 200g cherry tomatoes (or 1-2 regular tomatoes) - 3 limes - 2 avocados - Sea salt flakes - Lime juice

For the Fajitas - 1 brown or yellow onion - 2 cloves garlic - 2 chicken breasts (or thighs) - Olive oil - Taco seasoning (recipe below)

For the Taco Seasoning - 4g onion powder - 4g garlic powder - 4g paprika - 4g ground cumin - 2g dried oregano - 0.5g chili powder - Salt

For the Tacos - Flour tortillas (or corn tortillas) - Fresh coriander (or cilantro)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the Toppings:
  2. Slice red onion thinly, then dice into small to medium pieces.
  3. Dice cherry tomatoes into small to medium pieces.
  4. Slice limes into 8 even wedges, removing pith if desired.
  5. Slice avocados around the seed, remove seed, and mash in a bowl with salt and lime juice.
  6. Prepare the Fajitas:
  7. Slice onion in half lengthwise, then thinly slice across.
  8. Grate garlic cloves into a paste.
  9. Butterfly chicken breasts by slicing horizontally, then slice into thin, even strips.
  10. Make the Taco Seasoning:
  11. Combine onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, cumin, oregano, chili powder, and salt in a bowl. Mix well.
  12. Marinate the Fajitas:
  13. In a bowl, mix diced onion with 1 tablespoon of taco seasoning. Massage with hands.
  14. In a separate bowl, mix sliced chicken with remaining taco seasoning and 2 teaspoons of olive oil. Massage well.
  15. Cook the Fajitas:
  16. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  17. Add marinated onions and cook for 4 minutes, stirring regularly, until softened but still textured.
  18. Add grated garlic, stir, and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and transfer to a bowl.
  19. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the same pan.
  20. Add marinated chicken in batches if necessary, and cook for 1 minute per side to sear.
  21. Stir chicken and cook for 5 minutes, until cooked through.
  22. Add cooked onions and garlic back to the pan and cook for 30 seconds to heat through.
  23. Toast the Tortillas:
  24. Heat flour tortillas in a dry pan over medium heat for 1 minute per side, until golden. (Alternatively, microwave, bake, or toast.)
  25. Assemble the Tacos:
  26. Spread mashed avocado on tortillas.
  27. Top with chicken fajita mixture.
  28. Add diced tomatoes, onions, and fresh coriander.
  29. Squeeze lime wedges over tacos for extra flavor.
  30. Serve:
  31. Arrange tacos on a platter and serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ALeF0GUCSSk

fall_off_the_bone_pork_ribs.txt - Fall-Off-the-Bone Pork Ribs

Objectives

  • Learn to make fall-off-the-bone pork ribs with an Asian marinade and spice rub.
  • Understand the importance of slow cooking and steaming for tender ribs.
  • Discover a delicious and easy-to-make marinade and spice rub.

Ingredients

  • 150 grams (5.2 ounces) gochujang (Korean fermented spice paste)
  • 150 grams (5.2 ounces) tomato sauce or ketchup
  • 50 grams (1.7 ounces) sriracha or chili sauce (optional)
  • 1 tablespoon (6.5 grams) Chinese five spice powder
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) garlic powder
  • 1.5 teaspoons (7.5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 2 racks of pork ribs (600 grams/1.3 pounds each)

Instructions

  1. Combine gochujang, tomato sauce, and sriracha in a mixing bowl. Mix well and set aside.
  2. In a separate bowl, mix together five spice powder, onion powder, garlic powder, and sea salt.
  3. Rub half of the spice mix onto each rack of ribs, ensuring the entire surface is covered.
  4. Brush the ribs with the gochujang marinade, coating them thoroughly. Save some marinade for later.
  5. Wrap each rack of ribs in parchment paper, then wrap again in aluminum foil, ensuring no ribs are visible.
  6. Bake the wrapped ribs in a preheated oven at 150°C (300°F) for 2 hours and 15 minutes.
  7. Remove the ribs from the oven and carefully unwrap them. Allow them to cool for 10-15 minutes.
  8. Transfer the ribs to a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Baste them with the remaining marinade.
  9. Bake the ribs in the oven at 200°C (390°F) for 5-7 minutes, or until slightly charred. Watch closely to prevent burning.
  10. Serve the ribs hot and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xmbRnzDvrY8

fennel_salt.txt - Fennel Salt

Objectives

  • Learn how to make fennel salt from scratch.
  • Understand the importance of toasting fennel seeds for optimal flavor.
  • Discover how to use fennel salt to enhance various dishes.

Ingredients

  • 10 grams whole fennel seeds
  • 15 grams sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Heat a pan over high heat.
  2. Add 10 grams of whole fennel seeds to the pan.
  3. Toast the fennel seeds for 1-2 minutes, or until lightly golden and cracking.
  4. Stir the seeds regularly to prevent burning.
  5. Transfer the toasted fennel seeds to a spice grinder or mortar.
  6. Grind the fennel seeds into a fine powder.
  7. Add the ground fennel powder to a clean bowl.
  8. Add 15 grams of sea salt flakes to the bowl.
  9. Mix the fennel powder and salt until fully combined.
  10. Store the fennel salt in an airtight container for up to 2 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qFgl0FxCxUE

fettuccine_alfredo.txt - Fettuccine Alfredo

Objectives

  • Prepare a creamy and flavorful Fettuccine Alfredo sauce.
  • Learn how to cook pasta perfectly.
  • Combine the sauce with pasta for a delicious and satisfying meal.

Ingredients

  • 2 cloves garlic, sliced
  • 5 sprigs (2 grams) flat leaf parsley, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons salt
  • 200 grams pasta (fettuccine preferred)
  • 70 grams unsalted butter
  • 250 milliliters (1 cup) heavy cream
  • 45 grams freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat.
  2. Slice two cloves of garlic in half and then finely slice them. Set aside.
  3. Finely chop five sprigs of flat leaf parsley. Set aside.
  4. Add two tablespoons of salt to the boiling water.
  5. Add 200 grams of pasta (fettuccine preferred) to the boiling water and cook for 10-15 seconds.
  6. Cook the pasta according to package instructions, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
  7. Five minutes before the pasta is finished cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat.
  8. Add 70 grams of unsalted butter to the skillet and melt.
  9. Once the butter is melted, add 250 milliliters (1 cup) of heavy cream and whisk to combine.
  10. Bring the sauce to a simmer.
  11. Add the sliced garlic to the simmering sauce and cook for 45 seconds.
  12. After 45 seconds, add 45 grams of freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese and stir until fully melted and smooth.
  13. Turn off the heat and add the chopped parsley.
  14. Season the sauce with 1 teaspoon of sea salt and 1 teaspoon of cracked black pepper.
  15. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and immediately add it to the sauce, including the water dripping from the pasta.
  16. Mix the pasta and sauce thoroughly to ensure the sauce coats the pasta evenly.
  17. Serve the Fettuccine Alfredo immediately, topped with additional freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fL6x5cFhl84

firecracker_beef_broccoli.txt - Firecracker Beef & Broccoli Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a high-protein, low-carb meal prep bowl.
  • Create a flavorful firecracker sauce for the beef and broccoli.
  • Make a low-carb cauliflower rice alternative.
  • Assemble and store the meal prep bowls for later consumption.

Ingredients

For the Firecracker Sauce: - 70 ml light soy sauce - 70 ml apple cider vinegar - 90 g sriracha sauce - 35 g brown sugar

For the Cauliflower Rice: - 1 cauliflower - 10 g ginger, peeled and microplaned - 7.5 ml sesame oil - Sesame seeds (white and black, optional) - Sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper (20 cracks)

For the Firecracker Beef & Broccoli: - 1 kg beef mince (18% fat, ideally 10% fat) - 4 cloves garlic, microplaned - 1 head broccoli (medium size) - 1 tablespoon peanut oil (or olive oil/vegetable oil) - 1 teaspoon chili flakes (optional) - Sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper (10 cracks) - 125 ml chicken stock

Garnish (optional): - Spring onion or scallion - Lime wedge

Instructions

  1. Prepare the Broccoli:
  2. Cut two heads of broccoli into bite-sized florets.
  3. Slice the broccoli stems in half, then into 2-3 strips depending on size.

  4. Slice the strips into pieces similar in size to the florets.

  5. Prepare the Firecracker Sauce:

  6. Combine light soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, sriracha sauce, and brown sugar in a bowl.

  7. Mix well until all ingredients are combined.

  8. Prepare the Cauliflower Rice:

  9. Cut one cauliflower in half and then into large chunks.

  10. Use a box grater (larger side) or a blender to break the cauliflower into a coarse mixture (about 30 seconds in a blender).

  11. Cook the Cauliflower Rice:

  12. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan or pot over high heat.
  13. Add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil and the coarse cauliflower.
  14. Add a pinch of sea salt flakes and sauté for 4 minutes, until softened.
  15. Add microplaned ginger, sesame seeds (optional), sesame oil, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper.

  16. Cook for 1 minute, stirring to infuse the ginger and distribute the sesame oil.

  17. Cook the Beef Mince:

  18. Heat a large pot over high heat.
  19. Add 1/2 tablespoon of peanut oil and 1 kg of beef mince.
  20. Spread the mince and season with sea salt flakes.
  21. Cook for 3 minutes to brown the mince.

  22. Continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, until fully browned.

  23. Combine the Beef, Broccoli, and Garlic:

  24. Add the minced garlic, broccoli florets and stems, chili flakes (optional), sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to the pot.
  25. Mix well to coat the broccoli and beef.

  26. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the broccoli starts to soften.

  27. Add the Firecracker Sauce and Chicken Stock:

  28. Pour the firecracker sauce into the pot.
  29. Bring the mixture to a boil and stir continuously for 2-3 minutes to reduce the sauce.
  30. Cover the pot with a lid (optional) and reduce heat to medium to prevent boiling over.
  31. Add 125 ml of chicken stock and mix well.

  32. Cover the pot again and cook for 2 minutes to reduce the sauce slightly.

  33. Assemble and Store the Meal Prep Bowls:

  34. Remove the lid and take the pot off the heat.
  35. Divide the cauliflower rice, firecracker beef and broccoli, and any extra sauce evenly into 5 x 750 ml containers.
  36. Garnish with spring onion or scallion and a lime wedge (optional).
  37. Allow the bowls to cool slightly before covering with lids.

  38. Store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or freeze for up to 4 months (using a vacuum seal pump for longer freezer storage).

  39. Enjoy!

  40. Dig in and enjoy your delicious and nutritious firecracker beef and broccoli meal prep bowls.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Thh3MeVL884

french_onion_chicken.txt - French Onion Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious French onion chicken dish.
  • Master the art of caramelizing onions.
  • Discover how to create a flavorful sauce.

Ingredients

  • 1 onion
  • 1 chicken breast
  • 2 cloves of garlic
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • 1 tablespoon oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 tablespoon butter
  • 1/2 cup wine or stock
  • 1 cup beef stock
  • 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon thyme
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Parmesan cheese
  • Gruyere cheese

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion across the grain into long strips.
  2. Butterfly the chicken, slicing it into two even fillets.
  3. Grate the garlic.
  4. Combine the chicken, onion, garlic, garlic powder, smoked paprika, oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl and mix well.
  5. Set the chicken mixture aside.
  6. Melt the butter in a pan over medium heat.
  7. Add the onions and salt, then cook for 20 minutes, stirring regularly.
  8. Deglaze the pan with wine or stock (if consuming alcohol), and cook for 2 minutes.
  9. Add the beef stock, Worcestershire sauce, balsamic vinegar, garlic, thyme, and bay leaves to the pan.
  10. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes.
  11. Heat oil in a separate pan over medium-high heat.
  12. Cook the chicken in batches for 3 minutes per side, then remove and place on a tray.
  13. After 45 minutes, add the caramelized onions to the chicken.
  14. Grate parmesan and gruyere cheese over the chicken and onions.
  15. Grill or broil for 5 minutes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EVubJtyicOU

fried_chicken_brine_test.txt - Fried Chicken Brine Test

Objectives

  • Determine if brining chicken before frying enhances flavor and texture.
  • Learn how to make a simple pickle juice brine.
  • Prepare a flavorful coleslaw to accompany the fried chicken.

Ingredients

For the Brine: - 3 pieces of bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs - Pickle juice (enough to fully submerge the chicken)

For the Flour Mix: - 2.5 cups all-purpose flour - 2 tablespoons onion powder - 2 tablespoons garlic powder - 1 tablespoon sweet paprika - 1 teaspoon chili powder (optional) - 1/3 cup salt - 1/3 cup ground black pepper - 1/2 teaspoon dried ground sage

For the Coleslaw: - 100g white cabbage, thinly sliced - 100g red cabbage, thinly sliced - 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced - 2 spring onions, thinly sliced - 5g flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped (optional)

For the Coleslaw Dressing: - 100g plain Greek yogurt - 2.5 tablespoons macadamia oil (or extra virgin olive oil) - 1.5 tablespoons honey - Juice of 1/2 lemon - Salt and cracked black pepper to taste

For Frying: - Vegetable oil (enough to submerge the chicken)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the Brine: Place 3 pieces of chicken thighs in a bowl and pour enough pickle juice over them to fully submerge. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, up to 24 hours.
  2. Prepare the Flour Mix: Combine all flour mix ingredients in a large bowl and whisk until well combined. Set aside.
  3. Prepare the Coleslaw: Thinly slice the white and red cabbage, red onion, and spring onions. Roughly chop the parsley (optional). Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
  4. Prepare the Coleslaw Dressing: Combine all dressing ingredients in a small bowl and whisk until smooth. Pour dressing over the coleslaw and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  5. Fry the Unbrined Chicken: Heat vegetable oil in a pot over high heat to 170°C. Coat the unbrined chicken thighs in the flour mix, shaking off any excess. Carefully add the chicken to the hot oil, frying for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip the chicken a few times for even browning. Remove the chicken and place on a wire rack or paper towels to drain.
  6. Fry the Brined Chicken: Pat the brined chicken thighs dry with paper towels. Coat the chicken in the flour mix, shaking off any excess. When the oil returns to 170°C, carefully add the chicken to the hot oil, frying for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip the chicken a few times for even browning. Remove the chicken and place on a wire rack or paper towels to drain.
  7. Serve: Arrange the fried chicken, coleslaw, and pickles on a platter. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iy8RqBK9vEY

fried_prawns.txt - Fried Prawns

Objectives

  • Learn how to fry prawns to achieve a golden, crispy exterior.
  • Understand the importance of using high heat and proper oil temperature.
  • Discover a simple method for removing the prawn vein.

Ingredients

  • 1 kg large prawns
  • Canola oil (enough to fill a pan halfway)
  • 200 g plain flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • Sea salt or fennel salt (optional)
  • Lemon aioli (optional)
  • Lemon wedge (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a large, high-rimmed pan or pot over high heat.
  2. Pour in enough canola oil to fill the pan just under halfway.
  3. Heat the oil to 180 degrees Celsius.
  4. Remove the heads from the prawns and set them aside for making a bisque.
  5. Peel the prawns upwards from the belly to remove the shell in one piece.
  6. Optionally remove the tail or leave it on as a handle.
  7. Insert a skewer 1-2 millimeters into the top of the prawn, going underneath the vein.
  8. Gently pull the skewer up to remove the vein in one piece.
  9. Combine 200 grams of plain flour and 1 teaspoon of baking powder in a bowl.
  10. Add the prawns to the flour mixture in batches, mixing to coat them well.
  11. Shake off any excess flour.
  12. Gently place the prawns away from you into the hot oil.
  13. Fry for 1.5-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
  14. Remove the prawns and drain them on a wire rack.
  15. Season with sea salt or fennel salt (optional).
  16. Serve the prawns with lemon aioli (optional) and a wedge of lemon (optional).
  17. Squeeze lemon juice over the prawns for a fresh kick.
  18. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cx4eqB7Tp9U

fried_rice.txt - Fried Rice

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and flavorful fried rice.
  • Understand the importance of using cold rice for optimal texture.
  • Master the art of stir-frying ingredients for a perfect balance of flavors.

Ingredients

  • 1 cup white long grain rice
  • 1 3/4 cups (475 ml) cold water
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 small brown onion
  • 3 carrots
  • 3 spring onions (scallions)
  • 3 rashers streaky bacon (100g)
  • 1/2 cup frozen corn
  • 1/2 cup frozen peas
  • 3 free-range eggs
  • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
  • 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons dark or light soy sauce (gluten-free if needed)
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons sake (Japanese rice wine)
  • 1 teaspoon sesame oil
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper

  • Sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Rinse 1 cup of white long grain rice under cold water for 1 minute.
  2. Drain the rice for 5 minutes.
  3. Place a small saucepan on the stovetop over high heat.
  4. Add the washed rice and stir to lightly toast for 1 minute, until slightly transparent.
  5. Pour in 1 3/4 cups (475 ml) of cold water and bring to a boil.
  6. Reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan (or use aluminum foil), and cook for 18 minutes without disturbing.
  7. Turn off the heat and leave the lid on for 5 minutes to steam.
  8. Remove the lid and fluff the rice with a fork.
  9. Spread the rice on a plate or in a bowl and allow to cool completely for 20 minutes.
  10. Refrigerate the rice uncovered for 3-4 hours to dry out completely.
  11. Thinly slice 3 cloves of garlic, then roughly chop into a small dice.
  12. Sprinkle garlic with a pinch of sea salt flakes and use a knife to create a smooth paste.
  13. Slice a small brown onion in half through the root and remove the skin (save the skins for stock).
  14. Slice the onion thinly, then dice.
  15. Peel 2-3 medium-sized carrots and save the scraps for stock.
  16. Slice the carrots in half and remove a thin strip from the side to stabilize them.
  17. Slice the carrots into four even strips, then rotate and dice.
  18. Trim the root of 3 spring onions (scallions) and save for stock.
  19. Finely slice the spring onions and set aside.
  20. Stack 3 rashers of streaky bacon (100g) and slice into even strips.
  21. Rotate the bacon and dice into medium-sized pieces.
  22. In a bowl, combine 1/2 cup frozen corn and 1/2 cup frozen peas.
  23. Crack 3 free-range eggs into a bowl and whisk until smooth.
  24. Place a skillet or wok on the stovetop over high heat (a skillet is recommended for better heat distribution).
  25. Add 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil to the hot pan and swirl to coat.
  26. Add the diced carrots and fry for 20 seconds.
  27. Add the onion, garlic, and bacon and cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the bacon is lightly golden and the onions are translucent.
  28. Add the peas and corn and cook for 20 seconds.
  29. Add the cooked rice and break it up to ensure there are no chunks.
  30. Add 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce, 1 1/2 tablespoons of dark or light soy sauce (gluten-free if needed), and 1 1/2 tablespoons of sake (Japanese rice wine).
  31. Mix the rice thoroughly to incorporate the sauces and cook for 1 minute.
  32. Move the fried rice to one side of the pan.
  33. Add 1 teaspoon of sesame oil to the empty space and pour in the beaten eggs.
  34. Scramble the eggs for 1 minute, ensuring they are fully cooked and not runny.
  35. Mix the scrambled eggs into the fried rice.
  36. Add 1/4 teaspoon of ground white pepper and 2/3 of the thinly sliced spring onions.
  37. Mix everything together.
  38. Spoon the fried rice into a serving bowl and top with the remaining 1/3 of the spring onions.
  39. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CEMdcIEDfJo

frittata_recipe.txt - Frittata Recipe

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and simple breakfast frittata
  • Utilize leftover vegetables and meats
  • Learn how to prepare and cook a frittata

Ingredients

  • 1 small red bell pepper
  • 1 large brown or yellow onion
  • 2 chorizo sausages (200 grams or 7 ounces)
  • 3 large garlic cloves
  • 5 grams or 0.2 ounces of flat leaf parsley
  • 5 large free range eggs
  • 2 tablespoons or 40 milliliters of thickened cream (optional)
  • 1 tablespoon or 20 milliliters of olive oil
  • 1 and a half teaspoons or 2.5 grams of smoked paprika
  • 1 teaspoon or 5 grams of sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon or 10 cracks of black pepper
  • 220 grams or 7.7 ounces (1 can) of cooked chickpeas
  • 1/2 teaspoon or 1 gram of ground cumin
  • 120 grams or 4.2 ounces of baby spinach
  • Snow pea sprouts (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the red bell pepper in half, remove the core and seeds, and dice into small pieces.
  2. Slice the onion in half, peel, and dice into small pieces.
  3. Slice the chorizo sausages in half, then into quarters, and dice into small pieces.
  4. Slice the garlic cloves in half, rotate 90 degrees, and slice thinly into half moon shapes.
  5. Roughly chop the parsley.
  6. Crack the eggs into a bowl, add cream (optional), and beat until smooth.
  7. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  8. Add the diced onions and garlic and saute for 3-4 minutes until soft and golden.
  9. Add the diced chorizo, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
  10. Continue sauteing for 3 minutes to release oils and enhance flavor.
  11. Add the diced bell pepper, chickpeas, and cumin.
  12. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
  13. Add the baby spinach and let it soften for 45 seconds.
  14. Twist the spinach into the other ingredients.
  15. Continue cooking for 1 minute until spinach is soft.
  16. Pour in the beaten eggs and spread evenly around the pan.
  17. Cook for 1.5 minutes to create a seal around the edges.
  18. Transfer the pan to a preheated oven (grill or broil) at 190 degrees Celsius or 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
  19. Cook for 5 minutes or until puffy, golden, and fluffy.
  20. Place the frittata on a heat-resistant surface for 10 minutes to set.
  21. Gently loosen the frittata from the pan using a spatula.
  22. Remove the frittata from the pan and garnish with parsley, black pepper, sea salt flakes, extra virgin olive oil, and snow pea sprouts (optional).
  23. Serve immediately or allow to firm up in the fridge overnight.
  24. Slice the frittata into 4 large, 6 medium, or 12 small pieces.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Df-O2ZhtSL8

garlic_butter_pasta.txt - Garlic Butter Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful pasta dish with garlic butter sauce.
  • Prepare a crunchy topping with bacon and panko breadcrumbs.
  • Enhance the dish with fresh parsley and lemon juice.

Ingredients

  • 4 rashers streaky bacon (or back bacon)
  • 5 large garlic cloves, peeled
  • 5 grams flat leaf parsley (optional)
  • 1 large lemon
  • 500 grams pasta of choice (linguine used in video)
  • 120 grams unsalted butter
  • 1 tablespoon (14 grams) unsalted butter
  • 25 grams panko breadcrumbs
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1 gram) chili flakes (optional)
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions

  1. Slice bacon in half, then into even sized strips. Dice into small pieces.
  2. Grate garlic using a microplane or box grater.
  3. Roughly chop parsley, removing any large leaves or stems.
  4. Slice lemon in half, saving half for another use. Juice the other half.
  5. Place a saucepan of salted water over high heat and bring to a boil.
  6. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add bacon and fry for 2.5-3 minutes, or until fat starts to render and bacon is golden brown.
  7. Add 1 tablespoon butter to the skillet, mix, and let melt.
  8. Add panko breadcrumbs and fry for 1-1.5 minutes, stirring constantly, until golden and crispy.
  9. Remove bacon and breadcrumbs from skillet and set aside.
  10. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan over medium-high heat.
  11. Add pasta to boiling water and cook according to package instructions, stirring occasionally.
  12. Add 120 grams butter to the heated pan, melt, and bring to a bubble.
  13. Add minced garlic and reduce heat to low. Fry for 1 minute, stirring occasionally, until butter starts to brown.
  14. Remove pan from heat and add chopped parsley, chili flakes (optional), lemon juice to taste, and seasoning. Mix well.
  15. Add cooked pasta directly from the water to the garlic butter mixture, adding a few splashes of pasta water if needed.
  16. Mix thoroughly to coat pasta and adjust seasoning.
  17. Serve in bowls or plates.
  18. Sprinkle with bacon and panko crumb mixture.
  19. Garnish with parsley (optional) and black pepper.
  20. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cvUy6s2MVK4

garlic_butter_steak_bites.txt - Garlic Butter Steak Bites

Objectives

  • Prepare a simple and delicious meal prep dish.
  • Learn to cook steak bites to your desired doneness.
  • Create a flavorful garlic butter sauce to enhance the steak.

Ingredients

Steak - 1.25 kg (2.7 lb) rump steak or any lean steak - 1 tbsp (20 ml) grape seed oil - Salt and pepper to taste

Potatoes - 1.5 kg (3.3 lb) baby potatoes, washed - 2 tbsp (28 g) unsalted butter - 2 g dill, roughly chopped - 2 g thyme, roughly chopped - 2 g flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped - 1 tsp (1.5 g) chili flakes (optional) - 1/2 roasted garlic (optional) - Salt and pepper to taste

Garlic Butter Sauce - 2 tbsp (28 g) unsalted butter - 1 tbsp (15 ml) grated garlic - Optional: sriracha mayo or hot sauce

Instructions

  1. Trim any excess fat from the steak and dice into large pieces.
  2. Slice the steak with the grain, then rotate and slice across the grain to tenderize.
  3. Place a large pot of cold water on the stovetop and add the potatoes.
  4. Ensure the potatoes are covered by about an inch of water and season lightly with salt.
  5. Bring the water to a boil over high heat and cook for 15 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork tender.
  6. While the potatoes are cooking, heat a large steak pan over medium-high heat.
  7. Add 1 tablespoon of grape seed oil to the pan and heat until shimmering.
  8. Add the diced steak in batches, ensuring not to overcrowd the pan.
  9. Spread the steak pieces out evenly so they are not touching.
  10. Season the steak with salt and pepper.
  11. Let the steak cook for 30 seconds to form a crust on all sides.
  12. Mix the steak around and cook for another 2.5 minutes, or until the steak reaches your desired doneness.
  13. Remove the steak from the pan and set aside to rest.
  14. Repeat steps 8-12 for any remaining batches of steak.
  15. Once all the steak is cooked, return the pan to medium-high heat.
  16. Add 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter to the pan and stir to melt.
  17. Add the grated garlic to the pan and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
  18. Add the cooked steak and any resting juices to the pan and mix well.
  19. Cook for 1 minute, allowing the sauce to coat the steak evenly.
  20. Remove the steak from the pan and set aside.
  21. Once the potatoes are fork tender, drain them in a colander.
  22. Transfer the potatoes to a large mixing bowl and add 2 tablespoons of melted unsalted butter.
  23. Add the chopped parsley, thyme, dill, and chili flakes (optional) to the potatoes.
  24. Squeeze in half of the roasted garlic (optional) and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  25. Gently mix the potatoes with a spatula, ensuring they stay whole.
  26. Portion the steak and potatoes into 5-750 ml meal prep containers.
  27. Pour any remaining steak juices over the meal prep containers.
  28. Serve with a dollop of sriracha mayo or hot sauce (optional).
  29. Store the meal prep containers in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 4 months.

Notes

  • The cooking time for the potatoes may vary depending on their size.
  • The steak can be cooked to your desired doneness.
  • The garlic butter sauce can be adjusted to taste.
  • The meal prep containers can be reheated in the microwave or a pan.
  • The potatoes are best served warm, but can be enjoyed cold.
  • The steak should be reheated before serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M7UrGCYU9BM

garlic_chili_oil_noodles.txt - Garlic Chili Oil Noodles

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and easy garlic chili oil noodle dish.
  • Combine ingredients for a rich and spicy sauce.
  • Cook pasta or noodles of choice and toss with the sauce.

Ingredients

  • 4 cloves minced garlic
  • 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
  • 2 teaspoons sesame seeds
  • 1 bunch chopped coriander stems
  • 2.5 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1.5 tablespoons black vinegar
  • 2.5 tablespoons dark soy sauce
  • 375 grams pasta or noodles of choice
  • 2.5 tablespoons peanut oil
  • 2 tablespoons chili oil
  • Spring onion stems (optional)
  • Sesame seeds (optional)

Instructions

  1. Combine minced garlic, chili powder, sesame seeds, chopped coriander stems, soy sauce, black vinegar, and dark soy sauce in a bowl. Whisk to combine.
  2. Bring a pot of water to a boil and cook 375 grams of pasta or noodles of your choice.
  3. Carefully drain the cooked pasta or noodles.
  4. Heat a small saucepan over high heat.
  5. Add 2.5 tablespoons of peanut oil to the saucepan and heat until shimmering.
  6. Pour the heated peanut oil into the sauce mixture.
  7. Add 2 tablespoons of chili oil to the sauce mixture.
  8. Add the cooked pasta or noodles to the sauce and fold everything together until well coated.
  9. Twist the noodles into bowls and garnish with spring onion stems and sesame seeds (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SWf6HimvtvY

garlic_chili_oil_pasta.txt - Garlic Chili Oil Pasta

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a flavorful garlic chili oil from scratch.
  • Master the art of creating a balanced sauce with sweet, spicy, salty, acidic, and nutty flavors.
  • Discover a simple yet delicious pasta dish with a unique flavor profile.

Ingredients

  • 40 grams (1/4 cup) unsalted peanuts, roughly chopped
  • 3 spring onions (scallions), separated into white root ends and green stems
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 8 cloves garlic, thinly sliced
  • 1 bunch coriander (cilantro) stems (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons (10 grams) mild or hot chili flakes
  • 2/3 cup (150 milliliters) peanut oil
  • 2/3 cup (150 milliliters) sesame oil
  • 2 tablespoons (40 grams) brown sugar
  • 1/2 teaspoon (0.5 grams) red chili powder
  • 2 teaspoons (9 grams) sesame seeds
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 milliliters) light soy sauce
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) black vinegar
  • 2.5 teaspoons dark soy sauce
  • 375 grams (13.2 ounces) pasta or noodles of your choice (linguine used in the video)
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 milliliters) peanut oil for cooking pasta

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Spread chopped peanuts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and toast for 3-4 minutes, or until lightly golden. Let cool.
  2. Slice white root ends of spring onions on a straight angle. Slice green stems on a slight angle to create diamond shapes.
  3. Thinly slice 8 cloves of garlic. Mince 4 cloves of garlic using a microplane.
  4. Roughly chop coriander stems (optional).
  5. In a large pan, combine sliced garlic, sliced spring onion root ends, chili flakes, and 2/3 cup peanut oil. Cook over medium-low heat for 13 minutes, stirring occasionally, until garlic is golden and crispy and oil is golden.
  6. Add sesame oil, brown sugar, and roasted peanuts to the pan. Stir and cook for 2 minutes, until sugar melts. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
  7. Carefully pour the chili oil into a glass container, leaving the solids behind. Add the solids to the container after pouring the oil.
  8. In a mixing bowl, whisk together minced garlic, red chili powder, sesame seeds, chopped coriander, light soy sauce, black vinegar, and dark soy sauce.
  9. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta and cook according to package instructions.
  10. While pasta cooks, heat 2.5 tablespoons peanut oil in a small saucepan over medium heat until shimmering (about 3 minutes).
  11. Drain cooked pasta and let rest for a couple of minutes.
  12. Remove heated oil from the stove and immediately pour into the sauce mixture.
  13. Add 2-3 tablespoons of chili oil to the sauce. Whisk to combine.
  14. Gently add drained pasta to the sauce and toss to coat.
  15. Serve pasta immediately, garnished with green spring onion stems and sesame seeds. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JoEi7R08kWU

garlic_chili_oil.txt - Crispy Garlic Chili Oil

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful and aromatic chili oil.
  • Infuse oil with garlic, chili flakes, and other ingredients for a rich flavor.
  • Create a crispy texture with the garlic.

Ingredients

  • 8 cloves of garlic, peeled and thinly sliced
  • 3 spring onions (white part only), thinly sliced
  • 1/4 cup (40 grams) roasted peanuts, roughly chopped
  • 2/3 cup (150 ml) neutral flavored oil (sunflower, canola, safflower, or light peanut oil)
  • 2 tablespoons (20 grams) dried chili flakes
  • 1 long red chili (optional), dried
  • 2/3 cup (150 ml) toasted sesame oil
  • 2 tablespoons (8 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 2 tablespoons brown sugar (optional)

Instructions

  1. Peel and thinly slice 8 cloves of garlic.
  2. Thinly slice the white part of 3 spring onions.
  3. Roughly chop 1/4 cup (40 grams) of roasted peanuts.
  4. Heat a large heavy-based skillet over medium heat.
  5. Pour 2/3 cup (150 ml) of neutral flavored oil into the skillet.
  6. Add 2 tablespoons (20 grams) of dried chili flakes and stir.
  7. Add the sliced garlic and spring onions to the skillet.
  8. Add 1 long dried red chili (optional) for extra heat.
  9. Stir the mixture to ensure all flavors are infused into the oil.
  10. Increase heat until the oil starts to bubble.
  11. Reduce heat to medium-low and fry for 12-15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
  12. Monitor the garlic, removing it from the oil if it starts to darken too quickly.
  13. After 15 minutes, turn off the heat and remove the skillet from the stove.
  14. Pour 2/3 cup (150 ml) of toasted sesame oil into the skillet.
  15. Add the chopped roasted peanuts, 2 tablespoons (8 grams) of sea salt flakes, and 2 tablespoons of brown sugar (optional).
  16. Stir the mixture until the salt and sugar dissolve into the hot oil.
  17. Carefully transfer the crispy garlic and chili mixture into a glass jar or airtight container.
  18. Pour the infused oil over the mixture.
  19. Store in a clean and dry airtight container or jar in the refrigerator or a cool, dark space for up to 6 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E6KJ6LZv6u8

garlic_chili_oil_udon_noodles.txt - Garlic Chili Oil Udon Noodles

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and trendy garlic chili oil udon noodles dish.
  • Utilize pantry staples and easily accessible ingredients.
  • Prepare a quick and satisfying meal.

Ingredients

  • 440 grams (1 pound) udon noodles
  • 7 grams (0.25 ounces) coriander or cilantro
  • 1 spring onion or scallion
  • 2 large garlic cloves
  • 1 tablespoon (5 grams) ground szechuan peppercorns (or red chili powder)
  • 1 teaspoon (4 grams) chicken stock powder
  • 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) light soy sauce
  • 60 milliliters (1/4 cup) peanut oil
  • Black or white sesame seeds (optional)

Instructions

  1. Fill a saucepan with water and bring to a boil over high heat.
  2. Add udon noodles to the boiling water and stir to prevent sticking.
  3. Cook noodles according to package instructions (usually 2.5 minutes).
  4. Drain noodles in a sieve and set aside.
  5. Roughly chop coriander or cilantro.
  6. Slice the root end of the spring onion or scallion thinly.
  7. Slice the green stems of the spring onion or scallion thinly on a slight angle.
  8. Grate garlic cloves on a microplane to create a paste.
  9. In a bowl, combine minced garlic, spring onion root, szechuan peppercorns, chicken stock powder, rice wine vinegar, and light soy sauce.
  10. Heat peanut oil in a small saucepan over high heat until shimmering (or reach 180°C/350°F).
  11. Carefully pour hot oil into the flavor mix, creating a sizzling sound.
  12. Stir the flavor mix well to combine.
  13. Add drained udon noodles to the flavor mix.
  14. Add chopped coriander or cilantro, sliced spring onion stems, and sesame seeds (optional).
  15. Mix well to ensure noodles are coated in garlic chili oil.
  16. Serve in bowls or plates.
  17. Garnish with fresh coriander or cilantro, sliced spring onion stems, and sesame seeds.
  18. Enjoy with chopsticks or a fork.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lr6oPUf2CYA

garlic_honey_salmon_meal_prep.txt - Garlic Honey Salmon Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and healthy salmon meal.
  • Learn a quick and easy method for cooking salmon.
  • Combine broccoli and salmon for a balanced meal.

Ingredients

  • 1.25 kilos fresh salmon
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • Salt to taste
  • 2 heads of broccoli
  • 2 lemons
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 1 tablespoon peanut oil
  • 2 tablespoons butter
  • 2 tablespoons chicken stock
  • 1.5 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 5 tablespoons honey
  • Rice (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Slice 1.25 kilos of fresh salmon into five even-sized fillets.
  2. Place the salmon fillets in a bowl.
  3. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of smoked paprika, and salt to taste.
  4. Mix the salmon with the seasoning until well combined.
  5. Remove the florets from two heads of broccoli.
  6. Trim the stems of the broccoli, removing any woody parts.
  7. Slice the broccoli florets into strips.
  8. Juice one lemon using a citrus juicer.
  9. Grate six cloves of garlic using a microplane or fine grater.
  10. Heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in a pan over high heat.
  11. Add the broccoli to the pan and season with salt.
  12. Stir-fry the broccoli for 4-5 minutes.
  13. Remove the broccoli from the heat.
  14. In a separate pan, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat.
  15. Add the grated garlic and sauté for 45 seconds.
  16. Add 2 tablespoons of chicken stock, 1.5 tablespoons of soy sauce, and the lemon juice to taste.
  17. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 1 minute.
  18. Add 5 tablespoons of honey and cook for another minute.
  19. Add the salmon fillets to the pan, skin side down.
  20. Simmer the salmon for 4 minutes.
  21. Flip the salmon and cook for 2 minutes on the other side.
  22. Cook each side of the salmon for 1 minute.
  23. Remove the salmon from the heat.
  24. Serve the broccoli and salmon together with rice.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pB8vlfQa6Xw

garlic_mushroom_pasta.txt - Garlic Mushroom Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a simple and flavorful garlic mushroom pasta without cream.
  • Learn how to properly sauté mushrooms for a nutty flavor.
  • Master the technique of reducing sauce with white wine and stock.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion, sliced
  • 300g (10.5oz) mushrooms of your choice (e.g., Portobello, button, cremini, chanterelle), sliced
  • 6 cloves garlic, crushed and roughly chopped
  • 5g (0.2oz) flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped
  • Long ribbon pasta (e.g., pappardelle, fettuccine, linguine)
  • 1 tbsp (14g) unsalted butter
  • 1 tbsp (20ml) olive oil
  • Dijon mustard (optional)
  • 3/4 cup (180ml) white wine, chicken stock, or vegetable stock
  • Salt and pepper
  • Water for cooking pasta
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Peino Romano cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a pot of water on the stovetop, generously season with salt, and bring to a boil.
  2. In a separate pan over medium-high heat, add 1 tbsp (14g) unsalted butter and 1 tbsp (20ml) olive oil.
  3. Add the sliced onion and a pinch of salt, sauté for 3-4 minutes until translucent and slightly colored.
  4. Add the sliced mushrooms and another pinch of salt, mix well, and cook for 10 minutes over medium-high heat, scraping the bottom of the pan to prevent sticking.
  5. While the mushrooms cook, add pasta to the boiling water and cook for 1 minute less than the package instructions.
  6. After 10 minutes, the mushrooms should have released their moisture. Add 1 tbsp (14g) unsalted butter and a few cracks of black pepper to the pan, mix well, and cook for 1 minute.
  7. Add the chopped garlic, 1 tsp (10g) Dijon mustard (optional), and mix well. Continue cooking for 1 minute until fragrant.
  8. Add 3/4 cup (180ml) white wine, chicken stock, or vegetable stock, and reduce by 2/3, about 2 minutes. If the sauce reduces completely, add a little more stock.
  9. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it, reserving some of the pasta water.
  10. Add the cooked pasta, reserved pasta water, and 2/3 of the chopped parsley to the mushroom sauce. Mix well to combine all the flavors.
  11. Taste and adjust seasoning.
  12. Serve in bowls or plates, topping with remaining mushrooms and garnishing with remaining parsley, grated Parmesan or Peino Romano cheese, and cracked black pepper.
  13. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ATA3b7hBv0Q

garlic_mushrooms.txt - Garlic Mushrooms

Objectives

  • Learn to make delicious, flavorful garlic mushrooms.
  • Understand the importance of proper ingredients and cooking techniques.
  • Enjoy a simple yet satisfying side dish or appetizer.

Ingredients

  • 500 grams (17.6 ounces) Swiss brown or cremini mushrooms
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 fresh lemon
  • 5 sprigs fresh thyme
  • 100 grams melted unsalted butter
  • 25 milliliters olive oil
  • 1.5 teaspoons sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • Wedge of fresh lemon (optional)
  • Fresh sprigs of thyme (optional)

Instructions

  1. Wipe mushrooms with a dry cloth to remove dirt.
  2. Grate garlic cloves into a fine paste using a microplane.
  3. Zest half a lemon using a microplane or grater.
  4. Chop thyme sprigs into small pieces.
  5. Combine mushrooms, garlic paste, lemon zest, thyme, melted butter, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl.
  6. Mix well to coat mushrooms in the ingredients.
  7. Transfer mushrooms to a medium to large baking dish or oven tray.
  8. Spread mushrooms out evenly so they are not on top of each other.
  9. Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
  10. Bake mushrooms for 15 minutes.
  11. After 15 minutes, carefully remove mushrooms from the oven and toss them to ensure even cooking.
  12. Return mushrooms to the oven and bake for another 5-6 minutes until cooked through and golden brown.
  13. Remove mushrooms from the oven and squeeze a wedge of fresh lemon over them (optional).
  14. Add slices of lemon for presentation (optional).
  15. Sprinkle with fresh thyme sprigs (optional).
  16. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=crFYV_yI7Bg

garlic_prep.txt - Garlic Prep

Objectives

  • Learn to peel, chop, slice, and dice garlic
  • Understand the different methods for preparing garlic
  • Discover how different methods affect garlic flavor

Instructions

  1. Break the head of garlic into individual cloves by placing it on its side and pushing down firmly with the palm of your hand.
  2. Peel the garlic cloves by gently removing the husk from the tip towards the root.
  3. Option: Slice off the woody tip of the clove and place the side of your knife on the clove with the blade facing down and away from you. Press down with the palm of your hand to crush the clove, then wiggle the tip to remove the husk.
  4. Coarsely Diced:
  5. Make thin slices across the clove, stopping just before the opposite side.
  6. Slice through the center of the clove, stopping just before the opposite side.
  7. Use a rocking motion to dice the clove from the tip to the heel.
  8. Finely Diced:
  9. Make even thinner slices across the clove than for coarsely diced.
  10. Make three or four slices through the center of the clove.
  11. Use a rocking motion to finely dice the clove.
  12. Sliced:
  13. Make thin slices across the garlic using a rocking motion.
  14. Minced:
  15. Run a garlic clove across a fine microplane to create a paste.
  16. Option: Use a grater, garlic press, or a small amount of coarse sea salt to mince the garlic.
    • Sprinkle salt on diced garlic.
    • Use the side and tip of a knife to scrape the salt into the garlic, creating a paste.
  17. Continue scraping until the garlic is a smooth paste.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lBGt4IwtLsg

ginger_sesame_salad_dressing.txt - Ginger and Sesame Salad Dressing

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a delicious ginger and sesame salad dressing.
  • Understand how to create an emulsion for a flavorful and balanced dressing.

Ingredients

  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons (25 grams) ginger, minced
  • 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) soy sauce
  • 1/3 cup (80 milliliters) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon (30 grams) honey
  • 2 1/2 tablespoons (50 milliliters) sesame oil
  • 1/2 cup (125 milliliters) extra virgin olive oil

Instructions

  1. Add minced garlic, ginger, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, and honey to a mixing bowl.
  2. Whisk the ingredients together to break up the garlic and ginger and allow the flavors to blend.
  3. While continuously whisking, slowly pour in the sesame oil to create an emulsion and enhance the flavor.
  4. Continue whisking and slowly pour in the extra virgin olive oil to build up the dressing and balance the flavors.
  5. Transfer the dressing to an airtight container or serving vessel.
  6. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fVuSkg-TbNA

goen_chicken_curry.txt - Goen Chicken Curry

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious Goen chicken curry with a balanced flavor profile.
  • Prepare a flavorful spice mix from scratch.
  • Create a curry paste with fresh ginger, garlic, and spices.
  • Cook chicken in a flavorful sauce and serve with basmati rice.

Ingredients

  • 9 G Whole Coriander Seeds
  • 4 G Whole Cumin Seeds
  • 4 G Yellow Mustard Seeds
  • 4 Green Cardamom Pods
  • 4 Whole Cloves
  • 2 G Whole Black Peppercorns
  • 1 Cinnamon Stick
  • 2 Brown or Yellow Onions
  • 8 Whole Cloves of Garlic
  • 25 G Ginger
  • 1.2 Kilos Boneless and Skinless Chicken Thigh
  • 30 G Tamarind Paste
  • 10 G Smoked Paprika
  • 3 G Cayenne Pepper
  • 2 Tablespoons Neutral Flavored Oil (Vegetable Oil Recommended)
  • 500 G Pata (Tomato Puree or Tomato Sauce)
  • 125 Milliliters Chicken Stock or Water
  • 4 G Ground Turmeric
  • Pinch of Sugar
  • 300 G Basmati Rice
  • 600 mL Boiling Water
  • Sea Salt Flakes to Taste
  • Optional: Cinnamon Sticks, Cloves, Cardamom Pods, Bay Leaves (Amount to Taste)
  • Garnish: Coriander or Cilantro (Optional)

Instructions

  1. In a pan, add 9 G whole coriander seeds, 4 G whole cumin seeds, 4 G yellow mustard seeds, 4 green cardamom pods, 4 whole cloves, 2 G whole black peppercorns, and 1 cinnamon stick. This is your Masala mix.
  2. Heat the pan over medium heat and toast the spices for 2-2.5 minutes until golden brown and crackling.
  3. Remove the spices from the heat and let them cool down.
  4. While the spices are cooling, prepare the onions, garlic, and ginger.
    • Peel and slice two brown or yellow onions into thin strips.
    • Leave eight cloves of garlic whole.
    • Slice and break down 25 G of ginger.
  5. Trim and dice 1.2 kilos of boneless and skinless chicken thighs into even-sized pieces.
  6. Once the spices have cooled, grind them into a fine powder using a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
  7. Combine the garlic, ginger, ground spices, 30 G of tamarind paste, 10 G smoked paprika, 3 G cayenne pepper, and a pinch of salt in a food processor.
  8. Blend on high speed until the mixture is mostly broken down.
  9. Add 100 milliliters of water to the food processor to thin the paste slightly. You can also use chicken stock for extra flavor.
  10. Heat a large pan or pot over medium-high heat.
  11. Add 2 tablespoons of neutral flavored oil and sauté the onions for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they develop a slight caramel flavor and color.
  12. Add the diced chicken to the pan and cook for 5 minutes, stirring to ensure even cooking.
  13. Add the prepared curry paste to the pan and stir well to coat the chicken.
  14. Add 500 G of tomato puree or tomato sauce, a little bit of water, and salt to taste.
  15. Stir everything together until the curry paste is completely mixed into the chicken.
  16. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
  17. Add 125 milliliters of chicken stock or water, 4 G of ground turmeric, and a pinch of sugar to balance the acidity.
  18. Stir everything together and bring the mixture to a boil.
  19. Reduce heat to low, cover the pan, and cook for 45 minutes.
  20. About 25 minutes before the curry is ready, start cooking the rice.
    • Add 300 G of washed basmati rice to a baking dish.
    • Add 600 mL of boiling water, sea salt flakes to taste, and optional spices (cinnamon sticks, cloves, cardamom pods, and bay leaves).
    • Mix well to prevent clumps, cover tightly with foil, and bake in a preheated oven at 190°C (375°F) for 22 minutes.
  21. After 22 minutes, remove the rice from the oven and let it sit for 10 minutes before uncovering.
  22. After 45 minutes, carefully remove the lid from the curry, being cautious of escaping steam.
  23. Stir the curry well, check the seasoning, and adjust if necessary.
  24. Remove the curry from the stovetop.
  25. After 10 minutes, remove the foil from the rice and fluff it up with a fork.
  26. To serve, divide the curry and rice into five containers (7150 ml each).
  27. Garnish with coriander or cilantro, if desired.
  28. Let the curry cool for 15-20 minutes before placing on the lids and storing in the fridge for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 4 months.
  29. To reheat, warm the curry in a pan or microwave. If reheating from frozen, do not defrost overnight as it may overcook the chicken.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zek8hMhEsSY

granola_recipe.txt - High-Fiber, High-Protein Granola

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and healthy granola recipe.
  • Learn how to make granola with a crunchy texture.
  • Understand the importance of even cooking and proper cooling.

Ingredients

  • 4 cups (375 grams) rolled oats
  • 1 cup (135 grams) roughly chopped almonds
  • 1/2 cup (65 grams) pepitas (pumpkin seeds)
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons (3 grams) ground cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1/2 cup (115 grams) melted coconut oil
  • 1/3 cup (80 ml) maple syrup
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons (7 grams) pure vanilla extract
  • 1/2 cup (45 grams) shredded coconut
  • 1/2 cup (70 grams) dried cranberries

Instructions

  1. In a large mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, chopped almonds, pepitas, ground cinnamon, and sea salt flakes. Mix well to ensure even distribution.
  2. In a separate bowl, whisk together melted coconut oil, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
  3. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture, scraping the bowl to avoid any wastage. Mix thoroughly until all ingredients are well combined.
  4. Line a large baking dish with parchment paper.
  5. Pour the granola mixture into the prepared baking dish and spread it out evenly using a spatula or spoon.
  6. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  7. Bake the granola for 10 minutes on the middle shelf.
  8. Carefully remove the baking dish from the oven and place it on a stovetop or heat-resistant surface.
  9. Mix the granola thoroughly with a spoon, bringing up the granola from the bottom to ensure even cooking.
  10. Return the baking dish to the oven and bake for another 10 minutes.
  11. Remove the granola from the oven and place it on a heat-resistant surface.
  12. Add shredded coconut to the granola and mix well using a spoon.
  13. Return the granola to the oven and bake for 7 minutes, or until the top of the granola and coconut are lightly golden brown.
  14. Remove the granola from the oven and allow it to cool completely for 30 minutes.
  15. Once cooled, transfer the granola to a large mixing bowl or leave it in the baking dish.
  16. Add dried cranberries to the granola and mix well.
  17. Store the granola in a clean jar or airtight container in a cool, dark place.
  18. Serve with milk, yogurt, or fresh fruit. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eSpzxKvCeng

greek_beef_stew.txt - Greek Beef Stew

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a delicious Greek beef stew.
  • Prepare the ingredients for the stew.

Instructions

  1. Gather all necessary ingredients.
  2. Begin cooking the beef stew.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NVFKOtDasWQ

habanero_hot_sauce.txt - Habanero Hot Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful habanero hot sauce.
  • Discover the importance of carefully cooking the chilies to extract their flavor.
  • Understand the role of vinegar and sugar in creating a balanced sauce.

Ingredients

  • 30 habanero peppers
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
  • 1/4 cup white vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon sugar
  • Salt to taste

Instructions

  1. Trim the stems off the habanero peppers. (Optional: remove seeds for less heat).
  2. Roughly chop the peppers.
  3. Heat a saucepan over medium heat.
  4. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pan.
  5. Add the chopped habaneros and cook for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, to soften.
  6. Add 2 cloves of roughly chopped garlic and cook for 1 minute.
  7. Add 1/4 cup of apple cider vinegar, 1/4 cup of white vinegar, and 1 tablespoon of sugar.
  8. Season with salt to taste and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  9. Transfer the mixture to a blender-safe container.
  10. Use an immersion blender to blend the mixture until smooth.
  11. Transfer the hot sauce to a sterilized bottle or jar.
  12. Seal the container with a lid.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lZ-Xykok-WQ

harissa_chicken.txt - Harissa Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a flavorful Harissa chicken dish.
  • Discover the origins of Harissa and its use in Moroccan cuisine.

Ingredients

  • Chicken
  • Harissa Paste

Instructions

  1. Marinate the chicken in Harissa paste.
  2. Cook the chicken.
  3. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F3OZ4FopvPw

hash_brown_bites.txt - Cheesy & Crispy Bacon Hash Brown Potato Bites

Objectives

  • Learn to make cheesy and crispy bacon hash brown potato bites.
  • Create a perfect breakfast side dish, snack, or party pleaser.
  • Master the technique for achieving crispy edges and a fluffy center.

Ingredients

  • 5 rashers streaky bacon
  • 1 tablespoon (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 kg (2.2 lbs) red rascal potatoes (or similar variety)
  • 1 cup (90 g) freshly grated mozzarella cheese
  • 2 tablespoons (28 g) melted unsalted clarified butter
  • 1.5 teaspoons sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon (14 g) melted unsalted clarified butter for greasing the muffin pan

Instructions

  1. Stack the bacon rashers and slice them into even-sized strips.
  2. Rotate the bacon strips and dice them into medium-sized pieces.
  3. Heat a large, heavy-based skillet over high heat.
  4. Add olive oil to the skillet and fry the diced bacon for 4-5 minutes, stirring frequently, until golden brown and slightly crisp.
  5. Remove the skillet from the heat and carefully tip the bacon and rendered fat onto kitchen towels to drain.
  6. Peel the potatoes.
  7. Grate the potatoes on the largest side of a grater, being careful not to grate your fingers.
  8. Place the grated potatoes in a sieve or colander over a bowl to catch the potato juices.
  9. Rinse the potatoes with cold water for 20 seconds to remove excess starch.
  10. Shake the colander and squeeze out as much excess water as possible.
  11. Transfer the potatoes to a large mixing bowl.
  12. Add the crispy bacon, grated mozzarella cheese, melted clarified butter, salt, and pepper to the bowl.
  13. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until well combined.
  14. Lightly brush each hole of a 12-hole muffin pan with melted clarified butter.
  15. Fill each mold with 1/3 cup of the potato mixture, pressing it down lightly but not packing it too tightly.
  16. Wipe any excess potato mixture from the outside of the muffin pan.
  17. Bake in a preheated oven at 190°C (375°F) for 30-35 minutes, rotating the tray halfway through.
  18. Allow the hash brown bites to cool slightly for 5-10 minutes on a wire rack or heat-resistant surface.
  19. To remove the hash browns, gently run a knife around the edge of each bite.
  20. Serve immediately, garnished with parsley if desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fO1yhefdHns

hash_browns.txt - McDonald's Style Hash Browns

Objectives

  • Learn to make crispy, golden hash browns similar to McDonald's.
  • Master the technique of removing excess moisture from potatoes.
  • Create a delicious herby mayo dipping sauce.

Ingredients

Potatoes: - 3 large white potatoes (or all-rounder potatoes) - Oil - Salt - Pepper

Hash Browns: - 2 large free-range eggs - 3/4 teaspoon (3.5 grams) baking powder - 1.5 teaspoons (7.5 grams) sea salt flakes - 20 cracks of black pepper (or small pinch ground white pepper)

Herby Mayo: - 1 large free-range egg - 1.5 teaspoons (12 grams) Dijon mustard - 10 grams (0.3 ounces) dill - 5 grams (0.2 ounces) flat-leaf parsley - 1.75 cups (430 milliliters) olive oil - 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes - 10 cracks of black pepper (or small pinch ground white pepper) - 1 large lemon

Other: - Canola or vegetable oil (enough to fill a pan halfway) - Parchment or baking paper - Tea towel - Kitchen spider or slotted spoon - Wire rack - Baking tray

Instructions

  1. Peel and remove imperfections from the potatoes.
  2. Drizzle potatoes with oil, salt, and pepper, then bake at 180°C/350°F for crispy skins.
  3. Grate potatoes into thin strips using a box grater (be careful!).
  4. Place grated potatoes in a large bowl and run under cold water to wash out excess starch.
  5. Massage the potatoes while rinsing, but avoid overfilling the bowl.
  6. Drain the potatoes in a sieve (a larger one is recommended) and let sit for 10 minutes.
  7. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over high heat.
  8. Add drained potatoes to boiling water, stir, and boil for 2.5 minutes.
  9. Carefully remove potatoes with a kitchen spider or slotted spoon and drain excess water.
  10. Place potatoes in a tea towel or kitchen cloth over a bowl and allow to cool for 30 minutes.
  11. Wrap the towel tightly around the potatoes and squeeze out as much moisture as possible.
  12. Transfer potatoes to a clean, dry bowl, shaking off any remaining bits from the towel.
  13. Add 2 large eggs, 3/4 teaspoon baking powder, 1.5 teaspoons salt, and 20 cracks of pepper to the potatoes.
  14. Mix everything well until combined and can hold its shape.
  15. Line a baking tray with parchment or baking paper.
  16. Measure out 3 tablespoons of potato mixture per hash brown (or make them any size you like).
  17. Mold the hash browns into your desired shape (e.g., smooth rectangles).
  18. Freeze the tray of hash browns for at least 30 minutes (or overnight) to firm up.
  19. Crack 1 egg into a small bowl and add 1.5 teaspoons Dijon mustard.
  20. Chop 10 grams dill and 5 grams parsley roughly.
  21. Add chopped herbs to the bowl with the egg and mustard.
  22. Wrap a damp tea towel around the bottom of the bowl to stabilize it.
  23. Whisk ingredients together until combined.
  24. Slowly pour in 1.75 cups olive oil while continuously whisking to create an emulsion.
  25. Season the herby mayo with 1 teaspoon salt and 10 cracks of pepper.
  26. Juice 1 lemon and add the juice to the herby mayo.
  27. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve (up to 1 week in an airtight container).
  28. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan over high heat.
  29. Pour in enough canola or vegetable oil to fill the pan just under halfway.
  30. Heat the oil to 190°C/375°F using a thermometer.
  31. Carefully place the firm hash browns in the hot oil in batches (depending on pan size).
  32. Fry for 4-5 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown and crispy.
  33. Remove hash browns and place on a wire rack over a baking tray to drain excess oil.
  34. Turn off the heat and let the oil cool completely. Strain and reuse the oil.
  35. Serve the hash browns with your choice of dipping sauce (herby mayo, ketchup, barbecue, etc.).

Storage: - Refrigerate raw hash browns for up to 3 days. - Freeze raw hash browns for up to 6 months. - Reheat frozen hash browns in hot oil for 1 minute (but they may become soggy).

Tips: - Use a larger sieve for draining the potatoes. - Squeeze out as much moisture from the potatoes as possible. - Don't fry the hash browns before freezing. - Use a thermometer to accurately control the oil temperature. - Allow the hash browns to drain after frying to maximize crispiness. - Enjoy the hash browns fresh for best results.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f309swxRZWY

healthier_brownies.txt - Healthier Brownies

Objectives

  • Prepare a healthier alternative to regular brownies.
  • Learn how to create a double boiler for melting chocolate.
  • Understand the benefits of using coconut oil, monk fruit sweetener, and almond flour.

Ingredients

  • 60 grams of coconut oil
  • 180 grams of dark chocolate chips
  • 3 whole eggs
  • 110 grams of monk fruit sweetener
  • 100 grams of almond flour
  • 40 grams of cacao powder
  • Pinch of sea salt
  • Optional: 100 grams of chocolate chips
  • Optional: Pinch of sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Gently melt the chocolate and coconut oil in a double boiler.
    • Place a small saucepan filled with water over high heat.
    • Bring the water to a light simmer and lower the heat to low.
    • Place a bowl over the saucepan, ensuring it doesn't touch the water.
    • Add the coconut oil and dark chocolate chips to the bowl and mix until melted and glossy.
  2. In a stand mixer, beat the eggs and monk fruit sweetener for 5 minutes until light and fluffy.
    • If you don't have a stand mixer, use a whisk and beat for a longer time.
  3. Add the almond flour, cacao powder, melted chocolate mixture, and sea salt to the egg mixture.
    • Scrape the bowl to ensure all ingredients are incorporated.
  4. Optionally, add 100 grams of chocolate chips to the mixture.
  5. Transfer the batter to a lined baking tray and spread evenly.
    • Optionally, add more chocolate chips and sea salt flakes to the top of the batter.
  6. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 16 minutes.
    • Insert a skewer to check for doneness, it should come out slightly wet.
  7. Let the brownies cool on a wire rack for 20-30 minutes before slicing.
  8. To portion, slice the brownies into thirds, then halves, then halves again, resulting in 12 pieces.
  9. Store the brownies in the fridge for up to one week or freeze for up to six months.
    • Wrap them in Ziploc bags or use another storage method of your choice.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d3X1DZ7Zyes

herbie_mayo.txt - Herbie Mayo

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful herbie mayo using an immersion blender.
  • Understand the importance of using fresh herbs for a vibrant color and taste.
  • Learn how to store herbie mayo for optimal freshness.

Ingredients

  • 1 large egg
  • 15 milliliters of white vinegar
  • 10 grams of Dijon mustard
  • 200 milliliters of oil (your choice)
  • 10 grams of flat leaf parsley
  • 15 grams of dill

Instructions

  1. Add one large egg, 15 milliliters of white vinegar, 10 grams of Dijon mustard, and 200 milliliters of oil to a tall container.
  2. Use an immersion blender to blend the ingredients until a thick emulsion forms.
  3. Roughly chop 10 grams of flat leaf parsley and 15 grams of dill.
  4. Add the chopped herbs to the mayo mixture.
  5. Use the immersion blender to blend the mixture until it turns a light green color.
  6. Transfer the herbie mayo to a clean jar or leave it in the original container.
  7. Place a lid on the jar and refrigerate for up to one week.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KVLjQbESPes

herby_mayonnaise.txt - Herby Mayonnaise

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious Herby Mayonnaise
  • Understand the importance of using an immersion blender to create a smooth emulsion
  • Discover how to store the mayonnaise for maximum freshness

Ingredients

  • 1 egg
  • 15 milliliters of white vinegar
  • 10 grams of Dijon mustard
  • 180 milliliters of neutral flavored oil
  • 15 grams of dill
  • 10 grams of flat leaf parsley
  • Ginger
  • Sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Add one egg to a tall jar.
  2. Add 15 milliliters of white vinegar, 10 grams of Dijon mustard, and 180 milliliters of neutral flavored oil to the jar.
  3. Blend the ingredients on high speed with an immersion blender until a thick emulsion forms. This is the base for the mayonnaise.
  4. Add 15 grams of dill, 10 grams of flat leaf parsley, ginger, and sea salt flakes to taste.
  5. Blend again with the immersion blender until the mixture is smooth and lightly green.
  6. Transfer the mayonnaise to a clean sterilized jar or container, scraping all of it in.
  7. Place a lid on the jar and lock it tightly.
  8. Store the mayonnaise in the refrigerator for up to four days, but you'll likely eat it all before then.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-1lvSuoP_j4

hock_and_meat_noodles.txt - Hokkien Mee

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a quick and easy Hokkien Mee noodle dish.
  • Master the stir-frying technique for tender and flavorful meat and vegetables.
  • Discover the perfect balance of flavors with dark soy sauce and hoisin sauce.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion, peeled and sliced
  • 3 garlic cloves, peeled and minced
  • 10 grams (0.3 ounces) ginger, peeled and minced
  • 1 small red bell pepper (or half a large one), sliced
  • 150 grams (5.2 ounces) button mushrooms, sliced
  • 2 spring onions (scallions), sliced
  • 1 long red chili (optional), sliced
  • 500 grams (1.1 pounds) rump, scotch, or eye fillet steak, sliced thinly across the grain
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil
  • 350 grams (12.3 ounces) fresh Hokkien noodles
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 ml) dark soy sauce
  • 50 grams (1.76 ounces) hoisin sauce
  • Garlic chili oil (optional)
  • Coriander (cilantro) (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion in half and then thinly across the flat side.
  2. Mince the garlic and ginger using a microplane.
  3. Slice the red bell pepper in half, remove the stem and seeds, and slice into thin strips.
  4. Slice the mushrooms thinly or quarter them.
  5. Slice the green stems of the spring onions on an angle and the white stems straight across.
  6. Slice the red chili (optional) on an angle.
  7. Slice the steak thinly across the grain.
  8. Heat a large pan or wok over high heat.
  9. Add half a tablespoon of peanut oil to the pan and stir-fry the steak for one minute until slightly browned.
  10. Remove the steak from the pan and set aside.
  11. Add another half a tablespoon of peanut oil to the pan and stir-fry the onion for three minutes until softened and golden.
  12. Add the minced garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 45 seconds.
  13. Add the red bell pepper, mushrooms, and white stem spring onions to the pan and stir-fry until softened.
  14. Return the steak and any resting juices to the pan.
  15. Add the Hokkien noodles, dark soy sauce, and hoisin sauce to the pan and mix well.
  16. Stir-fry for one minute until the noodles are hot and coated in sauce.
  17. Remove the pan from the heat.
  18. Serve the Hokkien Mee on a plate or in a bowl.
  19. Garnish with the green stem spring onions, sliced chili (optional), and coriander (cilantro) (optional).
  20. Drizzle with garlic chili oil (optional) and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1seo1eLKrTA

hocken_beef_noodles.txt - Hocken Beef Noodles

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a simple and delicious Hocken Beef Noodles dish.
  • Understand the order of ingredients and cooking times for optimal flavor.
  • Learn how to garnish the dish for a visually appealing presentation.

Ingredients

  • 1/2 tablespoon peanut oil
  • 500 grams sliced rum steak
  • 1/2 tablespoon peanut oil
  • 1 slice brown onion
  • 3 cloves minced garlic
  • 10 grams minced ginger
  • 1/2 sliced bell pepper
  • 150 grams sliced mushrooms
  • 2 tablespoons sliced spring onion
  • 1/2 sliced red chili
  • 350 grams fresh hocken noodles
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons dark soy sauce
  • 2 1/2 tablespoons hoisin sauce
  • Chili oil (optional)
  • More spring onion (optional)
  • Coriander (optional)

Instructions

  1. Heat 1/2 tablespoon of peanut oil in a pan or wok over high heat.
  2. Add 500 grams of sliced rum steak and fry for 2 minutes, allowing it to brown all over.
  3. Remove the steak and set aside.
  4. Add another 1/2 tablespoon of peanut oil to the pan.
  5. Add one slice of brown onion and fry for 2 minutes, or until slightly soft.
  6. Add 3 cloves of minced garlic, 10 grams of minced ginger, and fry for 45 seconds.
  7. Add 1/2 sliced bell pepper, 150 grams of sliced mushrooms, 2 tablespoons of sliced spring onion, and 1/2 sliced red chili.
  8. Fry for 4 minutes, or until soft.
  9. Transfer the steak back into the pan along with 350 grams of fresh hocken noodles, 1 1/2 tablespoons of dark soy sauce, and 2 1/2 tablespoons of hoisin sauce.
  10. Mix to combine and fry for 1 1/2 minutes, until everything is well coated.
  11. Transfer to a plate or bowl.
  12. Drizzle with chili oil (optional).
  13. Garnish with more spring onion and coriander (optional).
  14. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ddSJrXld0M

hoisen_chicken_stir_fry.txt - Hoisin Chicken Stir Fry

Objectives

  • Create a quick and easy stir fry using leftover ingredients.
  • Learn how to prepare chicken, vegetables, and sauces for a flavorful hoisin stir fry.
  • Master the art of stir-frying to achieve tender chicken and crisp vegetables.

Ingredients

Chicken Marinade

  • 1/4 cup low sodium soy sauce
  • 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce
  • 2 tablespoons Shaoxing wine
  • 2 tablespoons mirin
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
  • 2 1/2 tablespoons cornflour
  • ground white pepper (to taste)

Stir Fry Sauce

  • 4 tablespoons hoisin sauce
  • 1/4 cup Shaoxing wine
  • 1 teaspoon mirin
  • 1 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce
  • 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce
  • 2 teaspoons rice wine vinegar
  • a pinch of white or brown sugar
  • ground white pepper (to taste)

Stir Fry

  • 500g boneless and skinless chicken thigh
  • 2 large brown or yellow onions (or 4 small ones)
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 1 green bell pepper
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 5-6 spring onions
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons peanut oil
  • sesame seeds (optional)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the vegetables:
  2. Slice onions in half, peel, and slice into medium-sized pieces.
  3. Remove the core and seeds from the bell peppers and slice them into pieces similar in size to the onions.
  4. Crush garlic cloves with the side of a knife and chop roughly.

  5. Slice the spring onion tops thinly for garnish and chop the rest into 2-inch pieces.

  6. Prepare the chicken:

  7. Slice the chicken thigh thinly across the grain, ensuring consistent thickness.

  8. Prepare the stir fry sauce:

  9. Combine all stir fry sauce ingredients in a bowl and whisk until well combined. Set aside.

  10. Prepare the chicken marinade:

  11. Combine all marinade ingredients in a bowl and whisk until well combined, ensuring the cornflour is fully dissolved.

  12. Add the sliced chicken to the marinade and mix well to coat.

  13. Cook the chicken:

  14. Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat until it begins to smoke.
  15. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of peanut oil to the hot wok.
  16. Add the marinated chicken and spread it out in a single layer.
  17. Let the chicken cook for about 1 minute, undisturbed, to develop a crust.

  18. Stir-fry the chicken for 2 minutes, ensuring it cooks evenly.

  19. Cook the vegetables:

  20. Add the sliced onions and bell peppers to the wok and stir-fry for 3 minutes, until slightly softened.

  21. Add the chopped garlic and stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant.

  22. Add the stir fry sauce:

  23. Add the chopped spring onions and the prepared stir fry sauce to the wok.

  24. Stir-fry for 1-1 1/2 minutes until the sauce thickens and boils.

  25. Serve:

  26. Remove the stir fry from the heat.
  27. Serve immediately in bowls or plates.
  28. Garnish with sesame seeds and the thinly sliced spring onion tops.
  29. Enjoy with rice or noodles, if desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xz0NOremGTQ

hollandaise_blender.txt - Hollandaise Sauce in a Blender

Objectives

  • Learn to make hollandaise sauce using a blender.
  • Understand the importance of slowly adding clarified butter.
  • Achieve a smooth, pourable consistency for the sauce.

Ingredients

  • 3 egg yolks
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) white vinegar or lemon juice
  • 300 grams (10.5 ounces) clarified butter

Instructions

  1. Add 3 egg yolks and 1 tablespoon of white vinegar or lemon juice to a blender.
  2. Secure the lid tightly and blend for 1 minute to break up the yolks and aerate them.
  3. While blending, slowly pour in 300 grams of clarified butter until the sauce reaches a thick but pourable consistency.
  4. Remove the lid and check the consistency of the sauce.
  5. Pour the sauce into a bowl or leave it in the blender.
  6. Store any leftover clarified butter in the refrigerator for future use.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fgksK1ELkjc

hollande_sauce.txt - Hollandaise Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn to make a quick and easy Hollandaise sauce.
  • Understand the importance of whisking continuously to prevent scrambling.
