  • Learn how to create a thick, rich base for the sauce.

Ingredients

  • 3 egg yolks
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) white vinegar or lemon juice
  • 300 g (10.5 oz) warm, melted clarified butter

Instructions

  1. Add 3 egg yolks to a bowl along with 1 tablespoon (20 ml) of white vinegar or lemon juice.
  2. Place a saucepan filled halfway with water on the stovetop and bring it to a boil.
  3. Reduce the heat to low and place the bowl on top of the saucepan to create a bain marie.
  4. Ensure the bowl isn't touching the water and start whisking the eggs in a figure eight pattern.
  5. Whisk continuously without stopping to prevent scrambling.
  6. Continue whisking until the mixture thickens and forms thick ribbons, which means you can see the bottom of the bowl when you whisk.
  7. Remove the bowl from the saucepan and place it in a damp tea towel to stabilize it.
  8. Continue whisking and slowly pour in 300 g (10.5 oz) of warm, melted clarified butter.
  9. Whisk until the sauce reaches a thick, pourable consistency.
  10. You may not need all of the butter, depending on the fat content of the yolks.
  11. Once the sauce is thick and smooth, you have a beautiful Hollandaise sauce.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZBIXkdoRqLE

honey_chicken_meal_prep.txt - Honey Chicken Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and nutritious meal prep for the week.
  • Learn to cook honey chicken with broccoli and rice.
  • Master the art of meal prepping for busy weekdays.

Ingredients

  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 medium heads broccoli, cut into florets and stalks
  • 1 spring onion, thinly sliced (optional)
  • 1 kilo boneless, skinless chicken thighs, diced
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • Cracked black pepper to taste
  • 70 grams honey
  • 50 grams sriracha sauce
  • 30 grams apple cider vinegar
  • 10 grams sesame oil
  • 350 grams basmati rice, washed
  • 700 ml cold water
  • 1 tablespoon peanut oil
  • Black sesame seeds (optional)
  • White sesame seeds (optional)
  • 1/2 tablespoon peanut oil
  • 10 cracks black pepper

Instructions

  1. Mince 4 cloves of garlic using a microplane or box grater.
  2. Cut 2 medium heads of broccoli into florets and trim the stalks.
  3. Thinly slice 1 spring onion on an angle (optional).
  4. Dice 1 kilo of boneless, skinless chicken thighs into consistent pieces.
  5. In a bowl, combine the diced chicken with 1 teaspoon onion powder, minced garlic, sea salt flakes, and 20 cracks of black pepper. Massage the chicken with your hands to ensure even distribution.
  6. In a separate bowl, whisk together 70 grams honey, 50 grams sriracha sauce, 30 grams apple cider vinegar, 10 grams sesame oil, and a pinch of sea salt flakes.
  7. Place a saucepan over high heat and add 350 grams of washed basmati rice, 700 ml of cold water, and a pinch of sea salt flakes. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  8. Place a large pan over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil.
  9. Add the seasoned chicken to the pan and sear for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and cooked through.
  10. Add the honey sauce to the pan and stir to combine. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute.
  11. Reduce heat to low and sprinkle with black and white sesame seeds (optional). Stir to combine and remove from heat.
  12. Once the rice timer goes off, turn off the heat and let it sit for 4 minutes with the lid on. Fluff with a fork and remove from heat.
  13. Place another pan over medium-high heat and add 1/2 tablespoon of peanut oil.
  14. Add the broccoli florets and stems to the pan, along with a pinch of sea salt flakes and 10 cracks of black pepper. Sauté for 5-6 minutes, stirring regularly, until slightly softened and golden brown.
  15. Divide the rice, broccoli, and chicken into individual containers. Add any remaining sauce and garnish with spring onions and sesame seeds (optional).
  16. Once slightly cooled, secure the lids on the containers. Store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 4 months.
  17. To reheat, microwave in bursts until hot. It is recommended to refrigerate overnight after reheating.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3SqoPSO_W9U

honey_chicken.txt - Honey Chicken

Objectives

  • Create crispy honey chicken with a delicious glaze
  • Understand the science behind each ingredient's role
  • Learn how to deep fry chicken for optimal texture

Ingredients

  • 1/4 cup (15 grams) sesame seeds
  • 1 liter (4 cups) canola or vegetable oil
  • 3 small chicken breasts (550 grams or 1.2 pounds)
  • 3/4 cup (105 grams) plain all-purpose flour
  • 1/4 cup + 1 tablespoon (45 grams) corn flour
  • 3/4 teaspoon (1.5 grams) baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 3/4 cup (180 ml) very cold soda water
  • 1 egg white
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) canola oil
  • 1/2 cup (140 grams) runny honey
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons (7.5 ml) sesame oil
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons (7.5 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • 1/2 cup (125 ml) cold water or leftover soda water
  • 1 tablespoon (16 grams) corn flour
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced

Instructions

  1. Toast sesame seeds in a skillet over high heat for 1 1/2-2 minutes, stirring frequently until lightly golden. Set aside.
  2. Heat canola or vegetable oil in a large saute pan or pot over high heat to 180°C (350°F).
  3. Butterfly and dice chicken breasts into even-sized pieces. Set aside.
  4. Combine flour, corn flour, baking powder, salt, soda water, egg white, and canola oil in a large bowl. Whisk until smooth.
  5. Combine honey, sesame oil, apple cider vinegar, cold water, corn flour, and salt in a separate bowl. Whisk until smooth.
  6. Coat chicken pieces in batter, ensuring no pieces stick together.
  7. Carefully add chicken pieces to hot oil, one at a time, frying for 6-7 minutes, rotating each piece until golden brown.
  8. Remove chicken from oil using a spider, slotted spoon, or tongs and place on a wire rack over a baking tray to drain.
  9. Heat 1 tablespoon of hot oil in a wok or skillet over high heat.
  10. Saute minced garlic for 45 seconds.
  11. Add honey sauce mixture to wok and cook for 1 1/2-2 minutes, stirring frequently, until thickened.
  12. Add crispy chicken to sauce and mix gently to coat.
  13. Add toasted sesame seeds and mix well.
  14. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oxDfDMJRe_k

honey_garlic_salmon_meal_prep.txt - Honey Garlic Salmon Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and easy honey garlic salmon meal prep.
  • Learn to cook salmon to medium rare for the best flavor.
  • Create a flavorful glaze for the salmon and broccoli.

Ingredients

  • 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) salmon, skin on or off
  • 1 teaspoon (5 ml) olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) smoked paprika
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 2 large heads broccoli
  • 2 lemons
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 350 grams (12.3 ounces) basmati rice
  • 750 grams (750 ml) cold water
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil
  • Sesame seeds (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons (28 grams) clarified or unsalted butter
  • 2 tablespoons (40 ml) chicken stock
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 5 tablespoons (70 grams) honey

Instructions

  1. Slice the salmon into five even fillets, about 250 grams (8.8 ounces) each.
  2. Place the salmon fillets in a bowl and rub with olive oil, garlic powder, smoked paprika, and salt.
  3. Cut the broccoli into even-sized florets and slice the stalk into battens.
  4. Juice half a lemon and set aside.
  5. Slice the other lemon into wedges for garnish.
  6. Grate the garlic cloves into a paste.
  7. In a saucepan, combine rice, water, and salt. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 14 minutes.
  8. Heat a wok or pan over high heat and add peanut oil. Stir-fry the broccoli for 3-4 minutes until al dente with a light char.
  9. Add a pinch of sesame seeds (optional) and stir-fry for another minute.
  10. Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add butter.
  11. Saute the minced garlic for 45 seconds, stirring constantly.
  12. Add chicken stock, soy sauce, half the lemon juice, and salt. Simmer for 1 minute.
  13. Stir in honey and cook for 1 minute to create a thick glaze.
  14. Place the salmon skin side down in the pan and cook for 4 minutes, basting with the glaze.
  15. Flip the salmon and cook for 2 minutes, basting with the glaze.
  16. Cook for 1 minute on each side to achieve a nice color.
  17. Remove the salmon from the pan and let it rest.
  18. Turn off the heat for the rice and let it rest for 5 minutes with the lid on.
  19. Fluff the rice with a fork.
  20. Divide the rice, salmon, and broccoli into 5 one-liter containers.
  21. Spoon some of the glaze over the salmon and broccoli.
  22. Refrigerate the meal prep containers for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
  23. Reheat in the microwave until hot.
  24. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-3h4O4on_-4

honey_glazed_carrots_and_parsnips.txt - Honey Glazed Carrots and Parsnips

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and flavorful honey-glazed carrots and parsnips dish.
  • Understand how to roast vegetables to achieve the perfect texture.
  • Create a delicious glaze using butter, honey, sage, and rosemary.

Ingredients

  • 600 grams carrots
  • 600 grams parsnips
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Salt (to taste)
  • 20 cracks black pepper
  • 3 tablespoons unsalted butter
  • 10 whole sage leaves
  • 1 sprig rosemary
  • 3 tablespoons (60g) honey
  • Ground white pepper (to taste)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 200°C.
  2. Slice carrots and parsnips in half lengthwise.
  3. Place carrots and parsnips on separate baking trays lined with parchment paper.
  4. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil onto each tray.
  5. Season with salt and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  6. Roast for 15 minutes.
  7. Flip the carrots and parsnips and roast for an additional 10 minutes.
  8. While the vegetables are roasting, melt 3 tablespoons of unsalted butter in a pan over medium-high heat.
  9. Add 10 whole sage leaves and 1 sprig of rosemary.
  10. Cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
  11. Add 3 tablespoons of honey, salt, and a pinch of white pepper.
  12. Stir until the glaze thickens and separates when a spatula is run through it (approximately 1.5 minutes).
  13. Remove the roasted carrots and parsnips from the oven.
  14. Serve the vegetables and drizzle with the honey glaze.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xiz0JOUUsOI

honey_mustard_dressing.txt - Honey Mustard Dressing

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and tasty honey mustard dressing.
  • Combine ingredients to create a smooth emulsion.
  • Use the dressing for salads, marinades, and other applications.

Ingredients

  • 1.5 tablespoons (30g) Dijon mustard
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30g) whole grain mustard
  • 3 tablespoons (90g) honey
  • 1/4 cup (60ml) apple cider vinegar
  • 1/2 teaspoon (2.5g) sea salt flakes
  • 1/2 teaspoon (5 cracks) black pepper
  • 1/2 cup (125ml) extra virgin olive oil

Instructions

  1. Add Dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, honey, apple cider vinegar, sea salt, and black pepper to a mixing bowl.
  2. Whisk the ingredients together until well combined.
  3. While continuously whisking, slowly pour in the extra virgin olive oil to create an emulsion.
  4. Once the emulsion is formed, transfer the dressing to a glass jar, airtight container, or serving vessel of your choice.
  5. Securely close the container with a lid.
  6. Enjoy the dressing on salads, marinades, and other dishes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ewNerD71mE4

honey_soy_chicken_wings.txt - Honey Soy Chicken Wings

Objectives

  • Make incredibly easy and flavorful honey soy chicken wings.
  • Learn to separate chicken wings into drumettes and wingettes.
  • Master the technique of marinating and basting chicken for optimal flavor.

Ingredients

  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) manuka honey (or any runny honey)
  • 110 milliliters (3.7 fluid ounces) soy sauce (low sodium optional)
  • 1/2 tablespoon (10 milliliters) olive oil
  • 2 cloves fresh garlic
  • 10 grams (0.3 ounces) fresh ginger, peeled
  • 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) chicken wings (tips removed)
  • 2 green spring onions (scallions) (optional)
  • 1 long red chili (optional)
  • Handful of coriander or cilantro (optional)
  • Sesame seeds (optional)
  • Sea salt flakes (optional)
  • Aluminum foil
  • Parchment paper

Instructions

  1. In a mixing bowl, combine honey, soy sauce, olive oil, minced garlic, and minced ginger. Whisk well to combine.
  2. Separate chicken wings into drumettes and wingettes by slicing through the skin next to the joint on the wing outside.
  3. Add chicken wings to the honey soy marinade, ensuring they are well coated.
  4. Wrap the chicken tightly to prevent air exposure and marinate for 20 minutes.
  5. Line a baking tray with aluminum foil and parchment paper.
  6. Arrange the marinated chicken wings on the tray, ensuring they are spaced apart for even cooking.
  7. Preheat oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
  8. Bake chicken wings for 20 minutes.
  9. While chicken wings are baking, thinly slice spring onion greens (optional) and red chili (optional) for garnish.
  10. After 20 minutes, remove chicken wings from the oven and place on a heat-resistant surface.
  11. Baste the chicken wings with the reserved marinade using a pastry brush or spoon.
  12. Flip the chicken wings and baste the other side.
  13. Return chicken wings to the oven and bake for another 10 minutes.
  14. Repeat the basting step and bake for another 10 minutes (total cooking time: 40 minutes).
  15. Remove chicken wings from the oven and let cool slightly.
  16. Serve chicken wings in a bowl, drizzled with pan juices.
  17. Garnish with sesame seeds, spring onion, chili, coriander or cilantro (optional).
  18. Sprinkle with sea salt flakes (optional).
  19. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rxBkD1xAGdg

honey_sriracha_chicken_bowl.txt - Honey Sriracha Chicken Bowl

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and healthy Honey Sriracha Chicken Bowl
  • Learn to prepare the chicken, sauce, and broccolini separately
  • Assemble the bowl with rice, broccolini, and chicken

Ingredients

  • Sriracha sauce
  • Soy sauce
  • Apple cider vinegar
  • Honey
  • Corn flour
  • Pepper
  • Garlic
  • Ginger
  • Peanut oil
  • Broccolini
  • Spring onion (optional)
  • Salt
  • Black and white sesame seeds (optional)
  • Chicken
  • Rice

Instructions

  1. In a bowl, combine Sriracha sauce, soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, honey, corn flour, and pepper.
  2. Grate garlic and ginger and add to the bowl. Mix until combined.
  3. Slice broccolini into small pieces. Optionally, chop spring onion.
  4. Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add peanut oil, broccolini, salt, and pepper. Saute for 4-5 minutes until soft and slightly al dente.
  5. Heat another large pan over high heat. Add peanut oil and chicken in batches. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 5-6 minutes, or 7 minutes if needed, until cooked through and browned.
  6. Return all cooked chicken to the pan with resting juices.
  7. Add the sauce to the pan and bring to a simmer.
  8. Cook for 3 minutes until the sauce thickens.
  9. Add black and white sesame seeds (optional) and cook for 1 minute.
  10. Remove from heat and serve over rice.
  11. Add broccolini and Sriracha chicken to the bowl.
  12. Garnish with spring onions and black sesame seeds.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DTXjltj3EtE

honey_sriracha_meatballs.txt - Honey Sriracha Meatballs

Objectives

  • Create flavorful and visually appealing honey Sriracha meatballs.
  • Master the technique of browning meatballs evenly.
  • Learn to prepare a delicious honey Sriracha sauce.

Ingredients

  • 1 pound ground beef
  • 2 eggs
  • 1/2 cup Panko bread crumbs
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1/4 cup tomato ketchup
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon cracked black pepper
  • 1/4 cup sriracha sauce
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
  • 2 tablespoons honey
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 inch ginger, minced
  • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
  • Cooked rice
  • Broccolini
  • Spring onions, chopped

Instructions

  1. Combine ground beef, eggs, Panko bread crumbs, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, thyme, ketchup, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
  2. Mix well until fully combined.
  3. Shape the mixture into 15 individual meatballs.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together sriracha sauce, soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, honey, minced garlic, and ginger.
  5. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  6. Brown the meatballs in batches for 2.5 minutes per side, ensuring they are cooked through.
  7. Remove the browned meatballs from the pan and set aside.
  8. Add the sauce to the pan and simmer for 1 minute.
  9. Return the meatballs to the sauce and cook for another minute, rotating them to ensure even coating.
  10. Serve the meatballs with rice and broccolini.
  11. Garnish with chopped spring onions.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IZd-s81iNrI

hot_cross_buns.txt - Hot Cross Buns

Objectives

  • Learn to make soft and fluffy hot cross buns
  • Understand the importance of proofing for a light and airy texture
  • Create a delicious glaze for a satisfying crunch

Ingredients

  • 1 1/2 cups (375 ml) full fat milk
  • 1 tablespoon (9 grams) dry yeast
  • 1/2 cup (110 grams) caster sugar
  • 4 1/4 cups (640 grams) bread flour
  • 1 1/2 cups (200 grams) sultanas
  • 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
  • 2 teaspoons ground allspice
  • Zest of 1 large orange
  • 1 large free-range egg, beaten
  • 50 grams unsalted butter, melted and cooled
  • 3/4 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon vegetable oil
  • 1/2 cup (70 grams) bread flour
  • 95 ml cold water
  • 1/2 cup (110 grams) caster sugar
  • 150 ml boiling hot water

Instructions

  1. Heat 1 1/2 cups (375 ml) of full fat milk in a saucepan over medium heat until warm.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 tablespoon (9 grams) of dry yeast, 2 teaspoons of caster sugar, and the warm milk.
  3. Whisk until combined and let sit for 10 minutes, or until the yeast creates a froth on top.
  4. Add 4 1/4 cups (640 grams) of bread flour, the remaining 1/2 cup (110 grams) of caster sugar, 1 1/2 cups (200 grams) of sultanas, 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon, 2 teaspoons of ground allspice, the zest of 1 large orange, 1 beaten egg, 50 grams of melted and cooled unsalted butter, and 3/4 teaspoon of sea salt flakes.
  5. Mix the ingredients using a stand mixer with a dough hook attachment on low speed for 5 minutes, or knead by hand for 8-10 minutes until smooth.
  6. Grease a large mixing bowl with 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil.
  7. Place the dough in the prepared bowl, cover with a warm damp tea towel, and let proof for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
  8. Punch down the dough and knead for 30 seconds to remove air bubbles.
  9. Shape the dough into a log and roll it to 60 centimeters (23 inches) long.
  10. Cut the log in half and roll each half to 40 centimeters (15 inches) long.
  11. Slice each half into 6 even pieces, resulting in 12 pieces of dough.
  12. Line a 9 by 13 inch baking tray with parchment paper.
  13. Roll the dough into individual balls and place them in the prepared tray, 3 across and 4 down.
  14. Cover the tray with lightly oiled cling wrap and let proof for another 40 minutes, or until risen by 75%.
  15. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  16. 20 minutes into the second proofing, prepare the cross paste by whisking together 1/2 cup (70 grams) of bread flour and 95 ml of cold water until smooth.
  17. Once the dough has risen by 75%, pipe the cross paste onto each bun, creating a cross shape from edge to edge.
  18. Bake the buns for 20-22 minutes, rotating the tray halfway through.
  19. 5 minutes before the buns are done baking, prepare the glaze by whisking together 1/2 cup (110 grams) of caster sugar and 150 ml of boiling hot water until the sugar dissolves.
  20. Remove the buns from the oven and brush them with the sugar water glaze.
  21. Let the buns sit in the tray for 5 minutes to absorb the glaze.
  22. Transfer the buns to a wire rack to cool.
  23. Serve the hot cross buns warm with butter.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vN4SPwIXIAs

hot_honey_buffalo_chicken_sandwich.txt - Hot Honey Buffalo Chicken Sandwich

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and easy hot honey buffalo chicken sandwich
  • Make homemade dill pickles for a tangy flavor
  • Prepare a creamy homemade ranch sauce for dipping

Ingredients

Dill Pickles - 1 Lebanese cucumber - 8 g fresh dill - 125 ml cold water - 125 ml white vinegar - 2 tbsp white sugar (optional) - Pinch of salt

Chicken Marinade - 1 cup buttermilk - 1/2 cup Frank's Hot Sauce - 4-6 large boneless, skinless chicken thighs

Ranch Sauce - 1/2 cup mayonnaise - 1 1/2 tbsp sour cream - 1/4 cup buttermilk - 1 tsp onion powder - 1 tsp garlic powder - 1 tsp dried dill - 1 tsp dried parsley - 2 tsp dried chives - Salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste

Dredging Flour - 1 cup plain all-purpose flour - 1/2 cup corn flour or cornstarch - 2 tsp smoked paprika - 1/2 tsp chili powder - 1 tsp onion powder - 1 tsp garlic powder - Salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste

Hot Honey Sauce - 1/2 cup Frank's Hot Sauce (or hot sauce of choice) - 1/3 cup unsalted butter - 1/4 cup honey - 1 tsp onion powder - 1 tsp garlic powder - Salt to taste

Other - Vegetable or sunflower oil (enough to fill a large pot halfway) - Brioche sesame buns (or your preferred buns)

Instructions

  1. Prepare Dill Pickles:
    • Slice the cucumber in half lengthwise and then thinly slice it using a mandolin or a sharp knife.
    • Place half of the dill in the bottom of a jar.
    • Add the cucumber slices.
    • Place the remaining dill on top.
  2. Make Pickling Brine:
    • Combine cold water, white vinegar, white sugar (optional), and salt in a saucepan.
    • Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until the sugar and salt dissolve.
    • Remove from heat.
  3. Pickle the Cucumbers:
    • Pour the hot pickling brine over the cucumbers in the jar, ensuring they are fully submerged.
    • Cover the jar and refrigerate for at least 48 hours (best after 48 hours).
  4. Marinate the Chicken:
    • Whisk buttermilk and Frank's Hot Sauce together in a bowl.
    • Add the chicken thighs to the marinade and coat thoroughly.
    • Refrigerate for up to 48 hours (can be used immediately).
  5. Make Ranch Sauce:
    • Combine mayonnaise, sour cream, buttermilk, onion powder, garlic powder, dried dill, dried parsley, dried chives, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
    • Mix well until all ingredients are combined.
    • Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  6. Prepare Dredging Flour:
    • Combine all-purpose flour, corn flour, smoked paprika, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
    • Whisk until well combined.
  7. Make Hot Honey Sauce:
    • Heat a saucepan over medium-high heat.
    • Add Frank's Hot Sauce, butter, honey, onion powder, garlic powder, and salt.
    • Stir until the butter melts. Remove from heat.
  8. Fry the Chicken:
    • Fill a large pot halfway with vegetable or sunflower oil.
    • Heat the oil to 180°C (350°F) over high heat.
    • Gently scrape off excess marinade from the chicken thighs.
    • Dredge each chicken thigh in the flour mixture, ensuring it's fully coated.
    • Carefully place the chicken thighs in the hot oil, one at a time, ensuring they are away from you to prevent oil splattering.
    • Fry for 10-12 minutes, until golden brown and crispy, and the chicken is cooked through (use a thermometer if desired).
  9. Coat Chicken in Sauce:
    • Remove the fried chicken thighs from the oil and place them on a wire rack to drain.
    • Once drained, transfer the chicken to a bowl.
    • Pour the hot honey buffalo sauce over the chicken and gently toss to coat.
  10. Toast the Buns:
    • Toast the brioche sesame buns in a pan over medium heat with a splash of oil, until golden brown. Alternatively, toast in the oven, under the grill, or in a toaster.
  11. Assemble the Sandwich:
    • Spread ranch sauce on the bottom and top of the toasted buns.
    • Place the crispy chicken thighs on the bottom bun.
    • Top with a few dill pickle slices.
    • Close the sandwich with the top bun.
  12. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cEBjw_-XaOU

hummus_recipe.txt - Hummus Recipe

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and smooth hummus from scratch.
  • Understand the importance of rehydrating chickpeas for optimal texture.
  • Master the techniques for toasting cumin seeds and blending hummus for a creamy consistency.

Ingredients

  • 1 cup (210 grams) raw and dried chickpeas
  • 3 cups (750 milliliters) cold water
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1 gram) whole cumin seeds
  • 1 whole fresh lemon
  • 1/3 cup (75 grams) homemade tahini
  • 1 whole clove minced garlic
  • 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 milliliters) extra virgin olive oil
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 milliliters) extra virgin olive oil (optional, for blending)
  • Smoked or sweet paprika (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Place 1 cup (210 grams) of raw and dried chickpeas in a medium to large saucepan.
  2. Add 3 cups (750 milliliters) of cold water to the saucepan, cover, and allow to sit for 24 hours to rehydrate the chickpeas.
  3. After 24 hours, drain the chickpeas in a sieve and rinse under cold water for 10-15 seconds.
  4. Return the chickpeas to the saucepan and fill with cold water to a level 5 inches above the chickpeas.
  5. Add 1 teaspoon (5 grams) of sea salt flakes to the saucepan, bring to a boil over high heat, and cook for 1.5-1.75 hours, or until the chickpeas are completely cooked through and soft.
  6. Drain the cooked chickpeas in a colander, allowing them to cool completely.
  7. Toast 1/2 teaspoon (1 gram) of whole cumin seeds in a small skillet over medium-high heat for 1.5 minutes, or until lightly golden brown.
  8. Grind the toasted cumin seeds into a fine powder using a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
  9. Juice 1 whole fresh lemon to extract approximately 1/4 cup (60 milliliters) of juice.
  10. Combine 1/3 cup (75 grams) of homemade tahini and the freshly squeezed lemon juice in a food processor or blender.
  11. Process the tahini and lemon juice mixture on high speed for 30 seconds to create a smooth paste.
  12. Add 1 whole clove of minced garlic, the freshly ground cumin powder, 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) of sea salt flakes, and 2.5 tablespoons (50 milliliters) of extra virgin olive oil to the food processor.
  13. Process the mixture on high speed for another 30 seconds to combine all ingredients.
  14. Add the cooked and cooled chickpeas to the food processor.
  15. Process the mixture on high speed for 2 minutes to create a smooth and whipped hummus, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
  16. Slowly pour in an additional 2.5 tablespoons (50 milliliters) of extra virgin olive oil (or cold water) while processing for another 1 minute to create a smooth and creamy texture.
  17. Transfer the hummus to a plate or bowl and spread it out using the back of a spoon to create waves or walls.
  18. Drizzle additional extra virgin olive oil over the hummus and sprinkle with smoked or sweet paprika for garnish.
  19. Serve with your favorite dipping items, such as carrots, celery, cucumbers, or bread.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pC1wUdhViX4

jalapeno_poppers.txt - Jalapeno Poppers

Objectives

  • Create a delicious bacon cream cheese filling for jalapeno poppers.
  • Top the poppers with a crunchy bacon and panko breadcrumb mixture.
  • Bake the poppers until golden and melted.
  • Make a flavorful honey mustard mayonnaise to serve alongside.

Ingredients

  • 6 rashers of streaky bacon
  • 80 grams cheddar cheese (or any good melting cheese)
  • 2 spring onions (scallions)
  • 3 grams coriander (cilantro)
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 12 jalapenos
  • 1 egg
  • 2.5 teaspoons white vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 200 milliliters neutral flavored oil
  • 60 grams honey
  • 60 grams Dijon mustard
  • Pinch of cayenne pepper (optional)
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 1/2 cup panko bread crumbs
  • 220 grams softened cream cheese
  • Olive oil

Instructions

  1. Dice the bacon into small pieces.
  2. Grate the cheddar cheese.
  3. Slice the spring onions and separate the roots from the stems.
  4. Roughly chop the coriander.
  5. Grate the garlic into a paste.
  6. Remove the stem and pith from the jalapenos, then remove the seeds.
  7. Make the honey mustard mayonnaise by blending an egg, vinegar, Dijon mustard, and oil until emulsified.
  8. Add honey, Dijon mustard, cayenne pepper (optional), salt, and black pepper to the mayonnaise and blend until smooth.
  9. Fry the bacon until lightly golden and set aside.
  10. Mix the bacon, bacon fat, panko bread crumbs, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
  11. Combine the cream cheese, grated cheddar, spring onion roots, minced garlic, coriander, bacon and panko mixture, and black pepper in a bowl.
  12. Fill the jalapeno halves with the cream cheese mixture.
  13. Place the filled jalapenos on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  14. Sprinkle the bacon and panko mixture over the jalapenos.
  15. Sprinkle with smoked paprika (optional) and drizzle with olive oil.
  16. Bake in a preheated oven at 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit) for 10-12 minutes, or until golden and melted.
  17. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving with the honey mustard mayonnaise.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JOUpkMtEenU

japanese_katsu_curry.txt - Japanese Katsu Curry

Objectives

  • Learn how to make authentic Japanese Katsu Curry.
  • Prepare chicken cutlets coated in panko breadcrumbs.
  • Create a flavorful curry sauce with onions, carrots, and spices.

Ingredients

  • 2 large chicken breasts (cut in half and sliced into fillets)
  • Panko breadcrumbs
  • 2 eggs
  • Plain white flour
  • 2 small to medium brown or yellow onions (sliced or diced)
  • Carrots (peeled, sliced in half lengthwise, then thinly sliced)
  • Chicken stock
  • Honey curry powder
  • Garlic powder
  • Onion powder
  • Chili powder
  • Soy sauce
  • Rice wine vinegar
  • Plain all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup (200g) jasmine rice
  • Cold water
  • Salt
  • 3 cloves garlic (thinly sliced)
  • 5g (0.2oz) ginger (peeled, thinly sliced, then diced)
  • Vegetable oil
  • Honey

Instructions

  1. Prepare the rice: Wash the rice until the water runs clear. Add 1 cup (200g) rice, 1 1/4 cups cold water, and a pinch of salt to a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes.
  2. Prepare the chicken: Cut 2 large chicken breasts in half and slice into fillets. Set aside.
  3. Prepare the curry sauce: In a large pot over medium-high heat, add 1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Heat until hot, then add the sliced onions and carrots. Sauté for 5 minutes, stirring regularly, until slightly softened.
  4. Add the garlic and ginger to the pot, along with a pinch of salt. Continue stirring for 5 minutes, until the vegetables are soft.
  5. Stir in 2 tablespoons curry powder and 1/2 teaspoon chili powder. Cook for 2 minutes, mixing well, to infuse the spices into the vegetables.
  6. Add 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 teaspoon rice vinegar, and 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour to the pot. Cook for 2 minutes, mixing well, to cook out the flour taste and create a thick paste.
  7. Pour in 500 ml chicken stock and bring to a boil. Adjust seasoning as needed. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 6-8 minutes until the sauce thickens.
  8. Prepare the chicken batter: In a bowl, whisk together 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon onion powder, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, and 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour until smooth. This will create a thick batter.
  9. Prepare the chicken coating: Place 150g of panko breadcrumbs in a shallow dish.
  10. Coat the chicken: Dip each chicken fillet into the batter, ensuring it's fully coated. Remove excess batter. Transfer the chicken to the panko breadcrumbs and coat thoroughly. Press the breadcrumbs into the chicken to ensure they stick.
  11. Fry the chicken: Heat enough vegetable oil in a large, high-rimmed pan or pot over medium-high heat to fill the pan halfway. Heat the oil to 170°C (340°F).
  12. Carefully add the coated chicken fillets to the hot oil, ensuring to place them away from you to avoid oil splashing. Fry for 3 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through.
  13. Drain the chicken: Remove the chicken from the oil and place on a wire rack over a tray to drain excess oil. Season with salt to taste.
  14. Optional: Slice the cooked chicken into 1-inch thick pieces.
  15. Assemble the dish: Place the cooked rice in a bowl. Pour a ladleful of curry sauce around the rice, to one side. Gently place the chicken over the rice, ensuring it overhangs slightly into the sauce.
  16. Garnish and serve: Garnish with spring onions or scallions if desired. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bLvQutBaaac

jerk_chicken.txt - Jerk Chicken

Objectives

  • Make jerk chicken using a barbecue.
  • Learn how to make a flavorful jerk marinade.
  • Prepare chicken marylands for optimal flavor penetration.

Ingredients

  • 1 red onion, sliced
  • 10-12 spring onions, chopped
  • 10 sprigs fresh thyme
  • 10 habaneros or scotch bonnet chilies
  • 10g ginger, peeled
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 1 lime
  • 1/3 cup grape seed or vegetable oil
  • 3 1/2 tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp Wister Sheer sauce
  • 2 1/2 tbsp brown sugar
  • 3 tsp ground allspice
  • 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 tsp ground cloves
  • Salt
  • Pepper (optional)

Instructions

  1. Add spring onions, red onion, thyme, habaneros, garlic and ginger paste, and lime zest and juice to a blender. Blend until a thick paste forms.
  2. Add oil, soy sauce, Wister Sheer sauce, brown sugar, allspice, cinnamon, cloves, salt, and pepper to the blender. Blend again until a thick, pourable paste forms.
  3. Place chicken marylands in a large mixing bowl. Add the jerk marinade and mix until chicken is completely coated.
  4. Marinate chicken for at least 4 hours, up to 48 hours.
  5. Preheat a barbecue. Place chicken marylands skin-side down and grill for 8-10 minutes until charred lines appear.
  6. Flip chicken and baste with remaining marinade. Grill for another 10 minutes, flipping every couple of minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 72°C (161°F).
  7. Remove chicken from barbecue and let rest for 5 minutes.
  8. Serve on a platter with charred lime and garnish with spring onions.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DPCl577p6po

jug_chicken.txt - Jug Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn how to make Jug Chicken using the Ziggy Elite triple Grill.
  • Discover a delicious and easy recipe for Jug Chicken.

Instructions

  1. Preheat the Ziggy Elite triple Grill.
  2. Prepare the Jug Chicken according to the recipe details in the video description.
  3. Place the Jug Chicken on the preheated grill.
  4. Cook the Jug Chicken according to the instructions in the video description.
  5. Enjoy the delicious and fantastic Jug Chicken!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=obwv5Drlwq0

karage_chicken.txt - Karage Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make Japanese-style fried chicken (karage)
  • Create a flavorful marinade for the chicken
  • Achieve a crispy and juicy chicken texture

Ingredients

  • 700g (1.5lb) boneless chicken thighs (skin-on preferred)
  • 40g (1.4oz) fresh ginger
  • 3.5 tbsp (70ml) soy sauce
  • 2.5 tbsp (50ml) mirin or sake
  • 1.5 cups (180g) corn flour or starch
  • Canola, sunflower, or vegetable oil (enough to fill a pot halfway)
  • 4 star anise
  • 1 tsp (1.5g) whole cloves
  • 1 tsp (1.5g) whole fennel seeds
  • 1.5 tsp (2g) szechuan peppercorns
  • 1 small cinnamon stick
  • 3/4 tbsp (8g) sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Cut the chicken thighs into even bite-sized pieces.
  2. In a mixing bowl, combine the ginger juice, soy sauce, and mirin or sake.
  3. Marinate the chicken in the mixture for no more than 20 minutes.
  4. Toast the star anise, cloves, fennel seeds, and szechuan peppercorns in a pan over high heat for 1.5-2 minutes until golden and cracking.
  5. Allow the spices to cool for 5 minutes.
  6. Grind the cooled spices with the cinnamon stick and sea salt flakes in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle until finely ground.
  7. Heat the oil in a deep-sided pot or pan to 180°C (350°F).
  8. Dredge the chicken pieces in the corn flour, ensuring they are well coated.
  9. Fry the chicken in batches for 45 seconds, shaking off excess oil, and rest on a wire rack for 45 seconds.
  10. Fry the chicken again for 30 seconds, rest for 30 seconds, and repeat the process one more time.
  11. Season the fried chicken with the five-spice salt.
  12. Serve with mayonnaise or your preferred dipping sauce.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ifa4ozKuOJA

katsu_curry.txt - Katsu Curry

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious katsu curry sauce from scratch.
  • Prepare juicy, flavorful chicken katsu.
  • Create a balanced and satisfying meal with rice.

Ingredients

Sauce: - 1 brown or yellow onion, thinly sliced - 2 carrots, peeled, ends removed, thinly sliced - 2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced - 1 inch ginger, peeled, roughly chopped - 1 tablespoon oil - Salt to taste - 1 tablespoon curry powder - 1/2 teaspoon chili powder - 1 tablespoon soy sauce - 1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar - 1 tablespoon plain flour - 1 cup chicken stock - 1 tablespoon honey

Chicken Katsu: - Chicken fillets - 2 eggs - 1 clove garlic, minced - 1 tablespoon onion powder - Salt and pepper to taste - 1/2 cup plain flour - Panko breadcrumbs

Instructions

  1. Thinly slice a brown or yellow onion.
  2. Peel and thinly slice two carrots, removing the ends.
  3. Thinly slice two cloves of garlic.
  4. Peel and roughly chop a 1-inch piece of ginger.
  5. Butterfly and cut chicken fillets into thin pieces.
  6. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  7. Add the sliced onions and carrots to the pan and cook for 10 minutes.
  8. Add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for 2 minutes.
  9. Season with salt.
  10. Add curry powder and chili powder to the pan and cook for 2 minutes.
  11. Add soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, and plain flour to the pan and cook for 2 minutes.
  12. Add chicken stock to the pan, bring to a boil, and reduce for 6 minutes.
  13. Stir in honey.
  14. Blend the sauce until smooth.
  15. In a bowl, combine eggs, minced garlic, onion powder, salt, pepper, and plain flour.
  16. Whisk the ingredients together to create a batter.
  17. Dip the chicken fillets in the batter, then coat in panko breadcrumbs.
  18. Fry the chicken for 3 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through.
  19. Season the chicken well.
  20. Slice the chicken thinly.
  21. Serve the chicken katsu with rice and the katsu curry sauce.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rA-HpGvhsII

korean_beef_stir_fry_meal_prep.txt - Korean Beef Stir Fry Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and satisfying Korean beef stir-fry meal prep.
  • Learn to cook rice perfectly for meal prep.
  • Utilize a simple and delicious sauce for the stir-fry.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- 1 brown or yellow onion | 1个洋葱 1 red bell pepper (capsicum) | 1个红辣椒 1 large carrot | 1个大胡萝卜 1 bunch broccolini (or broccoli) | 1束西兰花 1 spring onion (optional) | 1根葱 (可选) 5 cloves garlic | 5瓣大蒜 15 g ginger | 15克姜 100 ml low sodium soy sauce | 100毫升低盐酱油 40 ml rice vinegar | 40毫升米醋 70 g brown sugar | 70克红糖 15 ml toasted sesame oil | 15毫升芝麻油 1.5 g crushed chili flakes (optional) | 1.5克辣椒粉 (可选) 300 g washed jasmine rice | 300克洗好的茉莉香米 500 ml cold water | 500毫升冷水 Salt to taste | 适量盐 30 ml peanut oil | 30毫升花生油 1 kg beef mince (90% lean, 10% fat) | 1公斤牛肉末 (瘦肉90%，肥肉10%) Sea salt flakes | 海盐 Ground white pepper (optional) | 白胡椒粉 (可选) Sesame seeds (optional) | 芝麻 (可选)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the ingredients:
    • Remove the root and tip of the onion, slice in half, and thinly slice into strips.
    • Slice the red bell pepper in half, remove seeds, and slice into thin strips.
    • Grate the carrot or cut into matchstick cuts.
    • Slice the broccolini into even-sized strips.
    • Thinly slice the white root of the spring onion.
    • Slice the green stem of the spring onion into diamond or oval shapes (optional).
    • Grate the garlic and ginger into a paste.
  2. Make the sauce:
    • Combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic and ginger paste, and chili flakes in a bowl.
    • Whisk to mix well.
  3. Cook the rice:
    • In a saucepan, combine rice, water, and salt.
    • Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes.
    • Turn off the heat and let rest, covered, for 6 minutes.
    • Fluff with a fork.
  4. Cook the beef:
    • Heat peanut oil in a large pan over high heat.
    • Add beef mince and cook for 3 minutes, breaking up the meat, until golden brown.
    • Season with salt and pepper.
    • Cook for another 3 minutes, ensuring the beef is browned on all sides.
  5. Add the vegetables:
    • Add onion to the pan and cook for 2 minutes, mixing well.
    • Add carrot, broccolini, red bell pepper, salt, pepper, and white root of the spring onion.
    • Cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables soften slightly.
  6. Finish the stir-fry:
    • Pour the sauce into the pan, scraping the bottom to ensure all the flavor is incorporated.
    • Cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sauce reduces slightly.
    • Add sesame seeds (optional).
    • Remove from heat and taste for seasoning, adjusting as needed.
  7. Assemble the meal prep:
    • Divide the stir-fry evenly into 5 containers.
    • Top with any leftover sauce.
    • Add sesame seeds and spring onion (optional).
  8. Cool and store:
    • Let the meal prep cool for 10 minutes before placing lids on the containers.
    • Refrigerate for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 4 months.
  9. Reheating:
    • Microwave for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
    • Or, reheat in a pan over medium heat.
    • If frozen, defrost in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kBivrTwvTVU

korean_pork_ribs.txt - Korean Pork Ribs

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful marinade for Korean pork ribs.
  • Properly wrap and bake the ribs for optimal tenderness.
  • Achieve a glossy and melt-in-your-mouth texture.

Ingredients

  • 150 grams gochujang (Korean chili paste)
  • 150 grams tomato ketchup
  • 50 grams sriracha sauce
  • 1 tablespoon Chinese five spice
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 2 racks of pork ribs

Instructions

  1. Combine gochujang, ketchup, and sriracha sauce in a mixing bowl. Mix well.
  2. In a separate bowl, combine Chinese five spice, onion powder, and garlic powder. Mix well.
  3. Divide the spice mixture between the two racks of pork ribs.
  4. Rub the spice mixture into the ribs thoroughly with clean hands.
  5. Brush the ribs with the gochujang marinade, reserving one-third for later.
  6. Wrap the prepared ribs in parchment paper, covering them completely.
  7. Wrap the parchment-covered ribs in aluminum foil, sealing tightly to lock in flavor.
  8. Place the wrapped ribs on a baking tray.
  9. Bake at 150°C (300°F) for 2 hours and 15 minutes.
  10. Remove the ribs from the oven and unwrap them.
  11. Baste the ribs with the remaining gochujang marinade.
  12. Re-wrap the ribs in aluminum foil and place them back in the oven at 210°C (410°F).
  13. Bake for an additional 7 minutes.
  14. Remove the ribs from the oven and enjoy.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=23GC3ssfZiw

korean_style_meatballs.txt - Korean Style Meatballs

Objectives

  • Create flavorful Korean-style meatballs
  • Develop a delicious plum glaze for the meatballs
  • Learn a simple method for cooking meatballs

Ingredients

  • 500 grams (1.1 pounds) beef mince/ground beef
  • 2 cloves garlic, peeled
  • 25 grams (0.8 ounces) ginger, peeled
  • 2 spring onions/scallions
  • 70 grams (2.4 ounces) gochujang chili paste
  • 1.5 teaspoons (7.5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 2 teaspoons (20 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) olive oil
  • 120 grams (4.2 ounces) plum jam
  • 70 grams (2.4 ounces) gochujang Korean spice paste
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) soy sauce
  • Toasted sesame seeds (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Combine beef mince, minced garlic, minced ginger, thinly sliced spring onion root ends, gochujang chili paste, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Mix gently with your hands until just combined.
  2. Weigh out 50-gram portions of the mixture and roll into meatballs.
  3. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add olive oil and sear meatballs for 1 minute per side, ensuring they don't touch.
  4. Once golden brown, transfer the skillet to a preheated oven (180°C/350°F) and bake for 8 minutes.
  5. While the meatballs bake, prepare the glaze in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Combine plum jam, gochujang Korean spice paste, rice wine vinegar, and soy sauce. Stir frequently for 4 minutes until thickened and forms ribbons.
  6. Remove meatballs from the oven and gently toss in the glaze until evenly coated.
  7. Serve meatballs with a side of fresh Asian salad and garnish with toasted sesame seeds and sliced spring onion stems.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vdefN8H7xNw

kung_pao_chicken_meal_prep.txt - Kung Pao Chicken Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a week's worth of Kung Pao Chicken in under 40 minutes.
  • Learn how to properly marinate and cook the chicken.
  • Create a flavorful and balanced sauce for the dish.

Ingredients

  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 1 green bell pepper (or capsicum)
  • 1 spring onion
  • Chilies (optional)
  • Garlic
  • Ginger
  • Chicken
  • Soy sauce
  • Hoisin sauce
  • Shaoxing wine
  • Sesame oil
  • Szechuan pepper
  • Granulated sugar
  • Corn flour
  • Ground white pepper
  • Peanut oil
  • Peanuts (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the red and green bell peppers into thin, even strips, removing the core.
  2. Roughly chop the spring onion and chilies (if using).
  3. Grate the garlic and ginger using a microplane.
  4. Dice the chicken into even-sized pieces.
  5. In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, Shaoxing wine, garlic, ginger, sesame oil, Szechuan pepper, granulated sugar, corn flour, and ground white pepper.
  6. Whisk the marinade ingredients together.
  7. Add 4 tablespoons of the marinade to the chicken and mix well.
  8. Let the chicken marinate for 20 minutes.
  9. Heat peanut oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  10. Fry the chicken in batches for 6-7 minutes, then remove from the pan.
  11. Add the bell peppers and chilies (if using) to the pan and fry for 5 minutes.
  12. Add the spring onions and cook for 1 minute.
  13. Return the chicken to the pan and mix everything together.
  14. Cook for 1 minute.
  15. Add the sauce to the pan and bring to a boil.
  16. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes.
  17. Stir in the peanuts (if desired).
  18. Serve the Kung Pao Chicken over rice and garnish with spring onion.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AnxTFH2DBCg

kung_pao_chicken.txt - Kung Pao Chicken

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and easy Kung Pao Chicken dish in under 30 minutes.
  • Learn how to prepare the marinade and sauce.
  • Understand the importance of properly cooking the chicken and vegetables.

Ingredients

English:

  • 4 cloves garlic, peeled
  • 15 grams ginger, peeled
  • 125 milliliters low sodium soy sauce
  • 60 milliliters hoisin sauce
  • 40 milliliters Shaoxing cooking wine (optional)
  • 15 milliliters sesame oil
  • 2 grams Szechuan peppercorns, toasted and crushed
  • 9 grams granulated sugar (optional)
  • 12 grams corn flour
  • Pepper to taste
  • 1.2 kilos boneless and skinless chicken thigh, diced
  • 1/4 cup marinade
  • 1 green bell pepper, sliced into thin strips
  • 1 red bell pepper, sliced into thin strips
  • 2 long red chilies, roughly chopped (optional)
  • 6 spring onions, white root chopped, green stem for garnish
  • 300 grams jasmine rice, washed
  • 500 milliliters cold water
  • Pinch of salt
  • 50 grams chopped peanuts (optional)
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) peanut oil (or vegetable oil)

Chinese:

  • 大蒜 4瓣，去皮
  • 生姜 15 克，去皮
  • 低盐酱油 125 毫升
  • 蚝油 60 毫升
  • 绍兴酒 40 毫升（可选）
  • 芝麻油 15 毫升
  • 花椒 2 克，烤熟研磨
  • 糖 9 克（可选）
  • 玉米淀粉 12 克
  • 黑胡椒粉 少许
  • 去骨去皮鸡腿肉 1.2 公斤，切丁
  • 腌料 1/4 杯
  • 青椒 1 个，切成细条
  • 红椒 1 个，切成细条
  • 红辣椒 2 个，粗切（可选）
  • 春葱 6 根，白根切段，青茎用于装饰
  • 茉莉香米 300 克，洗净
  • 冷水 500 毫升
  • 盐 少许
  • 花生 50 克，切碎（可选）
  • 花生油 1.5 汤匙（30 毫升）（或植物油）

Instructions

  1. Combine garlic and ginger in a microplane to create a paste.
  2. Mix soy sauce, hoisin sauce, Shaoxing cooking wine (optional), garlic-ginger paste, sesame oil, Szechuan peppercorns, sugar (optional), corn flour, and pepper in a bowl. Whisk until smooth and set aside.
  3. Dice chicken thigh into even pieces.
  4. Add diced chicken to a large bowl, pour in 1/4 cup of the marinade, and mix well.
  5. Marinate the chicken for 30 minutes.
  6. Slice bell peppers into thin strips, removing seeds and pith.
  7. Roughly chop red chilies (optional).
  8. Chop spring onion white root into 3-4 centimeter pieces and slice green stem into thin rounds.
  9. Place saucepan over high heat, add rice, water, and salt. Mix and bring to a boil.
  10. Cover saucepan, lower heat to low, and cook rice for 12 minutes.
  11. Place small pan over medium-high heat and add chopped peanuts (optional). Toast for 2-3 minutes until fragrant and slightly golden. Remove from heat and let cool.
  12. After 12 minutes of cooking, turn off heat but leave lid on rice for 4 minutes.
  13. Remove lid carefully and fluff rice with a spatula or fork.
  14. Place large pan over medium-high heat and add peanut oil (or vegetable oil).
  15. Fry chicken in batches for 6-7 minutes until browned and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
  16. Add bell peppers and chilies (optional) to the pan and cook for 5 minutes until slightly softened.
  17. Add spring onion white root and cook for 2 minutes.
  18. Return chicken and any resting juices to the pan. Mix well and cook for 1 minute.
  19. Pour in the marinade, scraping the bottom of the bowl to incorporate all the sauce.
  20. Mix well and cook for 1 minute, allowing the sauce to thicken.
  21. Add toasted peanuts (optional) and mix well.
  22. Remove from heat and serve. Garnish with spring onion green stem if desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pkn3Fgxz-Lw

lamb_rogan_josh.txt - Lamb Rogan Josh

Objectives

  • Learn to make a traditional Rogan Josh curry.
  • Marinate lamb for maximum tenderness and flavor.
  • Create a flavorful spice paste for a deep red color and rich aroma.

Ingredients

  • 750 grams (1.6 pounds) diced lamb leg
  • 3/4 cup (170 grams) natural Greek yogurt
  • 1.5 teaspoons (7.5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 3 shallots, thinly sliced
  • 4 large garlic cloves, minced
  • 15 grams (0.7 ounces) peeled ginger, minced
  • 2 tablespoons (14 grams) Kashmiri chili powder
  • 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) ground fennel
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1.5 grams) ground ginger
  • 3/4 cup (180 milliliters) cold water
  • 2 tablespoons (28 grams) clarified butter or ghee
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) canola oil
  • 1 cinnamon stick
  • 5 whole cardamom pods
  • 4 whole cloves
  • 1.5 teaspoons (4.5 grams) whole cumin seeds
  • 3 dried bay leaves
  • 1 cup (200 grams) washed basmati rice
  • 2 cups (500 milliliters) cold water
  • 10 sprigs of saffron (optional)
  • Small pinch of sea salt flakes
  • Fresh coriander or cilantro (optional)
  • Additional Greek yogurt or labna (optional)

Instructions

  1. In a mixing bowl, combine the diced lamb, Greek yogurt, and salt. Mix well to ensure the yogurt coats the lamb.
  2. Cover the bowl tightly and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, up to 24 hours.
  3. Thinly slice the shallots into half-moon shapes.
  4. Grate the garlic and ginger using a microplane or box grater to create a paste.
  5. In a jar or bowl, combine the Kashmiri chili powder, ground fennel, ground ginger, and cold water. Mix well with a fork or whisk.
  6. Heat a large pan or pot over medium-high heat. Add the clarified butter or ghee and canola oil.
  7. Once the ghee is melted, add the cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, cumin seeds, and bay leaves. Fry for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally, to release their flavors.
  8. Add the thinly sliced shallots and fry for 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until they start to caramelize.
  9. Add the garlic and ginger paste and fry for 1 minute, stirring constantly, to release the fragrance.
  10. Add the marinated lamb, scraping in all of the yogurt. Mix well to coat the ingredients. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, to brown the meat.
  11. Pour in enough hot water to just reach the top of the ingredients. Mix well to combine the flavors.
  12. Bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40 minutes.
  13. Remove the lid, being careful of the steam. Pour in the spice mix slurry and stir well.
  14. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
  15. While the curry is simmering, heat a saucepan over high heat. Add the washed basmati rice, cold water, saffron (optional), and salt. Mix well.
  16. Bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover, and steam for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  17. Turn off the heat and allow the rice to steam for an additional 4 minutes with the lid on.
  18. Remove the lid, being careful of the steam, and fluff the rice with a spatula or fork.
  19. Remove the lid from the curry, being careful of the steam. Stir well.
  20. Check the seasoning of the curry, adjusting as needed. Remove from the heat.
  21. To serve, place a portion of the saffron rice in a bowl. Add a piece of tender lamb on top of the rice. Pour the curry sauce over the lamb and rice. Garnish with a spoonful of Greek yogurt or labna and fresh coriander or cilantro (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nv9wO3PNjLM

lamb_shank_braised_cumin_maple_glaze.txt - Braised Lamb Shanks with Cumin and Maple Glaze

Objectives

  • Create a rich, flavorful braised lamb shank dish.
  • Learn to sear lamb shanks for optimal browning.
  • Develop a flavorful sauce with cumin, maple syrup, and chicken stock.
  • Incorporate roasted nuts and chickpeas for added texture and flavor.

Ingredients

  • 2 brown or yellow onions, peeled and chopped
  • 5 cloves garlic, peeled and roughly chopped
  • 1 large red chili, thinly sliced (optional)
  • ½ bunch silver beet (chard), sliced or quartered
  • 40 grams pistachio nuts, roughly chopped
  • 4 lamb shanks
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 ½ tablespoons whole cumin seeds
  • ¼ cup + 2 teaspoons maple syrup
  • 2 ¼ cups chicken stock
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 40 grams flaked almonds
  • 1 can (400 grams) rinsed chickpeas
  • Chopped parsley (optional)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Slice onions in half, then into quarters, rotate 90 degrees, and slice into even-sized chunks.
  3. Crush garlic cloves with the side of a knife.
  4. Roughly chop chili, if using.
  5. Slice silver beet into quarters or halves.
  6. Roughly chop pistachio nuts.
  7. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
  8. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pot.
  9. Sear lamb shanks in batches for 6 minutes each, ensuring browning on all sides.
  10. Remove seared lamb shanks and set aside.
  11. Add chopped onions to the pot and sauté for 2 minutes until slightly browned.
  12. Add 1 ½ tablespoons of cumin seeds and roughly chopped garlic.
  13. Sauté for 1 minute until cumin is toasted and garlic is fragrant.
  14. Add sliced chili (optional), ¼ cup + 2 teaspoons maple syrup, 2 ¼ cups chicken stock, and sea salt flakes to taste.
  15. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  16. Arrange lamb shanks in the pot, ensuring they are not stacked on top of each other.
  17. Add additional chicken stock to cover the bottom of the lamb shanks.
  18. Cover the pot with a lid or foil and bake for 1 hour undisturbed.
  19. After 1 hour, carefully remove the pot from the oven and place it on the stovetop.
  20. Remove the lid and gently stir the sauce to ensure even flavor development.
  21. Flip the lamb shanks so the opposite side is facing up.
  22. Replace the lid and return the pot to the oven for another hour of braising.
  23. While the lamb is braising, heat a pan over high heat.
  24. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil, chopped pistachios, flaked almonds, and a pinch of sea salt.
  25. Toast the nuts for 1 ½ to 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until golden brown.
  26. Remove the nuts from the pan and let them cool.
  27. After the second hour of braising, carefully remove the pot from the oven and place it on the stovetop.
  28. Remove the lid and gently scoop the lamb shanks onto a plate, setting them aside.
  29. Bring the sauce to a boil and add chopped silver beet.
  30. Stir regularly and cook for 2 minutes until the silver beet is wilted and soft.
  31. Add rinsed chickpeas and stir.
  32. Cook for 1 minute to ensure the chickpeas are heated through.
  33. Adjust seasoning as needed.
  34. Remove the pot from the stovetop.
  35. Arrange wilted silver beet on plates.
  36. Top with braised lamb shanks, chickpeas, and sauce.
  37. Garnish with toasted nut mix and chopped parsley, if desired.
  38. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zmTe2S3U70k

lamb_shanks_recipe.txt - Melt-in-Your-Mouth Lamb Shanks

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful and tender lamb shank recipe
  • Master the art of braising for succulent meat
  • Create a delicious side dish of snake beans or green beans

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion (remove tip and root, save scraps for stock)
  • 2 medium carrots (save scraps for stock)
  • 1 rib celery
  • 3 small to medium potatoes
  • 4 cloves garlic (peeled)
  • 7 grams fresh thyme (roughly chopped)
  • 200 grams snake beans or green beans
  • 4 lamb shanks (1.6 kg total)
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 500 ml cheap red wine (or vegetable/chicken stock)
  • 1 liter chicken or vegetable stock (chicken preferred)
  • 2 tablespoons whole cumin seeds
  • 1.5 tablespoons whole fennel seeds
  • 3 bay leaves
  • 2 sprigs rosemary
  • 1.5 tablespoons dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 2 teaspoons black pepper
  • 2 tablespoons hot water
  • 1 tablespoon clarified butter

Instructions

  1. Roughly chop onion, carrots, celery, potatoes, and thyme. Crush garlic cloves.
  2. Slice snake beans in half (or remove stems from green beans).
  3. Heat a large pot over high heat. Add olive oil.
  4. Sear lamb shanks in batches until golden brown. Set aside.
  5. Add chopped onion, celery, and carrots to the pot. Sauté for 2 minutes.
  6. Add potatoes, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Sauté for 2 minutes.
  7. Stir in tomato paste, red wine (or stock), chicken stock, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, bay leaves, rosemary, oregano, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper.
  8. Return seared lamb shanks to the pot. Cover and transfer to a preheated oven at 180°C/350°F. Braise for 3.5 hours.
  9. Remove from oven and carefully strain braising liquid through a sieve into a saucepan.
  10. Return lamb shanks and solids from the sieve to the pot.
  11. Bring strained sauce to a boil over high heat. Reduce for 25-30 minutes until thickened.
  12. Heat a large pan over high heat. Add snake beans (or green beans), hot water, salt, and pepper. Steam for 2 minutes.
  13. Add clarified butter to the beans. Sauté for 1 minute.
  14. Arrange beans, braised vegetables, and lamb shanks on a plate. Spoon over lamb sauce.
  15. Flake lamb off the bone and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZiynakMxs9o

lasagna_recipe.txt - Easy Lasagna

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy lasagna.
  • Prepare a rich meat sauce with vegetables and herbs.
  • Create a creamy béchamel sauce.
  • Assemble and bake the lasagna for a satisfying meal.

Ingredients

Vegetables:

  • 2 medium onions, diced
  • 1 stalk celery, diced
  • 3 small carrots, diced
  • 6 cloves garlic, sliced or minced

Herbs:

  • 6 grams fresh oregano, roughly chopped
  • 3 sprigs rosemary, roughly chopped
  • 4 sprigs thyme, roughly chopped
  • 10 grams fresh basil, roughly chopped

Meat and Sauce:

  • 220 grams streaky bacon, sliced into strips
  • 500 grams beef mince (can substitute with pork mince)
  • 1 tablespoon sea salt flakes
  • 2 teaspoons black pepper
  • 300 ml cheap red wine (can substitute with beef, chicken, or vegetable stock)
  • 230 grams sun-dried tomatoes (optional, chopped)
  • 1.2 kg tin diced tomatoes
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon black pepper

Bechamel Sauce:

  • 900 ml full fat milk
  • 1 small brown onion, sliced in half (for onion clove)
  • 2 dried or fresh bay leaves
  • 90 grams unsalted butter
  • 90 grams plain flour
  • 1 - 1.5 cups fresh Parmesan cheese
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes

Assembly:

  • 350 grams lasagna sheets (instant sheets)
  • Unsalted butter, for greasing

Instructions

  1. Dice onions, celery, and carrots into medium-sized pieces. Slice garlic thinly or mince.
  2. Roughly chop oregano, rosemary, and thyme. Scrunch up basil leaves.
  3. Slice bacon into thin strips, then dice into medium-sized pieces.
  4. Heat olive oil in a large pot over high heat. Add bacon and fry for 1 minute, until slightly golden.
  5. Add onions, celery, carrots, garlic, oregano, rosemary, and thyme. Stir and fry for 8 minutes, until vegetables soften slightly.
  6. Add beef mince, 1 tablespoon salt, and 2 teaspoons pepper. Mix well and cook for 5-6 minutes, until mince is brown and no longer pink.
  7. Pour in red wine and bring to a boil for 5 minutes to cook out the alcohol.
  8. Add sun-dried tomatoes (if using), basil, and diced tomatoes. Mix well and season with 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon pepper.
  9. Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes.
  10. After 45 minutes, remove the lid, stir, and continue simmering for another 45 minutes.
  11. After 1 hour and 45 minutes, remove the lid, stir, and simmer for an additional 15 minutes.
  12. Remove the sauce from heat and allow it to rest.
  13. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
  14. For béchamel sauce, heat milk with onion clove (onion half with bay leaves secured with cloves) over medium heat until just under simmering point.
  15. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and mix to form a paste (roux). Cook for 2 minutes, stirring regularly.
  16. Remove onion clove from milk. Gradually add hot milk to roux, stirring constantly until fully incorporated.
  17. Remove from heat, stir in Parmesan cheese and 1 teaspoon salt.
  18. Grease a large oven tray with butter.
  19. Spoon 3 ladles of meat sauce into the bottom of the tray.
  20. Lay lasagna sheets over the sauce, avoiding too much overlap.
  21. Pour 2 cups of béchamel sauce over the lasagna sheets and spread evenly.
  22. Add another layer of meat sauce, spreading evenly.
  23. Optionally, sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the second layer of sauce.
  24. Repeat layers of lasagna sheets, béchamel sauce, and meat sauce until you have a third layer of lasagna sheets.
  25. Pour remaining béchamel sauce over the top layer and spread evenly.
  26. Grate 1-1.5 cups of Parmesan cheese over the top, covering the surface.
  27. Cover the tray with aluminum foil, sealing tightly.
  28. Bake for 45 minutes.
  29. Carefully remove foil and grate additional Parmesan cheese over the top.
  30. Bake for 25-30 minutes more, or until golden and crispy.
  31. Let the lasagna rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
  32. Garnish with a basil leaf and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2SSME8MB3jg

lasagna_traditional.txt - Traditional Lasagna

Objectives

  • Prepare a classic lasagna with traditional ingredients.
  • Create a flavorful meat sauce with vegetables, pork, and beef.
  • Make a smooth béchamel sauce.
  • Assemble and bake a layered lasagna with meat sauce, pasta sheets, béchamel, and cheese.

Ingredients

  • Brown onion
  • Celery
  • Carrots
  • Olive oil
  • Salt
  • Pork
  • Beef
  • Red wine
  • Seasoning
  • Tomatoes
  • Beef stock
  • Butter
  • Flour
  • Milk
  • Nutmeg
  • Salt
  • Pepper
  • Parmesan cheese
  • Fresh lasagna sheets
  • Mozzarella cheese

Instructions

  1. Dice brown onion, celery, and carrots into uniform sizes.
  2. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  3. Add the diced vegetables and salt, fry for 5 minutes.
  4. Add pork and beef, break it up and cook for another 5 minutes until no longer pink.
  5. Add red wine and seasoning, mix and reduce for 2 minutes.
  6. Add tomatoes, cover with a lid and cook for 1 hour over low heat.
  7. Remove the lid, add beef stock, mix and cook for another hour.
  8. Melt butter in a separate pan.
  9. Add flour to make a roux and cook for 1 minute.
  10. Slowly add milk until a smooth béchamel sauce forms.
  11. Grate nutmeg, salt, pepper, and Parmesan cheese into the béchamel sauce.
  12. Oil a baking tray.
  13. Spread the meat sauce over the tray.
  14. Layer fresh lasagna sheets over the meat sauce.
  15. Spread the béchamel sauce over the lasagna sheets.
  16. Add another layer of meat sauce.
  17. Grate mozzarella cheese over the meat sauce.
  18. Repeat steps 14-17 to create 3 layers.
  19. Bake covered at 180°C for 30 minutes.
  20. Remove the cover, add more mozzarella cheese and bake for another 10 minutes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2ohMLqSqfHk

lebanese_toum.txt - Lebanese Toum

Objectives

  • Learn how to make Lebanese Toum, a delicious garlic paste.
  • Understand the importance of slow and steady mixing to create a smooth emulsion.
  • Discover versatile uses for Toum, from bread spreads to dips for meats and vegetables.

Ingredients

  • 30 cloves of fresh garlic (160 grams)
  • 1 large fresh lemon
  • 3 cups (750 ml) of sunflower, canola, or safflower oil (not olive oil)
  • 2 teaspoons (10 grams) of sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Remove the root from the garlic cloves.
  2. Squeeze the juice from the lemon, discarding any seeds.
  3. In a food processor, blend the garlic cloves until finely minced.
  4. Add the sea salt flakes to the minced garlic and blend until a paste forms.
  5. With the food processor running on high speed, slowly add the lemon juice, one teaspoon (5 ml) at a time.
  6. Continue blending while slowly adding the oil, half a cup (125 ml) at a time.
  7. Repeat steps 5 and 6, adding the remaining lemon juice and oil until fully incorporated.
  8. Stir the mixture occasionally if the oil starts to separate.
  9. Transfer the Toum to an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to one month, or freeze for up to six months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eGJzLQFiQ6U

leek_soup_bacon_apple_sage.txt - Creamy Garlic Buttery Leek Soup with Bacon Apple and Sage Crust

Objectives

  • Create a creamy garlic buttery leek soup.
  • Prepare a bacon apple and sage crust topping.
  • Combine the soup and crust for a flavorful dish.
  • Serve with crusty toasted bread.

Ingredients

Soup: - 4 large leeks (green tips removed, washed) - 4 small all-rounder potatoes (or 3 large) - 3 large garlic cloves (peeled, woody roots removed) - 1 liter (4 cups) vegetable or chicken stock (or both) - 180 ml (3/4 cup) thickened cream or whipping cream - 3 tablespoons (42 grams) clarified butter or unsalted butter - Salt and pepper to taste

Crust: - 120 grams (4.2 ounces) streaky bacon (from pork belly) - 1 large apple (peeled, cored) - 15 sage leaves (total weight 12 grams or 0.4 ounces) - 1 tablespoon (14 grams) clarified butter or unsalted butter

Instructions

  1. Prepare the leeks:
    • Remove the green tips and wash leeks.
    • Slice off the root and green stems (save for stock).
    • Slice each leek in half lengthwise.
    • Slice thinly across the width of the leeks.
  2. Prepare the potatoes:
    • Slice into 3-4 even sized chunks.
    • Slice each chunk in half lengthwise.
    • Rotate 90 degrees and make 3-4 even slices across (creating cubes).
  3. Prepare the garlic:
    • Crush garlic cloves with the side of a knife.
    • Roughly chop the garlic.
  4. Prepare the bacon:
    • Slice bacon into medium strips lengthwise.
    • Dice the strips into medium to large pieces.
  5. Prepare the apple:
    • Peel and core the apple.
    • Slice the apple into chunks.
    • Slice each chunk in half.
    • Lay flat and slice into 3-4 even slices across.
    • Dice into small cubes.
  6. Prepare the sage:
    • Stack sage leaves and slice into even strips (or leave whole if leaves are small).
  7. Make the soup:
    • Heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
    • Add butter and melt.
    • Add sliced leeks and chopped garlic.
    • Sauté for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.
    • Add cubed potatoes, salt, and pepper.
    • Sauté for 1 minute, stirring regularly.
    • Pour in stock.
    • Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low.
    • Simmer for 30 minutes, covered.
    • Remove lid and stir in cream.
    • Cook for 1 minute.
    • Use an immersion blender to blend the soup (or cool and blend in a food processor).
  8. Make the crust:
    • Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
    • Add butter and melt.
    • Add diced bacon.
    • Cook for 30 seconds, stirring.
    • Add diced apple.
    • Cook for 3-3.5 minutes, stirring frequently, until bacon is golden and apples caramelize slightly.
    • Reduce heat to low and cook for 1 minute, stirring regularly.
    • Add chopped sage.
    • Increase heat to medium-high and cook for 1 minute, stirring frequently.
  9. Serve:
    • Ladle soup into bowls.
    • Top with bacon apple sage mixture.
    • Garnish with cracked black pepper.
    • Serve with crusty toasted bread.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sGJjOHImtnY

lemon_aioli.txt - Lemon Aioli

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a quick and easy lemon aioli.
  • Understand the importance of whisking continuously for a smooth emulsion.
  • Discover how to adjust the flavor of the aioli with lemon juice.

Ingredients

  • 1 large egg yolk
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 teaspoon (10 grams) Dijon mustard
  • 60 milliliters extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 lemon
  • Salt to taste

Instructions

  1. Secure a bowl with a damp tea towel.
  2. Add one large egg yolk to the bowl.
  3. Run one clove of garlic along a fine microplane to create a paste.
  4. Add the garlic paste to the bowl.
  5. Add one teaspoon (10 grams) of Dijon mustard.
  6. Whisk to combine until everything is smooth.
  7. While continuously whisking, slowly pour in 60 milliliters of extra virgin olive oil to create an emulsion.
  8. Continue whisking until the mixture looks smooth and emulsified.
  9. Slice one lemon in half and extract the juice, either using a citrus juicer or by hand.
  10. Add the lemon juice to the aioli and adjust the flavor accordingly.
  11. Mix to combine until smooth.
  12. Season to taste and mix through.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kglsha8cAVQ

lemon_chicken.txt - Lemon Chicken

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and easy lemon chicken recipe.
  • Prepare perfectly cooked rice and pan-fried vegetables.
  • Provide nutritional information for each serving.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- 2 heads broccoli | 西兰花 (xī lán huā) 250 grams green beans | 青豆 (qīng dòu) 2 lemons | 柠檬 (níng méng) 1 kilo boneless, skinless chicken thighs | 鸡胸肉 (jī xiōng ròu) 125 milliliters chicken stock | 鸡汤 (jī tāng) 3 cloves garlic | 大蒜 (dà suàn) 80 milliliters honey | 蜂蜜 (fēng mì) 2.5 grams onion powder | 洋葱粉 (yáng cōng fěn) 30 milliliters soy sauce | 酱油 (jiàng yóu) 10 milliliters sesame oil | 芝麻油 (zhī má yóu) 12 grams corn flour | 玉米淀粉 (yù mǐ diàn fěn) 350 grams basmati rice | 香米 (xiāng mǐ) 700 milliliters cold water | 冷水 (lěng shuǐ) 30 milliliters olive oil | 橄榄油 (gǎn lǎn yóu) 5 grams white sesame seeds | 白芝麻 (bái zhī má) 5 grams black sesame seeds | 黑芝麻 (hēi zhī má) Sea salt flakes | 海盐 (hǎi yán) Cracked black pepper | 黑胡椒 (hēi hú jiāo)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the broccoli by removing the florets and trimming them into bite-sized pieces. Save the stems for later.
  2. Trim the green beans by removing the top and tail, then chop them in half if desired.
  3. Slice the lemons in half and juice them, discarding the seeds.
  4. Slice the chicken thighs into strips, then dice them into bite-sized pieces.
  5. Make the sauce by combining chicken stock, minced garlic, lemon juice, honey, onion powder, soy sauce, sesame oil, and corn flour in a bowl. Whisk until well combined.
  6. Season the sauce with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper to taste.
  7. Cook the rice by adding basmati rice, cold water, and sea salt flakes to a saucepan. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and cook for 14 minutes.
  8. While the rice cooks, heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the broccoli and stems, season with sea salt flakes, and sauté for 3-4 minutes until golden brown.
  9. Add the green beans to the pan and continue sautéing for 3 minutes.
  10. Add cracked black pepper and 80 milliliters of water to the pan, cover, and steam for 2 minutes.
  11. Remove the lid and mix the vegetables. Set aside.
  12. After 14 minutes, turn off the heat for the rice and let it rest for 4 minutes with the lid on. Fluff the rice with a fork.
  13. Heat olive oil in the same pan used for the vegetables over high heat. Add the chicken and spread it evenly across the bottom of the pan.
  14. Season the chicken with sea salt flakes and cook for 10 minutes, stirring regularly, until cooked through and golden brown.
  15. Add the sauce mixture to the pan and stir for 1.5-2 minutes until the sauce boils and thickens.
  16. Optional: add white and black sesame seeds to the sauce for added flavor and color.
  17. Season the chicken and sauce with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper to taste.
  18. Serve the lemon chicken over the rice and alongside the pan-fried vegetables.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ZdaEdo73cs

lemon_vinaigrette.txt - Lemon Vinaigrette

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious lemon vinaigrette dressing
  • Understand how to create an emulsion with olive oil

Ingredients

  • 1 lemon (zest and juice)
  • 1 clove garlic (minced)
  • 1 tablespoon (20 grams) Dijon mustard
  • 1 tablespoon (20 grams) whole grain mustard
  • 1 tablespoon (30 grams) honey
  • 3 grams (0.1 ounces) chopped oregano
  • 1/3 cup (80 milliliters) red wine vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1/2 cup (120 milliliters) extra virgin olive oil

Instructions

  1. Add the zest and juice of one lemon, one clove of minced garlic, one tablespoon of Dijon mustard, one tablespoon of whole grain mustard, one tablespoon of honey, 3 grams of chopped oregano, 1/3 cup of red wine vinegar, one teaspoon of sea salt flakes, and one teaspoon of black pepper to a mixing bowl.
  2. Whisk the ingredients together until well combined.
  3. While continuously whisking, slowly pour in 1/2 cup of extra virgin olive oil to create an emulsion.
  4. Continue whisking until the dressing has a creamy consistency.
  5. Pour the dressing into a bottle, jar, or other storage container.
  6. Close the container tightly with a lid.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oJ1WGfq2JaQ

loaded_hasselback_potatoes.txt - Loaded Hasselback Potatoes

Objectives

  • Learn how to make loaded hasselback potatoes with crispy bacon and guacamole
  • Master the technique of evenly slicing potatoes for consistent cooking
  • Understand the importance of preheating the oven for optimal results

Ingredients

  • 4 white potatoes
  • 3 slices cold salted butter (1 tsp or 7g)
  • 1 tsp sea salt flakes (5g)
  • 1 tsp black pepper (10 cracks)
  • 4 rashers of streaky bacon (220g or 7.7 oz)
  • 1 large ripe avocado
  • 1 small red onion
  • 2 small tomatoes or 1 large tomato
  • 1 lime
  • 1 tsp sea salt flakes (5g)
  • 1 tsp black pepper (10 cracks)
  • 1 spring onion or scallion
  • American cheddar or mozzarella cheese (amount to taste)
  • Sour cream (amount to taste)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Prepare potatoes:
    • Insert skewers or chopsticks into each potato to prevent slicing all the way through.
    • Slice potatoes thinly, leaving a small gap at the ends to avoid cutting them off completely.
    • Place potatoes on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, leaving space between each one.
  3. Season potatoes:
    • Place 3 slices of cold salted butter evenly on each potato.
    • Season with 1 tsp sea salt flakes and 1 tsp black pepper per potato.
  4. Bake potatoes:
    • Bake for 45-50 minutes, rotating the tray halfway through.
  5. Cook bacon:
    • Slice bacon in half lengthwise, then rotate 90 degrees and dice into small pieces.
    • Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add the bacon.
    • Fry for 4-5 minutes, stirring regularly, until crispy.
    • Remove bacon from the pan and set aside to cool.
  6. Make guacamole:
    • Cut a slice into the avocado until you feel the seed.
    • Carefully run a knife around the avocado to make a smooth opening.
    • Twist open the avocado and remove the seed.
    • Scoop the avocado flesh into a mixing bowl.
    • Mash the avocado with a fork to your desired consistency.
    • Dice the red onion and tomato into small pieces.
    • Squeeze the juice from the lime into the avocado.
    • Add 1 tsp sea salt flakes and 1 tsp black pepper to the avocado (optional).
    • Mix all ingredients well.
  7. Assemble loaded potatoes:
    • Remove potatoes from the oven and place on a heat-resistant surface.
    • Place 3 slices of American cheddar or mozzarella cheese evenly on each potato.
    • Grate more cheese over the potatoes.
    • Top with the crispy bacon, distributing evenly.
    • Drizzle any leftover bacon fat over the potatoes.
    • Season with a sprinkle of sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper.
  8. Bake again:
    • Bake for 5 minutes to melt the cheese.
  9. Serve:
    • Place potatoes on a serving board or plate.
    • Top with sour cream, thinly sliced spring onion, and guacamole.
    • Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vKkKAZSauc4

loaded_potato_bites.txt - Loaded Potato Bites

Objectives

  • Create a budget-friendly and delicious meal prep option.
  • Prepare flavorful potato bites with a rich beef mix.
  • Utilize simple ingredients and techniques for a satisfying dish.

Ingredients

  • 1.2 kilos (2.6 pounds) potatoes, washed with peels
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 3 spring onions (scallions)
  • 2 teaspoons (10 ml) olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sweet paprika
  • 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) cumin
  • 1 teaspoon (1 gram) dried oregano
  • 1/2 teaspoon (0.5 grams) red chili powder (optional)
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 10 cracks of black pepper
