  • 500 grams (1.1 pounds) beef mince (ground beef)
  • 1.5 teaspoons (3.5 grams) ground cumin
  • 2 teaspoons (2 grams) dried Italian herbs
  • 2 cans diced tomatoes
  • 120 grams (4.2 ounces) freshly grated mozzarella cheese
  • Sour cream (optional)
  • Hot sauce (optional)
  • Sriracha mayo (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice the potatoes into large even pieces.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, combine potatoes with olive oil, onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, cumin, oregano, red chili powder (optional), salt, and black pepper.
  3. Massage the potatoes until well coated.
  4. Spread the potatoes on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, ensuring they are not overlapping.
  5. Bake in a preheated oven at 190°C (375°F) for 45 minutes, flipping them halfway through.
  6. While the potatoes bake, heat a large pan over high heat and add olive oil.
  7. Once the oil is hot, add the beef mince and fry for 5-6 minutes, breaking up any clumps, and season with salt.
  8. Once the beef has released most of its water, add the minced garlic, spring onion stems, cumin, Italian herbs, salt, and black pepper.
  9. Mix well and continue frying for 2 minutes.
  10. Add the diced tomatoes, mix well, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  11. After 10 minutes, sprinkle grated mozzarella cheese over the beef mix, ensuring it covers the surface, and season with additional black pepper (optional).
  12. Cook for 1 minute until the cheese starts to melt.
  13. Remove the beef mix from the stovetop.
  14. Once the potatoes are golden and soft, remove from the oven and divide evenly into five meal prep containers.
  15. Divide the beef mix evenly into the containers.
  16. Top with sour cream (optional), garnish with green spring onion stems, and drizzle with hot sauce (optional) or Sriracha mayo (optional).
  17. Store the loaded potato bites in the refrigerator for up to 5 days or in the freezer for up to 4 months.
  18. Reheat in the microwave until hot before serving.
  19. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SgVZy67mF2M

loaded_potatoes.txt - Loaded Potatoes

Objectives

  • Prepare delicious and flavorful loaded potatoes.
  • Create a hearty beef mince topping for the potatoes.
  • Assemble the loaded potatoes with flavorful toppings.

Ingredients

  • 1.2 kilos diced potatoes
  • 2 teaspoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • 1 teaspoon oregano
  • 0.5 teaspoon chili powder
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • Cracked black pepper to taste
  • 2 teaspoons olive oil
  • 500 grams beef mince
  • 4 cloves minced garlic
  • 3 sliced spring onion stem ends
  • 1.5 teaspoons ground cumin
  • 2 teaspoons dried Italian herbs
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • Cracked black pepper to taste
  • 2 cans diced tomatoes
  • 120 grams mozzarella cheese
  • Sour cream
  • Green stem spring onion
  • Sriracha mayo

Instructions

  1. Place 1.2 kilos of diced potatoes in a bowl.
  2. Add 2 teaspoons of olive oil, 1 teaspoon each of onion and garlic powder, 1 teaspoon each of cumin and paprika, 1 teaspoon of oregano, 0.5 teaspoon of chili powder, sea salt flakes to taste, and cracked black pepper.
  3. Mix the potatoes thoroughly and place them on a lined baking tray.
  4. Bake at 190°C for 45 minutes.
  5. While the potatoes are baking, heat a pan over medium-high heat.
  6. Add 2 teaspoons of olive oil and 500 grams of beef mince to the pan.
  7. Sear the beef mince for 6 minutes.
  8. Add 4 cloves of minced garlic, 3 sliced spring onion stem ends, 1.5 teaspoons of ground cumin, 2 teaspoons of dried Italian herbs, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to taste.
  9. Cook for 2 minutes more.
  10. Add 2 cans of diced tomatoes and mix to combine.
  11. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
  12. Sprinkle 120 grams of mozzarella cheese over the beef mixture and allow it to melt.
  13. Season with pepper.
  14. Remove the potatoes from the oven.
  15. Divide the potatoes into five separate containers.
  16. Top each portion with the beef mixture, dividing it evenly.
  17. Finish with sour cream, green stem spring onion, and sriracha mayo.
  18. Enjoy your delicious loaded potatoes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uUqIaAZZeFM

low_mean_noodles.txt - Low Mean Noodles

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful and easy low mean noodles dish
  • Understand how to prepare and cook chicken, vegetables, and noodles
  • Master the art of stir-frying ingredients for optimal taste and texture

Ingredients

  • 400 grams (14.1 ounces) egg noodles, fresh (or cooked noodles)
  • 300 grams (10.5 ounces) boneless, skinless chicken thigh, thinly sliced
  • 3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced or minced
  • 1/4 Chinese cabbage (wombok), shredded
  • 1 large carrot, washed, topped, tailed, sliced in half, then julienned
  • 2-3 spring onions (scallions), sliced into 3 cm strips
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) peanut oil
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil
  • 2 tablespoons (40 ml) regular or light soy sauce
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) dark soy sauce
  • 1 teaspoon (5 ml) toasted sesame oil
  • 1/4 teaspoon (3 grams) granulated sugar
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) mung beans (bean sprouts)
  • Optional: salt, pepper, spring onion (scallion) garnish, chili garnish

Instructions

  1. Bring a saucepan of water to a boil over high heat.
  2. Add fresh egg noodles and cook for one minute less than the packet instructions, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
  3. Drain the cooked noodles in a colander.
  4. Thinly slice the boneless, skinless chicken thighs, ensuring consistent size for even cooking.
  5. Heat a wok or large pan over high heat.
  6. Add 1.5 tablespoons of peanut oil and heat until smoking hot.
  7. Stir-fry the thinly sliced chicken for 2-3 minutes, or until lightly golden, mixing regularly.
  8. Remove the chicken and set aside in a bowl or plate.
  9. Return the wok or pan to high heat.
  10. Add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil and heat until smoking hot.
  11. Add the sliced or minced garlic and stir-fry for 10 seconds.
  12. Add the shredded Chinese cabbage and julienned carrot, stir-fry for 1.5-2 minutes, until lightly softened and cabbage is lightly golden brown.
  13. Return the cooked chicken and resting juices to the wok or pan.
  14. Add the cooked noodles and break them up, ensuring everything is evenly distributed.
  15. Cook for 1 minute, mixing constantly.
  16. For the sauce, add 2 tablespoons of regular or light soy sauce, 1/4 cup of dark soy sauce, 1 teaspoon of toasted sesame oil, and 1/4 teaspoon of granulated sugar.
  17. Mix well to combine the sauce and cook for 1 minute.
  18. Add the mung beans (bean sprouts) and spring onion (scallion) to the wok.
  19. Mix thoroughly and cook for 1 final minute, ensuring everything is saucy.
  20. Remove from the stovetop and serve in bowls, plates, or straight from the wok.
  21. Garnish with additional spring onion (scallion) and chili, if desired.
  22. Enjoy your delicious low mean noodles!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Oy7kyhtzsYY

makefile.win_shortcut.txt - Makefile.win Shortcut

Objectives

  • Learn how to create a shortcut for Makefile.win
  • Understand the importance of shortcuts in saving time and effort
  • Explore the benefits of using shortcuts for efficient work

Instructions

  1. Open the folder where Makefile.win is located.
  2. Right-click on the Makefile.win file.
  3. Select "Create shortcut" from the context menu.
  4. The shortcut will be created in the same folder.
  5. You can now drag and drop the shortcut to your desktop or any other location for easy access.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NasFd7TYjOI

marry_me_chicken.txt - Marry Me Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful and easy Marry Me Chicken dish.
  • Master the technique of searing chicken for a crispy exterior.
  • Create a rich and creamy sauce to complement the chicken.

Ingredients

  • 1 onion, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, grated
  • 1 tablespoon thyme, chopped
  • 1 tablespoon oregano, chopped
  • 1 whole chicken, butterflied and sliced into fillets
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Oil
  • Sun-dried tomato oil
  • Butter
  • Chicken stock
  • Wine (optional)
  • Dijon mustard
  • Cream
  • Sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
  • Dry chili flakes (optional)
  • Parmesan cheese, grated
  • Basil, chopped
  • Cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Dice the onion into small to medium-sized pieces.
  2. Grate the garlic along a microplane to create a paste.
  3. Roughly chop the thyme and oregano.
  4. Butterfly the chicken and slice it into even fillets.
  5. Place the chicken in a bowl, season generously with salt and pepper, and add a little bit of oil. Mix to combine.
  6. Add the sun-dried tomato oil to a pan over medium-high heat.
  7. Sear the chicken in batches for about 3.5 minutes on each side.
  8. Add butter and onions to the pan along with a pinch of salt. Cook for 4 minutes until golden.
  9. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
  10. Deglaze the pan with stock or wine and cook for another minute.
  11. Stir in the Dijon mustard.
  12. Add chicken stock, cream, sun-dried tomatoes, dry chili flakes (optional), and parmesan cheese. Stir to combine.
  13. Cook over medium-low heat for 6 minutes, seasoning along the way.
  14. Add the chopped oregano, thyme, and basil. Mix thoroughly.
  15. Add the chicken back to the pan and combine with the sauce.
  16. Adjust seasonings one last time.
  17. Serve in bowls, covering with plenty of sauce.
  18. Garnish with basil, parmesan cheese, and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wdDbGKxewoY

mashed_potato.txt - Mashed Potato

Objectives

  • Learn to make creamy mashed potatoes in 30 minutes.
  • Understand the importance of using high-starch potatoes.
  • Discover different methods for achieving a smooth consistency.

Ingredients

  • 1 kg high-starch potatoes
  • Salt
  • 180 ml warmed milk
  • 50 g softened unsalted butter
  • Ground white pepper

Instructions

  1. Peel and slice high-starch potatoes in half.
  2. Place the potatoes in a pot with cold, salted water.
  3. Bring the water to a boil and cook the potatoes for 25 minutes until fork tender.
  4. Drain the potatoes and pass them through a potato ricer, a masher, or a blender.
  5. Add warmed milk and softened unsalted butter to the mashed potatoes.
  6. Mix until the ingredients are well combined and the desired consistency is reached.
  7. Season with salt and ground white pepper to taste.
  8. Mix well until everything is combined.
  9. Serve on plates and use as a bed for any desired dish.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nPyKWBMt-L0

mashed_potato_with_brown_garlic_butter.txt - Mashed Potato with Brown Garlic Butter

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and flavorful mashed potato with brown garlic butter.
  • Understand the importance of using high-starch potatoes for a fluffy texture.
  • Master the technique of creating brown garlic butter for an extra layer of flavor.

Ingredients

  • 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) of high-starch potatoes (e.g., Nukong Gold, Russet)
  • 1 tablespoon (13 grams) of sea salt flakes
  • 5 cloves of freshly peeled garlic
  • 3/4 cup (175 milliliters) of full-fat milk
  • 175 grams (6 ounces) of cubed salted butter
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) of sea salt flakes (for seasoning the mashed potatoes)

Instructions

  1. Peel the potatoes using a peeler or knife.
  2. Place the peeled potatoes in a large, heavy-based pot or saucepan.
  3. Fill the pot with cold water, ensuring the water level is 1 inch above the potatoes.
  4. Place the pot on the stovetop over high heat.
  5. Add 1 tablespoon of sea salt flakes to the water and bring to a boil.
  6. Once boiling, continue cooking for 22-24 minutes, or until the potatoes are extremely soft but not falling apart.
  7. While the potatoes are boiling, grate the garlic using a fine microplane or grater to create a paste.
  8. Once the potatoes are cooked, turn off the heat and remove the pot from the stovetop.
  9. Pour the potatoes into a strainer or colander, being careful of the steam.
  10. Allow the potatoes to drain and slightly dry out for 5-10 minutes.
  11. Place a small saucepan on the stovetop and pour in 3/4 cup of full-fat milk.
  12. Heat the milk over low heat until it's hot but not simmering or boiling.
  13. Place a large, heavy-based skillet on the stovetop over high heat.
  14. Add 175 grams of cubed salted butter to the skillet.
  15. Break up the butter so it's not all on top of each other.
  16. Continuously move the butter around and allow it to melt.
  17. Once the butter is melted, bring it to a boil.
  18. Once boiling, continuously mix the butter for 1.5 minutes, or until the surface starts to become foamy and bubbly.
  19. Turn the heat down to medium and add the minced garlic to the butter.
  20. Continuously mix the butter and garlic for 1.5-2 minutes, crisping up the garlic and creating a browned butter.
  21. Continue mixing until the whole surface of the butter is golden brown and the garlic is deep golden brown.
  22. Turn off the heat and remove the skillet from the stovetop.
  23. Allow the brown garlic butter to sit for 5 minutes.
  24. In the same pot used to boil the potatoes, use a potato ricer, potato masher, or handheld blender to mash the potatoes.
  25. Place a sieve over the mashed potatoes and pour in 3/4 of the brown garlic butter, reserving the remaining quarter for later.
  26. Gradually add the hot milk to the mashed potatoes, mixing well until you achieve your desired consistency.
  27. Thoroughly mix the mashed potatoes, butter, and milk until extremely smooth.
  28. Season the mashed potatoes with 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes, adjusting to taste.
  29. Serve the mashed potatoes on a plate or in a bowl, spreading it out to create rough edges and grooves.
  30. Spoon the brown garlic butter over the mashed potatoes, allowing the crispy garlic pieces to sit in the grooves.
  31. Spoon some brown garlic butter around the edges for presentation.
  32. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ywedj1SnD84

mayonnaise.txt - Mayonnaise

Objectives

  • Learn to make mayonnaise with an immersion blender.
  • Understand the key ingredients and proportions for a successful emulsion.
  • Learn how to store and use homemade mayonnaise.

Ingredients

  • 1 egg
  • 15 milliliters white vinegar
  • 10 grams Dijon mustard
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 180 milliliters neutral flavored oil
  • Salt to taste

Instructions

  1. Add one egg, 15 milliliters of white vinegar, 10 grams of Dijon mustard, one clove of garlic, 180 milliliters of neutral flavored oil, and salt to taste to a tall jar or container.
  2. Blend the ingredients together using an immersion blender until a smooth emulsion forms.
  3. Transfer the mayonnaise to a jar or container with a lid.
  4. Refrigerate the mayonnaise for up to five days.
  5. Use the mayonnaise for sandwiches, salads, or any other desired recipe.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5qMebg88BpU

mayo_sauce.txt - Mayo Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn to make a versatile mayo-based sauce
  • Combine simple ingredients to create a flavorful dipping sauce
  • Understand the importance of proper mixing and storage

Ingredients

  • 1 whole egg
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons white vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 200 milliliters flavorless olive oil
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons American mustard
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons sriracha hot sauce
  • 1 teaspoon oyster sauce
  • 1 tablespoon buttermilk

Instructions

  1. Add one whole egg, 1 1/2 teaspoons of white vinegar, 1 teaspoon of Dijon mustard, and 200 milliliters of flavorless olive oil to a tall jar or container.
  2. Using an immersion blender, whip the mixture until it forms a thick mayonnaise.
  3. Transfer the mayonnaise to a bowl or leave it in the jar.
  4. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of American mustard, 1 1/2 tablespoons of sriracha hot sauce, 1 teaspoon of oyster sauce, and 1 tablespoon of buttermilk to the mayonnaise.
  5. Mix thoroughly until all ingredients are combined and the sauce is a golden color.
  6. Store the sauce in the refrigerator for up to three days.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yUo2zz8SvYQ

meal_prep_chicken_caesar_salad.txt - Meal Prep Chicken Caesar Salad

Objectives

  • Prepare ingredients for a delicious meal prep chicken Caesar salad.
  • Learn to cook chicken and bacon for a salad.
  • Assemble the salad for individual meal prep containers.

Ingredients

  • 5 slices of bread (any kind, not banana bread)
  • 2 teaspoons of olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 6 rashers of bacon
  • 3 cos or Romaine lettuces
  • 3 butterfly chicken breasts
  • 1 tablespoon of olive oil
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Caesar dressing (prepared separately)

Instructions

  1. Tear the bread into pieces and place on a lined baking tray.
  2. Drizzle with 2 teaspoons of olive oil and season with salt flakes and cracked black pepper.
  3. Place 6 rashers of bacon on the baking tray with the bread.
  4. Bake in a 180°C oven for 12 minutes.
  5. Shred 3 cos or Romaine lettuces and wash them in a colander.
  6. Beat 3 butterfly chicken breasts with a meat mallet and season with sea salt flakes.
  7. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over high heat in a pan.
  8. Add the chicken breasts to the pan and sear for 3 minutes on each side.
  9. Crack black pepper over the chicken to taste.
  10. Remove the chicken from the pan and let it rest.
  11. Remove the croutons and bacon from the oven.
  12. Slice the chicken and bacon into strips.
  13. Place the lettuce in a large mixing bowl.
  14. Add the chicken, bacon, and croutons to the bowl and mix well.
  15. Divide the salad into 5 meal prep containers.
  16. Shave Parmesan cheese over the salad if desired.
  17. Add the Caesar dressing to each container and mix to combine.
  18. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jZ74xYb57to

meatballs_marinara.txt - Meatballs in Marinara Sauce

Objectives

  • Create flavorful meatballs with a combination of pork and beef.
  • Prepare a rich marinara sauce with garlic, tomatoes, and basil.
  • Cook spaghetti al dente and combine with the meatballs and sauce.

Ingredients

Meatballs - 500g pork mince - 500g beef mince - 2 whole eggs - 100g fine breadcrumbs - 100ml beef stock - 50g pecorino romano cheese (or parmesan) - 2 cloves garlic, peeled - Salt - Cracked black pepper - 5g flat leaf parsley (optional)

Marinara Sauce - 6 cloves garlic, crushed and chopped - 800g tomato puree or crushed tomatoes - 6 basil stalks - 2g dried chili flakes (optional) - Salt - Cracked black pepper - Sugar (optional)

Pasta - 400g spaghetti - Salt - 10-15g fresh basil leaves

Other - 3 tbsp olive oil - 10-15g pecorino romano or parmesan cheese

Instructions

  1. Combine pork mince, beef mince, eggs, breadcrumbs, beef stock, pecorino romano cheese, garlic, salt, pepper, and optional parsley in a bowl.
  2. Mix well, ensuring all ingredients are evenly combined.
  3. Form the mixture into approximately 3-inch meatballs.
  4. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  5. Add 3 tablespoons of olive oil to the pan and heat until shimmering.
  6. Carefully add the meatballs to the hot pan, working in batches if necessary.
  7. Sear the meatballs for approximately 3 minutes on each side, aiming for a golden brown crust.
  8. Remove the meatballs from the pan and set aside on a plate.
  9. Crush 6 cloves of garlic and roughly chop them.
  10. Add the chopped garlic to the same pan used for searing the meatballs.
  11. Fry the garlic for 1 minute, stirring continuously, until fragrant.
  12. Add 800g of tomato puree or crushed tomatoes to the pan and stir to combine.
  13. Add 6 basil stalks, 2g of dried chili flakes (optional), salt, pepper, and optional sugar to the sauce.
  14. Stir to combine all ingredients and bring the sauce to a simmer over low heat.
  15. Cook the sauce for 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
  16. Return the seared meatballs to the simmering sauce.
  17. Cook for an additional 10 minutes, ensuring the meatballs are cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
  18. Bring a pot of water to a boil and season generously with salt.
  19. Add 400g of spaghetti to the boiling water and cook for 30 seconds.
  20. Twist the spaghetti to break it into shorter strands.
  21. Cook the spaghetti for 1 minute less than the package instructions, ensuring it remains al dente.
  22. After 10-12 minutes, remove the meatballs from the sauce and set aside.
  23. Drain the cooked spaghetti and set aside for 1 minute.
  24. Add 10-15g of fresh basil leaves to the sauce and stir until slightly wilted.
  25. Transfer the cooked spaghetti into the sauce, ensuring it is evenly coated.
  26. Add a splash of pasta water to the sauce to create a smooth consistency.
  27. Stir the pasta and sauce together over low heat for 1-2 minutes, until fully combined.
  28. To serve, scoop the pasta and sauce into bowls.
  29. Top with meatballs, ensuring to get a good amount of basil and sauce.
  30. Garnish with pecorino romano or parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper, and torn fresh basil.
  31. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SCbi396YZ8Y

meatballs_rice_broccolini.txt - Meatballs with Rice and Broccolini

Objectives

  • Prepare flavorful and easy-to-make meatballs.
  • Learn a simple method for cooking rice in the oven.
  • Master stir-frying broccolini for a delicious side dish.
  • Combine all elements for a satisfying and nutritious meal prep.
  • Create a flavorful sriracha sauce for the meatballs.

Ingredients

Rice - 300 grams of washed basmati rice - 600 milliliters of boiling hot water - Salt to taste

Broccolini - 300 grams of broccolini - 1.5 tablespoons of peanut oil (or vegetable oil) - Sea salt flakes to taste - Ground white pepper to taste - 2 teaspoons of sesame oil

Meatballs - 1 kilo of lean beef mince - 2 whole eggs - 50 grams of Panko bread crumbs - 4 grams of garlic powder - 4 grams of onion powder - 1 gram of dried thyme - 1 gram of dried oregano - 60 grams of tomato ketchup - Sea salt flakes to taste - Cracked black pepper (about 30 cracks) - 1.5 tablespoons of peanut oil (or vegetable oil)

Sauce - 120 grams of sriracha sauce - 30 milliliters of apple cider vinegar - 60 milliliters of reduced sodium soy sauce - 50 grams of honey - Garlic and ginger paste (from 4 cloves of garlic and 15 grams of ginger)

Optional Garnish - Spring onion or scallion - Sesame seeds

Optional Topping - Sriracha mayo

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Prepare rice: Add washed basmati rice to a baking dish. Pour boiling hot water over rice, season with salt, and mix to break up clumps. Cover tightly with foil and bake for 25 minutes undisturbed.
  3. Prepare broccolini: Trim woody stems from broccolini and slice into even-sized pieces.
  4. Prepare garlic and ginger paste: Grate garlic and ginger on a fine microplane and mix together.
  5. Prepare meatballs: Combine beef mince, eggs, Panko breadcrumbs, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, oregano, tomato ketchup, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl. Mix well with clean hands or a spoon until smooth.
  6. Form meatballs: Divide meatball mixture into 15 equal portions (approximately 80 grams each). Roll each portion into a tight ball.
  7. Prepare sauce: Combine sriracha sauce, apple cider vinegar, reduced sodium soy sauce, honey, and garlic-ginger paste in a mixing bowl. Whisk until smooth.
  8. Cook rice: After 25 minutes, remove rice from oven and let rest, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff with a spatula or fork.
  9. Stir-fry broccolini: Heat a large wok over high heat. Add peanut oil and stir-fry broccolini with salt and white pepper for 4-5 minutes until al dente. Remove from heat and toss with sesame oil.
  10. Brown meatballs: Heat a large flat-bottom pan over medium-high heat. Add peanut oil and brown meatballs in batches, ensuring each side is golden brown (approximately 6-7 minutes total cooking time).
  11. Make sauce: Once meatballs are cooked, add sauce to the pan, scraping up any flavorful bits. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2 minutes to reduce.
  12. Finish meatballs: Reduce heat to medium-low. Return meatballs to the pan along with their resting juices. Glaze meatballs with sauce, turning every 30 seconds. Continue cooking until sauce is thickened and meatballs are well-glazed.
  13. Serve: Divide rice, broccolini, and meatballs into five containers. Garnish with spring onion, sesame seeds, and sriracha mayo (optional).
  14. Store: Allow meal prep to cool for 10 minutes before sealing. Refrigerate for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 5 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MXJyH4vdkLk

mediterranean_roasted_tomato_salad.txt - Mediterranean Roasted Tomato Salad

Objectives

  • Create a fresh and flavorful roasted tomato salad with Mediterranean influences.
  • Learn a simple method for roasting tomatoes with cumin, garlic, and herbs.
  • Prepare a complementary citrus yogurt sauce to enhance the salad's flavor.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- 1 teaspoon (3 grams) whole cumin seeds | 孜然籽 (zīrán zǐ) 400 grams (14.1 ounces) cherry tomatoes | 圣女果 (shèngnǚguǒ) 3/4 teaspoon (2 grams) brown sugar | 红糖 (hóngtáng) 4 cloves garlic, peeled and thinly sliced | 大蒜 (dàsuàn) 1 lemon, zest and juice | 柠檬 (níngméng) 5 grams (0.2 ounces) fresh oregano | 牛至 (niúzì) 4 sprigs fresh thyme | 百里香 (bǎilǐxiāng) 3 tablespoons (60 milliliters) olive oil | 橄榄油 (gǎnlǎnyóu) 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes | 海盐 (hǎiyán) 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper | 黑胡椒 (hēihújiāo) 375 grams (13.2 ounces) natural Greek yogurt | 希腊酸奶 (xīlà suānnǎi) 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes | 海盐 (hǎiyán) 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper | 黑胡椒 (hēihújiāo) Fresh mint, chopped | 薄荷 (bóhe) Fresh oregano leaves | 牛至 (niúzì) Extra virgin olive oil | 特级初榨橄榄油 (tèjí chūzhà gǎnlǎnyóu) Black pepper | 黑胡椒 (hēihújiāo)

Instructions

  1. Heat a pan over medium heat and add 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds. Toast for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally, to enhance their flavor.
  2. Remove the cumin seeds from the heat and let them cool for a minute or two.
  3. In a mixing bowl, combine 400 grams of cherry tomatoes, the toasted cumin seeds, and 3/4 teaspoon of brown sugar.
  4. Thinly slice 4 cloves of peeled garlic. Add to the bowl with the other ingredients.
  5. Zest half of the lemon, saving the other half for later. Thinly slice the zest into even strips and add to the bowl.
  6. Add 5 grams of fresh oregano, 4 sprigs of fresh thyme, 3 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes, and 1 teaspoon of black pepper to the bowl.
  7. Mix all the ingredients together with your hands to combine the flavors.
  8. Tip the tomato mixture onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper, spreading it out so the tomatoes are not on top of each other.
  9. Preheat oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit). Roast the tomatoes for 25 minutes, stirring halfway through.
  10. While the tomatoes are roasting, combine 375 grams of Greek yogurt with the zest of the remaining lemon half.
  11. Squeeze the juice from the remaining lemon half, discarding the seeds, and add it to the yogurt.
  12. Season the yogurt with 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes and 1 teaspoon of black pepper. Mix well to combine the flavors.
  13. After 25 minutes of roasting, switch the oven setting to grill or broil and roast the tomatoes for an additional 5 minutes to create a golden color on top.
  14. Remove the tomatoes from the oven and let them rest for 5 minutes.
  15. To serve, pour the lemon yogurt onto a large plate, spreading it out to create a lip on the edges and a well in the center.
  16. Arrange the roasted tomatoes and other ingredients in the well of the yogurt.
  17. Garnish with chopped fresh mint, fresh oregano leaves, a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil, and a crack of black pepper.
  18. Serve with warm, fresh, or toasted bread.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S-ricAFOxmY

mexican_chicken_salad.txt - Mexican Chicken Salad

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and easy Mexican chicken salad for meal prep.
  • Learn to make a delicious citrus avocado and yogurt dressing.
  • Understand the importance of proper chicken cooking techniques.

Ingredients

Chicken: - 750 grams (1.6 pounds) chicken breast - 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) onion powder - 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) garlic powder - 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) smoked paprika - 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) ground cumin - Pinch of sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper (10 cracks) - 1 tablespoon olive oil

Salad: - 1 red onion - 200 grams (7 ounces) baby cherry roma tomatoes - 1 bunch coriander (cilantro) - 2 large limes - 1 ripe avocado - 1/2 cup (120 grams) natural Greek yogurt - 2.5 teaspoons (1 gram) dried oregano - 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) red wine vinegar - 1/2 lime juice - 1/3 cup (80 milliliters) extra virgin olive oil - Pinch of sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper (10 cracks) - 200 grams (7 ounces) mesclun lettuce mix - 1 can corn kernels (rinsed) - 1 can black beans (rinsed)

Instructions

  1. Season the chicken breasts with onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, ground cumin, salt, pepper, and olive oil. Rub the seasoning into the chicken.
  2. Slice the red onion thinly in half-moon shapes.
  3. Slice the cherry tomatoes in half and then into quarters.
  4. Roughly chop half of the coriander.
  5. Slice one lime in half and then slice one of the halves thinly for garnish.
  6. Extract the juice from the remaining half of the lime.
  7. Slice the avocado open, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a blender.
  8. Blend the avocado with Greek yogurt, remaining coriander, dried oregano, red wine vinegar, lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper until smooth.
  9. Cook the chicken by searing in a pan over medium-high heat for 2 minutes per side.
  10. Bake the chicken in a preheated oven at 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit) for 13 minutes.
  11. Allow the chicken to rest for 5 minutes before slicing thinly across the grain.
  12. Assemble the salad by combining the sliced red onion, quartered cherry tomatoes, chopped coriander, corn kernels, black beans, and sliced chicken in a bowl.
  13. Toss the salad with the citrus avocado and yogurt dressing.
  14. Portion the salad into containers and garnish with lime slices.
  15. Serve the salad with the remaining dressing. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQB3v8rbReQ

middle_eastern_slow_cooked_lamb.txt - Middle Eastern Slow Cooked Lamb

Objectives

  • Learn to make a slow-cooked lamb dish with a Ras el Hanout spice blend.
  • Prepare the lamb and vegetables for braising.
  • Create a flavorful sauce and a cumin yogurt topping.

Ingredients

Ras el Hanout Spice Mix: - 2.5 teaspoons (6 grams) ground cumin - 1.5 teaspoons (3 grams) ground coriander - 1.5 teaspoons (3 grams) smoked paprika - 1 teaspoon (2 grams) ground cardamom - 1 teaspoon (2 grams) ground ginger - 1 teaspoon (2 grams) turmeric - 1 teaspoon (2 grams) red chili powder (optional) - 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes

Lamb: - 1.4 kg (3.1 lb) boneless butterflied lamb leg - 1 tablespoon (20 ml) olive oil

Vegetables: - 2 large brown or yellow onions - 4 small carrots (or 2 large) - 3 large potatoes - 5 garlic cloves - 10 grams (0.3 ounces) flat leaf parsley (optional)

Sauce: - 1 tablespoon (20 ml) olive oil - 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper (to taste) - 1 liter (4 cups) beef stock

Cumin Yogurt: - 1 cup (240 grams) plain Greek yogurt - 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) ground cumin - Pinch of cayenne pepper - Sea salt flakes (to taste) - Cracked black pepper (to taste)

Instructions

  1. Make the Ras el Hanout spice mix: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and whisk until well combined.
  2. Season the lamb: Rub the Ras el Hanout spice mix all over the lamb leg, ensuring to get into all crevices. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and set aside.
  3. Prepare the vegetables:
    • Slice onions in half, then into quarters lengthwise. Rotate 90 degrees and roughly chop into large pieces.
    • Slice carrots into even-sized chunks.
    • Slice potatoes in half, then into quarters lengthwise. Rotate 90 degrees and roughly chop into large pieces.
    • Crush garlic cloves with the flat side of a knife.
    • Roughly chop parsley.
  4. Sear the lamb: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pot or pan over high heat. Gently place the seasoned lamb in the pan, fat cap facing down, and sear for 3 minutes until golden brown. Flip and sear the other side for 3 minutes. Remove lamb from the pan and set aside.
  5. Sauté the vegetables: Reduce heat to medium-high. Add onions, carrots, and potatoes to the pan and sauté for 3 minutes, stirring regularly. Add crushed garlic, 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to taste. Sauté for 45 seconds.
  6. Add the stock and lamb: Pour 1 liter of beef stock into the pan. Return the seared lamb to the pot, placing it on the bottom with the vegetables beside it. Add any resting juices from the lamb. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat.
  7. Braise the lamb: Cover the pot with a lid or foil. Transfer to a preheated oven at 160°C (320°F) and braise for 2 hours and 50 minutes, stirring halfway through.
  8. Make the cumin yogurt: Combine yogurt, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Whisk until well combined. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  9. Finish the lamb: Carefully remove the braised lamb from the oven and place back on the stovetop. Remove the lid, being cautious of escaping steam. Add 3/4 of the chopped parsley to the pot and stir gently.
  10. Serve: Transfer the braised lamb and vegetables to a serving dish. Top with the lamb and drizzle generously with the braising sauce. Serve with cumin yogurt on top or on the side. Garnish with remaining parsley, if desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eFh1VgQKQMA

milk_buns.txt - Milk Buns

Objectives

  • Learn how to make soft, fluffy milk buns from scratch.
  • Understand the importance of proofing for bun texture.
  • Master the art of glazing for a golden, glossy finish.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- 125 ml full fat milk | 全脂牛奶 125 毫升 1 tbsp (9 g) dry instant yeast | 干酵母 1 汤匙 (9 克) 60 ml full fat milk | 全脂牛奶 60 毫升 30 ml cold water | 冷水 30 毫升 20 g bread flour | 面包粉 20 克 2.5 cups (320 g) bread flour | 面包粉 2.5 杯 (320 克) 15 g caster sugar | 糖 15 克 5 g sea salt flakes | 海盐 5 克 1 free-range egg | 鸡蛋 1 个 1 free-range egg yolk | 蛋黄 1 个 3 tbsp (42 g) softened unsalted butter | 无盐黄油 3 汤匙 (42 克) 1 tsp vegetable oil | 植物油 1 茶匙 1 whole free-range egg | 鸡蛋 1 个 1 tbsp (15 ml) full fat milk | 全脂牛奶 1 汤匙 (15 毫升) 2 tbsp (28 g) unsalted butter | 无盐黄油 2 汤匙 (28 克)

Instructions

  1. Heat 125 ml full fat milk in a saucepan over high heat until warm (32°C/89°F).
  2. Remove from heat and pour into a jug or bowl.
  3. Add 1 tbsp (9 g) dry instant yeast and mix well.
  4. Set aside for 10 minutes to activate.
  5. In the same saucepan, combine 60 ml full fat milk, 30 ml cold water, and 20 g bread flour.
  6. Heat over medium heat, constantly mixing until a sticky paste forms (this is called a "water roux").
  7. Remove from heat and let cool in a bowl.
  8. In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, combine 2.5 cups (320 g) bread flour, 15 g caster sugar, and 5 g sea salt flakes.
  9. Add the activated yeast mixture and mix roughly.
  10. Add the water roux and mix with clean hands until coarse bread crumbs form.
  11. Add 1 whole free-range egg and 1 free-range egg yolk.
  12. Rub together until a dough starts to form.
  13. Add 3 tbsp (42 g) softened unsalted butter and rub until fully incorporated.
  14. Dust a work surface with bread flour and place the dough on top.
  15. Knead the dough for 6-7 minutes, folding the edges underneath to create a smooth ball.
  16. Grease a large bowl with 1 tsp vegetable oil.
  17. Place the dough in the bowl and cover with a warm, damp tea towel.
  18. Proof for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
  19. Punch down the dough to release air.
  20. Divide the dough into 6 equal pieces.
  21. Roll each piece into a smooth ball using your fingertips.
  22. Place the dough balls on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, leaving at least 3 inches between each.
  23. Cover with oiled cling wrap and proof for another hour, or until risen by 75%.
  24. Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
  25. Remove cling wrap from the buns.
  26. In a small bowl, whisk together 1 whole free-range egg and 1 tbsp (15 ml) full fat milk.
  27. Brush the egg wash over the buns.
  28. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
  29. Melt 2 tbsp (28 g) unsalted butter and brush over each bun.
  30. Transfer buns to a wire rack to cool.

Enjoy your soft and fluffy milk buns!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=APL3K3i2T9A

miso_glazed_salmon_meal_prep.txt - Miso Glazed Salmon Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and healthy Miso Glazed Salmon meal prep.
  • Marinate salmon in a miso glaze.
  • Sauté vegetables and create a flavorful sauce.

Ingredients

  • Miso paste
  • Soy sauce
  • Mirin
  • Brown sugar
  • Ginger paste
  • Pepper
  • Salmon
  • Broccoli
  • Carrot
  • Spring onion (optional)
  • Oil
  • Sesame oil
  • Sesame seeds

Instructions

  1. Combine miso paste, soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, ginger paste, and pepper in a bowl.
  2. Whisk the mixture until smooth.
  3. Add salmon to the bowl and gently mix to coat, avoiding breaking it up.
  4. Marinate the salmon for 30 minutes.
  5. Trim the broccoli stalk and cut into florets.
  6. Trim the ends of the carrot and slice into thin strips.
  7. Slice spring onion into small rounds (optional).
  8. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  9. Add broccoli, carrot, and seasoning to taste.
  10. Sauté or stir-fry the vegetables for about 5 minutes.
  11. Add sesame oil, sesame seeds, and pepper to the vegetables.
  12. Mix well and cook for 1 minute.
  13. Remove the vegetables from the pan.
  14. Heat oil in another non-stick pan over medium-high heat.
  15. Add the marinated salmon and sear for about 3 minutes on each side, including the sides.
  16. Allow the salmon to rest.
  17. Add the leftover glaze to the same pan.
  18. Cook the glaze for 2 minutes until thickened.
  19. Portion the salmon, vegetables, and thickened glaze into meal prep containers.
  20. Spread the glaze evenly over the salmon in each container.
  21. Garnish with spring onion (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a6ywNQoEFdo

miso_glazed_salmon.txt - Miso Glazed Salmon

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful miso glaze for salmon.
  • Marinate salmon in the miso glaze.
  • Sauté a mix of broccoli, carrots, and green beans.
  • Sear salmon to achieve a golden char.
  • Combine the ingredients for a satisfying meal prep.

Ingredients

  • 150 grams white miso paste
  • 80 milliliters mirin
  • 60 milliliters soy sauce
  • 20 grams brown sugar (optional)
  • 15 grams ginger (grated)
  • Ground white pepper to taste
  • 250 gram salmon fillets (1.2 kilos total)
  • 2 heads of broccoli
  • 2 medium-large carrots
  • 1 spring onion (optional)
  • 350 grams green beans
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 2 teaspoons (10 ml) sesame oil
  • 1.5 teaspoons (5 grams) sesame seeds

Instructions

  1. Combine miso paste, mirin, soy sauce, brown sugar (optional), grated ginger, and ground white pepper in a bowl. Whisk until smooth.
  2. Rub the marinade evenly over the salmon fillets and let marinate for 30 minutes to 24 hours.
  3. Cut broccoli into florets, ensuring they are all the same size for even cooking. Slice the broccoli stalks in half, then into thirds, and cut into pieces similar in size to the florets.
  4. Wash carrots and slice off the stalk. Cut carrots in half and then thinly slice them into even strips.
  5. Thinly slice spring onion, if using.
  6. While the salmon marinates, heat a large pan or wok over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil.
  7. Add broccoli, carrots, and green beans to the pan. Season with sea salt flakes and ground white pepper (or cracked black pepper).
  8. Sauté or stir-fry the vegetables for 6-7 minutes, until they are tender but still have a slight bite and a nice char.
  9. Stir in 2 teaspoons (10 ml) sesame oil and 1.5 teaspoons (5 grams) sesame seeds. Adjust seasoning as needed.
  10. Remove the vegetables from the heat.
  11. Heat a non-stick pan over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil.
  12. Sear the salmon fillets, skin-side down if applicable, for 2.5-3 minutes until golden brown.
  13. Flip the salmon and cook for 2 minutes on each of the remaining sides. Aim for a golden brown, slightly charred exterior.
  14. Remove the salmon from the heat.
  15. Wipe down the pan used for searing the salmon to remove any char.
  16. Add the leftover marinade to a pan over medium heat. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
  17. Bring the sauce to a boil, then remove from heat and let it simmer gently.
  18. Portion the vegetables and salmon into containers.
  19. Pour the remaining salmon juices into the thickened sauce and mix well.
  20. Drizzle the sauce over the salmon and vegetables. Garnish with spring onion slices, if desired.
  21. Allow the meal prep to cool for 20 minutes before sealing the containers.
  22. Refrigerate for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5E2OdntXJLc

miso_steak_bok_choy.txt - Miso Steak with Bok Choy

Objectives

  • Learn to cook a flavorful and juicy miso steak.
  • Create a crispy ginger and fat cap topping.
  • Prepare al dente bok choy to accompany the steak.

Ingredients

  • 1 bunch bok choy
  • 1/3 centimeter piece of ginger
  • 250 gram sirloin or New York strip steak
  • 1 tablespoon miso paste
  • Sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon oil
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons honey

Instructions

  1. Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat.
  2. While the water is heating, slice the bok choy in half through the stem and then through the leaves.
  3. Wash the bok choy in cold water and set aside on a plate.
  4. Peel the ginger with a spoon to avoid wastage.
  5. Slice the ginger thinly and then into thin strips. Set aside.
  6. Remove the fat cap from the steak and cut through the tough sinew.
  7. Slice the fat cap into thin strips and set aside.
  8. Slice the steak evenly down the center and then into even-sized pieces.
  9. Place the steak in a bowl, add 1 tablespoon of miso paste and a good sprinkle of sea salt, and mix well.
  10. Heat a large heavy-based skillet over high heat.
  11. Add the sliced fat cap to the hot skillet and sauté for 1-1.5 minutes until it has some good color.
  12. Add the ginger strips and continue to sauté for 45 seconds to 1 minute, or until the ginger is crispy.
  13. Remove the crispy ginger and fat cap from the pan and set aside.
  14. Return the pan to high heat and add the miso steak.
  15. Sear the steak for 45 seconds to get good color.
  16. Deglaze the pan with 1 1/2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar and 1 1/2 tablespoons of honey.
  17. Stir to coat the steak and pull up the flavors from the bottom of the pan.
  18. Cook for an additional 45 seconds.
  19. Remove the steak from the heat and set aside to rest.
  20. Add the bok choy to the boiling water and cook for 2 minutes, or until al dente.
  21. Remove the bok choy from the water and drain.
  22. Place the bok choy on a plate.
  23. Add the miso steak on top of the bok choy.
  24. Sprinkle the crispy fat and ginger over the steak.
  25. Spoon the glaze over the steak and bok choy.
  26. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rse8LYcrw6k

missing_recipe.txt - Missing Recipe

Objectives

  • No objectives available.

Ingredients

  • No ingredients available.

Instructions

  • No instructions available.

Unfortunately, there is no transcript available for this video. Please provide a transcript so I can extract the instructions.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8C80LDTWGTQ

mixed_berry_turnovers.txt - Mixed Berry Turnovers

Objectives

  • Learn to make both baked and fried versions of mixed berry turnovers.
  • Create a delicious berry compote filling.
  • Master the techniques for folding and crimping the pastry.

Ingredients

  • 500 grams (1.1 pounds) frozen mixed berries
  • 1/3 cup (80 grams) caster sugar
  • 1 large lemon (juiced)
  • 2 sheets of defrosted puff pastry
  • 1 large free-range egg
  • 1/2 cup (120 grams) caster sugar
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons (15 grams) ground cinnamon
  • Vegetable oil, canola oil or sunflower oil (for frying)

Instructions

  1. Combine frozen berries, caster sugar, and lemon juice in a saucepan.
  2. Heat over high heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture boils.
  3. Reduce heat to medium-high and simmer for 9 minutes, stirring regularly, until the berries break down and the mixture thickens.
  4. Remove from heat and let cool completely.
  5. Cut each sheet of puff pastry into four even squares.
  6. Place one tablespoon of berry compote slightly off-center in each square.
  7. Fold one corner over to the opposite side to create a triangle, crimping the end to secure.
  8. Gently crimp the sides of the turnover to prevent the compote from leaking.
  9. Brush the turnovers with egg wash.
  10. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar or plain sugar, if desired.
  11. For baked turnovers:
  12. Preheat oven to 200°C (350°F).
  13. Place turnovers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, ensuring they are not touching.
  14. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden and puffed.
  15. For fried turnovers:
  16. Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or pan over high heat to 180°C (350°F).
  17. Fry turnovers one at a time for 1 1/2 minutes, or until lightly golden brown.
  18. Flip and fry for 2 1/2-3 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
  19. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
  20. Toss in cinnamon sugar or plain sugar.
  21. Serve hot with vanilla ice cream, fruit sorbet, and a dusting of icing sugar.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=06c4SztSFUI

mongolian_beef_stir_fry.txt - Mongolian Beef Stir Fry

Objectives

  • Learn to make a quick and easy Mongolian beef stir fry.
  • Master the art of marinating beef for optimal flavor and texture.
  • Prepare and portion out the dish for convenient meal prep.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion, sliced
  • 20g ginger, peeled and sliced into thin strips
  • 4 cloves garlic, crushed and chopped
  • 4 spring onions, separated into white root and green stem
  • 600g beef fillet, sliced into strips
  • 30ml low sodium soy sauce
  • 30ml Shaoxing wine
  • 5g baking powder
  • 10g corn flour or starch
  • 1/2 cup low sodium soy sauce
  • 1/2 cup chicken stock
  • 20g brown sugar (optional)
  • 40ml Shaoxing wine
  • 60g oyster sauce
  • 1 tablespoon peanut oil
  • 600g precooked hwen noodles
  • Dark soy sauce (optional)
  • Chili and sesame seeds (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion in half, remove the core, and then slice into even pieces.
  2. Peel the ginger and slice into thin strips. Stack the strips and julienne them into thin matchstick cuts.
  3. Crush and roughly chop the garlic.
  4. Separate the white root from the green stem of the spring onions. Slice the white root into thin circles and slice the green stem on a slight angle into oval-shaped pieces.
  5. Marinate the beef strips by combining them with low sodium soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, baking powder, and corn flour. Mix until everything is combined and set aside.
  6. In a mixing bowl, combine the low sodium soy sauce, chicken stock, brown sugar, Shaoxing wine, and oyster sauce. Whisk until the flavors are blended and set aside.
  7. Heat a large pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add peanut oil.
  8. Add the sliced onion to the pan and stir-fry for about 4 minutes, breaking it up as you go. Cook until the onion is a light golden color.
  9. Add the chopped garlic and julienned ginger to the pan. Stir-fry for 1 minute to release the fragrance.
  10. Add the marinated beef and any remaining marinade to the pan. Stir-fry for 2 minutes, ensuring the meat is evenly cooked and slightly browned.
  11. Add the precooked hwen noodles and the sauce to the pan. Break up the noodles slightly and stir everything together until the sauce thickens. Optionally, add a touch of dark soy sauce for color.
  12. Cook for about 2 minutes, until the sauce is thickened.
  13. Add the white stem spring onions and mix well.
  14. Remove from the stovetop and portion out into 5-750ml meal prep containers. Garnish with green stem spring onions, chili, or sesame seeds (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TRuIRYW-1e0

moroccan_pulled_beef.txt - Moroccan Pulled Beef

Objectives

  • Learn how to make Moroccan pulled beef.
  • Understand the importance of browning the beef before braising.
  • Learn how to make a citrus tahini dressing.

Ingredients

  • 1.5 kg beef bowler roast
  • 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon ground ginger
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground allspice
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 1.5 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 brown or yellow onion, diced
  • 4 garlic cloves, crushed
  • 1 bunch coriander or cilantro, roots roughly chopped (optional)
  • 1.5 tablespoons harissa paste
  • 1 tablespoon ground cumin
  • 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
  • 1 liter beef stock
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 100g tahini
  • 1 large lemon, juiced
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Store-bought dinner rolls
  • Coriander or cilantro, for garnish (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice off both ends of the beef bowler roast and remove the skin.
  2. Slice the onion in half, then into quarters. Rotate 90 degrees and dice into large chunks.
  3. Peel and crush 4 garlic cloves.
  4. Optionally, separate the roots from a bunch of coriander or cilantro, saving the leaves and stems for garnish. Roughly chop the roots.
  5. In a large bowl, combine the beef roast with 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ground allspice, 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves, and sea salt flakes. Massage the spices into the beef.
  6. Heat a large pot over high heat. Add 1.5 tablespoons olive oil and sear the seasoned beef for 3 minutes on each side.
  7. Remove the beef and set aside.
  8. Add the diced onion to the pot and saute for 4 minutes.
  9. Add the crushed garlic, chopped coriander roots (optional), 1.5 tablespoons harissa paste, and 1 tablespoon ground cumin. Saute for 1 minute.
  10. Add the diced tomatoes, beef stock, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to the pot. Mix well.
  11. Return the seared beef to the pot along with any resting juices.
  12. Cover the pot or use foil and place it in a preheated oven at 160 degrees Celsius (320 degrees Fahrenheit). Braise for 3 hours, flipping the beef halfway through.
  13. While the beef is braising, make the citrus tahini dressing. In a bowl, combine 100g tahini, juice of 1 lemon, 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin, and sea salt flakes. Whisk until smooth and thin. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  14. After 3 hours, carefully remove the beef from the oven.
  15. Transfer the beef to a chopping board and pull it apart using two forks.
  16. Add the pulled beef to a large bowl and ladle in the sauce. Mix well.
  17. Place store-bought dinner rolls on a baking tray and toast in a preheated oven at 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit) for 3-4 minutes.
  18. Slice the rolls open and spread with the citrus tahini dressing.
  19. Fill the rolls with the Moroccan pulled beef and drizzle with additional dressing.
  20. Garnish with coriander or cilantro (optional) and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JTb3duOOff8

mushroom_risotto.txt - Mushroom Risotto

Objectives

  • Create a creamy and flavorful mushroom risotto
  • Learn to use different types of mushrooms for a complex flavor profile
  • Perfect the risotto cooking technique with precise stock additions

Ingredients

  • 1.5 liters chicken or vegetable stock
  • 1 large brown onion
  • 1 stalk celery
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 7 grams flat leaf parsley
  • 3 leaves sage
  • 4 sprigs thyme
  • 100 grams shiitake mushrooms
  • 200 grams baby king oyster mushrooms
  • 150 grams Swiss brown mushrooms
  • 15 grams dried porcini mushrooms
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 lemon
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon black pepper
  • 2 cups arborio rice
  • 80 milliliters white wine
  • 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
  • 1/2 cup fresh parmigiano cheese

Instructions

  1. Bring 1.5 liters of chicken or vegetable stock to a boil in a large saucepan.
  2. Dice 1 large brown onion, 1 stalk celery, and 3 cloves garlic.
  3. Finely chop 7 grams of flat leaf parsley, 3 leaves of sage, and 4 sprigs of thyme.
  4. Thinly slice 100 grams of shiitake mushrooms, 200 grams of baby king oyster mushrooms, and 150 grams of Swiss brown mushrooms.
  5. In a bowl, combine 15 grams of dried porcini mushrooms with 1/2 cup of the boiling stock. Let sit for 5 minutes to rehydrate.
  6. Finely slice the rehydrated porcini mushrooms and return them to the stock. Set aside.
  7. Heat a large pot over high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil, the shiitake, king oyster, and Swiss brown mushrooms. Saute for 5-6 minutes until golden brown and soft.
  8. Transfer the sauteed mushrooms to a bowl. Add the chopped parsley, sage, and thyme. Squeeze the juice of 1 lemon into the bowl, season with 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of pepper. Mix well and set aside.
  9. Return the pot to the stovetop over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil, the diced onion, and celery. Sweat for 5-6 minutes until softened.
  10. Add the diced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
  11. Add 2 cups of arborio rice to the pot and toast for 1 minute.
  12. Add 80 milliliters of white wine and cook for 1 minute until almost evaporated.
  13. Reduce heat to medium and add the porcini mushroom and stock mixture. Stir to combine.
  14. Gradually add 1/4 ladle of stock at a time, stirring frequently until absorbed before adding more. Continue until all stock is absorbed. This will take about 25-30 minutes.
  15. In the final 4 ladles of stock, do not let the rice absorb all the moisture. The risotto should be slightly runny.
  16. Remove the risotto from heat and place on a wire rack to prevent burning.
  17. Add the sauteed mushrooms, 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter, and 1/2 cup of grated parmigiano cheese to the risotto. Stir until melted and well combined.
  18. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
  19. Serve immediately, topped with additional parmigiano cheese, a drizzle of olive oil, and flat-leaf parsley.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pBannbiQvWg

mushroom_soup.txt - Mushroom Soup

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and flavorful mushroom soup.
  • Utilize dried mushrooms to create a flavorful mushroom powder.
  • Master the art of sauteing vegetables for a rich and aromatic soup base.

Ingredients

  • 5 grams dried porcini mushrooms
  • 5 grams dried shiitake mushrooms
  • 2 onions, roughly chopped
  • 2 all-purpose potatoes, roughly chopped
  • 1 leek, sliced lengthwise and thinly sliced
  • 6 cloves garlic, crushed and roughly chopped
  • 750 grams button mushrooms, thinly sliced
  • 140 grams unsalted butter
  • Pinch of salt
  • 50 milliliters white wine
  • 1 liter vegetable or chicken stock
  • 100 milliliters cream
  • 40 milliliters milk
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Mushroom powder (from dried mushrooms)
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Truffle oil (optional)
  • Toast (optional)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 150°C (300°F).
  2. Place 5 grams each of dried porcini and shiitake mushrooms on a baking tray and roast for 5 minutes.
  3. Blend the roasted mushrooms in a spice grinder to create mushroom powder.
  4. Roughly chop 2 onions and 2 potatoes.
  5. Slice 1 leek in half lengthwise, then slice it again lengthwise and thinly slice.
  6. Wash the leek slices.
  7. Crush 6 cloves of garlic with a knife and chop roughly.
  8. Thinly slice 750 grams of button mushrooms.
  9. Melt 140 grams of unsalted butter in a pot over medium-high heat.
  10. Add the chopped onions and potatoes to the pot along with a pinch of salt and saute for 7 minutes.
  11. Add the sliced leek, chopped garlic, and sliced mushrooms to the pot and continue sauteing for 12 minutes.
  12. Pour in 50 milliliters of white wine and reduce for 2 minutes.
  13. Add 1 liter of vegetable or chicken stock, 100 milliliters of cream, 40 milliliters of milk, salt, and pepper to taste.
  14. Simmer the soup for 10 minutes.
  15. Remove the pot from the heat and use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth.
  16. Serve the soup in bowls and garnish with mushroom powder, cracked black pepper, and truffle oil (optional).
  17. Serve alongside toast (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B_PZN9fsnls

no_bake_peanut_butter_cheesecake.txt - No-Bake Peanut Butter Cheesecake

Objectives

  • Create a no-bake peanut butter cheesecake with a simple recipe
  • Achieve a light, fluffy, and tasty cheesecake
  • Learn how to prepare the cheesecake base and filling

Ingredients

Base

  • 266g (9.3oz) Whole Oreo cookies (including cream)
  • 75g (2.6oz) Melted unsalted butter
  • 0.5 tsp (2.5g) Sea salt flakes

Filling

  • 550g (1.2lb) Cream cheese
  • 190g (6.7oz) Sifted icing sugar
  • 250g (8.8oz) Smooth peanut butter
  • 0.5 tsp (2.5ml) Pure vanilla seeds
  • 0.5 cup (118ml) Heavy thickened or whipping cream

Chocolate Ganache

  • 150g (5.2oz) Dark chocolate chips or chunks
  • 160ml (2/3 cup) Heavy thickened or whipping cream

Instructions

  1. Prepare a 23cm (9in) springform cake tin by lightly spraying or rubbing the base with vegetable oil or butter.
  2. Place a piece of parchment paper over the base and secure it in place with the springform tin.
  3. Spray or rub the inside of the tin with oil/butter and line the sides with trimmed parchment paper pieces.
  4. In a food processor, combine Oreo cookies, melted butter, and sea salt flakes.
  5. Blend until the mixture resembles smooth, wet sand.
  6. Transfer the mixture to the prepared springform tin and spread it out firmly to create a smooth and firm base.
  7. Refrigerate the base for 10 minutes to firm up.
  8. In a stand mixer bowl, combine cream cheese and sifted icing sugar.
  9. Mix on low speed until combined and the cream cheese has softened slightly.
  10. Increase the speed to medium and beat for 1 minute until smooth.
  11. Add peanut butter and vanilla seeds to the mixture.
  12. Beat on low speed for 1 minute, then increase to medium speed and beat for 2 minutes until completely smooth.
  13. Pour in heavy cream and beat on low speed for 20 seconds, then increase to medium speed and beat for 2 minutes to whip the cream.
  14. Pour the cheesecake mixture over the chilled base, ensuring to scrape out the bowl to avoid waste.
  15. Spread the mixture evenly over the base, covering the sides.
  16. Tap the cake tin lightly on the counter to eliminate air pockets.
  17. Refrigerate the cheesecake for 4 hours to overnight, or freeze for 2.5 hours to set.
  18. To make the chocolate ganache, melt dark chocolate and heavy cream in a saucepan over low heat, stirring frequently.
  19. Once melted and smooth, remove from heat.
  20. Pour the ganache over the chilled cheesecake, ensuring to scrape out the bowl to avoid waste.
  21. Spread the ganache evenly over the cheesecake, covering the edges.
  22. Refrigerate the cheesecake for 1.5 hours or freeze for 1 hour to set the chocolate.
  23. Once set, unlock the spring of the tin and carefully wiggle it to unstick the parchment paper.
  24. Gently remove the parchment paper, being careful as the cheesecake is unbaked and soft.
  25. Slide the cheesecake off the bottom tin by lifting up the overhanging paper.
  26. Slice the cheesecake into desired sizes, using a knife dipped in hot water and dried before each slice.
  27. Serve and enjoy.

Storage

  • Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 4 days.
  • Freeze in an airtight container for up to 4 months.
  • Can be eaten straight from frozen.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KsEB0c49vvw

oatmeal_slice.txt - Oatmeal Slice with Hazelnut Chocolate Spread

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and healthy oatmeal slice.
  • Prepare a homemade hazelnut chocolate spread.
  • Store and reheat oatmeal slices for later consumption.

Ingredients

Oatmeal Slice - 3 bananas, mashed - 560 ml oat milk, almond milk, or regular milk - 1 egg white - 80 ml maple syrup, golden syrup, or honey - 10 g vanilla extract or vanilla bean paste - 320 g rolled oats - 3.5 g ground cinnamon - 0.5 g ground nutmeg - 6 g baking powder - 180 g frozen or fresh blueberries - 6 g tapioca flour - Pinch of sea salt flakes

Hazelnut Chocolate Spread - 300 g hazelnuts - 80 g macadamia nuts - 50 g coconut sugar, Demerara sugar, or brown sugar - 25 g cacao powder - Pinch of sea salt flakes - 50 ml macadamia oil or any neutral flavored oil (optional)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
  2. Spread hazelnuts and macadamia nuts on a lined baking tray.
  3. Bake for 6 minutes, then remove and let cool.
  4. While nuts are cooling, mash bananas in a large mixing bowl.
  5. Add oat milk, egg white, maple syrup, vanilla extract, rolled oats, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking powder, blueberries, tapioca flour, and salt to the banana mixture.
  6. Mix well to combine.
  7. Grease a large baking dish with spray oil, coconut oil, or butter.
  8. Pour the oatmeal mixture into the prepared dish and spread evenly, ensuring blueberries are not bunched up.
  9. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until firm on the surface.
  10. While oatmeal slice is baking, remove macadamia nuts from the tray and spread hazelnuts out on a clean tea towel.
  11. Fold the tea towel over the hazelnuts and rub vigorously to remove husks.
  12. Add both nuts, coconut sugar, cacao powder, and salt to a blender.
  13. Blend until a coarse powder is formed.
  14. Add macadamia oil (optional) and blend until a smooth, pourable paste is achieved.
  15. Pour the hazelnut chocolate spread into a glass jar or clean container and store in the fridge for up to one month or freezer for up to six months.
  16. Remove oatmeal slice from the oven and allow to cool for 10-15 minutes.
  17. Cut oatmeal slice into desired portions.
  18. (Optional) Top each portion with additional banana slices and a generous spoonful of hazelnut chocolate spread.
  19. Store oatmeal slices in meal prep containers or paper bags in the fridge for up to six days or freezer for up to six months.
  20. Enjoy hot or cold.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lq5FEhKuqYs

one_pot_chicken_chorizo.txt - One Pot Chicken Chorizo

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful one-pot chicken chorizo dish under $10 per portion.
  • Utilize the fat rendered from chorizo to infuse the chicken with flavor.
  • Combine various ingredients for a rich and balanced taste profile.

Ingredients

  • 400g regular tomatoes, diced
  • 400g baby Roma tomatoes, whole or halved
  • 200g Spanish chorizo, sliced
  • 6 cloves garlic, crushed
  • 5g thyme, chopped or used as a bouquet garni
  • Fresh basil leaves (optional)
  • 1kg chicken thighs, seasoned with salt and pepper
  • 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar
  • 1 cup (250ml) chicken or vegetable stock
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Sugar (optional)
  • Baguette slices (optional)
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Fresh basil leaves (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice the regular tomatoes into even-sized pieces.
  2. Slice the chorizo into thin pieces.
  3. Crush the garlic cloves.
  4. Chop the thyme or wrap it in twine for a bouquet garni.
  5. Pick the basil leaves from the stems and reserve the stems for the sauce.
  6. Season the chicken thighs generously with salt and pepper.
  7. Place a large, high-rimmed pan over medium heat.
  8. Add the chorizo to the cold pan and cook for 2-3 minutes, until golden and the fat begins to render.
  9. Remove the chorizo and set aside.
  10. Add the chicken to the pan in batches, searing for 3-4 minutes per side to achieve a golden crust.
  11. Remove the chicken and set aside.
  12. Add the olive oil to the pan.
  13. Add the diced tomatoes and whole baby Roma tomatoes.
  14. Season heavily with salt and pepper.
  15. Fry the tomatoes for 2-3 minutes to soften slightly.
  16. Add the balsamic vinegar, crushed garlic, chorizo, chorizo fat, chopped thyme (or bouquet garni), and basil stems to the pan.
  17. Cook for 2 minutes to soften the ingredients.
  18. Add the chicken stock and tomatoes to the pan.
  19. Stir well and bring to a simmer.
  20. Adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and sugar if desired.
  21. Return the chicken and any resting juices to the pan, ensuring it's covered in liquid.
  22. Stir gently to combine.
  23. Bring the mixture to a simmer again.
  24. Transfer the pan to a preheated oven (190°C/375°F) and bake for 45 minutes.
  25. Carefully remove the pan from the oven.
  26. Toast baguette slices (optional).
  27. Serve the chicken chorizo with toasted baguette slices, additional sauce, and tomatoes.
  28. Garnish with cracked black pepper and fresh basil leaves.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8fZYYfnuYxs

one_pot_creamy_garlic_cajun_chicken_pasta.txt - One Pot Creamy Garlic Cajun Chicken Pasta

Objectives

  • Learn to make a creamy Cajun chicken pasta in one pot.
  • Discover the importance of browning the chicken before adding other ingredients.
  • Learn to deglaze the pan for a flavorful sauce.

Ingredients

  • 1 whole brown or yellow onion, diced
  • 5 cloves garlic, minced
  • 5g flat leaf parsley, chopped (optional)
  • 600g boneless and skinless chicken thighs, diced
  • 2.5g onion powder
  • 2.5g garlic powder
  • 1g dried oregano
  • 1g dried thyme
  • 7.5g smoked paprika
  • 1.5g chili powder (optional)
  • 5ml olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 10 cracks of black pepper
  • 650ml chicken stock
  • 1 can crushed diced tomatoes
  • 180ml thickened cream
  • 20 cracks of black pepper
  • 400g pasta of choice
  • Parmesan cheese, grated (optional)

Instructions

  1. Dice one whole brown or yellow onion.
  2. Mince 5 cloves of garlic.
  3. Chop 5g of flat leaf parsley (optional).
  4. Dice 600g of boneless and skinless chicken thighs.
  5. Combine diced chicken with 2.5g onion powder, 2.5g garlic powder, 1g dried oregano, 1g dried thyme, 7.5g smoked paprika, 1.5g chili powder (optional), 5ml olive oil, sea salt flakes to taste, and 10 cracks of black pepper.
  6. Mix the chicken mixture well with your hands.
  7. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
  8. Add 30ml olive oil to the pot.
  9. Once the oil is hot, add the chicken mixture and spread it out in a single layer.
  10. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring regularly, until the chicken is nicely browned.
  11. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pot.
  12. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring regularly, until the onion becomes translucent and the garlic infuses its flavor.
  13. Deglaze the pan with 650ml of chicken stock.
  14. Add one can of crushed diced tomatoes to the pot.
  15. Add 180ml of thickened cream.
  16. Season with 20 cracks of black pepper and check for salt if desired.
  17. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  18. Add 400g of pasta of your choice.
  19. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 15 minutes, until the pasta is al dente.
  20. Stir in the chopped parsley (optional).
  21. Mix well to combine all ingredients.
  22. Check for seasoning and adjust as needed.
  23. Remove the pot from the heat.
  24. Serve immediately.
  25. Top with grated Parmesan cheese and additional cracked black pepper, as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0hUr9VkO53A

onion_dicing.txt - Dicing Onions

Objectives

  • Learn two methods of dicing onions
  • Understand the benefits of making a horizontal slice before dicing
  • See the difference in texture between diced onions with and without the horizontal slice

Instructions

  1. Remove the tip of the onion, leaving the root intact.
  2. Peel the onion.
  3. Method 1: Dicing with a Horizontal Slice
  4. Make thin slices across the onion.
  5. Make a horizontal slice through the onion.
  6. Dice the onion into fine pieces.
  7. Trim off any excess flesh around the root.
  8. Method 2: Dicing without a Horizontal Slice
  9. Make thin slices across the onion.
  10. Dice the onion into fine pieces without making a horizontal slice.
  11. Compare the two methods:
  12. Method 1 produces a more uniform, fine dice.
  13. Method 2 produces a more scrappy dice with longer strands.
  14. Choose the method that you prefer.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZioiG78Jbg8

onion_rings.txt - Crispy Onion Rings with Ranch Sauce

Objectives

  • Make crispy onion rings with a tangy buttermilk batter.
  • Prepare a flavorful homemade ranch dressing.
  • Learn the importance of proper oil temperature for perfect frying.

Ingredients

For the onion rings: - 1 brown or yellow onion - 1 cup (250 ml) buttermilk - 1/2 cup (70 g) plain flour - 1/2 tsp (2.5 g) sea salt flakes - 1/4 tsp (0.2 g) ground black pepper - 1/2 tsp (2 g) garlic powder - 3/4 cup (180 ml) soda water (or beer) - 1/2 cup (70 g) plain flour for dredging - 4 cups (1 L) canola, sunflower, or vegetable oil

For the ranch dressing: - 2 free-range egg yolks - 1 tsp (7 g) Dijon mustard - 1/2 lemon, juiced - 5 g (0.2 oz) flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped - 5 g (0.2 oz) dill, roughly chopped - 6 chives, finely sliced - 1 1/2 cups (375 ml) olive oil or extra virgin olive oil - 1/4 tsp (1 g) garlic powder - 1/4 tsp (1 g) onion powder - 1/2 tsp (2.5 g) sea salt flakes - 1 tsp (10 cracks) black pepper - 1/2 cup (250 ml) buttermilk

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion into thin rings, removing the root and tip ends.
  2. Soak the onion rings in buttermilk for 20 minutes.
  3. Combine flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and soda water in a bowl, whisking until smooth.
  4. Place flour in a separate bowl for dredging.
  5. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat to 180°C (350°F).
  6. Combine egg yolks, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, herbs, and whisk until well combined.
  7. Slowly whisk in olive oil until a thick emulsion forms.
  8. Stir in garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and buttermilk until smooth.
  9. Transfer ranch dressing to an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  10. Toss onion rings in buttermilk, then dredge in flour.
  11. Gently add battered onion rings to hot oil, ensuring they are not overcrowded.
  12. Fry for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes per side, or until golden brown.
  13. Remove onion rings from oil and drain on a wire rack.
  14. Serve onion rings with homemade ranch dressing.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_NwG1gvIrMw

orange_chicken_and_rice.txt - Orange Chicken and Rice

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful orange chicken dish.
  • Create a fragrant coriander and ginger rice.
  • Learn how to properly cook and sear chicken for optimal texture.
  • Create a balanced sweet and savory orange sauce.

Ingredients

Orange Chicken - 4 cloves garlic - 15 grams ginger - 1.5 oranges (zest 1 whole orange, juice 1.5) - 80 ml light soy sauce - 100 grams honey - 50 ml rice wine vinegar - 17 grams corn flour - 1 kg boneless, skinless chicken thigh - 5 grams onion powder - Sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper - Olive oil

Coriander and Ginger Rice - 3 cloves garlic - 10 grams ginger - 15 grams coriander - 320 grams long grain rice - 625 ml chicken stock - Sea salt flakes - Olive oil

Instructions

  1. Prepare the orange chicken sauce:
  2. Grate the garlic and ginger for both the rice and the chicken separately.
  3. Zest one whole orange using a microplane.
  4. Combine the grated garlic and ginger, orange zest, light soy sauce, honey, rice wine vinegar, orange juice, corn flour, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
  5. Whisk until well combined.
  6. Prepare the chicken:
  7. Cut the chicken thigh into thirds or quarters, then slice through the center to create even-sized diced pieces.
  8. Season the chicken with onion powder, salt, and pepper.
  9. Toss the chicken with olive oil to coat.
  10. Prepare the coriander and ginger rice:
  11. Heat olive oil in a saucepan over high heat.
  12. Add the garlic and ginger paste (smaller amount) and sauté for 45 seconds until fragrant.
  13. Add the rice and chicken stock.
  14. Season with salt.
  15. Mix well to combine and ensure no clumps.
  16. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low.
  17. Cook undisturbed for 12 minutes.
  18. Remove from heat and let rest for 10 minutes, covered.
  19. Remove the lid and add the chopped coriander.
  20. Mix to combine.
  21. Cook the chicken:
  22. Heat olive oil in a large, high-rimmed pan or pot over high heat.
  23. Spread the seasoned chicken evenly in the pan.
  24. Cook undisturbed for 3 minutes to achieve a golden brown sear.
  25. Mix the chicken and cook for another 3 minutes undisturbed.
  26. Continue cooking for 6 minutes, mixing regularly until the chicken is cooked through.
  27. Finish the orange chicken:
  28. Whisk the orange sauce to break up the corn flour.
  29. Add the sauce to the cooked chicken and bring to a boil while mixing.
  30. Cook for 2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken.
  31. Optional: Add sesame seeds and mix well.
  32. Assemble and serve:
  33. Divide the rice into five portions.
  34. Add chicken and sauce to each portion.
  35. Garnish with black sesame seeds and spring onions (optional).
  36. Store and reheat:
  37. Allow the meals to cool slightly before storing.
  38. Store in airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 4 months.
  39. Reheat in a pan or microwave until hot.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KT_z5E7nPAU

oven_rice.txt - Oven Rice

Objectives

  • Learn how to cook perfect basmati rice in the oven.
  • Discover a simple method for fluffy and delicious rice.
  • Understand the importance of covering the rice during cooking.

Ingredients

  • 300 grams of washed basmati rice
  • 600 milliliters of boiling hot water

Instructions

  1. Place 300 grams of washed basmati rice into a baking dish.
  2. Pour 600 milliliters of boiling hot water over the rice.
  3. Stir the rice and water mixture with a spoon to prevent clumps.
  4. Cover the baking dish tightly with aluminum foil, ensuring no air can escape.
  5. Bake in a 190 degrees Celsius oven for 25 minutes.
  6. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for 5 minutes.
  7. Carefully remove the aluminum foil.
  8. Fluff the rice with a spatula or fork.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=psBR7ip7kFA

pad_thai.txt - Padu

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and quick Padu dish
  • Understand the importance of preparing ingredients properly
  • Learn to cook rice noodles to the perfect texture

Ingredients

  • Chinese broccoli (or regular broccoli)
  • 4 cloves of garlic
  • 1 long red chili (optional)
  • 2 spring onions or scallion stems
  • 300g (10.5 oz) boneless and skinless chicken thigh
  • Wide rice noodles (uncooked)
  • 1/4 cup white vinegar
  • 1 tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp peanut oil
  • 1 tsp corn flour/corn starch/tapioca flour
  • 1 1/2 tbsp oyster sauce
  • 1 tbsp (20ml) black soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp regular soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp fish sauce
  • 1/2 tsp sugar (optional)
  • Ground white pepper
  • 2 tsp vegetable or peanut oil

Instructions

  1. Slice Chinese broccoli in half and trim any woody stems.
  2. Thinly slice four cloves of garlic.
  3. Thinly slice one long red chili (optional) and discard the stem.
  4. Thinly slice two spring onions or scallion stems.
  5. Thinly slice 300g (10.5 oz) boneless and skinless chicken thigh.
  6. In a bowl, combine 1/4 cup white vinegar and the sliced chili. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  7. In a separate bowl, combine the sliced chicken, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp peanut oil, and 1 tsp corn flour/corn starch/tapioca flour. Mix well and set aside.
  8. In another bowl, combine 1 1/2 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp (20ml) black soy sauce, 1 tbsp regular soy sauce, 2 tbsp fish sauce, 1/2 tsp sugar (optional), and ground white pepper to taste. Mix well and set aside.
  9. Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat.
  10. Add 350g (12.3 oz) of wide rice noodles to the boiling water.
  11. Cook the noodles for 2 minutes less than the packet instructions.
  12. Drain the noodles and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process.
  13. Heat a wok over high heat until smoking.
  14. Add 2 tsp vegetable or peanut oil to the hot wok.
  15. Add the marinated chicken to the wok and stir-fry for 3 minutes.
  16. Transfer the chicken to a bowl, scraping the wok to ensure no burnt bits remain.
  17. Add another 2 tsp vegetable or peanut oil to the hot wok.
  18. Add the Chinese broccoli and sliced garlic to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute.
  19. Add the drained noodles and the sauce to the wok.
  20. Add the chicken back to the wok with any resting juices.
  21. Stir-fry everything for 1 minute to coat the noodles and chicken in sauce.
  22. Serve in bowls, drizzling with the pickled chili (optional) and sprinkling with the sliced spring onions or scallion stems.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PvrWGTOaiig

pan_steak.txt - Pan-Seared Steak

Objectives

  • Learn to cook a perfect medium-rare pan-seared steak.
  • Discover a simple and flavorful rosemary garlic butter sauce.
  • Understand the importance of resting the steak before slicing.

Ingredients

  • 300g eye fillet (room temperature)
  • Salt and pepper
  • 1 teaspoon vegetable oil (or grape seed oil)
  • Rosemary sprigs
  • Garlic cloves
  • Butter

Instructions

  1. Season the steak generously with salt and pepper on both sides.
  2. Place a pan over high heat.
  3. Add 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil to the pan.
  4. Sear the steak for 2.5 minutes on each side, until a golden crust forms.
  5. Flip the steak and add rosemary sprigs and garlic cloves to the pan.
  6. Add butter to the pan and allow it to melt.
  7. Baste the steak with the melted butter and rosemary garlic mixture for 2 minutes.
  8. Remove the steak from the pan and let it rest for 5 minutes.
  9. Pour some of the pan juices over the steak for extra flavor.
  10. Slice the steak and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f-twQeqQAZE

pasta_ala_norma.txt - Pasta alla Norma

Objectives

  • Learn to make a classic Italian eggplant and tomato dish
  • Understand the importance of roasting eggplant for optimal flavor
  • Create a flavorful sauce with fresh basil and garlic

Ingredients

  • 2 medium eggplants (450g)
  • 3 stalks of basil (20g)
  • 3 garlic cloves
  • 1.5 tbsp olive oil (30ml)
  • 1 tsp sea salt
  • 1 tsp black pepper
  • 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
  • 1.5 tsp dried oregano
  • 1 tsp dried chili flakes (optional)
  • 450g pasta (penne recommended)
  • 1/2 cup pasta water (125ml)
  • Fresh ricotta salata, pecorino romano, or parmigiano-reggiano cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Bring a pot of water to a boil with a small handful of sea salt.
  2. Dice the eggplant into 2cm pieces.
  3. Combine diced eggplant with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp sea salt, and 1 tsp black pepper in a bowl.
