  4. Spread the seasoned eggplant on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  5. Roast in a preheated oven at 220°C (430°F) for 25 minutes, mixing halfway through.
  6. While the eggplant roasts, heat 1.5 tbsp olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
  7. Add minced garlic and sauté for 1.5 minutes.
  8. Add diced tomatoes, basil stems, 1.5 tsp dried oregano, 1 tsp chili flakes (optional), 3/4 tsp sea salt, and 1 tsp black pepper to the pan.
  9. Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 12 minutes.
  10. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente.
  11. Remove eggplant from oven and set aside.
  12. Remove basil stems from the sauce.
  13. Add cooked pasta to the sauce, shaking off excess water.
  14. Add 1/2 cup pasta water to the sauce.
  15. Add roasted eggplant and chopped basil to the sauce.
  16. Mix well to combine and ensure pasta is coated in sauce.
  17. Adjust seasoning as needed.
  18. Serve pasta with ricotta salata, pecorino romano, or parmigiano-reggiano cheese (optional) and garnish with chopped basil and black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j0TMKrbF9TU

pasta_alan.txt - Pasta Alan

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple pasta dish with only 10 ingredients.
  • Understand the importance of using fresh ingredients.
  • Appreciate the beauty of simple cooking.

Ingredients

  • Pasta
  • Salt
  • Pepper
  • Water
  • Olive oil
  • Garlic
  • Onion
  • Tomato paste
  • Basil
  • Parmesan cheese

Instructions

  1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
  2. Add pasta and cook according to package directions.
  3. While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
  4. Add garlic and onion to the skillet and cook until softened.
  5. Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
  6. Add water, salt, and pepper to taste.
  7. Add basil and cook for 1 minute.
  8. Drain pasta and add to the skillet.
  9. Toss to coat.
  10. Serve with Parmesan cheese.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dgh0hbqHeWk

pasta_ala_vodka.txt - Pasta a la Vodka

Objectives

  • Learn to make a simple and delicious pasta a la vodka.
  • Understand the importance of sweating onions and garlic.
  • Learn how to use vodka to enhance the flavor of the sauce.

Ingredients

  • 1 onion, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, grated
  • 2 tablespoons butter
  • 1 tablespoon tomato paste
  • 2-3 dried chilies (optional)
  • 1 (28 ounce) can crushed or diced tomatoes
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1/2 cup vodka
  • 1/2 cup heavy cream
  • Cooked pasta of your choice (rigatoni recommended)
  • Pasta water
  • Parmesan cheese (for serving)
  • Cracked black pepper (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Dice the onion into small to medium sized pieces.
  2. Grate the garlic using a microplane.
  3. Heat butter in a pan over medium-high heat.
  4. Add the diced onion and grated garlic to the pan.
  5. Sweat the onion and garlic for about 5 minutes, adding salt to taste.
  6. Add tomato paste and dried chilies to the pan.
  7. Cook the tomato paste and chilies for about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  8. Add the crushed or diced tomatoes, salt, and pepper to the pan.
  9. Add the vodka and stir to combine.
  10. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
  11. Add the heavy cream and stir to combine.
  12. Cook for another 5 minutes.
  13. Remove the sauce from the heat and transfer to a blender or use an immersion blender to achieve a smooth consistency.
  14. Return the sauce to the pan.
  15. Add the cooked pasta of your choice and fold everything together, including some pasta water to thin the sauce.
  16. Serve in bowls or plates.
  17. Garnish with Parmesan cheese and cracked black pepper.
  18. Enjoy your delicious pasta a la vodka!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jsh81X59upY

pasta_alla_vodka.txt - Pasta alla Vodka

Objectives

  • Create a rich and flavorful pasta alla vodka sauce.
  • Learn how to properly sweat onions and sauté garlic.
  • Understand the importance of deglazing the pan with vodka.

Ingredients

  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 medium yellow onion, diced
  • 150 grams (5.2 ounces) concentrated tomato paste
  • 3/4 teaspoon (1 gram) dried chili flakes (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) vodka
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 cup (250 milliliters) thickened cream
  • 450 grams (15.8 ounces) pasta of choice (penne recommended)
  • 1/4 cup grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese
  • Fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced

Instructions

  1. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil over high heat.
  2. Mince the garlic using a microplane or grater.
  3. Dice the onion, saving the root and skin for stock.
  4. Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente.
  5. Heat olive oil in a large pan over high heat.
  6. Sweat the diced onions for 3-4 minutes until lightly golden.
  7. Add the minced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
  8. Add the tomato paste and chili flakes (optional) and cook for 3 minutes, stirring regularly.
  9. Deglaze the pan with vodka, stirring and allowing it to reduce for 1 minute.
  10. Season with salt and pepper.
  11. Stir in the thickened cream and bring to a simmer.
  12. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes, stirring regularly.
  13. Drain the pasta, reserving about 1 cup of pasta water.
  14. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and toss to coat.
  15. Stir in grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese.
  16. Add a small amount of pasta water to thin the sauce, if desired.
  17. Serve the pasta in bowls or plates, topped with additional grated cheese and fresh basil.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jo2wVOTIPaA

pasta_arabiata.txt - Pasta Arabiata

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and quick pasta arabiata.
  • Understand how to create a flavorful tomato sauce with garlic and chili flakes.
  • Learn how to cook pasta al dente and create a sauce with the perfect consistency.

Ingredients

  • 5 cloves garlic, peeled and minced
  • 60 ml (1/4 cup) olive oil
  • 1.5 tsp (3g) dried chili flakes
  • 2 x 800g (28 oz) cans crushed tomatoes or baby roma tomatoes in sauce
  • 1 tsp (5g) sea salt flakes
  • 1 tsp (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 500g (1.1 lb) pasta of choice (e.g., spaghetti)
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Fresh basil leaves (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a large pot of water on the stovetop over high heat. Add a small handful of sea salt and bring to a boil.
  2. While the water is heating, mince the garlic using a microplane or grater.
  3. Heat a large pan over high heat. Add the olive oil and minced garlic. Stir to combine and sauté for 1 minute, or until the garlic starts to sizzle.
  4. Add the chili flakes and stir to combine. Sauté for 10 seconds.
  5. Add the crushed tomatoes or baby roma tomatoes in sauce. Stir well to combine all flavors.
  6. Add the salt and pepper and stir well. Bring the sauce to a simmer.
  7. Reduce the heat to low and allow the sauce to simmer and reduce for 20 minutes, stirring frequently.
  8. After the sauce has been simmering for 10 minutes, add the pasta to the boiling water. If using spaghetti, allow it to sit for 20-30 seconds to soften.
  9. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions or until al dente, stirring occasionally.
  10. If using baby roma tomatoes or whole tomatoes, lightly crush them after 15 minutes of simmering to burst them and increase the flavor of the sauce.
  11. Once the pasta is al dente, transfer it directly from the pot into the reduced arabiata sauce, bringing along some of the pasta water.
  12. Stir well to ensure the sauce completely coats the pasta. Add some of the reserved pasta water to achieve your desired consistency.
  13. Adjust seasoning levels to your taste.
  14. Turn off the heat and remove the pasta from the stovetop.
  15. Serve the pasta in a bowl. Top with shaved or grated Parmesan cheese, torn fresh basil leaves, and cracked black pepper.
  16. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D8WQWMEAwd0

pasta_la_vodka.txt - Pasta alla Vodka

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy pasta alla vodka.
  • Understand the importance of sweating onions and garlic.
  • Create a smooth and flavorful sauce with a food processor.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 5 cloves of garlic
  • 30 grams unsalted butter
  • 130 grams triple concentrated tomato paste
  • 2 grams chili flakes (optional)
  • 1 can (400 grams) crushed tomatoes
  • Salt
  • Cracked black pepper (20 cracks)
  • Sugar (optional)
  • 60 milliliters vodka
  • 1 cup (250 milliliters) thickened cream (at least 35% fat)
  • 500 grams rigatoni or other pasta
  • Parmigiano Reggiano cheese or pecorino Romano (optional)
  • Basil (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion in half through the root, peel off the skins, and dice into small to medium pieces.
  2. Grate the garlic using a microplane or box grater to create a paste.
  3. Heat a large pan over medium heat and melt the butter.
  4. Add the diced onion and garlic paste to the pan and cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until softened.
  5. Season with salt and pepper.
  6. Add the tomato paste and chili flakes (if using) to the pan and cook for 3 minutes, stirring until the paste releases some oil and deepens in color.
  7. Add the crushed tomatoes, salt, pepper, and sugar (if using) to the pan and stir well.
  8. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cook for 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
  9. Add the vodka and stir well. Cook for 5 minutes.
  10. Add the thickened cream and stir until the sauce turns a golden orange color. Cook for 5 minutes over low heat.
  11. Remove the sauce from the heat and let it cool for 10-15 minutes.
  12. While the sauce cools, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta for 1 minute less than the package instructions.
  13. Blend the cooled sauce in a food processor until smooth (optional).
  14. Return the sauce to the pan over low heat.
  15. Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the sauce along with some of the pasta water. Stir well and cook for 1 minute.
  16. Adjust the sauce consistency with the pasta water as needed.
  17. Serve the pasta immediately, topped with cheese and pepper, and garnished with basil (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B9IUmgfLnDs

pasta_with_anchovies.txt - Pasta with Anchovies

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful pasta dish with anchovies, olives, and capers.
  • Understand the importance of cooking pasta al dente.
  • Master the technique of combining pasta with sauce for optimal flavor.

Ingredients

  • 2 cloves garlic, sliced in half and thinly sliced
  • 40 grams Kalamata olives, sliced into quarters
  • 15 grams rinsed capers, roughly chopped
  • 5 grams fresh oregano, roughly chopped
  • 2 stalks basil, leaves removed and roughly chopped
  • 300 grams spaghetti
  • 30 milliliters olive oil
  • 6 anchovy fillets
  • 1 can crushed tomatoes
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice 2 cloves of garlic in half and then thinly slice across into even-sized pieces.
  2. Slice 40 grams of Kalamata olives into quarters.
  3. Roughly chop 15 grams of rinsed capers.
  4. Roughly chop 5 grams of fresh oregano.
  5. Remove the leaves from two stalks of basil, saving the stalks.
  6. Roughly chop or tear the basil leaves into small pieces.
  7. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook 300 grams of spaghetti one minute less than the packet instructions.
  8. Place a pan over medium-high heat and add 30 milliliters of olive oil.
  9. Add 6 anchovy fillets to the pan and saute for one minute.
  10. Add the garlic, olives, and capers to the pan and saute for another minute.
  11. Add the oregano, basil stems, one can of crushed tomatoes, and pepper to taste.
  12. Mix well and bring to a boil.
  13. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 8 minutes.
  14. When the pasta is cooked, remove it from the heat and drain it through a colander.
  15. Discard the basil stems.
  16. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and cook and mix for one minute.
  17. Serve into bowls or plates.
  18. Garnish with basil, parmesan cheese, and pepper.
  19. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dICyf9CrL1s

patty_mil.txt - Patty Mil

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a patty mil, a hybrid between a burger and a toasty.
  • Discover the key ingredients and techniques for creating a delicious patty mil.
  • Learn how to caramelize onions and smash beef patties for optimal flavor.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • Butter
  • Olive oil
  • Salt
  • Brown sugar
  • Balsamic vinegar
  • 80/20 beef mince
  • Bread (as many slices as desired)
  • Cheese (as desired)
  • Chipotle in adobo sauce

Instructions

  1. Slice one brown or yellow onion into thin strips.
  2. Add butter and olive oil to a pan and heat over medium heat.
  3. Add the sliced onions, a pinch of salt, and sauté for approximately 45 minutes until caramelized.
  4. Stir in brown sugar and balsamic vinegar, continue cooking, and set aside.
  5. Roll out 80/20 beef mince into patties.
  6. Butter slices of bread as desired.
  7. Toast the bread in a pan over medium heat to your desired level of crispness.
  8. In the same pan, add oil and place the beef patties on top.
  9. Cover the patties with a sheet of parchment paper and press down firmly to smash.
  10. Remove the parchment paper and season the patties generously with salt and cracked black pepper.
  11. Flip the patties and repeat the smashing process.
  12. Cook the patties for approximately one minute on each side.
  13. Add cheese to the patties and allow it to melt.
  14. Spread Chipotle in adobo sauce on the toasted bread.
  15. Layer the caramelized onions on top of the sauce.
  16. Place the double-smashed beef patties on top of the onions.
  17. Cover the patty mil with the other slice of toasted bread.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mojVmfIbBpM

peanut_butter.txt - Easy and Delicious Peanut Butter

Objectives

  • Learn how to make homemade peanut butter.
  • Understand the importance of roasting peanuts for flavor.
  • Discover a simple recipe for a smooth and delicious peanut butter.

Ingredients

  • 375 grams (13.2 ounces) raw peanuts
  • 2 teaspoons (16 grams) honey
  • 3 teaspoons (15 milliliters) canola oil
  • 3/4 teaspoon (3.5 grams) sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
  2. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
  3. Spread 375 grams (13.2 ounces) of raw peanuts evenly on the tray.
  4. Roast peanuts for 5-6 minutes, or until golden brown.
  5. Allow peanuts to cool completely.
  6. Transfer cooled peanuts to a food processor or blender.
  7. Process for 2 minutes, scraping down the sides occasionally, until the peanuts start to release their oils and become smooth.
  8. Add 2 teaspoons (16 grams) honey, 3 teaspoons (15 milliliters) canola oil, and 3/4 teaspoon (3.5 grams) sea salt flakes.
  9. Process for another 2 minutes, or until everything is smooth.
  10. Pour freshly made peanut butter into a glass jar or airtight container.
  11. Enjoy your delicious homemade peanut butter!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0tKoZ9ZPkAI

pepper_beef_stir_fry.txt - Pepper Beef Stir-Fry

Objectives

  • Create a quick and easy pepper beef stir-fry.
  • Prepare a flavorful stir-fry sauce with a balance of sweet, salty, and spicy notes.
  • Learn to cook rice with infused lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves.

Ingredients

  • 600 grams (1.3 pounds) beef fillet (or substitute with flank, skirt, rump, or chicken)
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 1 green bell pepper
  • 3 bunches baby bok choy
  • 20 grams (0.7 ounces) ginger, peeled
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 1/2 cup (125 ml) low sodium soy sauce
  • 30 grams (1.06 ounces) brown sugar
  • 2 tablespoons (30 grams) sriracha sauce (or chili sauce of your choice)
  • 2 teaspoons (10 ml) toasted sesame oil
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons (12 grams) corn flour
  • 30 black peppercorns, cracked
  • 400 grams jasmine rice
  • 600 ml (600 grams) cold water
  • 1 stalk lemongrass, bruised (optional)
  • 4 kaffir lime leaves (optional)
  • 2 teaspoons (10 ml) peanut oil
  • Salt to taste
  • Sesame seeds for garnish (optional)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the vegetables:
  2. Slice the bell peppers in half, remove the pith and seeds, and chop into medium-sized chunks or strips.
  3. Remove the roots from the baby bok choy, separate the leaves, wash them, and chop roughly.
  4. Slice the bok choy stems into strips similar to the bell peppers.
  5. Prepare the ginger and garlic:
  6. Peel the ginger using a spoon to minimize waste.
  7. Grate the ginger and garlic using a microplane or box grater.
  8. Prepare the beef:
  9. Slice the beef fillet across the grain into even-sized pieces.
  10. Prepare the sauce:
  11. Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, sriracha sauce, sesame oil, corn flour, and black pepper in a bowl.
  12. Whisk until smooth.
  13. Cook the rice:
  14. Place a saucepan over high heat and add the washed rice.
  15. Add cold water, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves (optional), and salt.
  16. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes.
  17. Turn off the heat and let stand for 6 minutes.
  18. Remove the lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves (if used) and fluff the rice.
  19. Stir-fry the bell peppers and bok choy stems:
  20. Heat 2 teaspoons of peanut oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
  21. Add the bell peppers and stir-fry for 2-2.5 minutes until lightly golden.
  22. Add the bok choy stems and stir-fry for 1 minute until softened.
  23. Transfer the veggies to a bowl.
  24. Sear the beef:
  25. Heat 2 teaspoons of peanut oil in the wok or pan over high heat.
  26. Add the sliced beef in batches, seasoning with salt if desired.
  27. Stir-fry for 45 seconds to 1 minute until lightly browned but not cooked through.
  28. Remove the beef and repeat with the remaining batches.
  29. Combine and cook the stir-fry:
  30. Heat the wok or pan over medium-high heat.
  31. Add the stir-fried veggies, seared beef, bok choy leaves, minced garlic, ginger, and sauce.
  32. Bring the sauce to a light boil and mix well.
  33. Cook for 1.5-2 minutes until the sauce thickens.
  34. Assemble and serve:
  35. Portion the rice and pepper beef stir-fry into containers.
  36. Garnish with sesame seeds (optional).
  37. Let cool slightly before storing.

Enjoy your delicious and easy pepper beef stir-fry!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=akpZhZS194A

peppercorn_sauce.txt - Creamy Peppercorn Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a classic peppercorn sauce
  • Enhance the flavor of your steak with a delicious accompaniment
  • Master the art of deglazing and reducing sauces

Ingredients

  • Dried black peppercorns
  • Fresh green peppercorns
  • Brandy or cognac
  • Beef stock
  • Heavy cream
  • Salt

Instructions

  1. Place dried black peppercorns in a mortar and pestle and crush until coarsely ground.
  2. Add fresh green peppercorns to the mortar and pestle and crush until coarsely ground.
  3. Heat the same pan used for cooking the steak over medium-high heat.
  4. Deglaze the pan with brandy or cognac, cooking for a couple of minutes until reduced by half.
  5. Add beef stock to the pan and reduce by half, bringing out the flavor.
  6. Add heavy cream, crushed black and green peppercorns, and a pinch of salt to the pan.
  7. Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 6-7 minutes until thickened and golden.
  8. Remove the sauce from heat and serve alongside a cooked steak.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iq4NKvkwHME

pepper_sauce.txt - Pepper Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a rich and creamy pepper sauce.
  • Discover the importance of proper sauce reduction and flavor development.
  • Explore various uses for this versatile sauce.

Ingredients

  • 1 medium brown onion
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 3 grams flat leaf parsley
  • 3 tablespoons (42 grams) clarified butter
  • 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) brandy
  • 1 tablespoon (5 grams) black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon (10 grams) green peppercorns
  • 50 milliliters beef stock
  • 3 sprigs fresh thyme
  • 450 milliliters full fat thickened cream
  • 1 tablespoon (5 grams) black pepper
  • 1-1.5 teaspoons sea salt flakes
  • 2-3 sprigs fresh thyme (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion in half, then into thin slices, stopping at the root.
  2. Dice the onion, removing any excess flesh from the root.
  3. Slice the garlic cloves in half, lay them flat, and thinly slice.
  4. Finely chop the parsley.
  5. Heat a heavy-based skillet over high heat.
  6. Add the clarified butter and melt slowly.
  7. Add the diced onion and saute for 3 minutes, or until golden and translucent, stirring frequently.
  8. Add the sliced garlic and stir for 45 seconds.
  9. Pour in the brandy, being careful as it may flambe.
  10. Reduce the brandy for 1 minute, stirring frequently.
  11. Add the black pepper, green peppercorns, and beef stock.
  12. Reduce the stock for 1 minute, or until reduced by half.
  13. Add the chopped parsley, thyme sprigs, cream, and another tablespoon of black pepper.
  14. Season with salt and mix well.
  15. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce heat to low.
  16. Simmer for 10-12 minutes, or until the sauce is reduced by half and thickened, stirring occasionally.
  17. Remove the thyme sprigs from the pan.
  18. Remove the pan from the stovetop.
  19. Add more cracked black pepper to taste.
  20. Garnish with thyme sprigs and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0GF1bqQ2_Vg

perfect_juicy_chicken_breast.txt - Perfect Juicy Chicken Breast

Objectives

  • Learn how to cook juicy chicken breast every time.
  • Master the searing and oven cooking technique for chicken.
  • Create a flavorful marinade for chicken breast.

Ingredients

  • 1 chicken breast
  • 1 teaspoon (5 ml) olive oil
  • 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) olive oil

Instructions

  1. Place the chicken breast in a bowl.
  2. Add 1 teaspoon (5 ml) olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon onion powder, 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes, and 1 teaspoon (10 cracks) black pepper to the bowl.
  3. Use your hands or a spoon to rub the marinade all over the chicken breast until it is fully coated.
  4. Place a pan on the stovetop over high heat.
  5. Once the pan is hot, add 1 tablespoon (20 ml) olive oil.
  6. Carefully place the chicken breast skin side down in the pan.
  7. Sear the chicken for 2.5 minutes, or until it is golden brown.
  8. Flip the chicken breast over.
  9. Remove the pan from the stovetop and place it in a preheated oven set to 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit).
  10. Cook the chicken for 13 minutes.
  11. Remove the chicken from the oven and allow it to rest for 4 minutes.
  12. Slice the chicken breast as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k-cUHswM_b0

perfect_steak_weber_spirit.txt - The Perfect Steak on the Weber Spirit

Objectives

  • Learn to cook a perfect steak on the Weber Spirit BBQ.
  • Understand the importance of preheating, seasoning, and resting.
  • Explore the features of the Weber Spirit BBQ.

Ingredients

  • 350 grams Scotch fillet (ribeye)
  • Weber Steak Seasoning (or salt and pepper)
  • Neutral-flavored oil (optional)
  • Unsalted butter (optional)
  • 25 grams basil leaves
  • 25 grams mint leaves
  • 25 grams flat leaf parsley
  • 30 grams cornichons
  • 30 grams capers
  • 40 milliliters red wine vinegar
  • Sea salt flakes (to taste)
  • Cracked black pepper (20 grams)
  • Extra virgin olive oil

Instructions

  1. Preheat the Weber Spirit BBQ to 270 degrees Celsius (high heat on all knobs).
  2. Let the steak come to room temperature (about 45 minutes).
  3. Season the steak generously with Weber Steak Seasoning or salt and pepper.
  4. Drizzle a little neutral-flavored oil over the steak (optional).
  5. Place the steak on the preheated grill, pressing down slightly to create grill marks.
  6. Cook for 1.5 minutes with the lid closed.
  7. Rotate the steak 45 degrees and repeat step 6.
  8. Flip the steak to the other side and repeat steps 6 and 7.
  9. Drizzle unsalted butter over the steak (optional).
  10. Remove the steak from the grill at 49 degrees Celsius internal temperature.
  11. Rest the steak for 10 minutes to allow the juices to redistribute.
  12. While the steak rests, prepare the salsa verde by blending all ingredients until smooth.
  13. Slowly add extra virgin olive oil to the salsa verde until it reaches a pourable consistency.
  14. Slice the steak in half for presentation and then into strips.
  15. Serve the steak with the salsa verde.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rwATgKOv3wg

pesto_chicken_pasta_meal_prep.txt - Pesto Chicken Pasta Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and convenient pesto chicken pasta meal prep.
  • Utilize a combination of baking and grilling techniques for optimal flavor.
  • Assemble individual portions for easy meal prep.

Ingredients

  • 750 grams chicken breast
  • 2 teaspoons onion powder
  • 2 teaspoons garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 30 grams pine nuts
  • 2-3 cloves garlic
  • 1 lemon (sliced and juiced)
  • 2 bunches basil (picked, with stems saved from one bunch)
  • 30 grams parmesan cheese
  • 125 milliliters extra virgin olive oil (EVO)
  • 750 grams penne pasta
  • Salt (for pasta water)

Instructions

  1. Combine 750 grams of chicken breast with 2 teaspoons each of onion powder and garlic powder, salt, pepper, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Mix well.
  2. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
  3. Sear the chicken for 2 minutes on each side.
  4. Transfer the chicken to a 200°C oven and bake for 13 minutes.
  5. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest.
  6. Place 30 grams of pine nuts on a lined baking tray and grill for 1.5 minutes. Remove and let cool.
  7. Mince 2-3 cloves of garlic using a microplane.
  8. Slice and juice half a lemon.
  9. Pick the leaves from 2 bunches of basil, saving the stems from one bunch. Roughly chop the basil stems.
  10. Add the minced garlic, 30 grams of parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and lemon juice to a blender. Blend until combined.
  11. Add the chopped basil, basil stems, salt, pepper, and 125 milliliters of EVO to the blender. Blend again until smooth. Set aside.
  12. Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add salt.
  13. Add 750 grams of penne pasta to the boiling water and cook for 1 minute less than the packet instructions.
  14. Drain the pasta and let it cool.
  15. Slice the rested chicken across the grain and tear it up.
  16. Combine the cooked pasta, shredded chicken, and pesto in a bowl. Mix well.
  17. Divide the pasta mixture into meal prep containers.
  18. Enjoy your pesto chicken pasta meal prep!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ETz55VY1lY8

pickled_onions.txt - Pickled Onions

Objectives

  • Learn how to make crunchy, flavorful pickled onions.
  • Understand the importance of using fresh ingredients and proper preservation techniques.
  • Discover a versatile condiment that can be enjoyed on various dishes.

Ingredients

  • 2 medium to large red onions (also known as Spanish onions)
  • 2 cloves of garlic
  • 1 cup (250 ml) white vinegar
  • 1 cup (250 ml) water
  • 1.5 teaspoons (6 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 3.5 tablespoons (75 grams) white sugar (optional)
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) cumin seeds (optional)
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) coriander seeds (optional)
  • 1/2 teaspoon (0.5 grams) caraway seeds (optional)
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1 gram) black peppercorns (optional)
  • 1 star anise (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice off both ends of the red onions and slice them in half.
  2. Peel off the skins and save the scraps for stock.
  3. Slice the onions into thin strips, being careful of your fingers.
  4. Place the onions in a medium to large heavy-based saucepan.
  5. Crush the garlic cloves with the side of a knife.
  6. Add the crushed garlic to the saucepan with the onions.
  7. Pour in 1 cup (250 ml) of white vinegar and 1 cup (250 ml) of water.
  8. Add 1.5 teaspoons (6 grams) of sea salt flakes.
  9. Add 3.5 tablespoons (75 grams) of white sugar (optional).
  10. Add the optional spices: 1 teaspoon (2 grams) cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon (2 grams) coriander seeds, 1/2 teaspoon (0.5 grams) caraway seeds, 1/2 teaspoon (1 gram) black peppercorns, and 1 star anise.
  11. Place the saucepan on the stovetop over high heat.
  12. Stir the mixture well to ensure the onions are fully submerged in the brine.
  13. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  14. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 minute.
  15. Stir the mixture again and remove it from the heat.
  16. Transfer the hot onions, garlic, and spices to sterilized or clean jars.
  17. Pour the pickling brine over the onions, making sure to fully submerge everything.
  18. Allow the jars to cool to room temperature before sealing the lids.
  19. Place the sealed jars in the refrigerator.
  20. Allow the pickled onions to sit in the refrigerator overnight.
  21. Enjoy the crunchy, flavorful pickled onions on various dishes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=toM9JzTRo9s

pico_de_gallo.txt - Pico de Gallo

Objectives

  • Learn to make a fresh and flavorful pico de gallo.
  • Understand the basic ingredients and proportions for pico de gallo.
  • Discover how to adjust the spice level to your preference.

Ingredients

  • 5 whole tomatoes
  • 1 whole red onion
  • 10 grams of coriander or cilantro
  • 1 whole jalapeno
  • 1/2 lime
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Slice the tomatoes into thin slices.
  2. Stack the tomato slices and dice them into fine pieces.
  3. Slice and dice the red onion.
  4. Roughly chop the coriander or cilantro.
  5. Finely dice the jalapeno.
  6. Slice the lime in half and extract the juice.
  7. Combine all ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
  8. Season with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper to taste.
  9. Mix well.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6uWsrHxipLE

pizza_recipe.txt - Homemade Pizza

Objectives

  • Create a delicious pizza from scratch.
  • Learn how to make pizza dough and sauce.
  • Assemble and bake a pizza with various toppings.

Ingredients

  • Pizza Dough (from part 1 of the series)
  • Pizza Sauce (from part 2 of the series)
  • Freshly grated mozzarella cheese (amount to taste)
  • 2 tablespoons of pizza sauce
  • Fresh hungarian salami (optional)
  • Thinly sliced truced tomatoes (optional)
  • Buffalo mozzarella (optional)
  • Fresh basil (optional)
  • Sea salt flakes (optional)
  • Cracked black pepper (optional)
  • Semolina or bread flour

Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to the highest setting possible (250 degrees Celsius or 480 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Place a round or rectangle baking tray or a ceramic pizza stone in the oven and allow it to preheat for one hour.
  3. Dust both sides of the room temperature pizza dough with bread flour.
  4. Pound the dough with your fingertips to form an even circle, leaving a 2-centimeter edge for the crust.
  5. Use your weak hand to push against the crust (not touching it) and your strong hand to crimp the dough (again, not touching the crust).
  6. Stretch the dough to your desired size.
  7. Sprinkle a small amount of semolina or bread flour onto a pizza peel or parchment paper.
  8. Place the dough onto the prepared peel or parchment paper.
  9. Spoon 2 tablespoons of pizza sauce into the center of the dough and spread it evenly, avoiding the crust.
  10. Add freshly grated mozzarella cheese, again avoiding the crust.
  11. Add desired toppings (e.g., salami, tomatoes).
  12. Gently shake the peel or parchment paper to ensure the pizza is not stuck.
  13. Carefully slide the pizza onto the preheated tray or stone.
  14. Bake for 5-6 minutes, or until golden brown.
  15. Carefully remove the pizza from the oven using the pizza peel or tongs.
  16. Slice the pizza into desired pieces.
  17. Optionally, slide the pizza back onto the peel or parchment paper for easier serving or to add additional toppings.
  18. Add optional toppings like buffalo mozzarella, fresh basil, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper.
  19. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5B9B-VHuNtk

poached_eggs_avocado.txt - Poached Eggs on Avocado with Chili Oil

Objectives

  • Learn how to poach eggs for a soft texture.
  • Prepare a simple and flavorful avocado base.
  • Assemble a delicious and visually appealing breakfast dish.

Ingredients

  • 1 tablespoon of vinegar or lemon juice
  • Avocado
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 1/4 lemon
  • Homemade butter spread
  • Chili oil (from previous video)
  • Flat leaf parsley

Instructions

  1. Bring a saucepan of water to a boil over high heat.
  2. Add 1 tablespoon of vinegar or lemon juice to the boiling water.
  3. Prepare the avocado by cutting around the seed and twisting it open.
  4. Scoop out the avocado flesh and place it in a bowl.
  5. Season the avocado with sea salt flakes, cracked black pepper, and a squeeze of 1/4 lemon.
  6. Mash the avocado with a fork.
  7. Crack the eggs into the boiling water and cook for 2 and 1/2 minutes for a soft poach.
  8. Drain the eggs and place them on a paper towel or tea towel to absorb excess water.
  9. Spread homemade butter on a plate.
  10. Spoon the smashed avocado onto the buttered plate.
  11. Top the avocado with the poached eggs.
  12. Drizzle with chili oil.
  13. Garnish with cracked black pepper and flat leaf parsley.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GxL9fTvf4go

poached_egg.txt - Poached Egg

Objectives

  • Learn to poach an egg perfectly for breakfast, lunch or dinner.
  • Master the technique of creating a vortex in boiling water.
  • Understand the importance of using vinegar for a smooth egg white.

Ingredients

  • 1 fresh free-range egg
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) white vinegar

Instructions

  1. Crack a fresh free-range egg into a separate bowl.
  2. Place a small saucepan of water on the stovetop over high heat.
  3. Bring the water to a boil.
  4. Add 1.5 tablespoons (30 ml) of white vinegar to the boiling water.
  5. Stir the water with a spoon to create a vortex.
  6. Carefully add the egg to the center of the vortex.
  7. Poach the egg for 2.5 minutes.
  8. Remove the egg from the water using a slotted spoon.
  9. Place the egg on a kitchen cloth to drain.
  10. Enjoy your perfectly poached egg for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MOrFRTO-uI4

pork_belly_teriyaki_salad.txt - Pork Belly with Teriyaki Glaze and Japanese-Inspired Salad

Objectives

  • Create a juicy and tender pork belly with a rich teriyaki glaze.
  • Prepare a vibrant and flavorful Japanese-inspired salad.
  • Learn how to slice and prep ingredients for a delicious meal.
  • Combine the pork belly, glaze, and salad for a satisfying dish.

Ingredients

Pork Belly - 450 grams (15.8 ounces) pork belly, skin removed - 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) sunflower oil

Teriyaki Glaze - 1.5 brown or yellow onions, sliced - 20 grams (0.7 ounces) ginger, minced - 1/2 cup (120 milliliters) homemade teriyaki sauce

Salad - 150 grams (5.2 ounces) white cabbage, thinly sliced - 200 grams (7 ounces) red cabbage, thinly sliced - 1 small to medium carrot, julienned - 1 spring onion (scallion), thinly sliced (green part only)

Salad Dressing - 1/2 brown or yellow onion, grated - 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) toasted sesame oil - 1/2 tablespoon (10 milliliters) white rice vinegar - 1/2 tablespoon (10 milliliters) naturally brewed soy sauce - 1 teaspoon (4 grams) caster sugar

Garnish - Fresh mint leaves - Fresh coriander (cilantro) leaves - Sesame seeds

Instructions

  1. Slice the pork belly into thin strips, roughly 1-2 centimeters thick. Set aside.
  2. Slice the whole onion in half, remove the skin, and slice into thin strips.
  3. Peel the ginger using a spoon and grate it into a smooth paste. Set aside.
  4. Grate the half onion for the salad dressing, saving the skins for stock.
  5. Combine the grated onion, sesame oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, and sugar in a bowl. Whisk to mix and refrigerate for up to 5 days.
  6. Slice the white and red cabbage into thin strips (chiffonade).
  7. Top and tail the carrot, saving the ends for stock. Slice the carrot into thin strips, then julienne them.
  8. Slice the spring onion on an angle to create diamond-shaped pieces.
  9. Combine the cabbage, carrot, and spring onion in a bowl. Mix well and refrigerate for up to 3 days.
  10. Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add sunflower oil and sear the pork belly for 2-3 minutes per side, or until lightly golden brown.
  11. Remove the pork belly from the pan and set aside.
  12. Reduce the heat to medium and sauté the sliced onions in the pan for 5-6 minutes, or until golden brown and caramelized.
  13. Add the ginger paste to the pan and sauté for 20 seconds.
  14. Pour in the teriyaki sauce and return the seared pork belly to the pan along with any accumulated juices.
  15. Stir the mixture for 2 minutes to reduce the sauce and glaze the pork.
  16. Remove the pan from the heat and let it rest for a minute.
  17. Toss the salad with the prepared dressing.
  18. To serve, arrange the pork belly on a plate, topping with the caramelized onions and teriyaki glaze.
  19. Place the salad next to the pork belly.
  20. Garnish with fresh mint, coriander, and sesame seeds.
  21. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qJlYVGkAkO8

pork_loin_chop_honey_garlic_glaze.txt - Pork Loin Chop with Honey Garlic Glaze

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and flavorful pork loin chop with a honey garlic glaze
  • Learn how to sear pork chops to create a crispy crust
  • Prepare a simple and refreshing garden salad to accompany the pork chops

Ingredients

  • 2 x 250 gram (8.8 ounce) pork loin chops, bone removed
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Black pepper
  • 5 cloves garlic, peeled
  • 1 tablespoon (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons (28 grams) unsalted butter
  • 2 tablespoons (30 ml) chicken or vegetable stock
  • 1 tablespoon (15 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • 2 tablespoons (65 grams) honey
  • 1 handful rocket or arugula
  • 1/4 cucumber, thinly sliced
  • 6-8 cherry tomatoes, quartered
  • 1/4 small or red spanish onion, thinly sliced
  • 1 red radish, thinly sliced
  • Juice of 1/2 lemon
  • 1 tablespoon (15 ml) extra virgin olive oil
  • Fresh flat leaf parsley, chopped

Instructions

  1. Season the pork chops with sea salt flakes and black pepper on both sides.
  2. Let the seasoned chops rest for 20 minutes to come to room temperature.
  3. Grate the garlic cloves using a microplane or grater to create a smooth paste.
  4. Heat a large heavy-based skillet over high heat.
  5. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the hot skillet.
  6. Carefully place the pork chops in the skillet and sear for 2 minutes per side, without disturbing them, to create a golden crust.
  7. Once the chops are golden brown on both sides, place them onto their fat cap for 1 minute, leaning them against the side of the pan to create a crispy crust.
  8. Remove the chops from the pan and place them on a plate to rest.
  9. Reduce the heat to low and add 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter to the pan.
  10. Allow the butter to melt and mix to ensure there are no lumps.
  11. Add the minced garlic to the melted butter and sauté for 15 seconds, stirring constantly to prevent burning.
  12. Add the chicken or vegetable stock, apple cider vinegar, and honey to the pan.
  13. Mix the ingredients together and bring the sauce to a light boil over high heat.
  14. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer the sauce for 2-3 minutes, or until slightly thickened.
  15. Add the pork chops back into the pan along with any juices from the plate.
  16. Flip the chops every 30 seconds for 2 minutes to allow the glaze to evenly coat and seep in, basting with the sauce as you go.
  17. Transfer the pan to the top rack of a preheated oven set to 180°C (350°F) on the grill setting for 2 minutes, until the edges of the chops start to caramelize.
  18. Remove the chops from the oven and set aside.
  19. Serve the pork chops on a plate, spooning over the golden glaze and garnishing with chopped parsley.
  20. For the salad, combine rocket, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, onion, and radish in a bowl.
  21. Make a dressing with lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  22. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
  23. Serve the salad alongside the pork chops.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=okg4Bl23R4I

pork_prawn_wonton.txt - Pork and Prawn Wontons

Objectives

  • Learn to make delicious and easy pork and prawn wontons.
  • Create a flavorful dipping sauce to complement the wontons.
  • Understand the importance of properly cooking the wontons for optimal texture.

Ingredients

Filling - 150 grams (5.3 ounces) raw deveined prawns or shrimp - 6 cloves garlic, peeled - 10 grams (0.3 ounces) chives (or 3 spring onions/scallions) - 7 grams (0.2 ounces) coriander or cilantro (optional) - 200 grams (7 ounces) pork mince - 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) light soy sauce - 4 cloves garlic, minced - 7 grams (0.2 ounces) chives or spring onion stems (or scallion stems)

Dipping Sauce - 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) light soy sauce - 1 teaspoon (6 grams) granulated sugar - 2 cloves garlic, minced - 2 teaspoons (4 grams) dried chili flakes - 3 grams (0.1 ounces) chives or spring onions - Coriander or cilantro

Other - Store-bought wonton wrappers - Cold water - 1/3 cup (80 milliliters) peanut oil - Chili oil (optional) - Crispy fried shallots (optional) - Green stem spring onion or scallion (optional)

Instructions

  1. Finely chop prawns or shrimp until almost a paste.
  2. Grate garlic into a paste and divide into two bowls (4 cloves and 2 cloves).
  3. Finely chop chives (or spring onion stems) and divide into two portions (7 grams and 3 grams).
  4. Roughly chop coriander or cilantro (optional).
  5. Combine pork mince, chopped prawns/shrimp, 1.5 tablespoons soy sauce, 4 cloves minced garlic, and 7 grams chives/spring onions in a bowl.
  6. Mix well with your hands until evenly incorporated.
  7. Cover and marinate for 20 minutes (no longer).
  8. For dipping sauce, combine soy sauce, sugar, 2 cloves minced garlic, chili flakes, 3 grams chives/spring onions, and coriander/cilantro in a bowl.
  9. Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat.
  10. Heat peanut oil in a saucepan over medium heat to 180°C (350°F).
  11. Place wonton wrappers on a clean surface.
  12. Add 1 teaspoon of meat mixture to the center of each wrapper.
  13. Dip a finger in cold water and rub around the edges of the wrapper.
  14. Fold one corner to the opposite side to create a triangle and crimp to seal.
  15. Pinch the sides to seal the wonton completely.
  16. Place finished wontons on a plate.
  17. Remove the hot peanut oil from the heat and carefully pour it over the dipping sauce ingredients.
  18. Mix well to combine and set aside.
  19. Once water boils, gently add wontons (12-14 at a time) and cook for 3-4 minutes until wrappers are pale and slightly firm.
  20. Remove cooked wontons from the pot, drain, and place in a bowl or plate.
  21. Repeat steps 19 and 20 until all wontons are cooked.
  22. Place dipping sauce on a plate or bowl.
  23. Arrange cooked wontons on top of the dipping sauce.
  24. Drizzle with chili oil (optional) and garnish with crispy fried shallots and green stem spring onion/scallion (optional).
  25. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A0Vl8GITQpE

potato_bake_remake.txt - Potato Bake Remake

Objectives

  • Reimagine a classic potato bake recipe
  • Create a creamy and flavorful potato bake with a crispy crust
  • Utilize simple ingredients for an easy-to-follow recipe

Ingredients

  • 1.2 kg (2.6 lb) potatoes (any type)
  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 5 g (0.2 oz) flat leaf parsley
  • 5 g (0.2 oz) thyme
  • 140 g (4.9 oz) cheddar cheese
  • 600 ml thickened or heavy cream
  • 2 tbsp whole milk
  • 1 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp whole grain mustard
  • 1 tsp creamed horseradish (or 1/2 tsp regular horseradish)
  • 1/2 tsp nutmeg
  • Salt and cracked black pepper
  • 2 sprigs thyme
  • Panco breadcrumbs
  • Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano Reggiano cheese
  • Duck fat or cooking oil (for greasing)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
  2. Slice potatoes thinly, leaving skins on.
  3. Slice onion in half moons.
  4. Grate garlic into a paste.
  5. Roughly chop parsley and thyme, removing any stems.
  6. Grate cheddar cheese.
  7. In a saucepan, combine sliced onion, cream, milk, grated garlic, Dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, creamed horseradish (or regular horseradish), nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
  8. Whisk ingredients together and add thyme sprigs.
  9. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until bubbles form around the edges.
  10. Remove from heat.
  11. In a large bowl, combine potatoes and cream mixture.
  12. Grease a large roasting dish (30 cm x 20 cm).
  13. Add half of the potato mixture to the dish.
  14. Sprinkle with half of the parsley and thyme mixture.
  15. Grate Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano Reggiano cheese over the potatoes.
  16. Add remaining potato mixture, parsley and thyme, and black pepper.
  17. Pour remaining cream mixture over the potatoes.
  18. Wrap the dish tightly with aluminum foil.
  19. Bake for 1 hour at 180°C (350°F).
  20. Remove from oven and carefully remove foil.
  21. Sprinkle grated cheddar cheese over the potatoes.
  22. Add panco breadcrumbs and cracked black pepper.
  23. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes, or until cheese melts and breadcrumbs crisp.
  24. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.
  25. Garnish with remaining cream and parsley.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jKqTx_1nXXM

potato_du_noir.txt - Potato Dauphinois

Objectives

  • Learn to make a creamy, cheesy, and crispy potato dauphinois.
  • Master the layering technique for a flavorful and visually appealing dish.
  • Discover a simple method for reheating the dish.

Ingredients

  • 1.2 kilos (2.6 pounds) Sebago, Maris Piper, or Russet potatoes
  • 3 cloves garlic, peeled and minced
  • 5 grams (0.2 ounces) fresh thyme, roughly chopped
  • 260 grams (9.1 ounces) fresh mozzarella cheese, grated
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) fresh Gruyere cheese, grated
  • 600 ml (2.6 cups) thickened cream (whipping cream or heavy cream)
  • 2.5 tablespoons (35 grams) unsalted butter
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 10 cracks black pepper

Instructions

  1. Peel and thinly slice potatoes.
  2. Mince garlic and chop thyme.
  3. Grate mozzarella and Gruyere cheese.
  4. Combine grated cheese in a bowl.
  5. In a saucepan, combine cream, butter, minced garlic, and chopped thyme.
  6. Season cream mixture with salt and pepper.
  7. Heat cream mixture over medium-high heat, stirring until butter melts and mixture is hot but not simmering.
  8. In a large baking dish, layer sliced potatoes, cream mixture, and cheese mixture, repeating layers until all ingredients are used.
  9. Season each layer with salt and pepper.
  10. Cover the top layer with parchment paper, then aluminum foil.
  11. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for one hour.
  12. Remove from oven and carefully remove foil and parchment paper.
  13. Spread remaining cheese mixture over the top.
  14. Return to oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cheese is golden brown.
  15. Allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6IKSUCYqyw

potato_salad_recipes.txt - Three Potato Salad Recipes

Objectives

  • Learn how to make three different types of potato salad: traditional, tangy bacon, and Japanese-inspired.
  • Master the basics of potato salad preparation, including cooking potatoes, bacon, and eggs.
  • Explore various flavor combinations and garnishes for potato salad.

Ingredients

Traditional Potato Salad

  • 1 kg potatoes (peeled for skins)
  • 200 g bacon
  • 4 eggs
  • 1 shallot
  • 2 spring onions
  • 60 ml extra virgin olive oil
  • 2.5 tbsp whole grain mustard
  • 2.5 tbsp white wine vinegar
  • 1/4 cup full fat mayonnaise
  • 40 g sour cream
  • 1 tbsp creamed horseradish
  • 1/4 lemon (juiced)
  • Salt and cracked black pepper to taste

Tangy Bacon Potato Salad

  • 1 kg potatoes
  • 200 g bacon
  • 4 eggs
  • 1/2 red onion
  • 2-3 dill pickles
  • 2 g flat leaf parsley
  • 2 g chives
  • 2 g dill
  • 1/4 cup full fat mayonnaise
  • 1/2 cup sour cream
  • 1 tbsp American mustard
  • 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • Salt and cracked black pepper to taste

Japanese Inspired Potato Salad

  • 1 kg potatoes
  • 200 g bacon
  • 4 eggs
  • 1 cucumber
  • 1 carrot
  • 3 spring onions
  • 2 g ginger (grated)
  • 1/2 cup QP mayonnaise
  • 1 tsp hot English mustard
  • 1 tsp rice wine vinegar
  • 1 tsp mirin
  • Salt, ground white pepper, and MSG (optional) to taste

Instructions

  1. Cook the potatoes in a large pot of salted water over high heat for 15-16 minutes, or until fork tender.
  2. While the potatoes are cooking, bake the bacon on a parchment-lined baking tray at 190°C (375°F) for 12-15 minutes, or until crispy.
  3. Boil the eggs in a saucepan of water for 12 minutes for hard-boiled eggs.
  4. Once the eggs are cooked, transfer them to a bowl of ice water to cool and stop the cooking process.
  5. Drain the potatoes and allow them to cool completely.
  6. Peel the eggs and chop them roughly, dividing them into two portions for two of the recipes.
  7. Peel and slice the potatoes that were set aside for the skins.
  8. Toss the potato skins with oil, salt, and pepper, then bake them on a parchment-lined baking tray at 190°C (375°F) for 12-15 minutes, or until crispy.
  9. Traditional Potato Salad:
  10. Finely dice a shallot and two spring onions.
  11. Whisk together 2.5 tbsp whole grain mustard, 2.5 tbsp white wine vinegar, diced shallot, 60 ml extra virgin olive oil, salt, and cracked black pepper in a bowl.
  12. In a separate bowl, combine 1/4 cup full fat mayonnaise, 40 g sour cream, 1 tbsp creamed horseradish, 1/4 lemon juice, 2/3 of the chopped spring onions, 2/3 of the chopped bacon, the mustard-shallot vinaigrette, salt, and cracked black pepper.
  13. Add the potatoes, broken up slightly, to the bowl and mix well.
  14. Garnish with remaining chopped spring onion and bacon.
  15. Tangy Bacon Potato Salad:
  16. Finely dice 1/2 red onion and 2-3 dill pickles.
  17. Roughly chop 2 g flat leaf parsley, 2 g chives, and 2 g dill.
  18. In a bowl, combine 1/4 cup full fat mayonnaise, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 tbsp American mustard, 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, diced red onion, chopped dill pickles, chopped herbs, chopped eggs, salt, and cracked black pepper.
  19. Add the potatoes, broken up slightly, to the bowl and mix well.
  20. Garnish with chopped dill.
  21. Japanese Inspired Potato Salad:
  22. Slice 1 cucumber and 1 carrot into thin, triangular pieces.
  23. Slice 3 spring onions into thin strips.
  24. Grate 2 g ginger on a microplane to create a paste.
  25. In a bowl, combine half of the potatoes (mashed), the remaining whole potatoes, cucumber, carrot, spring onion, chopped egg, ginger, 1/2 cup QP mayonnaise, 1 tsp hot English mustard, 1 tsp rice wine vinegar, 1 tsp mirin, salt, ground white pepper, and MSG (optional).
  26. Mix well, breaking up some of the whole potatoes.
  27. Garnish with togarashi and crispy potato skins.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V8vUvyqKU5o

potato_salad.txt - Potato Salad

Objectives

  • Create a unique and flavorful potato salad.
  • Learn how to roast potatoes and macadamia nuts for optimal texture and flavor.
  • Make a tangy and delicious dressing for the salad.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- 1/2 cup (85g) macadamia nuts | 1/2 杯 (85 克) 澳洲坚果 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil | 1 茶匙 (5 毫升) 橄榄油 1/2 tsp (1.2g) sea salt flakes | 1/2 茶匙 (1.2 克) 海盐 1 kg (2.2 lb) baby potatoes | 1 公斤 (2.2 磅) 小土豆 1 tbsp (20 ml) olive oil | 1 汤匙 (20 毫升) 橄榄油 1 1/2 tsp (7.5g) sea salt flakes | 1 1/2 茶匙 (7.5 克) 海盐 1 1/2 tsp (15 cracks) pepper | 1 1/2 茶匙 (15 次研磨) 黑胡椒 2 spring onions | 2 根葱 1 clove garlic (minced) | 1 瓣大蒜 (切碎) 2 tsp (20 g) Dijon mustard | 2 茶匙 (20 克) 第戎芥末 2 tsp (20 g) whole grain mustard | 2 茶匙 (20 克) 全粒芥末 1 tbsp (20 ml) red wine vinegar | 1 汤匙 (20 毫升) 红酒醋 1 large lemon | 1 个大柠檬 1 tbsp (20 ml) macadamia oil | 1 汤匙 (20 毫升) 澳洲坚果油 1 tbsp (20 ml) extra virgin olive oil | 1 汤匙 (20 毫升) 特级初榨橄榄油 1/2 tsp (2.5g) sea salt flakes | 1/2 茶匙 (2.5 克) 海盐 8 cracks of pepper | 8 次研磨黑胡椒 fresh basil | 新鲜罗勒

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F.
  2. Toast macadamia nuts:
    • Place nuts in a baking pan lined with parchment paper.
    • Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt flakes.
    • Toss to coat.
    • Roast for 5-6 minutes or until golden brown.
    • Cool for 30 minutes.
    • Chop roughly.
  3. Prepare potatoes:
    • Wash and dry potatoes.
    • Toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
    • Spread evenly on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
    • Roast for 40 minutes or until golden and crispy.
  4. Prepare spring onions:
    • Slice spring onions in half, separating roots from green stalks.
    • Slice green stalks into bite-sized pieces.
  5. Make the dressing:
    • In a mixing bowl, combine minced garlic, Dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, red wine vinegar, and lemon juice.
    • Whisk until combined.
    • Slowly whisk in macadamia oil, then extra virgin olive oil to create an emulsion.
    • Season with salt and pepper.
    • Refrigerate until ready to use.
  6. Assemble the salad:
    • Once potatoes are cool enough to handle, gently crush them with your fingertips.
    • Slice potatoes into quarters or bite-sized pieces.
    • In a large bowl, combine potatoes, dressing, spring onions, and 3/4 of the roasted macadamia nuts.
    • Toss gently to coat.
  7. Serve and garnish:
    • Place salad on a plate or in a bowl.
    • Garnish with fresh basil, remaining roasted macadamia nuts, and a few cracks of pepper.
  8. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9pCNYBv9VlU

potato_soup.txt - Potato Soup

Objectives

  • Create a creamy, flavorful potato soup.
  • Utilize roasted garlic for a subtle, sweet flavor.
  • Balance the richness of the soup with sour cream and crispy bacon.

Ingredients

  • 1 whole bulb of garlic
  • 1 medium-sized brown onion
  • 1 kg (2.2 lbs) red desert potatoes (or other potatoes)
  • 10 leaves of fresh sage
  • 150 g (5.3 oz) streaky bacon
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 900 ml vegetable stock
  • 4 leaves of fresh sage
  • 125 ml full fat thickened cream (or vegetable stock)
  • 250 ml full fat milk (or vegetable stock)
  • 2 tsp cracked black pepper
  • 1/2 tsp sea salt flakes
  • 1 tbsp sour cream
  • Flat leaf parsley
  • Loaf of bread

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
  2. Wrap a whole bulb of garlic in aluminum foil and roast for 40 minutes.
  3. Remove both ends from a medium-sized brown onion.
  4. Slice the onion in half, remove the skin, and save it for stock.
  5. Slice the onion into quarters, rotate 90 degrees, and roughly chop.
  6. Peel and slice red desert potatoes in half lengthwise, then into quarters.
  7. Rotate the potatoes 90 degrees and slice into even-sized pieces.
  8. Scrunch and roughly chop 10 leaves of fresh sage.
  9. Slice streaky bacon into medium-sized strips, rotate 90 degrees, and dice.
  10. Heat a large pot over high heat.
  11. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the diced bacon.
  12. Stir and fry the bacon for 2.5 minutes, or until golden and fat is released.
  13. Add the chopped sage and fry for another 3 minutes, or until crispy and bacon is deeply golden-brown.
  14. Remove the pot from heat and transfer bacon and sage to a bowl, leaving the bacon fat in the pot.
  15. Return the pot to the stovetop over high heat.
  16. Add the chopped onion and fry for 5 minutes, or until lightly golden, translucent, and starting to caramelize.
  17. Add the chopped potatoes and mix well to coat in bacon fat.
  18. Pour in 900 ml of vegetable stock, reserving 100 ml.
  19. Add 4 leaves of torn fresh sage.
  20. Remove the roasted garlic from the oven, unwrap, and slice through the center.
  21. Squeeze the garlic cloves into the soup.
  22. Stir and bring the soup to a boil.
  23. Add 3/4 of the bacon and sage mix to the soup.
  24. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 28-30 minutes, or until potatoes are soft and stock is reduced by 25%.
  25. Turn off the heat and blend the soup with an immersion blender until silky smooth.
  26. If you don't have an immersion blender, let the soup cool for 25-30 minutes and blend in a regular blender.
  27. Stir in 125 ml of full fat thickened cream (or vegetable stock).
  28. Stir in 250 ml of full fat milk (or vegetable stock).
  29. Season with 2 teaspoons of cracked black pepper and 1/2 teaspoon of sea salt flakes.
  30. Spoon the soup into bowls.
  31. Top with a tablespoon of sour cream.
  32. Drizzle with full fat thickened cream.
  33. Sprinkle with crispy bacon and sage mix.
  34. Garnish with flat leaf parsley.
  35. Serve with toasted bread.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YrK7Zm7Zs8I

pot_sticker_dumplings.txt - Pot Sticker Dumplings

Objectives

  • Learn to make delicious and easy pot sticker dumplings.
  • Master the two-step cooking method for perfect texture.
  • Create a flavorful dipping sauce to complement the dumplings.

Ingredients

Filling - 200 grams Chinese cabbage (Napa cabbage), finely shredded - 1 clove garlic, microplaned - 5 grams ginger, microplaned (divided into 2.5 grams each) - 100 grams water chestnuts, drained and finely chopped - 3 grams chives (about 10-12 sprigs), finely chopped - 3 shiitake mushrooms, finely chopped (or substitute with button or Swiss brown mushrooms) - 1 spring onion (scallion), thinly sliced (optional) - 250 grams pork or chicken mince - 10 milliliters soy sauce - 2.5 milliliters Chinese rice wine - 2.5 milliliters sesame oil - 2 grams corn flour (or starch) - 1/2 of the ginger paste made earlier - Ground white pepper to taste

Dipping Sauce - 60 milliliters soy sauce - 60 milliliters Chinese black vinegar - 5 milliliters sesame oil - Garlic (remaining from filling) - 1/2 of the ginger paste made earlier - Spring onions (scallions) (optional)

Other - Salt - 2.5 teaspoons neutral-flavored oil (e.g., peanut oil) - Store-bought wonton wrappers - Cold water

Instructions

  1. Prepare the Cabbage: Finely shred the Chinese cabbage. Wash and drain it, then add it to a bowl with a pinch of salt. Let it sit for 20 minutes to extract moisture.
  2. Prepare the Filling: Microplane the garlic and ginger (dividing the ginger in half). Finely chop the water chestnuts, chives, and mushrooms. Thinly slice the spring onion (optional).
  3. Combine Filling Ingredients: In a bowl, mix the pork or chicken mince, soy sauce, rice wine, sesame oil, corn flour, ginger paste, drained cabbage, water chestnuts, chives, and mushrooms. Season with white pepper. Mix well until combined.
  4. Prepare the Dipping Sauce: In a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, black vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger paste, and spring onions (optional). Refrigerate until ready to use.
  5. Assemble the Dumplings: Place a wonton wrapper in your palm and dab the edges with cold water. Add 1 teaspoon of filling to the center. Fold the wrapper over and crimp the edges to seal. You can fold them in a semi-circle or make three pleats on each side.
  6. Cook the Dumplings: Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add 2.5 teaspoons of oil. Add the dumplings to the pan in a single layer, making sure they are not overlapping. Fry for 2 minutes until the bottom is golden brown.
  7. Steam and Fry: Immediately add 60 milliliters of cold water to the pan (be careful of splattering). Cover the pan with a lid and steam-fry for 2 minutes until the water evaporates and the dumplings are cooked through.
  8. Serve: Remove the dumplings from the pan and serve on plates or platters. Garnish with spring onion (optional) and serve with the dipping sauce.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pB90W6jXV8M

prawn_cherry_tomato_pasta.txt - Prawn and Cherry Tomato Pasta

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful prawn and cherry tomato pasta dish.
  • Utilize the pan juices to create a rich and creamy sauce.
  • Combine fresh ingredients for a balanced and satisfying meal.

Ingredients

  • Prawns
  • Oil
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Onions
  • Tomato paste
  • Wine
  • Cherry tomatoes
  • Cream
  • Flat leaf parsley
  • Parmesan cheese
  • Rigatoni pasta

Instructions

  1. Heat a pan over medium-high heat.
  2. Add oil, prawns, and a pinch of salt.
  3. Fry prawns for 1.5 minutes per side, flipping and seasoning with cracked black pepper.
  4. Remove prawns from the pan.
  5. Add onions to the pan and sauté for 5 minutes, browning them and seasoning.
  6. Add tomato paste and cook for 5 minutes to release oils and deglaze the pan.
  7. Add wine and cook for 2 minutes, reducing by half.
  8. Add cherry tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes, breaking them up as they soften.
  9. Check seasoning and add cream, mixing until a beautiful colored sauce is achieved.
  10. Add prawns and any resting juices.
  11. Stir in flat leaf parsley for 1 minute.
  12. Add parmesan cheese, cooked al dente rigatoni pasta, and stir for 1 minute.
  13. Garnish with more parmesan cheese, flat leaf parsley, and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oPpWO6EjIMk

prawn_tacos.txt - Prawn Tacos

Objectives

  • Learn to make fresh and vibrant prawn tacos.
  • Prepare the slaw and prawn marinade.
  • Assemble the tacos with all the toppings.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- White Cabbage | 白甘蓝 Red Cabbage | 红甘蓝 Red Onion | 红洋葱 Coriander | 香菜 Garlic | 大蒜 Prawns | 虾 Cumin | 小茴香 Lime Zest | 青柠皮 Lime Juice | 青柠汁 Salt | 盐 Pepper | 黑胡椒 Extra Virgin Olive Oil | 特级初榨橄榄油 Sour Cream | 酸奶油 Garlic Powder | 大蒜粉 Corn Tortillas | 玉米饼 Flour Tortillas | 面粉饼 Feta Cheese | 菲达奶酪 Lime Wedges | 青柠角

Instructions

  1. Thinly slice or shred white and red cabbage.
  2. Thinly slice red onion.
  3. Roughly chop coriander.
  4. Grate garlic into a paste using a microplane.
  5. Peel and devein prawns by removing the vein with a toothpick.
  6. In a bowl, combine prawns, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, lime zest, lime juice, salt, pepper, and extra virgin olive oil. Mix well.
  7. In a separate bowl, combine sour cream, lime zest, lime juice, coriander, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  8. Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add oil.
  9. Add marinated prawns to the pan and sear for 2 minutes on each side until cooked through.
  10. Remove prawns from the pan.
  11. Toast tortillas to your liking.
  12. Place a dollop of sour cream, some crumbled feta cheese, and the prepared slaw on the tortillas.
  13. Top with seared prawns.
  14. Serve with lime wedges.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r0yXtpc0DEI

pumpkin_ice_cream.txt - Pumpkin Ice Cream

Objectives

  • Create a delicious, creamy, and smooth pumpkin ice cream.
  • Learn to make pumpkin ice cream without any fancy equipment.
  • Enjoy a festive recipe perfect for Halloween, Thanksgiving, or any day.

Ingredients

  • 1/4 Kent or Japanese pumpkin (400 grams or 14.1 ounces)
  • 1 teaspoon (2 grams) ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon (0.8 grams) ground ginger
  • 1/4 teaspoon (0.4 grams) ground allspice
  • 1/8 teaspoon (0.2 grams) ground cloves
  • 1/4 teaspoon (0.4 grams) freshly grated nutmeg
  • 1 can (395 grams or 14 ounces) sweetened condensed milk
  • 2 cups (500 milliliters) thickened full fat cream (whipping cream, heavy cream, pourable double cream)

Instructions

  1. Wrap the pumpkin in aluminum foil to prevent it from coloring.
  2. Place the wrapped pumpkin on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
  3. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 45-50 minutes, or until the pumpkin is extremely soft.
  4. Allow the pumpkin to cool to room temperature.
  5. Scoop out the seeds and flesh from the pumpkin, discarding the skin.
  6. In a mixing bowl, combine the pumpkin flesh, cinnamon, ginger, allspice, cloves, nutmeg, and sweetened condensed milk.
  7. Mix well to ensure all spices are evenly distributed.
  8. In a separate bowl, whisk the cream until stiff peaks form (approximately 2-3 minutes).
  9. Gently fold the whipped cream into the pumpkin mixture, being careful not to deflate the cream.
  10. Pour the mixture into a freezable container or baking tin.
  11. Smooth out the top of the mixture and cover with parchment paper.
  12. Freeze for 6-24 hours to allow the ice cream to set.
  13. Once set, remove the parchment paper and scoop out the ice cream.
  14. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8usPS97VJeo

putanesca_pasta.txt - Puttanesca Pasta

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious Puttanesca pasta with a perfect balance of flavors.
  • Master the technique of creating an umami oil infusion with anchovies.
  • Understand the importance of gently simmering the sauce for optimal flavor development.

Ingredients

  • 2 cloves garlic, peeled and thinly sliced
  • 40 grams kalamata olives, pitted and rinsed, sliced into quarters
  • 15 grams baby capers, rinsed and roughly chopped
  • 5 grams fresh oregano, chopped
  • 2 stems fresh basil, leaves picked and thinly sliced
  • 300 grams spaghetti or pasta of your choice
  • 1.5 tablespoons olive oil
  • 6 anchovy fillets
  • 1 can crushed or diced tomatoes
  • Cracked black pepper (10 cracks)
  • Salt
  • Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil over high heat.
  2. Add spaghetti and cook for 1 minute less than package instructions, stirring occasionally.
  3. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  4. Add olive oil and anchovy fillets, fry for 1 minute, breaking up the anchovies.
  5. Add garlic, olives, capers, and continue frying for 1 minute.
  6. Add chopped oregano, basil stems, crushed tomatoes, and cracked black pepper.
  7. Stir to combine, bring to a simmer, and reduce heat to low.
  8. Simmer for 7-8 minutes, or until slightly reduced and thickened.
  9. Drain the cooked spaghetti and reserve some pasta water if desired.
  10. Remove basil stems from the sauce.
  11. Add drained spaghetti to the sauce and gently fold to coat.
  12. Cook for 1 minute.
  13. Serve in a bowl, spiraling the pasta for a high pile.
  14. Garnish with sliced basil and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese (optional).
  15. Season with additional cracked black pepper.
  16. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SL7utVejXUU

quick_pickles.txt - Quick Pickles

Objectives

  • Learn to make quick pickles in 5 minutes.
  • Prepare the brine and pickle ingredients.
  • Store the pickles in the refrigerator for optimal flavor.

Ingredients

  • Cucumbers (any sort, but small pickling cucumbers are preferred)
  • 3 cloves of garlic
  • 10 grams of fresh dill
  • White vinegar
  • Water
  • Yellow mustard seeds
  • Black peppercorns
  • White sugar (optional)
  • Salt

Instructions

  1. Slice cucumbers into strips or circles.
  2. Crush three cloves of garlic.
  3. Add the garlic, dill, and sliced cucumbers to a jar.
  4. Place a large saucepan on the stove.
  5. Add equal parts white vinegar and water to the saucepan.
  6. Add yellow mustard seeds, black peppercorns, white sugar (optional), and salt to the saucepan.
  7. Bring the brine to a boil over high heat, stirring to combine the ingredients.
  8. Boil the brine for 5 minutes.
  9. Remove the brine from heat.
  10. Pour the hot brine over the cucumbers, garlic, and dill in the jar, ensuring the ingredients are fully submerged.
  11. Place the lid on the jar while the brine is still hot.
  12. Store the pickles in the refrigerator.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fpiq81ds3jE

ranch_dressing.txt - Ranch Dressing

Objectives

  • Make a homemade ranch dressing from scratch.
  • Learn how to use an immersion blender to create a creamy texture.
  • Store the dressing in the refrigerator for up to a week.

Ingredients

  • 1 whole egg
  • 2 1/2 teaspoons of white vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon of Dijon or American mustard
  • 1/2 cup of neutral flavored oil
  • 2 1/2 tablespoons of sour cream
  • 1/2 cup of buttermilk
  • 1 teaspoon of onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon of garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon of dried dill
  • 1 teaspoon of dried parsley
  • 2 teaspoons of dried chives
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Add one whole egg, two and a half teaspoons of white vinegar, one teaspoon of Dijon or American mustard, and half a cup of neutral flavored oil to a tall container.
  2. Blend the mixture with an immersion blender until it's thick and creamy.
  3. Transfer the mixture to a bowl or leave it in the container.
  4. Add two and a half tablespoons of sour cream, half a cup of buttermilk, one teaspoon of onion powder, one teaspoon of garlic powder, one teaspoon of dried dill, one teaspoon of dried parsley, and two teaspoons of dried chives.
  5. Season to taste with sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper.
  6. Mix or blend the ingredients to combine evenly.
  7. Transfer the dressing to a clean, sterilized jar.
  8. Place a lid on the jar and store in the refrigerator for up to one week.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TZJIHWVB65w

ranch_sauce.txt - Creamy Herbal Ranch Sauce

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a creamy and herbal ranch sauce dressing.
  • Understand the importance of using fresh herbs for flavor.
  • Discover a simple method for emulsifying a creamy sauce.

Ingredients

  • 2 egg yolks
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • Juice of 1/2 lemon
  • 5 grams flat leaf parsley
  • 5 grams dill
  • 6 chives
  • 375 milliliters olive oil
  • 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon onion powder
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 10 cracks black pepper
  • 1/2 cup buttermilk

Instructions

  1. Add two egg yolks to a bowl along with one teaspoon of Dijon mustard.
  2. Slice one lemon in half and squeeze the juice of half of it into the bowl.
  3. Finely chop 5 grams of flat leaf parsley, 5 grams of dill, and slice 6 chives.
  4. Add the chopped herbs to the bowl and whisk to combine.
  5. While vigorously whisking, slowly pour in 375 milliliters of olive oil to create a mayonnaise-like consistency.
  6. Add 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon of onion powder, a pinch of sea salt flakes, 10 cracks of black pepper, and 1/2 cup of buttermilk.
  7. Mix the sauce well to combine all the flavors.
  8. Pour the sauce into a glass jar or airtight container and screw on the lid tightly.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pLvi9GbReaI

ribeye_steak_breakdown.txt - Ribeye Steak Breakdown

Objectives

  • Learn how to break down a whole slab of ribeye steak.
  • Understand the difference between ribeye and scotch fillet.
  • Discover how to trim excess fat and silver skin.

Ingredients

  • 5-6 kilo ribeye (with bone)

Instructions

  1. Remove excess fat from the area where the ribs were attached.
  2. Remove silver skin, which is found near the excess fat and is chewy.
  3. Trim the top side of the meat, ensuring it's flat and even.
  4. Portion the meat into steaks of desired size, using a sharp boning knife.
  5. A general rule of thumb is 2 fingers in width or about 1.5 fingers in width.
  6. Remove the ribeye cap (spinalis) if desired.
  7. Wrap and freeze the steaks for future use.
  8. Use for grilling, stir-fries, or other dishes.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZP6qEotgUfY

ribeye_steak.txt - Ribeye Steak

Objectives

  • Cook a perfect ribeye steak to medium-rare
  • Create a delicious, flavorful crust on the steak
  • Learn how to properly rest a steak for optimal tenderness

Ingredients

  • 500g ribeye steak (bone-in)
  • Salt and pepper
  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons salted butter
  • 3 sprigs thyme
  • 2 cloves garlic

Instructions

  1. Bring the ribeye steak to room temperature.
  2. Season the steak generously with salt and pepper on both sides.
  3. Pat the seasoning into the meat.
  4. Preheat oven to 120 degrees Celsius (240 degrees Fahrenheit).
  5. Bake the steak for 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 46 degrees Celsius (115 degrees Fahrenheit).
  6. Heat a pan over high heat.
  7. Add 1 teaspoon of olive oil to the pan.
  8. Sear the steak for 1.5 minutes per side, or until a golden crust forms.
  9. Add 2 tablespoons of salted butter, 3 sprigs of thyme, and 2 cloves of garlic to the pan.
  10. Tilt the pan towards you and baste the steak with the butter mixture for the remaining minute.
  11. Transfer the steak to a plate.
  12. Top with 1 tablespoon of salted butter.
  13. Cover with foil and let rest for 8 minutes.
  14. Slice the steak off the bone (optional).
  15. Slice off the cap (optional) to reveal the beautiful color.
  16. Slice the steak into even strips.
  17. Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8P0jevA1xV8

rice_pilaf.txt - Rice Pilaf

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful and aromatic rice pilaf.
  • Understand the importance of toasting the rice and spices.
  • Explore ways to serve and enjoy this versatile dish.

Ingredients

  • 2 tablespoons ghee
  • 1 sliced onion
  • 2 chopped garlic cloves
  • 1.5 teaspoons cumin seeds
  • 1.5 teaspoons caraway seeds
  • 1/4 teaspoon turmeric
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 1 cup washed basmati rice
  • 2 cups chicken stock
  • 3 dried bay leaves
  • 2.5 tablespoons currants or raisins
  • 1 green spring onion stem
  • 1/2 bunch chopped coriander

Instructions

  1. Place a saucepan over high heat.
  2. Add 2 tablespoons of ghee, 1 sliced onion, 2 chopped garlic cloves, 1.5 teaspoons cumin seeds, 1.5 teaspoons caraway seeds, 1/4 teaspoon turmeric, and a pinch of sea salt flakes.
  3. Mix the ingredients and saute for 3 minutes to toast the seeds and soften the onion.
  4. Add 1 cup of washed basmati rice and toast for 1 minute.
  5. Add 2 cups of chicken stock and 3 dried bay leaves.
  6. Mix well and bring to a boil.
  7. Place a lid on the saucepan, reduce heat to low, and cook for 12 minutes.
  8. After 12 minutes, leave the lid on, turn off the heat, and let it sit for another 5 minutes.
  9. Remove the lid and discard the bay leaves.
  10. Add 2.5 tablespoons of currants or raisins, the green stem from 1 spring onion, and 1/2 bunch of chopped coriander.
  11. Fluff the rice with a fork or spatula, mixing the ingredients.
  12. Remove the pilaf from the stovetop and serve with your preferred dish.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PjZi1-wNmqc

roasted_carrots_and_parsnips.txt - Roasted Carrots and Parsnips

Objectives

  • Learn how to roast carrots and parsnips for a delicious Christmas side dish.
  • Understand the importance of using a glaze for added flavor.

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).
  2. Wash and peel carrots and parsnips.
  3. Cut carrots and parsnips into bite-sized pieces.
  4. Toss the carrots and parsnips with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  5. Spread the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet.
  6. Roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until tender.
  7. While the vegetables are roasting, prepare the glaze.
  8. Once the carrots and parsnips are cooked, brush with the glaze.
  9. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=btRWKdWk0jQ

roasted_cauliflower_taco_bowls.txt - Roasted Cauliflower Taco Bowls

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and easy meal prep recipe.
  • Prepare a flavorful coriander lime sauce.
  • Roast cauliflower florets and stems for a satisfying texture.
  • Cook basmati rice with a perfect 2:1 ratio.
  • Char corn kernels for added flavor.

Ingredients

Coriander Lime Sauce

  • 1 whole egg
  • 10 grams Dijon mustard
  • 15 milliliters white vinegar
  • 200 milliliters neutral flavored oil
  • 10 grams coriander
  • 1 lime
  • 50 grams sour cream
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 10 cracks black pepper

Roasted Cauliflower

  • 1 whole cauliflower
  • 4 grams smoked paprika
  • 4 grams ground cumin
  • 1 gram dried oregano
  • 1 gram red chili powder (optional)
  • 50 milliliters olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes to taste
  • 10 cracks black pepper

Basmati Rice

  • 300 grams washed basmati rice
  • 600 milliliters cold water
  • Sea salt flakes to taste

Other Ingredients

  • 1 can corn kernels
  • 1 can black beans
  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • Spring onion (optional)

Instructions

Coriander Lime Sauce

  1. In a bowl, whisk together one egg, 10 grams of Dijon mustard, and 15 milliliters of white vinegar until combined.
  2. Create a ring or nest using a damp tea towel to secure the bowl and prevent it from wobbling.
  3. Slowly pour in 200 milliliters of neutral flavored oil while vigorously whisking to create an emulsion.
  4. Roughly chop 10 grams of coriander.
  5. Juice one lime.
  6. Add 50 grams of sour cream, chopped coriander, lime juice, sea salt flakes to taste, and 10 cracks of black pepper to the mayonnaise.
  7. Mix until everything is evenly combined.
  8. Portion the sauce into five containers (approximately 80 milliliters each) and store in the fridge for up to five days.

Roasted Cauliflower

  1. Remove the florets from one whole cauliflower, reserving the core for later use.
  2. Trim the florets to ensure they are all the same size for even cooking.
  3. Remove any woody ends from the cauliflower stem.
  4. Trim the stem to the same size as the florets.
  5. In a large bowl, combine the cauliflower florets and stem with 4 grams each of smoked paprika and ground cumin, 1 gram of dried oregano, 1 gram of red chili powder (optional), 50 milliliters of olive oil, sea salt flakes to taste, and 10 cracks of black pepper.
  6. Massage the herbs and spices into the cauliflower to ensure even coating.
  7. Transfer the cauliflower to a lined baking tray, spreading it out evenly.
  8. Bake in a preheated oven at 200 degrees Celsius for 30 to 35 minutes, or until charred and soft.

Basmati Rice

  1. Place a large saucepan over high heat.
  2. Add 300 grams of washed basmati rice and 600 milliliters of cold water (a 2:1 ratio).
  3. Season with sea salt flakes and stir to prevent clumping.
  4. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  5. Reduce heat to low, cover the pan, and cook for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  6. Turn off the heat, leave the lid on for an additional four minutes, then remove the lid and fluff the rice with a fork or spatula.

Charred Corn and Black Beans

  1. Drain one can of corn kernels and one can of black beans through a sieve. Rinse the black beans to remove excess moisture.
  2. Heat a large pan or non-stick pan over medium-high heat.
  3. Add the corn kernels and a drizzle of olive oil (approximately 1 teaspoon).
  4. Fry the corn, stirring regularly, for about four minutes until lightly charred.

Serving

  1. Portion the rice, roasted cauliflower, charred corn, and black beans into five bowls.
  2. Garnish with spring onion and coriander (optional).
  3. Pour the coriander lime sauce over the bowls, mix, and enjoy!

Storage
