  • Store the taco bowls in the fridge for up to five days or in the freezer for up to four months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x54eBZ2Sjpg

roasted_duck_pancakes.txt - Roasted Duck with Plum Sauce and Steamed Pancakes

Objectives

  • Learn to roast a duck with crispy skin and delicious plum sauce.
  • Master the art of making fluffy steamed pancakes.
  • Assemble a mouthwatering duck pancake roll.

Ingredients

Duck - 2.2 kg (4.8 lb) duck - 1.5 tsp (7 g) sea salt flakes - 1 tsp (2 g) cracked black pepper

Plum Sauce - 400 g (14 oz) plums - 2 cloves garlic - 1 small brown onion - 24 g (0.8 oz) ginger - 1 long red chilli (optional) - Zest of 1 orange - 100 g (1/2 cup) brown sugar - 125 ml (1/2 cup) apple cider vinegar - 60 ml (1/4 cup) dark soy sauce - 1 tbsp honey - 1 tsp sea salt flakes - 1 tsp Chinese five-spice powder

Pancakes - 240 g (2 cups) plain all-purpose flour - 44 ml (3 tbsp) vegetable oil - 1/2 tsp sea salt flakes - 250 ml (1 cup) boiling water

Assembly - 1 cucumber - 3 spring onions - 3 tbsp plum sauce

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 150°C (300°F).
  2. Pat the duck dry with paper towels and score the skin, being careful not to penetrate the meat.
  3. Season the duck with salt and pepper, pressing the seasoning into the skin.
  4. Place the duck breast-side up on a wire rack in an oven tray and roast for 50 minutes.
  5. While the duck roasts, prepare the plum sauce:
    • Rinse and chop the plums, removing the stones.
    • Chop the garlic, onion, and chilli.
    • Grate the ginger.
    • Combine all sauce ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
    • Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
    • Blend the sauce until smooth.
    • Simmer for another 12 minutes, or until thickened.
  6. After 50 minutes, flip the duck over and roast for another 50 minutes.
  7. Make the steamed pancakes:
    • Combine flour, oil, salt, and boiling water in a bowl.
    • Mix with a spoon until a dough forms.
    • Let cool for 5 minutes.
    • Knead the dough for 2-3 minutes.
    • Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.
  8. After the second 50 minutes, flip the duck again and roast for another 40 minutes.
  9. While the duck finishes roasting, prepare the pancakes:
    • Divide the dough into 18 equal pieces.
    • Roll each piece into a smooth ball.
    • Roll each ball into a thin circle (18-20 cm).
    • Steam the pancakes one at a time for 1 minute each.
  10. After 40 minutes, remove the duck from the oven and increase the oven temperature to 190°C (375°F).
  11. Brush the duck with 3 tablespoons of plum sauce and roast for 10-12 minutes, or until the skin is crispy.
  12. Let the duck rest for 10 minutes, covered with foil.
  13. Shred the duck meat from the bone.
  14. To assemble the pancakes:
    • Brush each pancake with 1 tablespoon of plum sauce.
    • Add cucumber strips, duck meat, and spring onions.
    • Roll up the pancakes.
  15. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1EeqoWIxZ2w

roasted_garlic.txt - Roasted Garlic

Objectives

  • Learn two methods for roasting garlic
  • Discover the benefits of roasting garlic as a whole bulb
  • Explore ways to use roasted garlic in various dishes

Ingredients

  • 4 whole garlic bulbs
  • 1 teaspoon (5 ml) olive oil
  • 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes (optional)
  • 3 cracks of black pepper (optional)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. For whole bulbs:
  3. Place a whole garlic bulb in the center of a piece of aluminum foil.
  4. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon (5 ml) olive oil.
  5. Fold the corners of the foil over the garlic to create a sealed packet.
  6. For individual cloves:
  7. Gently press down on the side of a garlic bulb with the palm of your hand to separate the cloves.
  8. Use a knife to remove the tough outer husk from each clove.
  9. Remove the root end of each clove.
  10. Place the cloves in the center of a piece of aluminum foil.
  11. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon (5 ml) olive oil.
  12. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes and 3 cracks of black pepper (optional).
  13. Fold the foil over the cloves to create a sealed packet.
  14. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
  15. Place the prepared garlic packets on the baking tray.
  16. Bake the individual cloves for 35 minutes and the whole bulbs for 45 minutes, or until soft.
  17. Allow the roasted garlic to cool for 20 minutes.
  18. For whole bulbs:
  19. Slice the roasted bulb in half.
  20. Squeeze the soft garlic out of the bulb.
  21. For individual cloves:
  22. Unwrap the cloves.
  23. Use the roasted cloves to spread on toasted bread or add to your favorite recipes.
  24. Store leftover roasted garlic in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months.
  25. To create a garlic-infused oil, place roasted garlic cloves in a glass jar and top with olive oil. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I9Cxxt0d7Wc

roasted_potatoes_duck_fat.txt - Roasted Potatoes with Duck Fat

Objectives

  • Learn to make crispy, fluffy roasted potatoes with duck fat.
  • Utilize leftover potato peels to create a crispy snack.
  • Discover the benefits of using high starch content potatoes for roasting.

Ingredients

  • 1.2 kilos (2.6 pounds) Sebago, Maris Piper, or Russet potatoes
  • 120 grams (4.2 ounces) duck fat (can be substituted with goose fat, sunflower or canola oil)
  • 10 grams (0.3 ounces) fresh rosemary
  • 1.5 tablespoons (17 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) olive oil or duck fat (optional)
  • Sea salt flakes (to taste)

Instructions

  1. Peel the potatoes and set aside the peels for later.
  2. Slice the potatoes into even-sized quarters.
  3. Place the potato quarters in a large pot and cover with cold water by one inch.
  4. Bring the water to a boil and simmer for 9 minutes.
  5. Preheat oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
  6. Pour the duck fat into a large baking tray and spread evenly.
  7. Place the tray in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
  8. Place rosemary and sea salt flakes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  9. Roast for 6 minutes to dry out the rosemary leaves.
  10. Remove the rosemary and allow to cool.
  11. Pick off the rosemary leaves, discarding the stems.
  12. Grind the rosemary leaves and salt together in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle to create rosemary salt.
  13. Drain the potatoes in a colander, shaking gently to rough up the surface.
  14. Carefully remove the hot duck fat from the oven and gently spoon in the potatoes.
  15. Spread the potatoes out in the tray so they are not touching.
  16. Roast for 1 hour, mixing and rotating the tray every 15 minutes.
  17. Place the potato peels in a bowl and drizzle with olive oil or duck fat.
  18. Season with sea salt flakes and massage to coat the peels.
  19. Spread the peels on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
  20. Roast the peels for 20 minutes, mixing and rotating halfway through.
  21. Remove the roasted potatoes from the oven.
  22. Transfer the potatoes to a mixing bowl, adding any crispy bits from the tray.
  23. Season with rosemary salt to taste.
  24. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hgfqp8g2Ack

roasted_potatoes.txt - Roasted Potatoes

Objectives

  • Learn to make perfect roasted potatoes.
  • Prepare a delicious side dish for your Christmas meal.
  • Create a crispy and flavorful potato dish.

Ingredients

  • Potatoes
  • Salt
  • Oil

Instructions

  1. Wash and cut potatoes into your desired size.
  2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).
  3. Toss potatoes with oil and salt.
  4. Spread potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
  5. Roast in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until tender and golden brown.
  6. Serve hot.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FubKLd0a_EM

rocky_road.txt - Rocky Road

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a delicious and easy rocky road recipe.
  • Master the technique of roasting nuts for optimal flavor.
  • Discover how to create a perfect balance of textures in a dessert.

Ingredients

  • 80 grams (2.8 ounces) pistachio nuts
  • 50 grams (1.7 ounces) macadamia nuts
  • 50 grams (1.7 ounces) peanuts
  • 200 grams (7 ounces) digestive biscuits
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) mini marshmallows
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) milk chocolate chips
  • 150 grams (5.2 ounces) dark chocolate chips
  • 120 grams (4.2 ounces) unsalted butter
  • 2 tablespoons (45 grams) golden syrup

Instructions

  1. Roughly chop the pistachio nuts, macadamia nuts, and peanuts.
  2. Spread the chopped nuts on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
  3. Roast the nuts in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 6 minutes, or until golden brown.
  4. Allow the nuts to cool for 5-10 minutes.
  5. Crush the digestive biscuits into a mixture of medium, small, and fine crumbs.
  6. Combine the crushed biscuits, mini marshmallows, and roasted nuts in a large bowl.
  7. Melt the milk chocolate chips, dark chocolate chips, unsalted butter, and golden syrup in a saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until smooth.
  8. Remove the saucepan from the heat and add half of the dry mixture to the melted chocolate.
  9. Fold the dry mixture into the chocolate until well coated.
  10. Add the remaining dry mixture and fold until everything is well coated.
  11. Pour the rocky road mixture into a 20x20 cm baking tin lined with parchment paper.
  12. Press the mixture down firmly to remove air bubbles and ensure a snug fit.
  13. Optionally, sprinkle chopped macadamia nuts or other toppings over the mixture.
  14. Refrigerate the rocky road for 2-24 hours to set.
  15. Remove the rocky road from the baking tin by gently lifting the parchment paper.
  16. Cut the rocky road in half, then cut each half in half again.
  17. Rotate the rocky road 90 degrees and repeat the cutting process to create 16 even-sized pieces.
  18. Serve the rocky road in a stack or as desired.
  19. Store leftover rocky road in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=epiv85nQdSc

sage_and_onion_stuffing.txt - Sage and Onion Stuffing

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a delicious and easy sage and onion stuffing.
  • Understand the steps involved in preparing the ingredients and cooking the stuffing.
  • Discover how to store and reheat the stuffing for future use.

Ingredients

  • 3 medium to large sized brown or yellow onions
  • 2 large cloves of garlic
  • 12 large leaves of fresh sage (or 2 teaspoons or 2 grams of dried sage leaves)
  • 5 grams or 0.1 ounces of flat leaf parsley (or half a teaspoon or half a gram of dried parsley)
  • 220 grams or 7.7 ounces of fresh white bread (with the crusts removed)
  • 100 grams or 3.5 ounces of cubed unsalted butter
  • 1 teaspoon or 5 grams of sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon or 10 cracks of black pepper
  • Half a tablespoon or 7.5 grams of melted unsalted butter

Instructions

  1. Slice the onions in half through the root, peel off the skin, and save the scraps for stock.
  2. Slice the onions thinly, stopping just before the root.
  3. Rotate the onions 90 degrees and slice them in half again, stopping just before the root.
  4. Dice the onions into medium-sized pieces, trimming off any excess flesh from around the root.
  5. Slice the garlic thinly.
  6. Chop the sage leaves.
  7. Chop the parsley leaves.
  8. Process the bread in a food processor to create coarse fresh breadcrumbs.
  9. Heat a large low-rimmed pot or pan over high heat and melt the butter.
  10. Add the diced onions, salt, and pepper to the pan and sauté for 5-6 minutes, or until lightly golden, translucent, and soft.
  11. Add the chopped sage, parsley, breadcrumbs, garlic, salt, and pepper to the pan and mix well.
  12. Cook for 1 minute, stirring regularly, to allow the bread to absorb the butter, lightly toast the garlic, and allow the herbs to infuse.
  13. Brush or wipe melted butter into a small to medium-sized baking dish.
  14. Add the stuffing mix to the buttered baking dish, making sure to scrape it all in.
  15. Spread the stuffing out so it's sitting flat.
  16. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius or 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
  17. Bake the stuffing for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown on top.
  18. Remove the stuffing from the oven and allow it to sit for 5 minutes before serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-6BqO605AAk

salmon_salad.txt - Seared Salmon with Asian Salad

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and healthy Asian-inspired salad.
  • Sear salmon perfectly to medium-rare doneness.
  • Create a flavorful ginger lime and sesame dressing.

Ingredients

Salad: - 1 large daikon radish (750g / 1.6 lb) - 2 large carrots - 100g / 3.5 oz snow peas - 5 red radishes - 1 long red chili (optional) - 1/2 bunch (15g) Thai basil - 1/2 bunch (15g) mint - 1 bunch (50g) coriander/cilantro

Dressing: - 30g / 1.6 oz fresh ginger - 2 large limes - 1 teaspoon / 5 ml sesame oil - 2.5 teaspoons / 50 ml extra virgin olive oil

Other: - 3 skinless salmon fillets (800g / 1.7 lb) - Sea salt flakes - 1 tablespoon / 20 ml olive oil - 1 tablespoon / 15g black sesame seeds

Instructions

  1. Prepare the daikon radish: Peel the daikon radish, removing the skin. Julienne the daikon radish using a mandoline or by hand.
  2. Prepare the carrots: Slice off the tips of the carrots and save them for stock. Cut the carrots in half and slice off a small strip to stabilize them. Slice the carrots into thin, even strips. Stack 2-3 strips and thinly slice them into julienne strips.
  3. Prepare the snow peas: Snap off the stems of the snow peas and pull down to remove the stringy part. Thinly slice the snow peas into julienne strips.
  4. Prepare the red radishes: Slice off the tip of the red radishes and discard. Thinly slice the radishes.
  5. Prepare the chili: Slice off the stem of the chili and compost it. Slice the chili in half lengthwise and scrape out the seeds (optional). Thinly slice the chili into julienne strips.
  6. Prepare the herbs: Pick the leaves from the Thai basil and mint, composting the stems. Roughly chop the coriander/cilantro, removing any large leaves or stems.
  7. Combine salad ingredients: In a mixing bowl, combine the shredded daikon radish, julienned carrots, thinly sliced red radishes, julienned chili, julienned snow peas, roughly chopped coriander/cilantro, and picked Thai basil and mint leaves. Mix well to ensure even distribution. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  8. Make the dressing: Peel the ginger with a spoon and grate it into a paste using a microplane or grater. Squeeze the juice from the limes into a small mixing bowl with the ginger paste. Whisk continuously while slowly pouring in the sesame oil. Continue whisking and slowly pour in the extra virgin olive oil to create an emulsion. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  9. Sear the salmon: Season the salmon fillets with sea salt flakes. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and once hot, carefully place the salmon fillets skin-side down in the pan, away from you. Sear for 3 minutes. Flip the salmon fillets and sear for another 3 minutes. Remove the salmon from the pan and allow it to rest for 10 minutes.
  10. Assemble the salad: Break up the rested salmon fillets into bite-sized pieces and add them to the prepared salad. Add the remaining juices from the pan to the salad (optional). Sprinkle in the black sesame seeds. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.
  11. Serve: Create a mound of the salad on a plate or in a bowl. Arrange additional salmon pieces around the edges of the salad. Garnish with Thai basil leaves, coriander/cilantro, and black sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QLhiocKkaSg

salted_chocolate_tart.txt - Salted Chocolate Tart

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a delicious and addictive salted chocolate tart.
  • Discover a simple recipe for a mouthwatering dessert.

Ingredients

  • Unspecified amount of chocolate
  • Unspecified amount of salt

Instructions

  1. [No instructions are provided in the transcript. The transcript appears to be corrupted.]

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NLUC-BPllVI

satay_chicken_curry_meal_prep.txt - Satay Chicken Curry Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a quick and easy Satay Chicken Curry meal prep.
  • Marinate chicken in a flavorful blend of Thai red curry paste, sweet soy sauce, peanut butter, brown sugar, fish sauce, and coconut milk.
  • Cook chicken in a pan and then finish in the oven.
  • Prepare fragrant coconut lime jasmine rice.
  • Create a rich and creamy satay sauce with coconut milk, peanut butter, Thai red curry paste, brown sugar, sweet soy sauce, fish sauce, and ginger and garlic pastes.
  • Assemble the meal prep containers with rice and curry.
  • Reheat and enjoy the delicious Satay Chicken Curry.

Ingredients

Chicken Marinade

  • 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) boneless and skinless chicken thigh
  • 3 tablespoons (60 grams) Thai red curry paste
  • 2 tablespoons (45 grams) ketchup mannis (sweet soy sauce)
  • 3 tablespoons (90 grams) smooth peanut butter
  • 2.5 tablespoons (40 grams) brown sugar
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 grams) fish sauce
  • 2/3 cup (150 milliliters) coconut milk

Other Ingredients

  • 20 grams (0.7 ounces) ginger, peeled
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) peanut oil
  • Sea salt to taste
  • 320 grams (11.2 ounces) washed jasmine rice
  • 360 grams (12.7 ounces) coconut milk (optional)
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) cold water
  • 4 kaffir lime leaves
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 660 milliliters (1.6 pounds) coconut milk
  • 1/2 cup (150 grams) peanut butter
  • 2 tablespoons (40 grams) Thai red curry paste
  • 2 tablespoons (30 grams) brown sugar
  • 2 tablespoons (45 grams) ketchup mannis (sweet soy sauce)
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) fish sauce
  • Sliced red chili (optional)
  • Spring onion or scallion (optional)

Instructions

  1. Marinate the chicken: Combine all marinade ingredients in a mixing bowl with the chicken thighs. Mix well and ensure all chicken is coated. Marinate for 30 minutes to 24 hours in the refrigerator.
  2. Prepare the ginger and garlic: Peel the ginger with a spoon, minimizing waste. Grate the ginger and garlic using a microplane to create pastes. Combine the pastes.
  3. Sear the chicken: Heat a large pan or pot over medium-high heat. Add peanut oil and sear the chicken for 3 minutes on each side. Season with salt to taste.
  4. Cook the chicken in the oven: Transfer the seared chicken to a preheated oven at 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit). Bake for 25 minutes, flipping the chicken halfway through.
  5. Prepare the rice: In a saucepan over high heat, combine the jasmine rice, coconut milk (optional), cold water, kaffir lime leaves, and salt flakes. Bring to a boil.
  6. Cook the rice: Reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan, and cook for 12 minutes undisturbed. Turn off the heat and leave the lid on for 10 more minutes.
  7. Make the satay sauce: In a separate saucepan over medium-high heat, combine coconut milk, peanut butter, Thai red curry paste, brown sugar, sweet soy sauce, fish sauce, and ginger and garlic pastes. Mix well until the peanut butter is fully incorporated and the sauce is smooth and creamy. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 6 minutes, stirring regularly, until thickened.
  8. Combine the chicken and sauce: Remove the chicken from the oven and place the pan over low heat. Pour the satay sauce over the chicken, scraping the bottom of the pan to incorporate the caramelized flavors. Mix well.
  9. Assemble the meal prep containers: Divide the rice into five meal prep containers. Top each container with the satay chicken curry and leftover sauce. Garnish with sliced red chili and spring onion or scallion, if desired.
  10. Reheat and enjoy: Reheat the Satay Chicken Curry in a pan or microwave until hot. Enjoy the delicious meal.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=abOZ2WSixi4

shepherds_pie_lamb.txt - Shepherd's Pie (Lamb)

Objectives

  • Learn to make a classic Shepherd's Pie using lamb mince.
  • Create a flavorful and creamy mashed potato topping.
  • Understand the importance of pre-heating the oven and the baking time.

Ingredients

Potato Mash

  • 1 kg (2.3 lbs) Kestrel potatoes, peeled and diced
  • 1.5 tsp sea salt flakes
  • 4 tbsp (56 g) softened unsalted butter
  • 1/3 cup (80 ml) warmed whole milk
  • 2 free-range egg yolks
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) freshly grated Parmesan cheese
  • 3/4 tsp sea salt flakes
  • 1/2 tsp ground white pepper

Lamb Filling

  • 1 kg (2.3 lbs) lamb mince
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp sea salt flakes
  • 1 tsp cracked black pepper
  • 1 carrot, peeled and grated
  • 1 brown onion, peeled and grated
  • 3 cloves garlic, grated
  • 3 sprigs thyme, roughly chopped
  • 1 stalk rosemary, leaves removed and chopped
  • 2 tbsp (50 g) tomato paste
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 cup cheap red wine
  • 1 cup vegetable or chicken stock
  • 3/4 cup (100 g) frozen peas
  • 1 tsp cracked black pepper
  • 3/4 tsp sea salt flakes
  • Freshly grated Parmesan cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Peel and dice the potatoes into even-sized pieces.
  2. Place the potatoes in a large pot, cover with cold water 1 inch above the potatoes, add 1.5 teaspoons of sea salt flakes, and bring to a boil over high heat.
  3. Cook the potatoes for 25 minutes, or until tender.
  4. Drain the potatoes in a colander for 1 minute.
  5. Return the potatoes to the pot and cook over medium heat for 1.5 minutes, stirring constantly to remove excess water.
  6. Remove the pot from the heat and add softened butter, warmed milk, egg yolks, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
  7. Mash the ingredients together until smooth and creamy.
  8. Optionally, push the mashed potatoes through a sieve to remove lumps.
  9. Peel and grate the carrot, onion, and garlic.
  10. Chop the thyme and rosemary.
  11. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
  12. Heat a large pot over high heat until very hot.
  13. Add olive oil and swirl to coat.
  14. Add lamb mince and break up any large chunks.
  15. Cook the mince for 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until browned.
  16. Add salt, pepper, grated carrot, onion, garlic, thyme, rosemary, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, and mix well.
  17. Cook for 2 minutes.
  18. Add red wine and cook for 5 minutes, or until the wine has reduced by half.
  19. Add vegetable or chicken stock, frozen peas, and mix well.
  20. Simmer over medium heat for 15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
  21. Adjust seasoning as needed.
  22. Spoon the lamb mixture into a medium-sized baking dish and spread evenly.
  23. Optionally, pipe mashed potato on top of the lamb mixture using a piping bag fitted with a star-shaped nozzle.
  24. Alternatively, spread the mashed potato over the lamb mixture and smooth it out.
  25. Run a fork over the mashed potato to create a criss-cross pattern.
  26. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
  27. Place the baking dish on an oven tray to catch any spills.
  28. Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
  29. Serve hot.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aCUsh4f7MXU

soft_fluffy_rice.txt - Soft Fluffy Rice Without a Rice Cooker

Objectives

  • Learn how to cook soft, fluffy rice without a rice cooker.
  • Understand the importance of rinsing rice before cooking.
  • Discover a simple method for seasoning and infusing rice with flavor.

Ingredients

  • 200 grams (1 cup) Basmati rice
  • 500 milliliters (2 cups) cold water
  • Salt (to taste)
  • Bay leaves (optional)
  • Green cardamom (optional)
  • Whole cloves (optional)
  • Star anise (optional)
  • Cinnamon sticks (optional)
  • Dried chilies (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place 200 grams (1 cup) of Basmati rice into a sieve.
  2. Rinse the rice under cold water, agitating it to remove excess starch and impurities.
  3. Continue rinsing until the water runs clear.
  4. Place a saucepan on the stovetop.
  5. Add the rinsed rice to the saucepan, ensuring no rice is left behind.
  6. Pour 500 milliliters (2 cups) of cold water into the saucepan, using a 2:1 ratio of water to rice.
  7. Season the rice with salt to taste.
  8. Optionally, add bay leaves, green cardamom, whole cloves, star anise, cinnamon sticks, and dried chilies for flavor.
  9. Place the saucepan over high heat and stir to remove any clumps.
  10. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  11. Cover the saucepan with a lid.
  12. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  13. After 14 minutes, turn off the heat and leave the lid on for an additional 4 minutes.
  14. Remove the lid and gently fluff the rice with a fork or silicone spatula.
  15. Serve and enjoy your soft, fluffy rice.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wT8wS0i2KBo

southern_style_mayonnaise.txt - Southern Style Mayonnaise

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a creamy, flavorful Southern-style mayonnaise.
  • Understand the importance of using unrefined olive oil for a richer taste.
  • Discover a simple method for combining mayonnaise with classic Southern flavors.

Ingredients

  • 200 milliliters unrefined olive oil
  • 1 whole egg
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons white vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 1 tablespoon tomato ketchup
  • 1 tablespoon horseradish
  • 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper

Instructions

  1. Combine 200 milliliters of unrefined olive oil, 1 whole egg, 1 1/2 teaspoons of white vinegar, and 1 teaspoon of Dijon mustard in a tall jar or container.
  2. Use an immersion blender to blend the ingredients until a thick, plain mayonnaise emulsion forms.
  3. Transfer the mayonnaise to a clean bowl.
  4. Add 1 tablespoon of tomato ketchup, 1 tablespoon of horseradish, 1 tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of smoked paprika, a pinch of sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper.
  5. Whisk the ingredients together until smooth and the flavors are well combined.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N2gFdS746qI

spaghetti_bolognese.txt - Spaghetti Bolognese

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful, easy spaghetti bolognese.
  • Understand the importance of mirepoix and its role in flavor extraction.
  • Discover how to create a rich sauce with rendered fat from bacon.

Ingredients

  • 2 onions
  • 2 carrots
  • 2 celery stalks (optional)
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 200 grams streaky bacon (or back bacon)
  • 200 grams sun-dried tomatoes
  • 10 grams oregano leaves
  • 10 grams rosemary leaves
  • 10 grams basil leaves
  • 1.5 tablespoons olive oil (if not using bacon)
  • 500 grams beef mince
  • 500 grams pork mince
  • 1 cup red wine (or vegetable/chicken/beef stock)
  • 2 cans (800 grams) diced tomatoes
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • 150 grams spaghetti per serving
  • Fresh parmigiano-reggiano cheese (optional)
  • Extra virgin olive oil (optional)
  • Fresh basil leaves (optional)

Instructions

  1. Grate the onions, carrots, and celery (if using) using the larger side of a box grater.
  2. Grate the garlic using a microplane or fine grater.
  3. Slice the bacon in half, then stack and slice into 1-2 cm strips. Rotate the strips and dice into medium-sized pieces.
  4. Roughly chop the sun-dried tomatoes.
  5. Scrunch the oregano, rosemary, and basil leaves into a tight bunch and chop roughly.
  6. Heat a large pot or pan over high heat.
  7. Add the diced bacon and fry for 3 minutes, stirring regularly.
  8. If not using bacon, add 1.5 tablespoons of olive oil to the hot pan.
  9. Add the grated onion, carrot, and celery (if using) to the pan and sauté for 4 minutes, stirring regularly.
  10. Add the garlic paste, oregano, and rosemary to the pan and season generously with salt. Continue mixing for 2 minutes.
  11. Add the beef and pork mince to the pan and break it up, mixing it with the other ingredients. Brown the meat for 6-7 minutes, stirring regularly.
  12. Season the meat mixture with salt halfway through browning.
  13. Deglaze the pan by adding 1 cup of red wine (or stock) and bring to a boil. Reduce for 2 minutes.
  14. Add the chopped sun-dried tomatoes and basil to the pan.
  15. Add the diced tomatoes and a splash of water to the pan. Season with salt and 20 cracks of black pepper. Mix well.
  16. Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
  17. Remove the lid and stir the sauce. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
  18. Reduce heat to low and simmer for an additional 15 minutes.
  19. While the sauce is simmering, bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add salt to the water.
  20. Add 150 grams of spaghetti per serving to the boiling water and cook for 20 seconds.
  21. Twist the spaghetti and cook according to package instructions (usually 7-11 minutes).
  22. Once the pasta is cooked, either add it directly to the bolognese sauce or to a mixing bowl.
  23. If adding the pasta to the sauce, mix well. If using a bowl, add the sauce to the bowl and mix well.
  24. Add pasta water to help the sauce stick to the pasta.
  25. Serve the spaghetti bolognese in bowls or plates.
  26. Add toppings such as grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese, extra virgin olive oil, freshly cracked black pepper, and a fresh basil leaf.
  27. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jhe-x4DxssY

spaghetti_meatballs.txt - Spaghetti and Meatballs

Objectives

  • Create a simple and flavorful one-pot spaghetti and meatballs dish.
  • Learn to make meatballs with a variety of herbs and spices.
  • Understand the importance of gentle cooking to preserve the meatballs' texture.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- 1 large brown or yellow onion | 大洋葱 4 large cloves of garlic | 大蒜 4 grams fresh thyme | 百里香 7 grams fresh oregano | 牛至 7 grams fresh basil | 罗勒 70 grams sun-dried tomatoes (optional) | 干番茄 500 grams beef mince | 牛肉末 1 egg | 鸡蛋 50 grams fine breadcrumbs | 面包糠 20 grams freshly grated parmesan cheese | 帕尔马干酪 1 tablespoon olive oil | 橄榄油 50 grams concentrated tomato puree | 番茄酱 1.5 cans (600 grams) diced tomatoes | 切碎的西红柿 400 grams spaghetti | 意大利面 Chicken or beef stock (625 milliliters) | 鸡汤或牛肉汤 Salt | 盐 Black pepper | 黑胡椒

Instructions

  1. Prepare the ingredients:
  2. Peel and dice a large brown or yellow onion, saving the scraps for stock.
  3. Peel and finely grate four cloves of garlic.
  4. Roughly chop 4 grams of fresh thyme, 7 grams of fresh oregano, and 7 grams of fresh basil.
  5. If using, roughly chop 70 grams of sun-dried tomatoes.
  6. Make the meatballs:
  7. In a bowl, combine 500 grams of beef mince, half of the diced onion, one egg, 50 grams of fine breadcrumbs, 20 grams of grated parmesan cheese, half of the chopped oregano and basil, salt, and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  8. Mix well with your hands, ensuring the egg is fully incorporated.
  9. Divide the mixture into 16 equal portions and roll into meatballs.
  10. Sear the meatballs:
  11. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan or pot over high heat.
  12. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
  13. Add the meatballs to the pan and sear for 1.5-2 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
  14. Make the sauce:
  15. Reduce the heat to medium.
  16. Add the remaining diced onion and garlic paste to the pan and sauté for 2 minutes.
  17. Stir in 50 grams of tomato puree and cook for 1 minute.
  18. Add the diced tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes (if using), remaining oregano and basil, thyme, chicken or beef stock, salt, and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  19. Stir well to combine.
  20. Cook the spaghetti:
  21. Bring the sauce to a boil.
  22. Add 400 grams of spaghetti to the pan, spreading it out evenly.
  23. Let it sit for 30 seconds, then gently nudge it into the sauce.
  24. Reduce heat to low and cook for 1 minute less than the package instructions.
  25. Finish and serve:
  26. Cover the pan with a lid and cook for 8 minutes.
  27. Remove the lid and gently stir the spaghetti into the sauce.
  28. Grate parmesan cheese over the spaghetti.
  29. Cover the pan again and cook for 1 minute to melt the cheese.
  30. Serve the spaghetti and meatballs in bowls or plates.
  31. Garnish with thinly sliced basil, additional parmesan cheese, and a drizzle of olive oil.
  32. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F9r7NFIzwZg

spatchcock_chicken.txt - Spatchcock Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn how to spatchcock a chicken for faster cooking.
  • Understand the benefits of spatchcocking chicken.
  • Learn how to use a boning knife or kitchen shears for this technique.

Ingredients

  • 1 whole chicken (or poultry of choice)

Instructions

  1. Pat the chicken dry with a cloth towel.
  2. Place the chicken breast side down.
  3. Using a sharp boning knife or kitchen shears, cut along either side of the backbone.
  4. Remove the backbone.
  5. Optional: Make a slice between the breastplate.
  6. Flip the chicken over and push down between the breasts to crack it open.
  7. Use the removed backbone to make a delicious stock.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Ewjt5Xmj50

spice_chicken_bowl_meal_prep.txt - Spice Chicken Bowl Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and healthy spice chicken bowl meal prep.
  • Learn how to roast sweet potatoes and broccolini.
  • Create a delicious Green Goddess dressing.
  • Cook juicy chicken breasts.
  • Assemble the meal prep bowls.

Ingredients

  • 3 sweet potatoes
  • 2 teaspoons olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 4 medium to large chicken breasts
  • 2 teaspoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons sweet paprika
  • Salt and pepper
  • 3 avocados
  • 220 grams natural Greek yogurt
  • 15 grams dill
  • 15 grams coriander (cilantro)
  • 15 grams flat leaf parsley
  • 15 grams basil
  • 15 grams capers (rinsed)
  • 1 garlic clove
  • Zest of 1/2 lemon
  • Juice of 1/4 lemon
  • 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
  • Water (optional)
  • 3 bunches broccolini
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil

Instructions

  1. Peel and slice 3 sweet potatoes into even-sized pieces.
  2. Toss the sweet potatoes with 2 teaspoons of olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  3. Roast the sweet potatoes in a preheated oven at 210 degrees Celsius (410 degrees Fahrenheit) for 15 minutes.
  4. Butterfly 4 chicken breasts, slicing them in half to create fillets.
  5. In a mixing bowl, combine the chicken fillets with 2 teaspoons of olive oil, onion powder, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, cayenne pepper, paprika, salt, and pepper.
  6. Set the chicken aside.
  7. Slice 3 avocados thinly and spread them out like a fan.
  8. In a blender, combine 220 grams of Greek yogurt, 15 grams each of dill, coriander, parsley, basil, and capers, 1 garlic clove, zest of 1/2 lemon, juice of 1/4 lemon, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  9. Blend until smooth, adding water if needed to thin the consistency.
  10. Transfer the Green Goddess dressing to a clean jar or container.
  11. Slice 3 bunches of broccolini in half.
  12. Place the broccolini on a baking tray, drizzle with 2 teaspoons of olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and spread out evenly.
  13. After 15 minutes of roasting, remove the sweet potatoes from the oven, give them a quick mix, and add the broccolini on top.
  14. Continue roasting for another 15 minutes.
  15. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  16. Sear the chicken fillets for 3-3.5 minutes on each side, cooking in batches if needed.
  17. Remove the chicken from the pan and allow it to rest for 5 minutes before slicing into strips or dicing.
  18. After 30 minutes of roasting, transfer the sweet potatoes and broccolini to meal prep containers.
  19. Divide the cooked chicken evenly among the containers.
  20. For presentation, add avocado slices and Green Goddess dressing to the containers.
  21. Let the meal prep bowls cool for 15-20 minutes before refrigerating for up to 4 days or freezing for up to 2 months.
  22. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jb-WYY3F27k

spiced_beef.txt - Spiced Beef

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious spiced beef dish.
  • Brown the beef mince thoroughly for optimal flavor.
  • Combine the beef with spices, sauce, and vegetables for a flavorful meal.

Ingredients

  • 1 tablespoon of clarified butter
  • 500 grams of beef mince
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons of curry powder
  • 1/3 cup of sweet chilli sauce
  • 1/4 cup of hot water
  • 1 spring onion (root end thinly sliced)
  • 5 grams of roughly chopped coriander (optional)
  • 100 grams of frozen peas
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Melt 1 tablespoon of clarified butter in a pan over high heat.
  2. Add 500 grams of beef mince to the pan and fry for 5 minutes, stirring regularly, until browned all over.
  3. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons of curry powder to the pan and continue frying for 1 minute to toast the spice.
  4. Add 1/3 cup of sweet chilli sauce, 1/4 cup of hot water, the thinly sliced root end of 1 spring onion, 5 grams of roughly chopped coriander (optional), 100 grams of frozen peas, and a pinch of sea salt flakes to the pan.
  5. Mix well and cook for 1 additional minute to heat the peas.
  6. Remove the spiced beef mixture from the stovetop.
  7. Serve over rice pilaf (optional) and garnish with coriander and spring onion.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YONvNh_YWBw

spiced_chicken_burrito_bowls.txt - Spiced Chicken Burrito Bowls

Objectives

  • Create a high-protein, high-fiber, and flavorful burrito bowl.
  • Prepare a simple corn salsa with fresh ingredients.
  • Make fried black beans with a hint of spice.
  • Cook cauliflower rice for a healthy alternative to traditional rice.
  • Sear chicken breasts for a juicy and flavorful protein.

Ingredients

Corn Salsa - 2 large tomatoes - 1 red onion - 2 limes - 10g (0.3oz) coriander/cilantro - 1 can corn kernels (drained) - 2 tsp olive oil - Pinch of salt

Fried Black Beans - 1 can black beans (drained) - 2 tsp olive oil - 1 tsp (2.5g) ground cumin - 1/2 tsp (1.5g) ground chili powder - Pinch of salt - Coriander/cilantro (optional)

Cauliflower Rice - 1 whole cauliflower - 1 tbsp olive oil - Pinch of salt - 20 cracks of black pepper

Chicken - 5 medium-large chicken breasts - 1 tsp (2.5g) ground cumin - 1 tsp (2.5g) smoked paprika - 1 tsp (2.5g) garlic powder - 1 tsp (2.5g) onion powder - Pinch of salt and pepper - 1 tbsp olive oil

Instructions

  1. Prepare Corn Salsa:
  2. Wash and slice tomatoes into strips.
  3. Stack strips and slice into smaller pieces.
  4. Dice red onion into small to medium pieces.
  5. Slice limes in half.
  6. Roughly chop coriander/cilantro.
  7. Drain corn kernels.
  8. Cook Corn Salsa:
  9. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  10. Add olive oil, corn kernels, and salt.
  11. Fry for 2-3 minutes until lightly charred.
  12. Add diced tomatoes, red onion, and coriander/cilantro.
  13. Squeeze in one lime half, adjusting acidity as needed.
  14. Season with salt and pepper.
  15. Mix until combined.
  16. Prepare Fried Black Beans:
  17. Drain black beans.
  18. Chop coriander/cilantro (optional).
  19. Cook Fried Black Beans:
  20. Heat a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
  21. Add olive oil, black beans, cumin, chili powder, and salt.
  22. Cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  23. Add coriander/cilantro (optional).
  24. Cook for 30 seconds.
  25. Remove from heat.
  26. Prepare Cauliflower Rice:
  27. Trim cauliflower, removing any woody parts.
  28. Blend cauliflower into a fine crumb, similar to rice grains.
  29. (Optional: If you don't have a blender, finely chop cauliflower by hand.)
  30. Cook Cauliflower Rice:
  31. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  32. Add olive oil and heat until hot.
  33. Add cauliflower rice in batches, seasoning with salt and pepper.
  34. Fry for 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden brown.
  35. Prepare Chicken:
  36. Combine chicken breasts, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and olive oil in a bowl.
  37. Mix until well combined.
  38. Cook Chicken:
  39. Heat a large oven-safe pan over medium-high heat.
  40. Add olive oil and heat until hot.
  41. Add chicken breasts, flat side down, and sear for 4 minutes.
  42. Flip and sear the other side for 4 minutes.
  43. Transfer to a preheated oven (200°C/390°F) and bake for 14-15 minutes.
  44. Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes.
  45. Slice chicken into even pieces.
  46. Assemble Burrito Bowls:
  47. Divide the cooked ingredients into bowls.
  48. Top with sriracha or other chili sauce (optional).
  49. Garnish with coriander/cilantro (optional).
  50. Serve immediately.

Storage: - Store burrito bowls in the fridge for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 4 months. - Reheat in the microwave or on the stovetop.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IBcYXUULV3k

spiced_tomato_pasta.txt - Spiced Tomato Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful spiced tomato pasta sauce
  • Cook pasta al dente
  • Assemble the dish with fresh basil and parmesan cheese

Ingredients

  • 1/4 cup olive oil
  • 3 garlic cloves, thinly sliced
  • 1 kilo diced tomatoes
  • 2 teaspoons chipotle and adobo
  • Sugar to taste
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 1 cup chicken stock
  • 500 grams pasta of your choice
  • 15 grams chopped basil
  • Parmesan cheese

Instructions

  1. Place a large pan over medium-high heat.
  2. Add 1/4 cup of olive oil to the pan.
  3. While the oil is still cold, add 3 thinly sliced garlic cloves and mix.
  4. Sauté the garlic until it starts sizzling.
  5. Add 1 kilo of diced tomatoes, 2 teaspoons of chipotle and adobo, sugar to taste, sea salt flakes, and cracked black pepper to the pan.
  6. Mix well to combine the flavors.
  7. Cook for 5 minutes.
  8. Add 1 cup of chicken stock and mix to combine.
  9. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  10. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes.
  11. Bring a saucepan of water to a boil.
  12. Add salt and 500 grams of pasta to the boiling water.
  13. Cook the pasta for 1 minute less than the packet instructions.
  14. While the sauce finishes, add 15 grams of chopped basil and mix to combine.
  15. Add the pasta directly from the saucepan to the sauce, bringing along some of the pasta water.
  16. Mix everything together.
  17. Serve in bowls or your preferred dish.
  18. Garnish with more chopped basil, cracked black pepper, and a good grating of parmesan cheese.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yJ1nx9hzi_4

spicy_prawn_tortillas.txt - Spicy Prawn Tortillas

Objectives

  • Learn to make quick and easy spicy prawn tortillas.
  • Prepare a delicious salsa with chipotle chilies and adobo.
  • Create a refreshing salad with shredded white cabbage, cucumber, and coriander.

Ingredients

  • 1 large red onion
  • 4 garlic cloves
  • 1/4 small white cabbage
  • 1 small continental cucumber
  • 15 grams coriander (optional)
  • 4 large tomatoes
  • 1 1/2 limes
  • 650 grams peeled and deveined prawns
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons whole cumin seeds
  • 8 grams chili paste (optional)
  • 110 ml extra virgin olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes
  • 20 grams chipotle chilies and adobo
  • Fresh tortilla wraps
  • [Optional] Hot sauce

Instructions

  1. Peel and remove the tip from one large red onion. Slice in half through the root, then make thin slices across, stopping just before the root. Rotate 90 degrees and slice through the center to break up the formation. Dice into small pieces.
  2. Crush four peeled garlic cloves with the side of a knife. Roughly chop into small pieces.
  3. Remove the heart from a quarter of a small white cabbage. Slice it on an angle, separating some outer leaves for easier handling. Slice the cabbage as thin as possible into strips.
  4. Slice off both ends of one small continental cucumber. Slice the cucumber in half lengthwise, then into quarters lengthwise. Rotate 90 degrees and thinly slice into triangles.
  5. Roughly chop 15 grams of coriander.
  6. Remove the core from four large tomatoes. Thinly slice the tomatoes into strips, stack them in twos or threes, and slice again into strips. Rotate 90 degrees and dice into small pieces.
  7. Slice one and a half limes in half and set aside.
  8. In a mixing bowl, combine the prawns, minced garlic, diced red onion, cumin seeds, chili paste (optional), extra virgin olive oil, and sea salt flakes. Mix well and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 24 hours.
  9. In another bowl, combine the shredded white cabbage, sliced cucumber, chopped coriander (optional), and sea salt flakes. Mix well with your hands and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  10. In a clean bowl, combine diced tomatoes, chipotle chilies and adobo, and sea salt flakes. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  11. Heat a large pan over high heat. Add the marinated prawns and cook for one minute on each side, shaking the pan occasionally.
  12. Once the prawns are nearly cooked, shake the pan to coat them in the marinade and remove from heat.
  13. Squeeze the juice from the one and a half limes into the pan and mix well.
  14. Heat tortilla wraps in the microwave for 20 seconds.
  15. Assemble the tortillas by adding tomato and chipotle salsa, fresh salad, 3-4 prawns, and some of the onion, garlic, and chili marinade.
  16. Fold the top of the tortilla over, tucking it into the bottom. Fold in the sides halfway and continue rolling until the wrap is secured.
  17. Slice the tortilla in half to reveal the filling and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0gYge6AGZ6k

squid_avocado_sriracha.txt - Squid, Avocado, and Sriracha

Objectives

  • Learn how to prepare crispy squid with a flavorful avocado topping.
  • Discover a simple yet delicious recipe for a quick and easy meal.
  • Master the art of coating squid for optimal crispiness.

Ingredients

  • 700 milliliters vegetable oil, canola oil, or sunflower oil
  • 1 avocado
  • 1/2 lime
  • 1/2 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • 1/2 teaspoon finely milled black pepper
  • 2 Phillips of squid or squid chips
  • 2 tablespoons plain all-purpose flour
  • 1 tablespoon corn flour
  • 1/4 teaspoon cracked black pepper
  • 1/4 teaspoon sea salt flakes
  • Sriracha sauce or chili sauce of your choice
  • Fresh coriander or cilantro leaves
  • Wedge of lime

Instructions

  1. Fill a pan just under halfway with oil (700 milliliters) and heat over medium-low heat.
  2. Slice the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl.
  3. Mash the avocado with a fork until smooth.
  4. Zest half a lime into the avocado, then squeeze in the juice of half a lime.
  5. Add 1/2 teaspoon of sea salt flakes and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper to the avocado and mix well.
  6. Score the squid by making thin horizontal slices about a quarter of the way through the tube.
  7. Rotate the squid and slice across to create a checkered pattern.
  8. Cut the squid in half and then into thin, even pieces.
  9. In a bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon of corn flour, 1/4 teaspoon of cracked black pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon of sea salt flakes.
  10. Coat the squid pieces in the flour mixture, ensuring they are fully covered and not clumped together.
  11. When the oil reaches 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit), carefully add the squid to the pan.
  12. Cook the squid for 45 seconds to 1 minute, or until lightly golden brown, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
  13. Remove the squid from the pan and place it in a bowl lined with kitchen paper to absorb excess oil.
  14. Spread the mashed avocado on a plate to create a base.
  15. Arrange the cooked squid on top of the avocado.
  16. Drizzle sriracha sauce or chili sauce over the squid and avocado.
  17. Garnish with fresh coriander or cilantro leaves and a wedge of lime.
  18. Once the oil has cooled completely, strain it through a sieve and store it in a cool, dark place for future use.
  19. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Lb7ZYNSACc

sri_lankan_chicken_curry.txt - Sri Lankan Chicken Curry

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious and easy Sri Lankan chicken curry.
  • Master the art of creating a flavorful curry powder from scratch.
  • Understand the importance of proper cooking techniques for a tender and flavorful chicken curry.

Ingredients

  • 2 tablespoons (12.5 grams) coriander seeds
  • 1 tablespoon (7 grams) cumin seeds
  • 1 teaspoon (3 grams) fennel seeds
  • 1/4 teaspoon (1.5 grams) fenugreek seeds
  • 1 large brown or yellow onion
  • 30 grams (1.06 ounces) fresh ginger
  • 3 large cloves of garlic
  • 1 large long red chili (optional)
  • 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) boneless and skinless chicken thigh
  • 4 whole cloves
  • 3 whole cardamom pods
  • 8 fresh or 6 dried curry leaves
  • 1 2.5 centimeter cinnamon stick
  • 1 dried long red chili or 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) dried chili flakes (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) sunflower oil or coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon (3 grams) ground turmeric
  • 800 grams (1.7 pounds) or 2 tins of diced tomatoes
  • 1 teaspoon (5 grams) sea salt flakes or to taste
  • 1 cup (200 grams) washed basmati rice
  • 1 3/4 cups (430 milliliters) cold water
  • 1 dried bay leaf (optional)
  • 2 cardamom pods (optional)
  • 1 star anise (optional)
  • 200 milliliters (200 grams) coconut milk
  • Fresh coriander or cilantro (optional)
  • Crunchy bread (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place a large pan on the stovetop over high heat.
  2. Add 2 tablespoons (12.5 grams) coriander seeds, 1 tablespoon (7 grams) cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon (3 grams) fennel seeds, and 1/4 teaspoon (1.5 grams) fenugreek seeds to the pan.
  3. Toast the seeds for 1 1/2 minutes, stirring regularly, until they are golden brown and fragrant.
  4. Remove the seeds from the pan and let them cool for 10 minutes.
  5. Slice the onion in half through the center, peel off the skin, and slice into thin half-moon shapes.
  6. Peel the ginger using a spoon to avoid wasting flesh.
  7. Grate the ginger and garlic on a fine microplane or grater to create a paste.
  8. Combine the ginger and garlic paste.
  9. Thinly slice the red chili (optional).
  10. Slice the chicken thighs into four even-sized pieces.
  11. Place the cooled spices in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
  12. Add 4 whole cloves, 3 whole cardamom pods, 8 fresh or 6 dried curry leaves, 1 2.5 centimeter cinnamon stick, and 1 dried long red chili or 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) dried chili flakes (optional) to the grinder.
  13. Grind the spices into a smooth, fine powder.
  14. Place a large rimmed pan or pot on the stovetop over high heat.
  15. Once the pan is extremely hot, add 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) sunflower oil or coconut oil and let it shimmer heavily.
  16. Add the diced chicken thighs in batches to the hot pan and sear for 3 minutes on each side, browning it off and moving it around often.
  17. Remove the browned chicken and set aside to rest.
  18. Once the chicken is removed, allow the pan to get hot again.
  19. Add the thinly sliced onion, garlic and ginger paste, and 1 teaspoon (3 grams) of ground turmeric to the pan.
  20. Mix well, ensuring the garlic and ginger are broken up and the turmeric coats everything.
  21. Sauté the onion mixture for 5 minutes, stirring regularly, until the onions are soft.
  22. Add the toasted spice mixture to the pan and mix well.
  23. Pour in 800 grams (1.7 pounds) or 2 tins of diced tomatoes.
  24. Mix well, ensuring the spices are fully incorporated, and bring the mixture to a boil.
  25. Add 1 teaspoon (5 grams) of sea salt flakes or to taste.
  26. Return the chicken and any juices to the pan and mix well.
  27. Bring the mixture to a boil again, cover the pan, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes.
  28. Place a medium to large saucepan on the stovetop over high heat.
  29. Add 1 cup (200 grams) of washed basmati rice to the saucepan.
  30. Stir the rice every 10 seconds for 1 minute to lightly toast it.
  31. Pour in 1 3/4 cups (430 milliliters) of cold water and stir to break up any clumps.
  32. Add 1 dried bay leaf (optional), 2 cardamom pods (optional), and 1 star anise (optional) for additional flavor.
  33. Bring the rice mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and steam for 14 minutes.
  34. After the curry has simmered for 15 minutes, carefully remove the lid, mix well to ensure all flavors are combined, and simmer uncovered for another 15 minutes.
  35. After the rice has steamed for 14 minutes, turn off the heat, leave the lid on, and allow the rice to continue steaming for 5 minutes.
  36. After the curry has simmered for 30 minutes, pour in 200 milliliters (200 grams) of coconut milk and mix well.
  37. Cook the curry for 3 more minutes to allow the flavors to mellow and balance.
  38. Remove the lid from the rice, carefully remove the bay leaf, cardamom pods, and star anise, and fluff the rice with a fork or spatula.
  39. To serve, place the rice in a large rimmed bowl, top with the chicken curry, ensuring plenty of sauce is present.
  40. Garnish with the thinly sliced chili (optional) and fresh coriander or cilantro (optional).
  41. Serve with crunchy bread (optional).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qrWpOgafwCk

steak_sandwich.txt - Steak Sandwich

Objectives

  • Make a delicious and easy steak sandwich.
  • Caramelize onions for a flavorful topping.
  • Create a flavorful mayonnaise-based sauce.
  • Cook the steak to your desired doneness.
  • Assemble the sandwich with caramelized onions, rocket, and cheese.

Ingredients

For the Caramelized Onions: - 1 brown or yellow onion - 1 teaspoon olive oil - 1 tablespoon unsalted butter - Salt to taste - 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce (optional)

For the Sauce: - 1 whole egg - 15 milliliters (2.5 teaspoons) white vinegar - 1 teaspoon (10 grams) Dijon mustard - 3/4 cup (180 milliliters) neutral flavored oil - 1.5 tablespoons (30 grams) whole grain mustard - Truffle oil (optional) - Salt and pepper to taste

For the Steak Sandwich: - 350 grams sirloin steak (or porterhouse) - Salt to taste - Oil for searing - 14 grams unsalted butter - 2 cloves garlic, crushed - 4 slices sourdough bread (or your choice of bread) - 100 grams rocket (arugula) - 2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil - Sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper (optional) - Swiss cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the caramelized onions:
  2. Slice the onion in half, peel off the skin, and remove one layer if needed.
  3. Thinly slice the onion into half-moon shapes.
  4. Heat a pan over medium-low heat.
  5. Add olive oil and butter, allowing it to melt.
  6. Add the sliced onions and a pinch of salt.
  7. Sauté for 15-20 minutes, breaking up any layers, until soft and caramelized.
  8. Optionally add a drizzle of Worcestershire sauce and cook for 30 seconds.

  9. Remove from heat and set aside.

  10. Make the sauce:

  11. Combine egg, vinegar, Dijon mustard, and oil in a blender or bowl.
  12. Blend until smooth and thick using an immersion blender or regular blender.
  13. Add whole grain mustard, truffle oil (optional), and salt and pepper to taste.
  14. Blend again until well combined.

  15. Transfer to a container and refrigerate until ready to serve.

  16. Cook the steak:

  17. Season the steak generously with salt.
  18. Heat a pan over high heat.
  19. Add oil and sear the steak fat cap down for 1 minute.
  20. Flip the steak and sear for 2.5 minutes on each side, aiming for a golden crust.
  21. After 30 seconds on the second side, add butter and crushed garlic.
  22. Baste the steak with the butter mixture for the remaining 2.25 minutes.

  23. Remove the steak from heat and let it rest for 6-7 minutes on a wire rack.

  24. Prepare the other ingredients:

  25. Toast the bread to your desired level.

  26. Toss the rocket with olive oil, sea salt flakes, and pepper (optional).

  27. Assemble the sandwich:

  28. Spread a generous amount of sauce on each slice of toast.
  29. Layer the rocket on top of the sauce.
  30. Add sliced steak on top of the rocket.
  31. Top with the caramelized onions.
  32. Add sliced Swiss cheese (optional) and melt it with a blowtorch or under the grill.
  33. Close the sandwich with the other slice of toast.
  34. Slice the sandwich in half for presentation.
  35. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xj-Gqa52qcE

sticky_asian_chicken_wings.txt - Sticky Asian Chicken Wings

Objectives

  • Learn to make flavorful and crispy Asian chicken wings.
  • Master a marinade technique for chicken wings.
  • Prepare a delicious sticky glaze for chicken wings.

Ingredients

  • 1.2 kilos (2.6 pounds) chicken wings, separated into wingets and drumettes, tips removed
  • 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) sesame oil
  • 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) shaoxing cooking wine (or chicken stock/broth)
  • 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) light soy sauce
  • 2 tablespoons (25 grams) brown sugar
  • 1.5 tablespoons (25 grams) oyster sauce
  • 1.5 tablespoons (25 grams) hoisin sauce
  • 1/4 cup (70 grams) tomato ketchup
  • 1 tablespoon (25 grams) sambal olak or sriracha sauce (optional)
  • 1/2 teaspoon Chinese five spice powder
  • 5 cloves fresh garlic, finely grated
  • 1 tablespoon (30 grams) ginger, peeled and finely grated
  • 1 fresh lemon, juiced (save half for another use)
  • 2 spring onions (scallions), thinly sliced
  • 1 bird's eye chili, thinly sliced (optional)
  • 1 tablespoon sesame seeds (optional)
  • Fresh coriander (cilantro) leaves and stems

Instructions

  1. Combine all marinade ingredients in a bowl, mixing until well combined.
  2. Add chicken wings to the marinade and coat thoroughly.
  3. Cover the bowl with cling wrap and marinate in the fridge for no more than 20 minutes.
  4. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  5. Line a baking tray with aluminum foil and parchment paper.
  6. Arrange marinated chicken wings on the prepared tray, ensuring they are spaced apart.
  7. Bake for 15 minutes.
  8. Remove the tray from the oven and carefully baste the chicken wings with the reserved marinade.
  9. Flip the chicken wings over and baste the other side.
  10. Return the tray to the oven and bake for another 20 minutes.
  11. Repeat the basting and flipping process.
  12. Continue baking for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the wings are golden brown and caramelized.
  13. Remove the chicken from the oven and place on a wire rack or heat-resistant surface.
  14. Rub the wings with the juices accumulated on the baking tray.
  15. Sprinkle with sesame seeds (optional).
  16. Arrange the chicken wings in a serving dish.
  17. Pour the remaining juices over the wings.
  18. Garnish with thinly sliced chili (optional), spring onions, and fresh coriander.
  19. Serve and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lRYbF4XTtdU

sticky_thai_pork.txt - Sticky Thai Pork

Objectives

  • Make a simple, tasty Thai pork dish
  • Learn how to roast peanuts for a unique texture
  • Create a sweet and salty caramel sauce

Ingredients

  • 80 grams (2.8 ounces) unsalted peanuts
  • 3 garlic cloves, peeled and thinly sliced
  • 90 grams (3.1 ounces) palm sugar (or brown sugar)
  • 6 kaffir lime leaves, thinly sliced (optional)
  • 20 grams (0.7 ounces) coriander (cilantro)
  • 1 lime, juiced
  • 1 long red chili, thinly sliced (optional)
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil
  • 500 grams (1.1 pounds) pork mince (ground pork)
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 ml) fish sauce
  • 60 grams (2.1 ounces) fried shallots (optional)
  • 7-8 stems broccolini
  • 1 bunch baby pak choy, sliced in half
  • 1 teaspoon (5 ml) sesame oil (optional)
  • Sea salt flakes (to taste)

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
  2. Spread peanuts on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
  3. Roast peanuts for 5-6 minutes, or until golden brown.
  4. Remove peanuts from oven and let cool.
  5. Chop peanuts roughly.
  6. Slice garlic thinly.
  7. Grate palm sugar (if using).
  8. Slice kaffir lime leaves thinly (optional).
  9. Roughly chop coriander (optional).
  10. Juice half a lime.
  11. Thinly slice chili on a slight angle (optional).
  12. Place wok or large pan over high heat.
  13. Add 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil and 500 grams (1.1 pounds) pork mince.
  14. Break up pork with tongs and fry for 4-5 minutes, or until lightly browned.
  15. Add garlic and fry for 1 minute.
  16. Remove pork and garlic mixture from pan and set aside.
  17. Place pan back over medium-high heat.
  18. Add palm sugar (or brown sugar), fish sauce, and kaffir lime leaves.
  19. Stir to combine and bring to a boil.
  20. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1-1.5 minutes, or until thickened.
  21. Add pork and garlic mixture back to pan along with any resting juices.
  22. Add 3/4 of the roasted peanuts and 45 grams (1.5 ounces) of fried shallots.
  23. Mix well to coat in sauce and fry for 1 minute.
  24. Add chopped coriander, lime juice, remaining peanuts, and remaining fried shallots.
  25. Mix well to combine.
  26. Place a clean pan over high heat.
  27. Add 1 tablespoon (20 ml) peanut oil, broccolini, and a pinch of sea salt.
  28. Saute for 3 minutes, or until slightly browned.
  29. Add baby pak choy and saute for 2 minutes.
  30. Turn off heat and add sesame oil (optional).
  31. Mix well to coat.
  32. Serve broccolini and pak choy on a plate.
  33. Top with sticky pork.
  34. Garnish with chili, coriander (optional), and fried shallots.
  35. Serve with lime wedges.
  36. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FP5Eaehx0q0

stuffed_pitters.txt - Stuffed Pitters

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious Middle Eastern dish called Stuffed Pitters
  • Prepare a flavorful spiced yogurt sauce to accompany the Pitters
  • Create a flavorful minced beef filling for the Pitters

Ingredients

Spiced Yogurt - 1 Lebanese cucumber (or half a regular cucumber) - 1 cup (250g) plain Greek yogurt - 1 teaspoon (3g) smoked paprika - 1/2 teaspoon (1.5g) ground cumin - 1 teaspoon (3g) ground turmeric - 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional) - Salt to taste - Ground white pepper to taste - Zest from 3/4 of a lemon - Juice from 1/2 lemon

Minced Beef Filling - 500g (1.1 lb) 90% lean beef mince - 1 small brown or yellow onion (or half if large) - 3 cloves garlic - 10g (0.3 oz) coriander or cilantro - 5g (0.2 oz) flat leaf parsley - 1 teaspoon (3g) ground cumin - 1 teaspoon (3g) smoked paprika - 1 teaspoon (3g) ground allspice - 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional) - Salt to taste - Cracked black pepper to taste

Other - Pitter bread (thicker is better) - Sunflower or avocado oil

Instructions

  1. Prepare the Spiced Yogurt:
  2. Grate the cucumber on the larger side of a box grater.
  3. Wrap the grated cucumber in a clean cloth and squeeze out all the moisture.
  4. Place the squeezed cucumber in a bowl.
  5. Add the yogurt, smoked paprika, cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper (optional), salt, white pepper, lemon zest, and lemon juice to the bowl.
  6. Mix everything well until combined.
  7. Store in the fridge until ready to serve.
  8. Prepare the Minced Beef Filling:
  9. Place the beef mince in a bowl.
  10. Grate the onion on the larger side of a box grater, adding it to the bowl with the juice.
  11. Grate the garlic on a microplane to create a paste and add it to the bowl.
  12. Chop the coriander and parsley finely and add to the bowl.
  13. Add the cumin, smoked paprika, allspice, cayenne pepper (optional), salt, and cracked black pepper to the bowl.
  14. Mix everything well with your hands until combined.
  15. Allow to marinate for up to 24 hours or use immediately.
  16. Stuff the Pitters:
  17. Open up the pitter bread to create a pocket.
  18. Gently stuff half of the minced beef filling into each pitter bread, ensuring even distribution and avoiding tearing.
  19. Lay the stuffed pitters flat.
  20. Cook the Pitters:
  21. Brush one side of each stuffed pitter with a little sunflower or avocado oil.
  22. Heat a pan over medium-high heat.
  23. Place the stuffed pitters in the pan, oil-side down.
  24. Cook for 2-3 minutes, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown and crispy.
  25. Flip the pitters a couple of times during cooking to ensure even crispiness.
  26. Remove the cooked pitters and place them on a wire rack.
  27. Serve:
  28. Slice the cooked pitters in half or quarters.
  29. Serve with the spiced yogurt and garnish with fresh parsley and coriander.
  30. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XUnbuBegM_8

stuffed_sweet_potatoes.txt - Stuffed Sweet Potatoes

Objectives

  • Learn to make delicious loaded sweet potatoes with chili con carne.
  • Prepare sweet potatoes with a caramelized flavor.
  • Create a flavorful chili con carne from scratch.

Ingredients

  • 5 sweet potatoes (or regular potatoes)
  • 2 teaspoons olive oil
  • Sea salt flakes (to taste)
  • Cracked black pepper (to taste)
  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 jalapeno (optional)
  • 10 grams flat leaf parsley (optional)
  • 1.5 tablespoons olive oil
  • 500 grams beef mince (90% lean, 10% fat)
  • 1 tablespoon tomato paste
  • 2 teaspoons ground cumin
  • 2 teaspoons dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
  • Sea salt flakes (to taste)
  • Cracked black pepper (20 cracks)
  • 3/4 cup beef stock
  • 1 can crushed or diced tomatoes
  • 1 can rinsed kidney beans
  • Freshly grated cheddar or mozzarella cheese (optional)
  • Sliced spring onion or scallion stems (optional)
  • Coriander or cilantro (optional)
  • Sour cream or sriracha mayo (optional)

Instructions

  1. Scrub sweet potatoes clean and poke with a fork to create air pockets.
  2. Place potatoes on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
  3. Drizzle with 2 teaspoons olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
  4. Bake in a preheated oven at 190°C (375°F) for 1 hour, or until golden and soft.
  5. Peel and slice onion in half, then make thin slices, stopping at the root.
  6. Dice onion into even-sized pieces, saving scraps for stock.
  7. Peel garlic and create a paste using a microplane.
  8. Remove jalapeno stem and slice thinly, optionally removing pith and seeds.
  9. Roughly chop parsley (optional).
  10. Heat 1.5 tablespoons olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
  11. Add diced onion and saute for 3 minutes, until slightly golden and translucent.
  12. Add garlic paste, sliced jalapeno, and a pinch of salt.
  13. Saute for 1 minute, mixing to prevent burning.
  14. Add beef mince and break it up, cooking for 6-7 minutes until browned.
  15. Add tomato paste, cumin, oregano, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.
  16. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.
  17. Deglaze the pan with beef stock and reduce for 1 minute.
  18. Add crushed or diced tomatoes and a splash of water.
  19. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 25 minutes.
  20. Remove potatoes from oven and let cool for 10-15 minutes.
  21. Add kidney beans and parsley (optional) to chili.
  22. Remove chili from heat.
  23. Slice potatoes lengthwise and push down sides to open.
  24. Spoon chili into potatoes.
  25. Top with cheese (optional), cracked pepper, and broil for 5-6 minutes until cheese is melted.
  26. Place stuffed potatoes in meal prep containers.
  27. Top with extra chili, spring onion or scallion stems, coriander or cilantro, sour cream or sriracha mayo (optional).
  28. Store in the fridge for up to 5 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months.
  29. Reheat in the microwave until hot.
  30. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HVBmciYuxTI

sunbeam_barista_plus.txt - Sunbeam Barista Plus Coffee Machine

Objectives

  • Learn how to use the Sunbeam Barista Plus coffee machine
  • Make a perfect cup of coffee with the Sunbeam Barista Plus coffee machine
  • Learn how to steam and texture milk with the Sunbeam Barista Plus coffee machine

Ingredients

  • Coffee beans (your favorite)
  • Milk or milk alternative

Instructions

  1. Remove the red plug from the water reservoir.
  2. Slide the water reservoir onto the back of the machine and connect the water plugs.
  3. Align the bean hopper marker with the red marker on the machine.
  4. Slot the bean hopper into place and twist to lock it in.
  5. Adjust the grind settings to your preference.
  6. Place the grind bin underneath the tap and go grinding cradle.
  7. Lock either the single or double shot basket into the group handle.
  8. Attach the group handle onto the group head of the machine.
  9. Pour your favorite coffee beans into the hopper.
  10. Turn on the machine and wait for the LED screen to illuminate the pour sign.
  11. Slot the group handle into the tap and go grinding cradle and push down to initiate the grind.
  12. Adjust the grind time to your preference.
  13. Once the grind is complete, gently remove the group handle.
  14. Use the fine brush to brush off any excess coffee grounds from the edges.
  15. Use the tamper to compress the coffee using 10 to 15 kilos of force.
  16. Quickly slot the handle into the group head and choose either manual shot, single shot, or double shot.
  17. Initiate the pour.
  18. Observe the consistency of the pour to adjust the grind setting.
  19. Pour your desired amount of milk or milk alternative into the jug.
  20. Connect the thermometer onto the side of the jug.
  21. Place the steam wand into the spout of the milk jug.
  22. Switch the steam wand to steam.
  23. Temper the milk with the tip of the steam wand, using the thermometer to achieve the correct heat of around 62 degrees Celsius or 143 degrees Fahrenheit.
  24. After each use, run the steam through to clear out any buildup and wipe it down immediately to prevent milk burning onto it.
  25. Enjoy your coffee.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VfKQ6zhjhr0

sun_dried_tomato_pesto_chicken_pasta.txt - Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto Chicken Pasta

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and satisfying sun-dried tomato pesto chicken pasta.
  • Learn a meal prep recipe that can be stored for up to five days in the fridge.
  • Understand the importance of seasoning and proper cooking techniques.

Ingredients

Pasta - 600 grams (1.32 pounds) pasta of your choice - Salt (to taste)

Chicken - 750 grams (1.65 pounds) boneless and skinless chicken thighs - 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) onion powder - 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) garlic powder - 1 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sweet paprika - 2 teaspoons (10 milliliters) olive oil - Sea salt flakes (to taste) - Cracked black pepper (20 cracks)

Pesto - 200 grams (7 ounces) sun-dried tomatoes (without oil) - 20 grams (0.7 ounces) basil leaves - 10 grams (0.3 ounces) grated parmesan cheese - 1-2 cloves garlic - 40 grams (1.4 ounces) pine nuts - 150 milliliters (2/3 cup) oil from sun-dried tomatoes - Sea salt flakes (to taste) - Cracked black pepper (10 cracks)

Optional Toppings - Freshly grated parmesan cheese - Freshly chopped basil - Lemon wedge

Instructions

  1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and generously salt it.
  2. In a mixing bowl, season chicken thighs with onion powder, garlic powder, sweet paprika, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  3. Rub the seasoning into the chicken thighs until evenly coated.
  4. Place the chicken thighs on a parchment-lined baking tray, ensuring they are not touching.
  5. Bake in a preheated oven at 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit) for 16 minutes.
  6. Add pasta to the boiling water and cook according to package instructions.
  7. Once cooked al dente, drain the pasta and let it sit for 5-10 minutes.
  8. Heat a pan over high heat and toast pine nuts until lightly golden.
  9. In a blender, combine sun-dried tomatoes, basil, parmesan cheese, garlic, toasted pine nuts, oil from sun-dried tomatoes, salt, and pepper.
  10. Blend until ingredients are well combined and smooth.
  11. Remove chicken from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes.
  12. Slice or dice the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
  13. In a large mixing bowl, combine the drained pasta, chicken, and pesto.
  14. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are coated in the pesto.
  15. Adjust seasoning to taste.
  16. Divide the chicken pasta mixture into five portions.
  17. Top with optional toppings such as parmesan cheese, basil, and lemon.
  18. Let the mixture cool slightly before storing in the fridge for up to five days or in the freezer for up to four months.
  19. To reheat, microwave until hot or enjoy cold.
  20. Squeeze lemon over the pasta for a refreshing touch.
  21. Enjoy your delicious sun-dried tomato pesto chicken pasta!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKLuBYplVXI

sundried_tomato_pesto_pasta.txt - Sundried Tomato Pesto Pasta

Objectives

  • Learn how to make sundried tomato pesto pasta.
  • Understand the versatility of this dish.

Instructions

  1. Make sundried tomato pesto pasta.
  2. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RbhZLuTk3gg

sun_dried_tomato_pesto.txt - Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto

Objectives

  • Learn how to make sun-dried tomato pesto from scratch
  • Discover the benefits of toasting pine nuts for enhanced flavor
  • Understand the versatility of this pesto in various dishes

Ingredients

  • 40 grams (1.4 ounces) pine nuts
  • 200 grams (7 ounces) sun-dried tomatoes (without oil)
  • 20 grams (0.7 ounces) fresh basil leaves
  • 10 grams (0.3 ounces) freshly grated Parmesan cheese
  • 2 cloves garlic, peeled
  • 2/3 cup (150 ml) oil from sun-dried tomatoes (or extra virgin olive oil)
  • Sea salt flakes, to taste
  • Freshly cracked black pepper, to taste

Instructions

  1. Place a pan over medium-high heat.
  2. Add 40 grams (1.4 ounces) of pine nuts to the pan and toast for 1-2 minutes, until lightly golden.
  3. Remove the pine nuts from the pan and let them cool.
  4. In a blender, combine 200 grams (7 ounces) of sun-dried tomatoes (without oil), 20 grams (0.7 ounces) of fresh basil leaves, 10 grams (0.3 ounces) of freshly grated Parmesan cheese, 2 cloves of peeled garlic, the slightly cooled toasted pine nuts, 2/3 cup (150 ml) of the oil from the sun-dried tomatoes (or extra virgin olive oil), sea salt flakes to taste, and freshly cracked black pepper.
  5. Securely attach the lid to the blender.
  6. Blend on high speed until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
  7. Add more oil if you prefer a runnier consistency.
  8. Transfer the pesto to a glass jar or container, ensuring no waste.
  9. Tightly screw on the lid.
  10. Enjoy the delicious and versatile sun-dried tomato pesto.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DYwIhthWhlk

swedish_meatballs.txt - Swedish Meatballs

Objectives

  • Learn to make classic Swedish meatballs.
  • Create a rich, flavorful gravy.
  • Perfect the sear on the meatballs for a crispy exterior.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 4 cloves of garlic
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • Pinch of salt
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 500g beef mince
  • 250g pork mince
  • 2 tbsp panco breadcrumbs
  • 3 tbsp full-fat milk
  • 1/4 tsp ground allspice (pimento)
  • 1 egg
  • 1/4 tsp fresh nutmeg
  • 4 tbsp unsalted butter, cubed
  • 4 tbsp plain all-purpose flour
  • 1 2/3 cup beef stock
  • 2/3 cup thickened cream (whipping cream)
  • 2 1/2 tsp soy sauce
  • 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 1/2 tsp Dijon mustard
  • Flat-leaf parsley (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice off the tip of a brown or yellow onion, halve it, peel it, and dice it finely.
  2. Grate 4 cloves of garlic using a microplane or chop them finely.
  3. Heat 1 tbsp of olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  4. Add the diced onion and a pinch of salt and cracked black pepper.
  5. Sauté the onions for 5-6 minutes until translucent and golden brown.
  6. Remove the onions from the pan and allow them to cool for 5 minutes.
  7. In a bowl, combine 500g beef mince, 250g pork mince, 2 tbsp panco breadcrumbs, 3 tbsp full-fat milk, 1/4 tsp ground allspice, 1 egg, 1/4 tsp fresh nutmeg, the cooled onions, a pinch of salt, and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  8. Mix the meat mixture thoroughly with clean hands until it forms a cohesive mass.
  9. Divide the meat mixture into 16-20 portions, shaping them into meatballs.
  10. Heat 1 tbsp of olive oil in the same pan over medium-high heat.
  11. Sear the meatballs in batches for 5-6 minutes, turning them to brown on all sides.
  12. Remove the meatballs from the pan and place them on a tray to rest.
  13. Reduce the heat to medium and add 4 tbsp of cubed unsalted butter to the pan.
  14. Whisk the butter until melted.
  15. Add 4 tbsp of plain all-purpose flour and cook for 1-1.5 minutes, stirring constantly, to cook out the flour taste.
  16. Increase the heat to medium-high and add 1 2/3 cup of beef stock.
  17. Stir well to combine and cook for 2-2.5 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
  18. Add 2/3 cup of thickened cream, 2 1/2 tsp soy sauce, 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce, and 1 1/2 tsp Dijon mustard.
  19. Stir to combine and taste, adjusting seasoning with salt and cracked black pepper if needed.
  20. Return the meatballs and any resting juices to the pan.
  21. Cook for 3-4 minutes, turning the meatballs occasionally, to allow them to finish cooking and absorb the flavors of the sauce.
  22. Garnish with chopped flat-leaf parsley (optional) and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9n_60gtAauU

sweet_chili_beef_turmeric_rice.txt - Sweet Chili Beef with Turmeric Rice

Objectives

  • Prepare sweet chili beef with a turmeric rice accompaniment.
  • Utilize fresh ingredients like onions, garlic, and spring onions.
  • Master the art of cooking basmati rice with flavorful spices.
  • Learn a quick and easy recipe perfect for weeknight meals.
  • Create a visually appealing and aromatic dish.

Ingredients

Rice: - 2 tablespoons (28 grams) clarified butter or ghee - 1 brown or yellow onion, diced - 5 cloves garlic, roughly chopped - 2.5 teaspoons (6 grams) whole cumin seeds - 1.75 teaspoons (4 grams) whole caraway seeds - 0.75 teaspoon (1 gram) ground turmeric - Pinch of sea salt flakes - 300 grams (10.5 ounces) washed basmati rice - 600 milliliters (20.2 fluid ounces) chicken stock

Beef: - 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) olive oil - 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) beef mince (18% fat) - 3 teaspoons (7 grams) curry powder - 0.75 cup (180 milliliters) sweet chili sauce - 0.5 cup (125 milliliters) chicken stock - Spring onion or scallion stems (white parts) - 200 grams (7.05 ounces) frozen peas - 0.5 of the roughly chopped coriander or cilantro (optional) - 1/3 of the spring onion or scallion stems (optional)

Garnish: - Remaining coriander or cilantro (optional) - Remaining spring onion or scallion stems (optional) - 30 grams (1.06 ounces) slivered almonds - 80 grams (2.8 ounces) currants (optional)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the onion: Peel and remove the tip of one brown or yellow onion. Slice it in half and make thin slices, stopping just before the root. Make two horizontal slices through the onion, stopping before the root, to break up the layers. Dice the onion into small pieces.
  2. Prepare the garlic: Peel 5 cloves of garlic. Crush each clove with the side of a knife, facing away from you, to activate the allicin compound. Roughly chop the garlic into small pieces.
