  3. Prepare the spring onions: Remove the tips of four spring onions or scallions and save for stock. Slice the white roots thinly and straight. Slice the green stems thinly on a slight angle.
  4. Prepare the coriander: If using, scrunch 20 grams (0.7 ounces) of coriander or cilantro into a tight bunch and chop roughly, removing large leaves or stems.
  5. Cook the rice: Place a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons (28 grams) of clarified butter or ghee and allow it to melt.
  6. Sauté the onion and garlic: Once the butter is melted, add the diced onion and sauté for 1 minute, mixing regularly. Add the chopped garlic, 2.5 teaspoons (6 grams) of whole cumin seeds, 1.75 teaspoons (4 grams) of whole caraway seeds, 0.75 teaspoon (1 gram) of ground turmeric, and a pinch of sea salt flakes. Continue sautéing for 2 minutes, stirring regularly.
  7. Toast the rice: Add 300 grams (10.5 ounces) of washed basmati rice to the saucepan and mix well. Toast the rice for 1 minute, stirring constantly to prevent burning.
  8. Add the stock and simmer: Pour in 600 milliliters (20.2 fluid ounces) of chicken stock, mix well, and bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and simmer for 12 minutes.
  9. Cook the beef: Place a large high-rimmed pan over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) of olive oil and heat until hot.
  10. Brown the beef: Add 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) of beef mince (18% fat) to the pan and fry for 5 minutes, mixing regularly. The fat will render out, and any water content will evaporate. Optionally, drain the fat, or leave it in the pan.
  11. Add the curry powder and cook: After 5 minutes, add 3 teaspoons (7 grams) of curry powder and mix well. Cook for 1 minute.
  12. Add the remaining ingredients: Add 0.75 cup (180 milliliters) of sweet chili sauce, 0.5 cup (125 milliliters) of chicken stock, the sliced spring onion or scallion stems, 200 grams (7.05 ounces) of frozen peas, half of the chopped coriander or cilantro (optional), and 1/3 of the spring onion or scallion stems (optional). Mix well.
  13. Cook for one minute: Cook the mixture for 1 minute to ensure the peas are hot in the center. Check and adjust seasoning levels. Remove from the stovetop.
  14. Rest the rice: After 12 minutes, turn off the heat for the rice but leave the lid on for another 5 minutes to finish cooking.
  15. Fluff the rice: Carefully remove the lid from the rice saucepan. Fluff the rice with a spatula or fork, mixing through any spices that have risen to the surface.
  16. Add the remaining ingredients: Add the remaining coriander or cilantro, half of the remaining spring onion or scallion stems, 30 grams (1.06 ounces) of slivered almonds, and 80 grams (2.8 ounces) of currants (optional). Mix well to combine the flavors. Taste for seasoning and remove the rice from the stovetop.
  17. Serve: Each portion of rice is 180 grams (6.35 ounces), and each portion of beef is 270 grams (9.25 ounces). Garnish with the remaining spring onion or scallion stems. You will have 5 containers of food that will last 4 days in the fridge and 3 months in the freezer. To reheat, thaw overnight in the fridge and microwave until hot.
  18. Enjoy: Dig in!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MEjK0jq0SrI

sweet_chili_chicken_meal_prep.txt - Sweet Chili Chicken Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a flavorful and easy sweet chili chicken meal prep
  • Learn how to marinate and cook chicken for a delicious meal
  • Combine chicken with vegetables and rice for a balanced and satisfying meal

Ingredients

  • 4 cloves garlic, peeled
  • 10 grams ginger, peeled
  • 310 milliliters sweet chili sauce (Thai Sweet Chili recommended)
  • 60 milliliters low sodium soy sauce
  • 60 milliliters Shaoxing cooking wine
  • 10 milliliters mirin
  • 9 grams corn flour
  • 1 kilogram boneless, skinless chicken thigh (or breast)
  • 1/2 cup sweet chili marinade
  • 1 brown or yellow onion, peeled and sliced
  • 1 bunch broccolini or broccoli, roughly chopped
  • 3 spring onions (scallions), separated (white root and green stem)
  • 1 red bell pepper (capsicum), sliced
  • 300 grams washed jasmine rice
  • 500 milliliters cold water
  • Salt to taste
  • 1 tablespoon peanut oil

Instructions

  1. Grate garlic and ginger into a paste using a microplane or fine box grater.
  2. In a bowl, whisk together sweet chili sauce, soy sauce, Shaoxing cooking wine, mirin, garlic-ginger paste, and corn flour.
  3. Dice chicken into even-sized pieces.
  4. Add chicken to a mixing bowl, pour in half of the sweet chili marinade, and mix well.
  5. Marinate chicken for at least 30 minutes (optional).
  6. Slice onion into thin strips.
  7. Roughly chop broccolini or broccoli into florets and stems.
  8. Slice the white root of the spring onions into small chunks.
  9. Thinly slice the green stem of the spring onions for garnish.
  10. Slice red bell pepper into thin strips, removing the core and seeds.
  11. Add rice, cold water, and salt to a saucepan and mix well.
  12. Bring the rice mixture to a boil over high heat.
  13. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 12 minutes.
  14. Heat peanut oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.
  15. Cook marinated chicken in batches for 6-7 minutes, until browned and cooked through.
  16. Remove chicken from pan and set aside.
  17. Add onion, broccolini/broccoli, and white root of spring onions to the pan and stir-fry for 5 minutes, until softened.
  18. Return chicken to the pan along with any resting juices and remaining marinade.
  19. Bring to a simmer and cook for 3-4 minutes, until sauce thickens and coats everything well.
  20. After 12 minutes, turn off the heat for the rice and leave the lid on for 4 minutes.
  21. Fluff the rice with a fork or spatula.
  22. Serve rice and sweet chili chicken, garnishing with the green stem of spring onions (optional).
  23. Let the meal prep cool for 10-15 minutes before storing in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or freezing for up to 4 months.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oCJHz21OFrQ

sweet_potato_fries.txt - Sweet Potato Fries (Baked & Fried)

Objectives

  • Learn how to make crispy baked sweet potato fries.
  • Master the technique for perfectly fried sweet potato fries.
  • Understand the importance of soaking and cornstarch for crispness.

Ingredients

  • 2 sweet potatoes
  • 1 tablespoon of sea salt flakes
  • 4 teaspoons of cornstarch
  • 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
  • 2 tablespoons of white vinegar
  • 9 cups of water
  • 1/2 cup of vegetable, canola, or sunflower oil (for frying)

Instructions

Baked Sweet Potato Fries

  1. Remove both ends from the sweet potatoes and peel them.
  2. Slice the sweet potatoes into 1 cm strips.
  3. Cut the strips into 1 cm by 1 cm battens.
  4. Place the potato battens in a large mixing bowl and cover with cold water.
  5. Add 1 tablespoon of sea salt flakes and mix.
  6. Let the potatoes soak for 1 hour.
  7. Drain the potatoes in a colander and allow them to drain for 5 minutes.
  8. Pat the potatoes dry with a tea towel.
  9. Add the potatoes to a large mixing bowl and add 4 teaspoons of cornstarch.
  10. Mix thoroughly with clean hands to ensure the potatoes are coated.
  11. Drizzle 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over the potatoes and rub it in with clean hands.
  12. Line a baking tray with parchment paper and spread the potatoes out evenly, ensuring they don't touch.
  13. Bake in a preheated oven at 220°C (430°F) for 15 minutes.
  14. Flip the fries over using tongs and continue baking for 20 minutes, rotating the tray halfway through.
  15. Turn off the oven and leave the fries in the oven with the door slightly open for 10 minutes.
  16. Season to taste and serve.

Fried Sweet Potato Fries

  1. Remove the ends and peel the sweet potatoes.
  2. Slice the sweet potatoes into 1 cm strips.
  3. Cut the strips into 1 cm by 1 cm battens.
  4. Place the potato battens in a large pot and cover with 9 cups of water.
  5. Add 1 tablespoon of sea salt flakes and 2 tablespoons of white vinegar.
  6. Bring the pot to a boil over high heat.
  7. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 9-10 minutes or until the potatoes are tender but not breaking apart.
  8. Drain the potatoes in a colander and allow them to cool for 20 minutes.
  9. Pat the potatoes dry with a tea towel.
  10. Heat 1/2 cup of vegetable, canola, or sunflower oil in a large saucepan over high heat.
  11. Heat the oil to 180°C (350°F).
  12. In a large bowl, whisk together 4 teaspoons of cornstarch and 2 tablespoons of cold water.
  13. Gently coat the boiled potatoes in the cornstarch mixture.
  14. Carefully add the coated potatoes to the hot oil in batches, ensuring they are not overcrowded.
  15. Fry for 8 minutes or until deeply brown and crisp.
  16. Remove the fries from the oil and drain them on a tea towel.
  17. Keep the fries warm in a 100°C (210°F) oven while you finish frying the remaining batches.
  18. Season to taste and serve.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uVGYudEHLQ4

sweet_sour_chicken_basmati_rice.txt - Sweet and Sour Chicken with Basmati Rice

Objectives

  • Prepare a high-protein sweet and sour chicken dish for meal prepping.
  • Cook fluffy Basmati rice for a balanced meal.
  • Create a flavorful sweet and sour sauce with a thickening agent.
  • Sauté bell peppers and onions for a colorful and flavorful side.
  • Sear chicken breast for a crispy exterior.
  • Combine all ingredients for a delicious sweet and sour chicken dish.

Ingredients

Rice - 300 g Basmati rice, washed - 600 ml cold water - Sea salt flakes, to taste

Sweet and Sour Chicken - 3 bell peppers (capsicum), sliced and diced - 1 brown or yellow onion, thinly sliced - 4 cloves garlic, minced - 15 g ginger, minced - 1.4 kg chicken breast, sliced into strips and diced - 125 ml light or low sodium soy sauce - 80 ml store-bought pineapple juice - 80 g honey - 40 ml Worcestershire sauce - 40 ml apple cider vinegar (or white vinegar) - 40 ml tomato sauce - 12 g corn flour (or cornstarch) - 30 ml grape seed oil (or any neutral flavored oil) - Sea salt flakes, to taste - Sesame seeds, to taste (optional)

Instructions

  1. Wash 300g of Basmati rice and place it in a pot with 600ml of cold water and a pinch of sea salt flakes.
  2. Bring the rice mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  3. While the rice is cooking, prepare the sweet and sour chicken.
  4. Slice and dice 3 bell peppers, removing seeds and pith.
  5. Thinly slice 1 brown or yellow onion.
  6. Mince 4 cloves of garlic and 15g of ginger.
  7. Slice and dice 1.4kg of chicken breast into even-sized pieces.
  8. Combine the following ingredients in a bowl: 125ml of soy sauce, 80ml of pineapple juice, 80g of honey, 40ml of Worcestershire sauce, 40ml of apple cider vinegar, 40ml of tomato sauce, and 12g of corn flour. Whisk until well combined.
  9. After 14 minutes, turn off the heat for the rice and let it sit with the lid on for 4 minutes.
  10. Fluff the rice with a fork or spatula and remove it from the stovetop.
  11. Heat a large pan or pot over high heat.
  12. Add 30ml of grape seed oil and sauté the diced bell peppers and thinly sliced onion for 4 minutes, or until they start to caramelize.
  13. Remove the sautéed vegetables from the pan and set aside.
  14. Place the same pan back over high heat and add another 20ml of grape seed oil.
  15. Add the diced chicken breast to the hot pan, along with a pinch of sea salt flakes.
  16. Sear the chicken for 3 minutes on each side, or until it's browned.
  17. Add the garlic and ginger paste to the chicken and cook for 45 seconds, stirring constantly.
  18. Return the sautéed vegetables to the pan and cook for another 30-40 seconds.
  19. Add the prepared sweet and sour sauce to the pan, whisking it before adding to ensure the corn flour is fully incorporated.
  20. Bring the sauce to a boil and cook for 2 minutes, or until it thickens.
  21. Stir in a tablespoon of sesame seeds (optional).
  22. Remove the pan from the heat and serve the sweet and sour chicken over the cooked Basmati rice.
  23. Garnish with spring onion, scallion, chili, or more sesame seeds, as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1N6hbRbyAeQ

tahini.txt - Tahini

Objectives

  • Learn how to make tahini from scratch.
  • Understand the importance of toasting sesame seeds for flavor.
  • Discover how to achieve the desired consistency for tahini.

Ingredients

  • 2.5 cups (350 grams) whole sesame seeds
  • 2.5 tablespoons (50 milliliters) olive oil
  • 0.5 teaspoon (2.5 grams) sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Weigh out 2.5 cups (350 grams) of whole sesame seeds.
  2. Place a large skillet on the stovetop over medium-high heat.
  3. Add the sesame seeds to the pan and stir for 1.5-2 minutes to toast them.
  4. Keep the seeds at the edge of the pan, moving them constantly as they toast faster there.
  5. Toast the seeds until they are a nice golden brown color.
  6. Remove the seeds from the heat and place them on a heat-resistant surface or in a bowl to cool for 30 minutes.
  7. Once the seeds have cooled, transfer them to a blender or food processor.
  8. Add 2.5 tablespoons (50 milliliters) of olive oil and 0.5 teaspoon (2.5 grams) of sea salt flakes.
  9. Secure the lid of the blender or food processor and blend on the highest setting for 45 seconds.
  10. Stop the blender, open the lid, and scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula to ensure all seeds are processed.
  11. Repeat step 10 at least a couple of times throughout the blending process.
  12. Secure the lid again and blend on the highest setting for 2-3 minutes, depending on the power of your blender.
  13. If you prefer a completely smooth tahini, blend for an additional minute and add an extra 0.5 tablespoon (10 milliliters) of olive oil.
  14. After blending for 2.5 minutes, the tahini should be smooth with a slight crunch.
  15. Pour the tahini into a clean or sterilized jar or container.
  16. Store the tahini in the refrigerator in an airtight container or glass jar for up to 5 months.
  17. Alternatively, store the tahini in the freezer in an airtight container for up to 1 year.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-lYYLtvYVNc

tandoori_chicken_meal_prep.txt - Tandoori Chicken Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Learn to prepare a flavorful and easy tandoori chicken meal prep.
  • Master the art of marinating chicken for maximum flavor.
  • Create a delicious raita sauce to complement the tandoori chicken.

Ingredients

Chicken Marinade: - 1.2 kilos boneless and skinless chicken thighs - 1 cup (250 grams) plain natural Greek yogurt - 5 grams garam masala - 7 grams ground cumin - 4 grams sweet paprika - 2 grams red chili powder - 3 grams turmeric - 3 grams ground coriander - Pinch of sea salt flakes - Cracked black pepper - 4 cloves garlic, finely grated - 20 grams peeled ginger, finely grated - Juice of 2 small limes

Rice: - 320 grams washed basmati rice - 3 grams turmeric - Sea salt flakes to taste - 640 milliliters chicken stock - 3 bay leaves (optional)

Raita: - 1/4 cucumber, grated - 3 grams coriander, scrunched - 3 grams mint, scrunched - 170 grams plain Greek yogurt - 2 grams ground cumin - Sea salt flakes to taste

Other: - 14 grams ghee - 40 milliliters peanut or vegetable oil

Instructions

  1. Combine all marinade ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
  2. Add chicken thighs to the marinade and coat thoroughly.
  3. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to 48 hours.
  4. Heat ghee in a saucepan over high heat.
  5. Add basmati rice, turmeric, and salt.
  6. Toast for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
  7. Add chicken stock and bay leaves (optional).
  8. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low.
  9. Cook for 14 minutes undisturbed.
  10. Turn off heat and leave covered for 4 minutes.
  11. Remove bay leaves and fluff rice with a fork.
  12. Combine all raita ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
  13. Portion raita into containers.
  14. Remove chicken from marinade and pat dry.
  15. Heat peanut or vegetable oil in a pan or on a grill.
  16. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes per side, flipping once.
  17. Remove chicken from heat and let rest for 10 minutes.
  18. Slice or dice chicken as desired.
  19. Serve rice with chicken and raita.
  20. Refrigerate leftovers for up to 4

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FGbbahxi04U

tandoori_chicken_rice_raita.txt - Tandoori Chicken with Rice and Raita

Objectives

  • Learn how to make authentic Tandoori chicken
  • Prepare a flavorful turmeric rice to accompany the chicken
  • Make a refreshing raita to balance the spice of the dish

Ingredients

Chicken - 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) skinless and boneless chicken thigh - 2 teaspoons (4 grams) ground cumin - 2 teaspoons (4 grams) garam masala - 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) ground coriander - 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) ground red chili powder or kashmiri - 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) sweet paprika - 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) ground turmeric - 1 cup (250 grams) plain yogurt - 1.5 teaspoons (7.5 grams) sea salt flakes - 3 cloves garlic, freshly peeled - 10 grams (0.4 ounces) fresh ginger, peeled - 1 large lime

Rice - 1 cup (200 grams) jasmine rice - 1 tablespoon (14 grams) clarified butter - 2 cups (500 milliliters) chicken stock - 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) ground turmeric - 2 fresh or 3 dried bay leaves - A pinch of sea salt flakes

Raita - 1 cup (250 grams) plain yogurt - 1/2 large continental cucumber - 2.5 grams (0.1 ounces) coriander or cilantro - 2.5 grams (0.1 ounces) mint - 1 teaspoon (1.5 grams) ground cumin - A pinch of sea salt flakes

Other - 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) canola, sunflower, or coconut oil - Parchment or baking paper - Black pepper

Instructions

  1. Combine the chicken thighs, spices (cumin, garam masala, coriander, chili powder, paprika, turmeric), yogurt, salt, garlic, ginger, and lime juice in a large bowl.
  2. Massage the chicken well to ensure the spices are evenly distributed and the chicken is fully coated.
  3. Cover the bowl tightly and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, up to 3 days.
  4. Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
  5. Heat a large pan over high heat. Add the oil and sear the marinated chicken, flat side down, for 2.5 minutes per side, or until golden and slightly charred. Work in batches if necessary.
  6. Transfer the seared chicken to a baking tray lined with parchment paper, making sure not to overlap the thighs.
  7. Pour any remaining marinade from the pan over the chicken.
  8. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  9. Bake for 16-17 minutes, or until cooked through.
  10. While the chicken bakes, prepare the rice: Rinse the rice in a sieve under cold water until the water runs clear.
  11. Heat a saucepan over high heat. Add the clarified butter and melt.
  12. Add the rinsed rice and toast for 45 seconds, stirring constantly, until slightly nutty.
  13. Add the chicken stock, turmeric, bay leaves, and salt. Stir to combine.
  14. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and steam for 16 minutes.
  15. Prepare the raita: Combine the yogurt, grated cucumber, chopped herbs, cumin, and salt in a bowl.
  16. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
  17. After 16 minutes, remove the lid from the rice and discard the bay leaves. Fluff the rice with a fork or spatula.
  18. Remove the chicken from the oven.
  19. To serve, place a bed of turmeric rice on a plate. Top with the Tandoori chicken, pouring any remaining juices from the baking tray over the chicken.
  20. Garnish with raita, either on the side or on top of the chicken and rice.
  21. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JvPP2_vWdTY

teriyaki_chicken_meal_prep.txt - Teriyaki Chicken Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Prepare a delicious and easy teriyaki chicken meal prep
  • Create a teriyaki sauce from scratch
  • Learn how to cook brown rice properly

Ingredients

Chicken - 1 kg (2.2 lbs) chicken thigh or breast - 1.5 tbsp (20 g) corn flour or starch

Teriyaki Sauce - 60 ml (1/4 cup) regular soy sauce - 40 ml (2 tbsp) dark soy sauce - 70 ml (1/4 cup + 2 tsp) cooking sake - 70 ml (1/4 cup + 2 tsp) mirin - 15 g (3 tsp) caster or fine sugar

Brown Rice - 350 g (12.35 oz) washed brown rice - Salt (to taste)

Bok Choy - 4 large bunches bok choy - 2 spring onions (optional) - 1 tbsp (20 ml) peanut oil - 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil - Sea salt flakes (to taste)

Instructions

  1. Prepare Bok Choy:
  2. Slice the root off of 4 bunches of bok choy, saving it for compost.
  3. Cut bok choy into medium to large size chunks.
  4. Wash the bok choy under cold water, separating the stems and leaves.
  5. Prepare Spring Onions (Optional):
  6. Thinly slice the green stems of 2 spring onions.
  7. Place the sliced onions in icy water to make them crisp.
  8. Prepare Chicken:
  9. Slice chicken into large, even strips.
  10. Place chicken in a mixing bowl.
  11. Add 1.5 tbsp (20 g) corn flour and rub it into the chicken until coated.
  12. Cook Brown Rice:
  13. Place a large saucepan of water over high heat.
  14. Bring the water to a boil and add salt.
  15. Add 350 g (12.35 oz) washed brown rice.
  16. Bring back to a boil and stir.
  17. Cook at a boil for 30 minutes.
  18. Make Teriyaki Sauce:
  19. In a small saucepan, combine 60 ml (1/4 cup) regular soy sauce, 40 ml (2 tbsp) dark soy sauce, 70 ml (1/4 cup + 2 tsp) cooking sake, 70 ml (1/4 cup + 2 tsp) mirin, and 15 g (3 tsp) caster sugar.
  20. Place the saucepan over high heat and mix regularly until the sugar melts and the sauce simmers.
  21. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  22. Sear the Chicken:
  23. Place a large, high-rimmed pan over medium-high heat.
  24. Add 1 tbsp (20 ml) peanut oil.
  25. Once hot, add the chicken and sear for 5-6 minutes on each side, jiggling the pan to prevent sticking.
  26. Add Teriyaki Sauce to Chicken:
  27. Pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken, ensuring even coverage.
  28. Mix well to coat the chicken.
  29. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 5-6 minutes, stirring regularly, until the sauce thickens.
  30. Saute Bok Choy Stems:
  31. Place a pan over medium-high heat.
  32. Add 1 tbsp (20 ml) peanut oil.
  33. Once hot, add the bok choy stems and saute for 4 minutes, moving them around regularly to achieve a golden brown color.
  34. Finish Cooking Brown Rice:
  35. After 30 minutes, drain the brown rice through a sieve.
  36. Place the saucepan back on the stovetop (off the heat).
  37. Add the drained rice back to the saucepan.
  38. Cover with a lid and let the rice steam for 10 minutes.
  39. Saute Bok Choy Leaves:
  40. Add the bok choy leaves to the pan with the stems.
  41. Mix well and saute for 2 minutes.
  42. Finish Bok Choy:
  43. Add 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil and a pinch of sea salt flakes to the bok choy.
  44. Mix well and saute for 1 minute to infuse the sesame flavor.
  45. Assemble Meal Prep Containers:
  46. Place the brown rice on one side of the container.
  47. Add the sesame bok choy in the center.
  48. Place the teriyaki chicken on the opposite side, spooning over any remaining sauce.
  49. Garnish with spring onions (optional).
  50. Store and Reheat:
  51. Once slightly cooled, place lids on the containers and store in the fridge for up to 4 days.
  52. For longer storage, freeze for up to 3 months.
  53. Reheat in the microwave until hot.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uLBenQ5orkI

teriyaki_chicken_skewers_stir_fry.txt - Teriyaki Chicken Skewers with Stir-Fry

Objectives

  • Prepare delicious teriyaki chicken skewers for a quick and easy meal.
  • Create a flavorful stir-fry to accompany the skewers.
  • Learn to make a flavorful teriyaki sauce.

Ingredients

  • 8 skewers (soaked in water)
  • 1 teaspoon (4.5 grams) white sesame seeds
  • 1 teaspoon (4.5 grams) black sesame seeds
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) dark soy sauce
  • 2 tablespoons (20 milliliters) mirin
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) cooking sake
  • 1.5 teaspoons (7.5 grams) sugar
  • 5 spring onions/scallions
  • 2 carrots (washed, skin on)
  • 4 parsnips (washed, skin on)
  • 6 large boneless, skinless chicken thighs (diced)
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) peanut oil
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) mirin
  • 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) toasted sesame oil

Instructions

  1. Soak skewers in water to prevent burning.
  2. Toast sesame seeds in a pan until they pop and crackle (about 2 minutes).
  3. Make teriyaki sauce:
  4. Combine soy sauce, dark soy sauce, mirin, cooking sake, and sugar in a saucepan.
  5. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
  6. Prepare vegetables:
  7. Slice spring onion white ends into large strips (4 cm).
  8. Thinly slice spring onion green ends.
  9. Wash and slice carrots and parsnips into julienne strips.
  10. Dice chicken thighs, removing any excess fat or gristle.
  11. Assemble skewers:
  12. Alternate chicken and spring onion white strips on each skewer.
  13. Cook skewers:
  14. Heat peanut oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
  15. Cook skewers in batches for 2 minutes per side, with lid on, for a total of 8 minutes.
  16. Glaze skewers:
  17. Add teriyaki sauce to the pan and bring to a boil.
  18. Add skewers back to the pan and coat in sauce.
  19. Prepare stir-fry:
  20. Heat peanut oil in a wok or pan over high heat.
  21. Stir-fry julienned carrots and parsnips for 3-4 minutes until soft and golden.
  22. Add soy sauce and mirin, stir-fry for 1 minute.
  23. Add toasted sesame oil and seeds, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
  24. Serve:
  25. Place stir-fry on a plate.
  26. Top with skewers (remove ingredients if desired).
  27. Garnish with green spring onion slices.
  28. Drizzle with leftover teriyaki sauce.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XFbz27nM018

teriyaki_chicken.txt - Teriyaki Chicken

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious teriyaki chicken dish.
  • Prepare a flavorful teriyaki sauce from scratch.
  • Cook chicken and bok choy for optimal texture and flavor.

Ingredients

  • 4 large bok choy or pak choy, chopped into large chunks
  • 2-3 spring onions, thinly sliced
  • 1 kilo of chicken thighs, sliced into large pieces
  • 1.5 tablespoons of cornflour
  • 60 milliliters of dark soy sauce
  • 40 milliliters of regular soy sauce
  • 70 milliliters of cooking sake
  • 70 milliliters of mirin
  • 3 teaspoons of sugar
  • 1 tablespoon of peanut oil
  • Brown or white rice (optional)

Instructions

  1. Chop four large bok choy or pak choy into large chunks, separating the leaves.
  2. Thinly slice two to three spring onions for garnish.
  3. Slice one kilo of chicken thighs into large, even-sized pieces.
  4. Place the chicken in a bowl, add 1.5 tablespoons of cornflour, and coat well.
  5. In a saucepan, combine 60 milliliters of dark soy sauce, 40 milliliters of regular soy sauce, 70 milliliters of cooking sake, 70 milliliters of mirin, and 3 teaspoons of sugar.
  6. Place the saucepan over high heat, mix the ingredients, and bring to a boil.
  7. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
  8. Remove the saucepan from the stovetop.
  9. In a large pan over high heat, add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil.
  10. Seal the chicken for 5 minutes on both sides.
  11. Pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken, bring it to a simmer, and cook for 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens.
  12. Remove the pan from the stovetop.
  13. In another pan over medium-high heat, add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil.
  14. Add the bok choy stems and sauté for 4 minutes.
  15. Add the bok choy leaves and continue sautéing for 2 minutes, or until soft and wilted.
  16. Serve the teriyaki chicken with brown or white rice, adding any leftover sauce.
  17. Garnish with spring onions and enjoy.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mwGStiS4Ink

teriyaki_salmon_meal_prep.txt - Teriyaki Salmon Meal Prep

Objectives

  • Create a delicious and easy teriyaki salmon meal prep recipe.
  • Prepare flavorful teriyaki sauce from scratch.
  • Cook perfectly tender and caramelized salmon.
  • Sauté bok choy with garlic and ginger for a side dish.
  • Make cafe lime infused rice for a balanced meal.

Ingredients

Salmon - 900 grams salmon (skin on or off) - 1 tablespoon corn flour - Sea salt flakes (to taste)

Bok Choy - 2 bok choys - 1 clove garlic - 5 grams peeled ginger

Teriyaki Sauce - 60 milliliters light soy sauce - 40 milliliters dark soy sauce - 70 milliliters sake - 70 milliliters mirin - 15 grams sugar

Rice - 300 grams jasmine rice - 500 milliliters cold water - 4 kaffir lime leaves - Sea salt flakes (to taste)

Additional - 1 tablespoon peanut oil (or vegetable/olive oil) - 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) sesame oil

Instructions

  1. Dice salmon into large pieces or use whole fillets.
  2. Place salmon in a bowl, add corn flour and salt, mix to coat.
  3. Wash bok choy stems and leaves separately, slice stems and shred leaves.
  4. Grate garlic and ginger together.
  5. Combine soy sauces, sake, mirin, and sugar in a saucepan.
  6. Heat over high heat, stir until sugar melts.
  7. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
  8. Combine rice, water, kaffir lime leaves, and salt in a pot.
  9. Stir to break up clumps, bring to a boil.
  10. Cover, reduce heat to low, cook for 12 minutes.
  11. Heat peanut oil in a pan over high heat.
  12. Sauté bok choy stems with salt for 3-4 minutes until golden and softened.
  13. Add bok choy leaves, garlic/ginger paste, and sauté for 1 minute.
  14. Stir in sesame oil, remove from heat.
  15. After 12 minutes of cooking, turn off heat and let rice rest for 8 minutes with lid on.
  16. Heat peanut oil in a large pan over high heat.
  17. Add salmon, spread out and cook for 2 minutes, browning slightly.
  18. Pour teriyaki sauce over salmon, cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  19. Remove salmon from heat and let rest.
  20. Remove kaffir lime leaves from rice, fluff with a fork.
  21. Divide cooked rice, salmon, and bok choy into 5 containers.
  22. Garnish with spring onion (optional).
  23. Let meal preps cool for 20 minutes before storing.
  24. Store in the fridge for up to 4 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
  25. Reheat in microwave or pan.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UlZNlCAy7AI

texas_style_chili.txt - Texas Style Chili

Objectives

  • Learn how to make a flavorful and authentic Texas-style chili.
  • Understand the importance of proper browning and seasoning techniques.
  • Discover how to create a rich and complex chili base.

Ingredients

  • 1 onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 spring onion
  • 1 tablespoon oil
  • 1 pound ground beef
  • Salt
  • Ground cumin
  • Red chili powder
  • Smoked paprika
  • Mustard powder
  • Concentrated tomato paste
  • Tomato ketchup
  • Yellow mustard
  • Brown sugar
  • Apple cider vinegar
  • Ground allspice
  • Beef stock
  • Jasmine rice
  • Sour cream

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion in half, peel it, and dice into large even pieces.
  2. Grate the garlic using a microplane to create a paste.
  3. Separate the white roots from the green stems of the spring onion.
  4. Thinly slice the stems and roots of the spring onion, angling the roots.
  5. Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
  6. Add the ground beef and cook for 3 minutes without stirring.
  7. Stir the beef, season with salt, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
  8. Add the diced onions, spring onions, and garlic paste to the pot.
  9. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  10. Add ground cumin, red chili powder, smoked paprika, mustard powder, and a pinch of salt.
  11. Stir to combine and cook for 45 seconds.
  12. Add concentrated tomato paste, tomato ketchup, yellow mustard, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, ground allspice, and beef stock.
  13. Stir to combine and bring the chili to a boil.
  14. Cover the pot with a lid, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 35 minutes.
  15. Serve the chili with jasmine rice, a dollop of sour cream, and the green stems of the spring onion.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6-U7H1j9Y6U

tex_mex_burrito.txt - Tex-Mex Style Burritos

Objectives

  • Create delicious Tex-Mex style burritos with customizable ingredients.
  • Learn how to prepare and cook the fillings for the burritos.
  • Understand the importance of texture in burrito making.

Ingredients

For the Avocado Crema: - 2 avocados, ripe - 1/2 lime, juiced - Sea salt flakes, to taste

For the Vegetable Fajitas: - 2 brown or yellow onions, sliced into thin strips - 2 bell peppers (green preferred), thinly sliced - 2 teaspoons oil - Sea salt flakes, to taste - Cracked black pepper, to taste (optional) - 1.5 grams ground cumin - 1.5 grams smoked paprika

For the Turkey Mince Filling: - 500 grams turkey mince (can substitute beef, chicken, or pork) - 3 teaspoons oil - Sea salt flakes, to taste - 7 grams ground cumin - 2.5 grams sweet paprika - 2.5 grams chili powder (optional) - 200 grams salsa (classic Old El Paso recommended)

Other Ingredients: - 2 baby romaine lettuces, shredded - 150 grams mozzarella cheese, grated - 5 tortillas (flour preferred, but corn or gluten-free can be used) - Black beans, drained and rinsed - Spray oil or light drizzle of oil (for toasting)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the Avocado Crema:
  2. Slice avocados around the seed, being careful.
  3. Remove the seed and scoop out the avocado flesh into a bowl.
  4. Squeeze lime juice over the avocado.
  5. Season with sea salt flakes and optionally black pepper.
  6. Mash the avocado with a fork or masher to your desired consistency.
  7. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  8. Prepare the Vegetable Fajitas:
  9. Slice onions into thin strips.
  10. Slice bell peppers thinly, removing the core and seeds.
  11. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
  12. Add oil to the pan.
  13. Add onions and bell peppers to the pan.
  14. Season with salt and pepper.
  15. Sauté for 5-6 minutes until golden brown and soft but still slightly firm.
  16. Add ground cumin and smoked paprika.
  17. Mix and cook for 1 minute to infuse flavors.
  18. Remove from heat and set aside.
  19. Cook the Turkey Mince Filling:
  20. Place the same pan back over medium-high heat.
  21. Add oil to the pan.
  22. Add turkey mince to the pan.
  23. Season with salt.
  24. Cook for 2 minutes to form a crust on the bottom.
  25. Break up the mince with a spatula or spoon.
  26. Continue cooking for 7-8 minutes until cooked through.
  27. Add ground cumin, sweet paprika, and chili powder (optional).
  28. Stir in the salsa.
  29. Cook for 2 minutes until the sauce reduces and coats the mince.
  30. Prepare the Burrito Fillings:
  31. Shred romaine lettuce into thin strips (chiffonade).
  32. Grate mozzarella cheese.
  33. Drain and rinse black beans.
  34. Assemble the Burritos:
  35. Lay out a tortilla.
  36. Add avocado crema, black beans, vegetable fajita mix, turkey mince, shredded lettuce, and mozzarella cheese.
  37. Fold in the sides of the tortilla.
  38. Bring the bottom edge up and tuck it in.
  39. Fold the top edge over, tucking it in with your fingers.
  40. Roll the burrito completely.
  41. Optional: Toast the Burritos:
  42. Heat a pan over medium-high heat.
  43. Add a spray oil or light drizzle of oil to the pan.
  44. Place the burrito in the pan, fold-side down.
  45. Toast for 1.5 minutes on each side, ensuring a golden brown and crispy exterior.
  46. Serve:
  47. Slice the burrito in half, optionally on a slight angle.
  48. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JrOqtiD18uU

thai_coconut_soup.txt - Creamy Thai Coconut Soup

Objectives

  • Learn to prepare flavorful prawns for a Thai coconut soup
  • Create a fragrant and creamy coconut soup base
  • Assemble a delicious and balanced Thai coconut soup

Ingredients

English | Chinese Characters ------- | -------- 20 individual prawns (1 kilo or 2.2 pounds) | 20 只虾 (1 公斤或 2.2 磅) 2 inch piece of fresh ginger (50 grams) | 2 英寸新鲜姜 (50 克) 6 cloves of freshly peeled garlic | 6 瓣新鲜蒜 4 inch piece of fresh lemongrass (1 root) | 4 英寸新鲜柠檬草 (1 根) 2 tablespoons (10 milliliters) olive oil | 2 汤匙 (10 毫升) 橄榄油 1 kilo (2.2 pounds) prawns (or chicken) | 1 公斤 (2.2 磅) 虾 (或鸡肉) 2 tablespoons (25 grams) brown sugar | 2 汤匙 (25 克) 红糖 3 tablespoons (45 milliliters) fish sauce | 3 汤匙 (45 毫升) 鱼露 2 and a half teaspoons (7 grams) curry powder | 2.5 茶匙 (7 克) 咖喱粉 3 teaspoons (6 grams) ground coriander seed | 3 茶匙 (6 克) 芫荽粉 1 and a half tablespoons (30 grams) sambal olek (optional) | 1.5 汤匙 (30 克) 三巴酱 (可选) 4 cups (1 liter) vegetable or chicken stock | 4 杯 (1 升) 蔬菜或鸡汤 2 cans (800 milliliters) coconut milk | 2 罐 (800 毫升) 椰奶 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes (optional) | 1 茶匙 海盐 (可选) 1 whole lime | 1 个青柠 150 grams of fresh egg noodles | 150 克 鲜鸡蛋面 Fresh mung bean sprouts | 鲜绿豆芽 5-6 stalks of fresh coriander or cilantro | 5-6 棵 新鲜香菜 5-6 leaves of fresh mint | 5-6 片 新鲜薄荷 Freshly sliced red chili (optional) | 新鲜辣椒片 (可选)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the prawns by removing the shell, deveining, and butterflying them.
  2. Peel the ginger, garlic, and lemongrass.
  3. Grate the ginger, garlic, and lemongrass into a paste.
  4. Heat a large pot over high heat.
  5. Add olive oil to the pot and heat.
  6. Add the prawns to the pot and sear for 45 seconds on each side.
  7. Remove the prawns from the pot and set aside.
  8. Reduce the heat to medium and add the garlic paste, ginger paste, and lemongrass paste to the pot.
  9. Fry for 20 seconds, stirring constantly.
  10. Add the brown sugar and fish sauce to the pot and mix for 30 seconds.
  11. Add the curry powder, ground coriander seed, and sambal olek (optional) to the pot and mix for 20 seconds.
  12. Pour the vegetable or chicken stock and coconut milk into the pot and mix.
  13. Taste and adjust seasoning with sea salt flakes (optional).
  14. Bring the soup to a boil over high heat.
  15. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
  16. Grate the zest of one lime into the soup.
  17. Add the seared prawns and any juices from the bowl to the soup.
  18. Simmer for 2 minutes.
  19. Remove the soup from the heat.
  20. To serve, place egg noodles in a bowl.
  21. Pour the soup over the noodles.
  22. Gently place the prawns in the bowl.
  23. Top with mung bean sprouts, coriander or cilantro, mint, and sliced red chili (optional).
  24. Squeeze a wedge of lime over the soup.
  25. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gIPmCO0CYHY

thai_pumpkin_soup.txt - Thai Pumpkin Soup

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful Thai pumpkin soup
  • Understand the importance of using fresh ingredients
  • Learn how to store and reheat the soup

Ingredients

  • 1/2 large butternut pumpkin (1.2 kg / 2.6 lbs)
  • 2 medium red onions (or 1 large)
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 25 g / 0.8 oz peeled ginger
  • 1 bunch coriander (roots and leaves)
  • 1 long red chili (optional)
  • 1.5 tbsp / 30 ml olive oil
  • 2 stalks fresh lemongrass
  • 1 tsp / 5 g sea salt flakes
  • 4 fresh kaffir lime leaves
  • 1 L / 4 cups vegetable or chicken stock
  • 400 ml / 1 can coconut milk
  • Toasted bread (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Peel and remove the pulp from the butternut pumpkin.
  2. Slice the pumpkin in half, then into quarters, and finally into medium-sized chunks.
  3. Peel the red onions and slice them in half.
  4. Slice the onions into large strips, then dice into medium-sized pieces.
  5. Grate the garlic and ginger.
  6. Roughly chop the coriander roots.
  7. Roughly chop the coriander leaves and stems.
  8. Slice the red chili thinly (optional).
  9. Place a large pot over high heat and add the olive oil.
  10. Add the diced red onion, grated garlic, and grated ginger.
  11. Saute for 2 minutes, stirring regularly.
  12. Add the chopped coriander roots and bruised lemongrass.
  13. Saute for another 2 minutes, stirring regularly.
  14. Add the diced pumpkin, mix well, and cook for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.
  15. Add the salt flakes and kaffir lime leaves.
  16. Pour in the vegetable or chicken stock and mix well.
  17. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and simmer for 30 minutes.
  18. Remove the pot from the heat and remove the lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves.
  19. Add the chopped coriander leaves and stems.
  20. Blend the soup using an immersion blender until smooth.
  21. Add the coconut milk and mix well.
  22. Adjust seasoning as needed.
  23. Serve the soup in bowls or mugs, garnished with sliced chili and fresh coriander.
  24. Serve with toasted bread.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BBKpWUksCq4

thank_you_2022.txt - Thank You 2022!

Objectives

  • Express gratitude to viewers for their support
  • Highlight channel growth and future plans
  • Wish viewers a happy New Year

Instructions

This transcript is a personal message from the creator to their viewers, expressing gratitude for their support. There are no actionable steps or instructions to extract.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kgv7I0R2EMs

tomato_basil_pasta.txt - Tomato and Basil Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a simple and delicious tomato and basil pasta dish.
  • Learn how to prepare ingredients for optimal flavor.
  • Utilize basic cooking techniques for a satisfying meal.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion, halved and diced
  • 3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced or minced
  • 30 grams fresh basil leaves
  • 400 grams spaghetti or pasta of choice
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon balsamic or red wine vinegar
  • 2 cans diced or crushed tomatoes
  • 2 teaspoons dried oregano
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Fresh parmesan cheese (optional)

Instructions

  1. Slice the onion in half through the root.
  2. Make thin slices across the onion, stopping at the root.
  3. Rotate the onion 90 degrees and make a horizontal slice through the center.
  4. Dice the onion into small, even-sized pieces.
  5. Thinly slice or mince the garlic cloves.
  6. Remove the basil leaves from the stems.
  7. Chop or tear the basil leaves by hand.
  8. Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat.
  9. Add the pasta to the boiling water and cook for 1 minute less than the package instructions.
  10. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan over medium-high heat.
  11. Add olive oil to the pan and sauté the diced onion for 3-4 minutes, until lightly golden and translucent.
  12. Add the sliced or minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
  13. Add balsamic or red wine vinegar to the pan.
  14. Add the diced or crushed tomatoes and dried oregano.
  15. Stir to combine all ingredients.
  16. Season with salt, pepper, and sugar to taste.
  17. Add the basil stems to the sauce.
  18. Bring the sauce to a simmer and reduce heat to low.
  19. Simmer the sauce for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  20. Remove the basil stems from the sauce.
  21. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce, along with some pasta water.
  22. Stir to combine the pasta and sauce.
  23. Add the chopped or torn basil leaves to the pasta.
  24. Mix thoroughly to ensure the basil is evenly distributed.
  25. Adjust seasoning levels as needed.
  26. Remove the pasta from the heat.
  27. Serve the pasta in bowls or plates.
  28. Garnish with chiffonade basil leaves, grated parmesan cheese, and cracked black pepper.
  29. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=165FjFhF3Zw

tomato_pasta.txt - Tomato Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful tomato-based sauce with a smoky kick
  • Learn how to chiffonade basil for a unique flavor infusion
  • Cook pasta al dente and toss it in the sauce for a satisfying meal

Ingredients

  • 3 cloves garlic, peeled and thinly sliced
  • 1 kg (2.2 lbs) tomatoes, diced
  • 15 g (0.5 oz) fresh basil leaves, chiffonaded
  • 60 ml (1/4 cup) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (20 g) chipotle in adobo OR 1.5 tsp (3 g) smoked paprika
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sugar
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper (20 cracks)
  • 1 cup (250 ml) vegetable stock
  • 500 g spaghetti or pasta of your choice
  • Freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano or parmesan cheese (amount to taste)

Instructions

  1. Slice 3 cloves of garlic thinly.
  2. Dice 1 kg (2.2 lbs) of tomatoes into even-sized pieces.
  3. Chiffonade 15 g (0.5 oz) of fresh basil leaves.
  4. Place a large, high-sided pan over medium-high heat.
  5. Add 60 ml (1/4 cup) of olive oil to the cold pan.
  6. Add the thinly sliced garlic and stir until it starts to sizzle.
  7. Add diced tomatoes, 2 tsp (20 g) chipotle in adobo (or 1.5 tsp smoked paprika), 1 tsp (5 g) sugar, sea salt flakes to taste, and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  8. Mix well and sauté for 5 minutes.
  9. Pour in 1 cup (250 ml) of vegetable stock and mix well.
  10. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and sugar as needed.
  11. Add more chipotle in adobo (or smoked paprika) for extra heat and smokiness, if desired.
  12. Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
  13. 20 minutes before the sauce is ready, bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
  14. Add 500 g of spaghetti (or pasta of your choice) to the boiling water and cook for 30 seconds.
  15. Twist the pasta in the water and cook for 1 minute less than the package instructions.
  16. Add the chiffonaded basil to the simmering sauce and mix well.
  17. Transfer the cooked pasta directly from the pot to the sauce, bringing along some pasta water.
  18. Toss the pasta in the sauce for 1 minute, allowing the sauce to thicken.
  19. Remove from heat and serve in bowls or plates.
  20. Garnish with additional chiffonaded basil, cracked black pepper, and freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano or parmesan cheese.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dhApeW6Twfs

tomato_salsa.txt - Tomato Salsa

Objectives

  • Create a citrusy and flavorful tomato salsa.
  • Learn how to finely dice garlic with salt.
  • Understand the benefits of using extra virgin olive oil.

Ingredients

  • 5 roma tomatoes (750g/1.6 lbs)
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1/2 tsp sea salt flakes
  • 1 medium red onion (spanish onion)
  • 1/2 bunch coriander/cilantro (40g/1.4 oz)
  • 1 jalapeno pepper (optional)
  • 2 limes
  • 1 tsp balsamic vinegar (optional)
  • 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
  • 1.5 tsp sea salt flakes
  • 1 tsp black pepper

Instructions

  1. Remove the core of each tomato by rotating a pairing knife around the core on a slight inward angle.
  2. Dice the tomatoes into small pieces.
  3. Peel and finely dice the garlic cloves.
  4. Sprinkle garlic with 1/2 tsp sea salt flakes and use a knife to scrape the salt into the garlic to create a paste.
  5. Slice the red onion in half, peel, and dice into medium-sized pieces.
  6. Roughly chop the coriander/cilantro, including the roots.
  7. Slice the jalapeno pepper in half, remove the seeds, and dice.
  8. Squeeze the juice from two limes into a bowl.
  9. Add the diced tomatoes, garlic paste, onion, coriander/cilantro, jalapeno, lime juice, balsamic vinegar (optional), olive oil, sea salt flakes, and black pepper to a bowl.
  10. Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
  11. Serve the salsa with toasted bread, drizzled with olive oil, and topped with fresh coriander/cilantro and black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ed5TwducHvs

tortilla_wraps.txt - Tortilla Wraps

Objectives

  • Learn how to make homemade tortilla wraps from scratch
  • Understand the importance of kneading and resting dough
  • Discover versatile uses for homemade tortillas

Ingredients

  • 3 cups (375 grams) plain all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon (4.5 grams) sea salt flakes
  • 1 teaspoon (4 grams) baking powder
  • 1/3 cup (75 milliliters) olive oil
  • 1 cup (250 milliliters) warm water
  • 1/2 cup (65 grams) plain all-purpose flour (for dusting)

Instructions

  1. Combine 3 cups (375 grams) plain all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon (4.5 grams) sea salt flakes, and 1 teaspoon (4 grams) baking powder in a large mixing bowl.
  2. Whisk the dry ingredients together until well combined.
  3. Pour in 1/3 cup (75 milliliters) olive oil and 1 cup (250 milliliters) warm water.
  4. Whisk all ingredients together until a sticky dough forms.
  5. Lightly dust your work surface with 1/2 cup (65 grams) plain all-purpose flour.
  6. Tip the sticky dough onto the floured surface.
  7. Dust any dough stuck in the bowl with flour and rub it out.
  8. Add the dusted dough back to the main dough.
  9. Lightly flour the top of the dough.
  10. Knead the dough for approximately 4 minutes, adding a small amount of flour at a time until it is smooth and no longer sticky.
  11. Weigh the dough. You should have approximately 712 grams.
  12. Divide the dough into 16 equal pieces, each weighing approximately 44.5 grams.
  13. Roll each dough piece into a smooth ball using your fingers.
  14. Gently press down on each ball to remove excess air.
  15. Cover the balls with a clean, dry tea towel and let them rest for 1 hour.
  16. After 1 hour, dust each side of the dough with flour.
  17. Roll each dough piece out to a 7-8 inch diameter circle using a rolling pin, adding flour if necessary.
  18. Rotate the dough while rolling to ensure an even circle.
  19. Wrap a rolled-out tortilla around a rolling pin to easily lift it from the work surface.
  20. Place rolled-out tortillas on a clean, dry work surface, making sure they don't overlap.
  21. Heat a large skillet over medium heat until hot.
  22. Carefully place one tortilla in the hot skillet at a time, ensuring it doesn't fold over.
  23. Cook the tortilla for 1 minute.
  24. Flip the tortilla and cook for an additional 20 seconds.
  25. Remove the cooked tortilla from the skillet and place it on a wire rack to cool.
  26. Repeat steps 21-25 until all tortillas are cooked.
  27. Stack cooled tortillas on the wire rack.
  28. Enjoy your homemade tortilla wraps!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HQsmYPV171o

triple_cooked_crispy_garlic_parmesan_fries.txt - Triple Cooked Crispy Garlic Parmesan Fries

Objectives

  • Learn to make crispy, flavorful fries using a triple-cooking method.
  • Create a delicious Outback-style dipping sauce.
  • Understand the importance of starch removal and oil temperature control.

Ingredients

Potatoes: - 5-6 allrounder potatoes (Yukon Gold, Desiree, or Russet) - 2 cloves of garlic (for garlic butter, optional) - 2 g flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped (for garlic butter, optional) - 2 teaspoons corn flour/cornstarch (optional)

Outback Sauce: - 1 egg - 3 tablespoons white vinegar - 1 teaspoon American/yellow mustard or Dijon mustard - 150 ml neutral flavored oil (vegetable oil) - 1 tablespoon tomato ketchup - 1 tablespoon creamed horseradish (or half the amount of regular horseradish) - 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce - 1 teaspoon smoked paprika - 1 tablespoon garlic powder - 1/2 teaspoon chili powder (optional) - Salt to taste

Garlic Butter: - 3 tablespoons (42 g) unsalted butter - 2 cloves of garlic, grated (optional) - 2 g flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped (optional)

Other: - Vegetable oil (for frying) - Salt - Black pepper - Parmesan cheese (for garnish)

Instructions

  1. Prepare Potatoes:
  2. Slice potatoes into strips of equal size.
  3. Stack strips and dice into even-sized fries.
  4. Place fries in a bowl of cold water and soak for 1 hour to remove excess starch.
  5. Make Outback Sauce:
  6. In a tall container, blend 1 egg, 3 tablespoons white vinegar, 1 teaspoon mustard, and 150 ml oil with an immersion blender until emulsified.
  7. Add 1 tablespoon ketchup, 1 tablespoon horseradish, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, and 1/2 teaspoon chili powder (optional).
  8. Season with salt and blend until combined.
  9. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
  10. First Cook:
  11. Bring a pot of water to a boil.
  12. Add potatoes in batches and cook for 4-5 minutes until the outside is soft but the center is firm.
  13. Remove potatoes and place on a wire rack.
  14. Refrigerate or freeze overnight to allow starch to set.
  15. Prepare Garlic Butter (optional):
  16. Grate 2 cloves of garlic across a microplane to create a paste.
  17. Roughly chop 2 g of flat leaf parsley.
  18. Melt 3 tablespoons of butter in a pan over medium heat.
  19. Add garlic and parsley, stirring until garlic is broken up.
  20. Cook for 1 minute over low heat, then remove from heat and set aside.
  21. Second Cook:
  22. Transfer cold potatoes to a tray or bowl with large sides.
  23. Add 2 teaspoons of corn flour/cornstarch (optional).
  24. Heat vegetable oil in a pot over high heat until it reaches 160°C/320°F.
  25. Fry potatoes in batches for 5-6 minutes until the outer shell is crispy but not colored.
  26. Third Cook:
  27. Increase oil temperature to 180°C/350°F.
  28. Fry potatoes in batches for 3-4 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
  29. If desired, cook for an additional couple of minutes for extra crispiness.
  30. Season and Serve:
  31. Transfer cooked fries to a mixing bowl.
  32. Season generously with salt and black pepper.
  33. Add garlic butter (optional) and grated Parmesan cheese (optional).
  34. Toss to combine.
  35. Serve in a fry basket or on a plate with Outback sauce and additional garnishes (Parmesan cheese, garlic butter).

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=10N9lKyoxt0

truffle_mac_and_cheese.txt - Truffle Mac and Cheese

Objectives

  • Learn to make a gourmet mac and cheese with a truffle twist.
  • Create a creamy, cheesy sauce using parmesan, cornflour, and white wine reduction.
  • Elevate the dish with truffle-infused olive oil and cream cheese.

Ingredients

  • 90 grams (3.1 ounces) Parmesan cheese, finely grated
  • 14 grams (0.4 ounces) cornflour or starch
  • 250 grams (8.8 ounces) macaroni
  • 300 milliliters (300 grams) cheap white wine (e.g., Sauvignon Blanc)
  • 1 1/4 cups (310 milliliters) chicken stock
  • 30 milliliters (1 1/2 tablespoons) truffle-infused extra virgin olive oil
  • 90 grams (3.1 ounces) soft cream cheese (e.g., Philadelphia)
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Black pepper
  • Additional Parmesan cheese for grating (optional)

Instructions

  1. Grate the Parmesan cheese finely using a microplane or box grater.
  2. Combine the grated Parmesan with the cornflour or starch in a bowl and mix well.
  3. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil, add a generous sprinkle of sea salt flakes, and then add the macaroni. Cook for one minute less than the packet instructions.
  4. While the macaroni cooks, place another large saucepan over high heat and pour in the white wine. Bring to a boil and reduce for 5-6 minutes, or until only 2 tablespoons (40 milliliters) remain.
  5. Drain the macaroni and let it rest for 10 minutes to cool slightly.
  6. Add the chicken stock to the reduced wine and bring to a simmer.
  7. Mix the Parmesan and cornflour mixture with a fork to ensure no lumps remain.
  8. Add the macaroni to a clean bowl and toss with the truffle-infused olive oil.
  9. Add the macaroni to the wine and chicken stock mixture, scraping in any remaining oil from the bowl. Fold the macaroni through the sauce until well combined.
  10. Add the cream cheese and fold until smooth and creamy.
  11. Transfer the mac and cheese to a baking dish and spread evenly.
  12. Grate additional Parmesan cheese over the surface.
  13. Broil the mac and cheese for 4-5 minutes, or until golden brown.
  14. Let the mac and cheese cool for 5 minutes before serving.
  15. Serve the mac and cheese on its own or alongside a protein of your choice. Garnish with sea salt flakes, black pepper, and a drizzle of truffle oil.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TTh9gXLyyrM

truffle_mustard_mayonnaise.txt - Truffle Mustard Mayonnaise

Objectives

  • Learn to make a delicious truffle mustard mayonnaise.
  • Understand the process of creating an emulsion using an immersion blender.
  • Prepare a flavorful spread perfect for sandwiches and other dishes.

Ingredients

  • 1 egg
  • 15 ml white vinegar
  • 10 g Dijon mustard
  • 180 ml neutral flavored oil
  • 40 g whole grain mustard
  • 20 g creamed horseradish
  • 10 ml truffle oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions

  1. Add one egg, 15 ml of white vinegar, 10 grams of Dijon mustard, and 180 ml of neutral flavored oil to a tall jar or container.
  2. Use an immersion blender on high speed to create a thick emulsion.
  3. Add 40 grams of whole grain mustard, 20 grams of creamed horseradish, and 10 ml of truffle oil to the mayonnaise.
  4. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
  5. Blend with the immersion blender until combined.
  6. Transfer the mayonnaise to a clean sterilized jar or container.
  7. Store in the refrigerator for up to four days.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzPNgMYYQU8

tuna_cado_sandwich.txt - Tuna Cado Sandwich

Objectives

  • Make a homemade mayonnaise with fresh herbs.
  • Create a flavorful basil pesto.
  • Assemble a delicious tuna and avocado sandwich.

Ingredients

Mayonnaise: - 1 egg - 1 tsp (10g) Dijon mustard - 3 tbsp (15ml) white distilled vinegar - 150ml neutral flavored oil (sunflower oil) - 10g fresh dill - 10g flat leaf parsley - Salt and cracked black pepper (10 cracks)

Basil Pesto: - 1 clove garlic - 5g (0.2oz) parmesan reggiano cheese - 5g (0.2oz) pine nuts (or cashews, almonds, peanuts, walnuts) - 1/2 bunch basil (leaves only, ~25g/0.8oz) - 3 tbsp (60ml) extra virgin olive oil - 1/4 lemon (juiced) - Sea salt flakes and cracked black pepper (10 cracks)

Tuna Mix: - 1/2 red onion (diced) - 3 cornichons or 1 slice dill pickle (finely diced) - 5g (0.2oz) flat leaf parsley (chopped) - 1 can (425g) tuna in spring water (drained) - 10g (2 tsp) American or yellow mustard - Herby mayo (save some for spreading) - Salt and cracked black pepper (10 cracks)

Sandwich: - 1 avocado (thinly sliced) - 2 tomatoes (thinly sliced or quartered) - Bread of choice (flat loaf, ciabatta) - Butter (optional) - Herby mayo - Basil pesto - Hot sauce (optional)

Instructions

  1. Make the mayonnaise:
  2. In a tall jar, combine egg, mustard, vinegar, and oil.
  3. Blend with an immersion blender until emulsified.
  4. Add dill, parsley, salt, and pepper.
  5. Blend again until combined.

  6. Store in the fridge until ready to use.

  7. Make the basil pesto:

  8. In a blender, combine garlic, parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and basil leaves.
  9. Blend on high speed for 20 seconds.
  10. Add olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
  11. Blend until smooth.
  12. Adjust consistency with additional olive oil until pourable.

  13. Store in the fridge until ready to use.

  14. Prepare the tuna mix:

  15. Dice red onion.
  16. Finely dice cornichons or dill pickle.
  17. Chop parsley.
  18. Drain tuna in spring water.
  19. Combine tuna, onion, cornichons, parsley, mustard, Herby mayo (save some), salt, and pepper.

  20. Mix well.

  21. Assemble the sandwich:

  22. Thinly slice avocado and tomatoes.
  23. Toast bread (optional) in a pan, toaster, or oven.
  24. Spread Herby mayo on one slice of bread and basil pesto on the other.
  25. Layer tuna mix, avocado, and tomato slices on top.
  26. Season with salt, pepper, and hot sauce (optional).
  27. Place the top slice of bread on top and press down gently.
  28. Cut in half and enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yx1P-9SnOUQ

tunado_sandwich.txt - Tunado Sandwich

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful basil pesto from scratch.
  • Assemble a delicious tunado sandwich with a unique combination of ingredients.
  • Learn to layer and season ingredients for maximum flavor.

Ingredients

  • 1 garlic clove
  • 1/4 cup parmesan cheese
  • 1/4 cup pine nuts
  • 1/2 cup basil leaves
  • 1 tablespoon EVOO (extra virgin olive oil)
  • Salt
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 1 red onion
  • 1/2 cup corn kernels
  • 1/4 cup flat leaf parsley
  • 1 can tuna in spring water (or tuna in olive oil)
  • 1 tablespoon American mustard
  • 2 tablespoons Herby Mayo (or regular mayo)
  • 1 avocado
  • 2 tomatoes
  • Sliced bread
  • Butter (optional)
  • Chili sauce (optional)

Instructions

  1. In a blender, combine garlic clove, parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and blend on high until broken down.
  2. Add basil leaves, a splash of EVOO, salt, and cracked black pepper. Blend again on high.
  3. Adjust consistency with more EVOO until thick and pourable. This is your basil pesto.
  4. Small dice red onion and add to a bowl.
  5. Dice corn kernels finely and roughly chop flat leaf parsley. Add both to the bowl with the red onion.
  6. Drain tuna from its liquid and add to the bowl with the onion, corn, and parsley.
  7. Add American mustard and Herby Mayo (or regular mayo) to the bowl. Season and mix well.
  8. Open avocado, remove seed, and thinly slice across the entire avocado.
  9. Thinly slice tomatoes and cut them in half.
  10. Toast bread to your liking. (Use a pan with butter, toaster, or grill.)
  11. Spread pesto onto toasted bread.
  12. Top with the tuna mixture.
  13. Arrange avocado slices on top of the tuna mixture.
  14. Add tomato slices on top of the avocado. Season tomatoes with salt, pepper, and optional chili sauce.
  15. Slice the sandwich in half and enjoy your tunado sandwich!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZGPc7LnInrM

tuna_monet.txt - Tuna Monet

Objectives

  • Transform canned tuna into a delicious and easy Tuna Monet.
  • Learn a simple recipe that's both cheap and flavorful.
  • Discover a recipe suggested by viewers.

Ingredients

  • 1 can (425g) tuna in spring water
  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 400g macaroni pasta (or shells, or other pasta)
  • 600ml full fat milk
  • 100g unsalted butter
  • 70g plain all-purpose flour
  • 180ml thickened cream (optional)
  • Zest of half a lemon (optional)
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Breadcrumbs (optional)
  • Cheddar cheese (amount to taste)
  • Extra virgin olive oil (for serving)
  • Flat leaf parsley (for garnish)
  • Cracked black pepper (for serving)

Instructions

  1. Open the can of tuna and drain the liquid. Crumble the tuna.
  2. Peel and dice the onion, saving the root for stock.
  3. Grate or chop the garlic.
  4. Fill a pot with water and bring to a boil. Season with salt.
  5. Add the pasta to the boiling water and cook for 3 minutes less than the packet instructions.
  6. Drain the pasta and set aside the pot.
  7. Heat the milk in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until warm.
  8. Melt the butter in the pasta pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion and salt, and sweat for 3 minutes.
  9. Add the garlic paste and cook for 45 seconds.
  10. Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes.
  11. Gradually add the warmed milk to the flour mixture, mixing until absorbed.
  12. Repeat step 11 until all the milk is incorporated.
  13. Stir in the cream (if using), and continue mixing until thickened.
  14. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  15. Add the lemon zest (optional), tuna, and cooked pasta to the sauce. Mix well.
  16. Grease a large roasting dish with oil or butter.
  17. Transfer the tuna Monet mixture to the dish and spread it evenly, pressing it down.
  18. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs (optional).
  19. Cover the top with cheddar cheese.
  20. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown and crusty.
  21. Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes.
  22. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil, a garnish of parsley, and cracked black pepper.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vGBU8UAXoX8

tuna_mornay.txt - Tuna Mornay

Objectives

  • Transform canned tuna into a flavorful and satisfying Tuna Mornay
  • Learn how to create a creamy sauce base for the Mornay
  • Bake the Tuna Mornay to achieve a golden, crispy topping

Ingredients

  • 1 large tin of tuna
  • 1 brown or yellow onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 package macaroni pasta
  • 2 tablespoons butter
  • 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
  • 2 cups milk
  • 1/2 cup heavy cream
  • Zest of 1/2 lemon
  • 1/2 cup Panko bread crumbs
  • 1/2 cup shredded cheese

Instructions

  1. Drain the tuna and set aside.
  2. Slice and dice the onion into small pieces.
  3. Grate the garlic on a microplane to create a paste.
  4. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
  5. Add the macaroni pasta and cook for 3 minutes less than the package instructions.
  6. Drain the pasta and set aside.
  7. Return the same pot to the stovetop over medium-high heat.
  8. Add the butter and onions, cook for 3 minutes.
  9. Add the garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
  10. Stir in the flour and cook until the mixture is thickened.
  11. Gradually add the milk in batches, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.
  12. Add the remaining milk and cream, continue stirring until smooth.
  13. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon zest, tuna, and cooked pasta.
  14. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking pan.
  15. Sprinkle with Panko bread crumbs and cheese, ensuring even coverage.
  16. Bake at 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown.
  17. Let the Tuna Mornay rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FFnqgf-bQsI

tuscan_chicken.txt - Tuscan Chicken

Objectives

  • Create a quick and easy Tuscan Chicken recipe.
  • Utilize alcohol in the sauce for enhanced flavor, offering substitutes for those who prefer not to consume alcohol.
  • Present a visually appealing and flavorful dish.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion, peeled and diced
  • 6 garlic cloves, minced
  • 100 grams (3.5 ounces) sun-dried tomatoes, chopped (optional)
  • 10 grams (0.3 ounces) fresh basil, chopped
  • 2 large butterfly chicken breasts or 4 small whole chicken breasts
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) unrefined olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon (3 grams) onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon (3 grams) garlic powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1.5 grams) regular paprika
  • Sea salt flakes, to taste
  • 10 cracks of black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon (14 grams) clarified butter
  • 1 tablespoon (35 grams) concentrated tomato paste
  • 1 teaspoon (1 gram) dried oregano
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1.5 grams) regular paprika
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • 100 ml (100 grams) white wine or chicken stock
  • 180 ml (3/4 cup) chicken stock
  • 400 ml (410 grams) thickened cream (heavy cream)
  • 60 grams (2.1 ounces) freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano or parmesan cheese
  • 120 grams (4.2 ounces) baby spinach

Instructions

  1. Dice the onion, mince the garlic, and chop the sun-dried tomatoes (if using).
  2. Roughly chop the basil.
  3. Season the chicken breasts with olive oil, onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Massage the seasoning into the chicken.
  4. Heat a large, high-rimmed pan over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and sear the chicken for 3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
  5. Add clarified butter to the same pan and melt.
  6. Sauté the diced onion for 3 minutes until golden and translucent.
  7. Add minced garlic, tomato paste, sun-dried tomatoes, oregano, paprika, and a pinch of salt. Sauté for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
  8. Deglaze the pan with white wine or chicken stock. Reduce for 2 minutes until the liquid has mostly evaporated.
  9. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce for 1 minute.
  10. Stir in thickened cream. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 7 minutes until thickened.
  11. Add grated cheese, chopped basil, and baby spinach. Stir for 1 minute until cheese melts and spinach wilts.
  12. Return the seared chicken breasts to the sauce along with any resting juices. Stir to coat the chicken in the sauce.
  13. Increase heat to medium-high and bring the sauce back to a heavy simmer. This ensures the chicken is heated through.
  14. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
  15. Serve the chicken in bowls or on plates, topped with the sauce, garnished with basil leaves and cracked black pepper. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EXqCHrlw8rw

tusin_beef_pasta.txt - Tusin Beef Pasta

Objectives

  • Create a flavorful and easy Tusin Beef Pasta dish.
  • Learn to cook pasta al dente.
  • Utilize sundried tomato oil for a unique flavor.

Ingredients

  • 1 brown or yellow onion, diced
  • 2-3 cloves garlic, crushed and chopped
  • Salt
  • Pepper
  • Sundried tomato oil
  • Beef
  • Sweet paprika
  • Dried Italian herbs
  • Tomato paste
  • Chicken stock
  • Cream
  • Baby spinach
  • Pasta

Instructions

  1. Dice one brown or yellow onion into small to medium size pieces.
  2. Crush and roughly chop garlic into small pieces.
  3. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
  4. Cook pasta for 1 minute less than the packet instructions.
  5. Place a pan over medium-high heat.
  6. Add sundried tomato oil, beef, salt, and pepper to the pan.
  7. Cook for 4-5 minutes until the beef is no longer pink.
  8. Add the diced onion and cook for 2 minutes.
  9. Add garlic, sundried tomato, sweet paprika, dried Italian herbs, and tomato paste.
  10. Season with salt and pepper.
  11. Mix and cook for a few minutes.
  12. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil, then reduce heat.
  13. Add cream and cook for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens.
  14. Add baby spinach and mix until wilted.
  15. Drain pasta and add to the sauce, along with some pasta water to thin the sauce if needed.
  16. Mix everything together.
  17. Serve and garnish as desired.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Th3F6PjRLm0

vietnamese_chicken_curry.txt - Vietnamese Chicken Curry (Cà Ri Gà)

Objectives

  • Learn to make a flavorful and easy Vietnamese chicken curry.
  • Master the technique of searing chicken and vegetables separately.
  • Create a rich and creamy sauce with coconut milk and spices.

Ingredients

  • 2 carrots, top and tail, roughly chopped
  • 500g (1.1 lb) potatoes, sliced in half lengthwise, roughly chopped
  • 1 brown or yellow onion, sliced in half, peeled, sliced across in half moons
  • 6 cloves garlic, minced or microplaned into a paste
  • 3 stalks lemongrass, sliced in half lengthwise, bruised
  • 1 kg (2.2 lb) boneless, skinless chicken thighs, sliced, diced, or left whole
  • 2 teaspoons neutral-flavored oil (vegetable oil)
  • 2 teaspoons chicken stock powder
  • 2 tablespoons Vietnamese curry powder (or Indian curry powder)
  • Salt to taste
  • Ground black pepper (optional)
  • 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
  • 4 bay leaves or lime leaves
  • 2 tablespoons (8g) sugar (optional)
  • 3 cups (750 ml) chicken stock
  • 1 cup (250 ml) water
  • 1 tablespoon (20 ml) fish sauce
  • 1 can (400 ml) coconut milk
  • 2 tablespoons Sandell o chili paste (optional)
  • Baguette, bread roll, or other bread for serving
  • Sliced chili (optional)
  • Salt (optional)
  • Coriander or cilantro (optional)

Instructions

  1. Prepare the vegetables: Top and tail the carrots and roughly chop them into bite-sized pieces. Slice the potatoes in half lengthwise and roughly chop them, ensuring they are the same size as the carrots. Slice the onion in half, peel it, and then slice it across in half moons.
  2. Prepare the garlic and lemongrass: Mince or microplane the garlic into a paste. Slice the lemongrass in half lengthwise and bruise it slightly.
  3. Marinate the chicken: Slice, dice, or leave the chicken thighs whole. Place the chicken in a bowl and add 2 teaspoons of neutral-flavored oil, 2 teaspoons of chicken stock powder, 2 tablespoons of Vietnamese curry powder (or Indian curry powder), salt to taste, and ground black pepper (optional). Mix well with a clean hand and set aside.
  4. Sear the vegetables: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large pan or pot over medium-high heat. Add the carrots and potatoes along with a pinch of salt. Cook for 4-5 minutes, until they start to brown and develop flavor. Remove the vegetables and set them aside in a bowl.
  5. Sear the chicken: Add the marinated chicken to the pan and spread it out, ensuring it's not all piled on top of each other. Cook for 3-4 minutes, allowing it to brown and the spices to infuse. Remove the chicken and set it aside in a separate bowl.
  6. Sauté the onions and garlic: Add more oil to the pan if needed. Add the sliced onions and cook for 4 minutes, until they are golden brown. Add the garlic and lemongrass, along with a pinch of salt, and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
  7. Combine the ingredients: Return the seared chicken and any resting juices to the pan. Add 4 bay leaves or lime leaves, 2 tablespoons of sugar (optional), 3 cups of chicken stock, 1 cup of water, 1 tablespoon of fish sauce, and mix everything together.
  8. Simmer the curry: Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 10 minutes.
  9. Add the vegetables and coconut milk: After 10 minutes, add the carrots and potatoes back into the pan and mix well to coat them in the sauce. Simmer for 15 minutes, until the potatoes have softened slightly. Add 1 can of coconut milk and 2 tablespoons of Sandell o chili paste (optional). Mix well.
  10. Finish cooking and serve: Continue simmering for 5 minutes, until the potatoes and carrots are fork tender. Remove from heat and check for seasoning, adjusting as needed. Serve the curry hot with a baguette, bread roll, or other bread. Garnish with sliced chili, salt, and coriander or cilantro.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rta03TPi_Do

vietnamese_chicken_salad.txt - Vietnamese Chicken Salad

Objectives

  • Prepare a refreshing and flavorful Vietnamese chicken salad.
  • Learn various cooking techniques, including roasting peanuts, poaching chicken, and pickling vegetables.
  • Create a delicious dressing using fish sauce, sugar, garlic, and lime.

Ingredients

English | Chinese Characters ------- | -------- 40 grams peanuts | 花生 (huāshēng) 2.5 tablespoons fish sauce | 鱼露 (yúlù) 1/4 cup water | 水 (shuǐ) 2.5 tablespoons caster sugar | 糖 (táng) 1 clove garlic | 大蒜 (dàsuàn) 1 large lime | 柠檬 (níngméng) 3 kaffir lime leaves | 香茅 (xiāngmáo) 2 large chicken breasts (500 grams) | 鸡胸肉 (jīxiōngròu) 1 large carrot | 胡萝卜 (húluóbo) 100 grams white cabbage | 白菜 (báicài) 100 grams red cabbage | 紫甘蓝 (zǐgānlán) 1 white onion | 洋葱 (yángcōng) 1/2 cup rice wine vinegar | 米酒醋 (mǐjiǔcù) 1.5 tablespoons caster sugar | 糖 (táng) 1 teaspoon sea salt flakes | 海盐 (hǎiyán) 100 grams bean sprouts | 豆芽 (dòuyá) 15 grams coriander | 香菜 (xiāngcài) 15 grams mint | 薄荷 (bòhe) Bird's eye chili (optional) | 小米椒 (xiǎomǐjiāo) Fried shallots (optional) | 炸洋葱 (zhá yángcōng)

Instructions

  1. Roughly chop 40 grams of peanuts.
  2. Spread peanuts on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
  3. Roast peanuts in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 5-6 minutes, or until golden brown.
  4. Allow roasted peanuts to cool while preparing the rest of the salad.
  5. Combine 2.5 tablespoons of fish sauce, 1/4 cup of water, and 2.5 tablespoons of caster sugar in a small saucepan.
  6. Crush 1 clove of garlic using the side of a knife.
  7. Add the crushed garlic to the saucepan.
  8. Slice a large lime in half, reserving half for serving.
  9. Add the remaining lime juice to the saucepan.
  10. Add 3 kaffir lime leaves to the saucepan.
  11. Bring the mixture to a simmer over high heat, stirring occasionally.
  12. Once simmering, stir once more and remove from heat.
  13. Pour the dressing into a fresh vessel and refrigerate until completely cold.
  14. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over high heat.
  15. Gently place 2 large chicken breasts (500 grams) into the boiling water and poach for 10 minutes.
  16. Turn off the heat and allow the chicken breasts to rest in the water for 2 minutes.
  17. Remove the chicken breasts from the water and place on a plate to cool.
  18. Top and tail a large carrot, slice it in half, and set half aside.
  19. Slice thin strips off the side of the carrot to create a stable base.
  20. Cut the carrot into thin, even-sized strips.
  21. Stack 2-3 carrot strips and thinly slice them into matchstick cuts (julienned).
  22. Separate 100 grams of white cabbage and 100 grams of red cabbage into halves or thirds.
  23. Slice the cabbage as thin and consistent as possible, creating a chiffonade.
  24. Slice off the tip and root of a white onion.
  25. Slice the onion in half and peel off the skin.
  26. Slice the onion thinly, creating wafer-thin strips.
  27. Combine 1/2 cup of rice wine vinegar, 1.5 tablespoons of caster sugar, and 1 teaspoon of sea salt flakes in a mixing bowl.
  28. Whisk the ingredients together until slightly dissolved.
  29. Add the julienned carrot, thinly sliced onion, and 100 grams of bean sprouts to the brine.
  30. Mix the vegetables well to ensure they are coated in the brine.
  31. Allow the vegetables to pickle for 5 minutes.
  32. Thinly slice the cooked chicken breasts.
  33. Optionally, tear the chicken into smaller pieces or strips.
  34. Combine the chiffonaded cabbages, pickled vegetables (drained), 15 grams of roughly chopped coriander, 15 grams of torn mint leaves, and the sliced or torn chicken in a large mixing bowl.
  35. Pour the cold dressing over the salad, discarding any remaining dressing.
  36. Mix all ingredients together until evenly distributed.
  37. Serve the salad in a bowl, garnished with thinly sliced bird's eye chili (optional), roasted peanuts, fried shallots (optional), and a lime wedge.
  38. Squeeze the lime wedge over the salad for added citrus flavor.
  39. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-8ZH3R_lFeY

vietnamese_chicken_wings.txt - Crispy Vietnamese Chicken Wings

Objectives

  • Learn to make crispy Vietnamese chicken wings.
  • Prepare a flavorful caramel sauce.
  • Deep fry chicken wings for optimal texture.

Ingredients

English | Chinese ------- | -------- 1.3 kg chicken wings | 1.3公斤鸡翅 2 shallots | 2个青葱 7 cloves garlic | 7瓣蒜 2 spring onions | 2根葱 2 red chilies | 2个红辣椒 2 limes | 2个青柠 2 tbsp garlic powder | 2汤匙蒜粉 2 tbsp onion powder | 2汤匙洋葱粉 1 tbsp fish sauce | 1汤匙鱼露 salt | 盐 ground white pepper | 白胡椒粉 3 tbsp peanut oil | 3汤匙花生油 3 1/2 tbsp brown sugar | 3.5汤匙红糖 1/4 cup fish sauce | 1/4杯鱼露 1 cup corn flour | 1杯玉米粉 1 tsp baking powder | 1茶匙泡打粉 pinch of salt | 少许盐 vegetable or sunflower oil | 植物油或葵花籽油 15 g mint | 15克薄荷 15 g coriander | 15克香菜

Instructions

  1. Separate chicken wings into drums and flats by slicing through the joint bone.
  2. Place wings on a wire rack and refrigerate overnight for drying.
  3. Finely dice shallots.
  4. Crush garlic cloves and cut to the same size as the shallots.
  5. Thinly slice spring onions, including the green stem for garnish.
  6. Slice red chilies into quarters lengthwise, removing seeds if desired.
  7. Slice limes in half and set aside.
  8. In a bowl, combine chicken wings with 2 tbsp each of garlic and onion powder, 1 tbsp fish sauce, salt, and ground white pepper. Mix well.
  9. Heat 3 tbsp peanut oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
  10. Sauté diced shallots for 3 minutes until lightly browned.
  11. Add 3 1/2 tbsp brown sugar, 1/4 cup fish sauce, and crushed garlic to the pan. Mix well and bring to a boil.
  12. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until a caramel sauce forms.
  13. Add chopped chilies and spring onions (except for garnish) to the sauce. Mix well.
  14. Squeeze lime juice into the sauce, adding half at a time, to taste.
  15. Remove sauce from heat and set aside.
  16. Heat a large pot of vegetable or sunflower oil to 160°C.
  17. In a bowl, whisk together 1 cup corn flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
  18. Coat chicken wings in the flour mixture, 2-3 wings at a time, ensuring they are evenly coated. Place coated wings on a clean wire rack.
  19. Carefully lower chicken wings into the hot oil, frying for 7-8 minutes until golden brown.
