  20. Increase oil temperature to 180°C.
  21. Fry chicken wings again in batches for 2-3 minutes until crispy.
  22. Remove wings from oil and place on a wire rack to drain.
  23. Add fried chicken wings to a large bowl.
  24. Pour the caramel sauce over the chicken wings.
  25. Add 15g each of chopped mint and coriander to the bowl.
  26. Toss everything together to coat evenly.
  27. Serve chicken wings on bowls, plates, or a serving platter.
  28. Garnish with remaining spring onions and enjoy.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LgwZsTB2MWg

vodka_sauce_chicken_py_sandwich.txt - Vodka Sauce Chicken Parmesan Sandwich

Objectives

  • Create a crispy, delicious chicken parmesan sandwich with juicy chicken.
  • Prepare a flavorful vodka sauce.
  • Learn to properly bread and fry chicken for a golden, crispy finish.

Ingredients

  • 1 onion, diced
  • 2-3 cloves garlic, crushed and roughly chopped
  • Chicken breast, butterflied and sliced into fillets
  • Butter
  • Salt
  • Pepper
  • Tomato paste
  • Chili flakes
  • Vodka
  • Heavy cream
  • Eggs
  • Flour
  • Panko breadcrumbs
  • Dried herbs
  • Mozzarella cheese
  • Parmesan cheese (optional)
  • Pesto (optional)
  • Basil
  • Cracked black pepper
  • Bread (for sandwiches)

Instructions

  1. Dice the onion into small pieces.
  2. Crush and roughly chop the garlic.
  3. Butterfly the chicken breast and slice into even fillets.
  4. Heat a pan over medium heat and add butter.
  5. Add the diced onions, salt, and pepper to the pan and cook for a couple of minutes.
  6. Add the garlic, tomato paste, and chili flakes to the pan and cook for a few more minutes.
  7. Add a dash of vodka to the pan and bring to a boil.
  8. Reduce the vodka sauce by half.
  9. Add heavy cream, salt, and pepper to the sauce and mix well.
  10. Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 6 minutes.
  11. Crack a couple of eggs into a bowl.
  12. In a separate bowl, combine flour, panko breadcrumbs, dried herbs, salt, and pepper.
  13. Dredge the chicken fillets in flour, then dip in the egg wash, and finally coat with the panko breadcrumb mixture.
  14. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
  15. Fry the breaded chicken fillets for 5-6 minutes until golden brown and cooked through.
  16. Toast bread in a pan with butter (or to your liking).
  17. Spread pesto on the bread (optional).
  18. Add the vodka sauce to the bread.
  19. Place the fried chicken on top of the sauce.
  20. Top with mozzarella and parmesan cheese (optional).
  21. Garnish with basil and cracked black pepper.
  22. Enjoy your Vodka Sauce Chicken Parmesan Sandwich!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rvjxf3xZh98

website_launch.txt - Website Launch Announcement

Objectives

  • Express gratitude to viewers for their support
  • Announce the launch of a new website and merchandise store
  • Share plans for future website development and content

Instructions

  1. Visit the new website and merchandise store.
  2. Explore the features and content.
  3. Provide feedback on missing features or desired additions via comments, Instagram DM, or the website's contact page.
  4. Consider joining the community and contributing to its growth.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nXhoCQAYOr8

wild_mushroom_eggs_benedict_bruschetta.txt - Wild Mushroom Eggs Benedict Bruschetta

Objectives

  • Combine elements of eggs benedict and bruschetta into one dish.
  • Utilize wild mushrooms for a unique flavor profile.
  • Create a silky smooth hollandaise sauce.

Ingredients

  • 4 large portobello mushrooms
  • 3 shiitake mushrooms
  • 1 king oyster mushroom
  • 250 grams (8.8 ounces) wild mushroom mix (enoki, king oyster, shiitake, portobello)
  • 3 grams (0.1 ounces) flat leaf parsley
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 tablespoons (28 grams) unsalted butter
  • Sea salt flakes
  • Cracked black pepper
  • 300 grams (10.5 ounces) unsalted butter (for clarified butter)
  • 3 egg yolks
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) white vinegar or freshly squeezed lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon (20 milliliters) olive oil or leftover clarified butter
  • 2 teaspoons (10 milliliters) white vinegar (for poaching eggs)
  • 4 whole eggs
  • Sourdough bread
  • Extra virgin olive oil (optional)
  • Snow pea sprouts

Instructions

  1. Remove stems from portobello mushrooms and slice into thin strips.
  2. Thinly slice shiitake and king oyster mushrooms.
  3. Thinly slice regular oyster mushrooms, removing any woody ends.
  4. Remove woody ends from enoki mushrooms.
  5. Roughly chop flat leaf parsley.
  6. Grate garlic into a paste.
  7. Combine softened butter, garlic paste, parsley, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
  8. Coat portobello mushrooms in garlic butter and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  9. Roast mushrooms in a preheated oven at 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit) for 12-13 minutes.
  10. Make clarified butter by melting unsalted butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
  11. Allow butter to melt completely and cook for 4 minutes.
  12. Skim off milk solids from the surface of the melted butter.
  13. Carefully pour clarified butter into a heatproof container, leaving solids behind.
  14. Traditional Hollandaise Method:
    • Place egg yolks and vinegar in a heatproof mixing bowl.
    • Place a saucepan of boiling water on low heat.
    • Place the bowl over the saucepan to create a bain-marie.
    • Whisk egg yolks vigorously until thick ribbons form.
    • Remove bowl from heat and place a damp tea towel in the bowl to prevent wobbling.
    • Slowly whisk in warmed clarified butter until thick and pourable.
    • Season with salt and pepper.
    • Cover with cling wrap and store in a warm area until ready to serve.
  15. Blender Hollandaise Method:
    • Place egg yolks and vinegar in a blender.
    • Blend on high speed for 1 minute.
    • Slowly pour in warmed clarified butter until thick.
    • Season with salt and pepper.
    • Transfer to a bowl and cover with cling wrap.
    • Store in a warm area until ready to serve.
  16. Heat olive oil or clarified butter in a pan over medium-high heat.
  17. Sauté sliced mushrooms (excluding enoki) for 4-5 minutes until golden brown and soft.
  18. Season with salt and pepper.
  19. Add enoki mushrooms and continue sauteing until soft.
  20. Bring a saucepan of water to a boil.
  21. Add white vinegar to the boiling water and create a vortex with a spoon.
  22. Gently place eggs into the vortex and poach for 2.5 minutes.
  23. Remove poached eggs with a slotted spoon and place on a towel-lined plate to drain.
  24. Toast sourdough bread to desired level.
  25. Drizzle toasted bread with olive oil (optional).
  26. Top bread with roasted garlic butter mushrooms.
  27. Place poached eggs on top of mushrooms.
  28. Gently arrange wild mushroom mix around the eggs and bread.
  29. Drizzle with hollandaise sauce.
  30. Garnish with chopped parsley, snow pea sprouts, and cracked pepper.
  31. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iF86FDEvVZo

yorkshire_puddings_carrots_parsnips_roasted_potatoes.txt - Yorkshire Puddings, Honey Glazed Carrots & Parsnips, and Duck Fat Roasted Potatoes

Objectives

  • Make crispy Yorkshire puddings from scratch.
  • Prepare a flavorful honey glazed carrots and parsnips side dish.
  • Learn to roast potatoes in duck fat for a crispy, delicious side.

Ingredients

Yorkshire Puddings - 3 whole eggs - 150 ml skim milk (or full fat milk + splash of water) - 60 g plain all-purpose flour - Pinch of salt - Pinch of ground white pepper - 2 1/2 teaspoons fat of choice (beef tallow recommended)

Honey Glazed Carrots & Parsnips - 600 g carrots - 600 g parsnips - 1 tablespoon olive oil - Pinch of salt - 20 cracks black pepper - 3 tablespoons unsalted butter - 10 whole sage leaves - 1 sprig rosemary - 3 tablespoons (60 g) honey

Duck Fat Roasted Potatoes - 1.5 kg high starch potatoes - 5 g baking soda - Pinch of salt - 80 g duck fat (goose fat or beef tallow can be substituted) - 10 g rosemary leaves - Handful of sea salt flakes

Instructions

  1. Yorkshire Puddings:
  2. Crack 3 eggs into a mixing bowl.
  3. Add 150 ml skim milk (or full fat milk + splash of water).
  4. Whisk until pale yellow and yolks are combined.
  5. Add 60 g plain flour, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of ground white pepper.
  6. Whisk until smooth.
  7. Place in the fridge overnight (optional, but recommended).
  8. Preheat oven to 240°C (465°F).
  9. Yorkshire Puddings (continued):
  10. Add 2 1/2 teaspoons of fat of choice to a muffin tray or cupcake tin.
  11. Bake for 10 minutes until fat is smoking hot.
  12. Remove tray and place on a heat-resistant surface.
  13. Spoon batter into each mold, filling halfway.
  14. Bake for 16-18 minutes until golden brown and puffed up.
  15. Let rest for 5 minutes to allow fat to drain.
  16. Honey Glazed Carrots & Parsnips:
  17. Slice carrots and parsnips in half lengthwise.
  18. Place on separate baking trays lined with parchment paper.
  19. Drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil on each tray.
  20. Season with salt and 20 cracks of black pepper.
  21. Bake at 200°C (390°F) for 15 minutes.
  22. Flip carrots and parsnips and bake for another 10 minutes until soft and slightly al dente.
  23. Honey Glazed Carrots & Parsnips (continued):
  24. Melt 3 tablespoons unsalted butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
  25. Add 10 sage leaves and 1 sprig rosemary.
  26. Cook for 1 minute.
  27. Add 3 tablespoons (60 g) honey, salt, and pepper.
  28. Cook for 1 1/2 minutes until thickened.
  29. Duck Fat Roasted Potatoes:
  30. Peel potatoes and save the peels for another recipe.
  31. Slice potatoes into quarters.
  32. Bring a pot of water to a boil.
  33. Add 5 g baking soda and a pinch of salt.
  34. Add potatoes and cook for 15 minutes until still soft.
  35. Drain potatoes in a colander.
  36. Duck Fat Roasted Potatoes (continued):
  37. Heat 80 g duck fat in a large roasting dish at 190°C (375°F) for 15 minutes until smoking hot.
  38. Carefully add potatoes to the hot fat, avoiding splattering.
  39. Roast for 1 hour, rotating the tray every 15 minutes.
  40. Rosemary Salt:
  41. Combine 10 g rosemary leaves and a couple of handfuls of sea salt flakes in a mortar and pestle.
  42. Grind until rosemary is broken down and turns a beautiful green color.
  43. Duck Fat Roasted Potatoes (continued):
  44. Remove potatoes from oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
  45. Transfer to a bowl and toss with rosemary salt.
  46. Serve hot.
  47. Assemble and Serve:
  48. Serve Yorkshire puddings, honey glazed carrots & parsnips, and duck fat roasted potatoes together.
  49. Enjoy!

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eKg73L6l-iE

yorkshire_puddings.txt - Yorkshire Puddings

Objectives

  • Learn to make classic Yorkshire puddings.
  • Understand the importance of preheating the oil for fluffy results.
  • Discover how to store and reheat Yorkshire puddings.

Ingredients

  • 200 grams (7.05 ounces) plain all-purpose flour
  • 4 large free-range eggs
  • 210 milliliters (210 grams) whole milk
  • Pinch of sea salt flakes
  • Pinch of ground white pepper
  • 1.5 tablespoons (30 milliliters) sunflower oil

Instructions

  1. Combine 200 grams of flour and 4 eggs in a mixing bowl or jug.
  2. Mix the eggs and flour with a fork or whisk until just combined, leaving some lumps.
  3. Pour in 210 milliliters of whole milk, add a pinch of salt and pepper, and whisk until smooth.
  4. Let the batter rest for at least one hour at room temperature or refrigerate for up to three days.
  5. Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F).
  6. Divide 1.5 tablespoons of sunflower oil evenly between a 12-hole cupcake tin (0.5 teaspoon per hole).
  7. Heat the oil in the oven for 20 minutes until smoking hot.
  8. Carefully remove the tin from the oven.
  9. Pour the batter into the hot tin, filling each hole at least halfway.
  10. Bake for 17-18 minutes until the puddings have quadrupled in size and are golden brown.
  11. Carefully remove the puddings from the oven.

Storage and Reheating

  • Store Yorkshire puddings in the refrigerator for up to four days or in the freezer for up to six months.
  • To reheat, place puddings in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 10 minutes until hot and crispy.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y5FhinAIcXo

yorkshire_pudding.txt - Yorkshire Pudding

Objectives

  • Learn how to make Yorkshire puddings for Christmas dinner.
  • Identify the key ingredients for a perfect Yorkshire pudding.

Ingredients

  • Flour
  • Eggs
  • Milk
  • Salt

Instructions

  1. Gather all necessary ingredients for the Yorkshire pudding.
  2. Refer to the provided ingredient list for specific quantities.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CvWDXL9qfhM
